original: And while they were going on their way, they came to some water, and the Ethiopian said, See, here is water; why may I not have baptism?
translation: Terwyl hulle op pad was, het hulle by 'n stuk water gekom, en die Ethiopian het gesê: "Kyk, hier is water; hoekom mag ek nie gedoop word nie?"

original: At the first God made the heaven and the earth.
translation: In die begin het God die hemel en die aarde geskep.

original: And David said to Ahimelech the priest, The king has given me orders and has said to me, Say nothing to anyone about the business on which I am sending you and the orders I have given you: and a certain place has been fixed to which the young men are to go.
translation: En David het vir Ahimelech die priester gesê: Die koning het vir my opdragte gegee en gesê: Moet met niemand praat oor wat ek jou stuur om te doen en die opdragte wat ek jou gegee het nie; daar is 'n spesifieke plek waarheen die jong mense moet gaan.

original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let everything in me give praise to his holy name.
translation: Loof die Here, my siel; laat alles in my God se heilige naam prysgee.

original: Or which of you, if his son makes a request for bread, will give him a stone?
translation: Of watter een van julle, as sy seun vir brood vra, sal vir hom 'n klip gee?

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbieding was 'n silwer skottel wat honderdtwintig shekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer basin wat sewentig shekels geweeg het, volgens die maatstaf van die heilige plek; albei was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanaanbieding.
Sorry, there doesn't seem to be any text provided for translation. Please provide the text you'd like me to translate.

original: And a third are to be stationed at the king's house; and a third at the doorway of the horses: while all the people are waiting in the open spaces round the house of the Lord.
translation: En 'n derde moet by die koning se huis gaan staan; en 'n derde by die deur van die perde, terwyl al die mense in die oop ruimtes rondom die huis van die Here wag.

original: May that man be like the towns overturned by the Lord without mercy: let a cry for help come to his ears in the morning, and the sound of war in the middle of the day;
translation: Mag daardie man wees soos die dorpe wat deur die Here omgekeer is, sonder genade: laat 'n hulp roep in sy ore kom in die oggend, en die geluid van oorlog gedurende die dag;

original: So now, if you have here five cakes of bread, give them into my hand, or whatever you have.
translation: As jy vyf brode hier het, gee dit in my hand of enigiets anders wat jy het.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien shekels, vol speserye;

original: And the earth was waste and without form; and it was dark on the face of the deep: and the Spirit of God was moving on the face of the waters.
translation: Die aarde was leeg en sonder vorm; dit was donker oor die diepte; en God se Gees het op die waters beweeg.

original: Or if he makes a request for a fish, will give him a snake?
translation: Of as hy vir 'n vis vra, sal hy vir hom 'n slang gee?

original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul; let not all his blessings go from your memory.
translation: Gee prys aan die Here, my siel; vergeet nooit al die seëninge wat Hy vir jou gegee het.

original: Because he did not put me to death before my birth took place: so my mother's body would have been my last resting-place, and she would have been with child for ever.
translation: Omdat hy my nie doodgemaak het voordat ek gebore is nie: dan sou my ma se liggaam my laaste plek van rus gewees het, en sy sou vir altyd swanger gewees het.

original: And he gave orders for the carriage to be stopped, and the two of them went down into the water, and Philip gave him baptism.
translation: Hy het gesê dat die kar moet stop, en hulle het albei in die water gegaan, en Filippus het hom gedoop.

original: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.
translation: En God het gesê, Laat daar lig wees: en daar was lig.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, een lam van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: He has forgiveness for all your sins; he takes away all your diseases;
translation: Hy het vergifnis vir al jou sondes; hy neem al jou siektes weg.

original: And the priest, answering David, said, I have no common bread here but there is holy bread; if only the young men have kept themselves from women.
translation: En die priester het vir David gesê, Ek het nie gewone brood hier nie, maar daar is heilig brood; as net die jong manne hulle van vroue afsonder.

original: But let no one come into the house of the Lord but only the priests and those of the Levites who have work to do there; they may go in for they are holy; but the rest of the people are to keep the orders of the Lord.
translation: Maar laat niemand in God se huis inkruip nie, sy net die priesters en die Leviete wat daar werk; hulle mag ingaan, want hulle is heilig; maar die ander mense moet aan God se opdragte voldoen.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sondeoffer.

original: He keeps back your life from destruction, crowning you with mercy and grace.
translation: Hy hou jou lewe weg van vernietiging en bedek jou met genade en liefde.

original: And when they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord took Philip away; and the Ethiopian saw him no more, for he went on his way full of joy.
translation: Toe hulle uit die water gekom het, het die Gees van die Here Filippus weggevat; en die Etiopeer het hom nie meer gesien nie, want hy het bly en vol vreugde sy pad gegaan.

original: If you, then, being evil, are able to give good things to your children, how much more will your Father in heaven give good things to those who make requests to him?
translation: As julle, wat sleg is, goeie dinge aan julle kinders kan gee, hoeveel meer sal julle Vader in die hemel goeie dinge aan diegene gee wat Hom om iets vra?

original: And God, looking on the light, saw that it was good: and God made a division between the light and the dark,
translation: En God het na die lig gekyk en gesien dit is goed: en God het 'n skeiding gemaak tussen die lig en die donker.

original: Why did I come from my mother's body to see pain and sorrow, so that my days might be wasted with shame?
translation: Waarom het ek uit my ma se liggaam gekom om pyn en hartseer te ervaar, sodat my dae vergeefs kan wees deur skaamte?

original: And David in answer said to the priest, Certainly women have been kept from us; and as has been done before when I have gone out the arms of the young men were made holy, even though it was a common journey; how much more today will their arms be made holy.
translation: En David het geantwoord en vir die priester gesê, Dis seker waar dat vroue van ons af gehou is; soos wat al voorheen gebeur het toe ek uitgegaan het, was die jongmense se arms heilig gemaak, al was dit 'n gewone reis; hoeveel meer sal hulle se arms vandag heilig gemaak word.

original: He makes your mouth full of good things, so that your strength is made new again like the eagle's.
translation: Hy maak jou mond vol met goeie dinge, sodat jou krag weer vars word soos 'n arend se.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke en vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Shelumiel, die seun van Zurishaddai.

original: And the Levites are to make a circle round the king, every man being armed; and any man who comes into the house is to be put to death; you are to keep with the king when he comes in and when he goes out.
translation: Die Leviete moet 'n sirkel om die koning maak, elke man moet gewapen wees; enige man wat die huis binnekom, moet doodgemaak word; julle moet by die koning bly wanneer hy inkom en wanneer hy uitgaan.

original: All those things, then, which you would have men do to you, even so do you to them: because this is the law and the prophets.
translation: Doen aan ander wat jy wil hê hulle moet aan jou doen, want dit is die wet en die profete.

original: But Philip came to Azotus, and went through all the towns, preaching the good news, till he came to Caesarea.
translation: Maar Filippus het na Azotus gekom en deur al die dorpie gegaan om die goeie nuus te vertel, totdat hy by Caesarea gekom het.

original: Naming the light, Day, and the dark, Night. And there was evening and there was morning, the first day.
translation: God het die lig Dag genoem, en die donker Nag. En daar was aand en daar was oggend, die eerste dag.

original: The Lord gives decisions in righteousness for all who are in trouble.
translation: Die Here maak regvaardige keuses vir almal wat in moeilikheid is.

original: So the priest gave him the holy bread: there was no other, only the holy bread which had been taken from before the Lord, so that new bread might be put in its place on the day when it was taken away.
translation: So het die priester vir hom die heilige brood gegee: daar was geen ander nie, net die heilige brood wat voor God weggehaal is, sodat nuwe brood op die dag wanneer dit weggehaal is, in sy plek gesit kan word.

original: On the sixth day Eliasaph, the son of Reuel, chief of the children of Gad:
translation: Op die sesde dag het Eliasaph, die seun van Reuel, die hoof van die kinders van Gad, gesê:

original: The word which came to Jeremiah from the Lord, when King Zedekiah sent to him Pashhur, the son of Malchiah, and Zephaniah, the son of Maaseiah the priest, saying,
translation: Die boodskap wat na Jeremia van die Here gekom het, toe koning Sedekia vir hom Pashhur, die seun van Malgajah, en Seraja, die seun van Maäseja die priester, gestuur het en gesê het,

original: But Saul, still burning with desire to put to death the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,
translation: Maar Saul, nog steeds brandend van die begeerte om die volgelinge van die Here te dood, het na die hoëpriester gegaan.

original: Go in by the narrow door; for wide is the door and open is the way which goes to destruction, and great numbers go in by it.
translation: Gaan in deur die smal deur; want die deur is breed en die pad is oop wat na ondergang lei, en baie mense gaan daarin.

original: And God said, Let there be a solid arch stretching over the waters, parting the waters from the waters.
translation: En God het gesê: Laat daar 'n stevige boog wees wat oor die waters strek en die waters van mekaar skei.

original: He gave knowledge of his way to Moses, and made his acts clear to the children of Israel.
translation: Hy het vir Moses vertel wat sy pad was en sy dade vir die Israeliete duidelik gemaak.

original: And made a request for letters from him to the Synagogues of Damascus, so that if there were any of the Way there, men or women, he might take them as prisoners to Jerusalem.
translation: Hy het gevra vir briewe van hom na die sinagoges in Damaskus, sodat, as daar enige mense van die Weg daar was, mans of vroue, hy hulle as gevangenes na Jerusalem kon neem.

original: For narrow is the door and hard the road to life, and only a small number make discovery of it.
translation: Die deur is smal en die pad na die lewe is moeilik, en net 'n paar mense vind dit.

original: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, kept back before the Lord; his name was Doeg, an Edomite, the strongest of Saul's runners.
translation: Daar was 'n sekere man van Saul se dienaars daardie dag, wat voor die Here gehou is; sy naam was Doeg, 'n Edomiet, die sterkste van Saul se hardlopers.

original: So the Levites and all Judah did as Jehoiada the priest had given them orders: every one took with him his men, those who were to come in and those who were to go out on the Sabbath; for Jehoiada had not sent away the divisions.
translation: Die Leviete en al Juda het gedoen soos wat die priester Jehoiada vir hulle gesê het: elkeen het sy mense saamgeneem, dié wat op die Saterdag moes inkom en dié wat moes uitgaan; want Jehoiada het nie die groepies weggestuur nie.

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbieding was een silwer skottel, eenhonderd en dertig shekels gewig, een silwer bak van sewentig shekels, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; hulle was albei vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n aanbiedingsmaal.

original: And God made the arch for a division between the waters which were under the arch and those which were over it: and it was so.
translation: En God het die reënboog gemaak om 'n scheiding te wees tussen die water wat onder die reënboog was en die water wat daarbo was: en dit was so.

original: Be on the watch for false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inside they are cruel wolves.
translation: Wees versigtig vir valse profete, wat soos skape lyk, maar binne-in is hulle gemene wolwe.

original: Will you get directions from the Lord for us; for Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, is making war against us; it may be that the Lord will do something for us like all the wonders he has done, and make him go away from us.
translation: Sal jy vir ons vir die Here raad vra; want Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, is besig om oorlog teen ons te voer; dalk sal die Here iets vir ons doen soos al die wonderwerke wat Hy gedoen het, en maak dat hy ons los.

original: The Lord is kind and full of pity, not quickly made angry, but ever ready to have mercy.
translation: Die Here is goed en vol medelye, nie maklik om kwaad te raak nie, maar altyd gereed om te vergewe.

original: And while he was journeying, he came near Damascus; and suddenly he saw a light from heaven shining round him;
translation: Terwyl hy op reis was, het hy naby Damaskus gekom; en skielik het hy 'n lig vanuit die hemel gesien wat om hom geskyn het.

original: And David said to Ahimelech, Have you no sword or spear with you here? for I have come without my sword and other arms, because the king's business had to be done quickly.
translation: En David het vir Ahimelech gesê: Het jy nie 'n swaard of spies hier nie? Want ek het sonder my swaard en ander wapens gekom, omdat ek vinnig die koning se werk moes doen.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien shekels, vol speserye;

original: And God gave the arch the name of Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, the second day.
translation: God het die boog Hemel genoem. En daar was aand en daar was oggend, dit was die tweede dag.

original: By their fruits you will get knowledge of them. Do men get grapes from thorns or figs from thistles?
translation: Aan hulle vrugte sal jy hulle ken. Kry mense druiwe uit dorings of vywe uit distels?

original: Then Jeremiah said to them, This is what you are to say to Zedekiah:
translation: Toe het Jeremia vir hulle gesê: Julle moet vir Sedekia sê:

original: His feeling will no longer be bitter; he will not keep his wrath for ever.
translation: Sy gevoel sal nie meer sleg wees nie; hy sal nie sy kwaad vir altyd hou nie.

original: Then Jehoiada the priest gave to the captains of hundreds the spears and body-covers which had been King David's and which were kept in the house of God.
translation: Toe het die priester Jehojada aan die leiers van die honderde die spiese en beskermings gegee wat van King David af was en in God se huis gehou is.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een volwasse ram, een ram van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: And he went down on the earth, and a voice said to him, Saul, Saul, why are you attacking me so cruelly?
translation: Hy het op die aarde neergedaal, en toe het 'n stem vir hom gesê: Saul, Saul, waarom aanvaar jy my so ongenadig?

original: He has not given us the punishment for our sins, or the reward of our wrongdoing.
translation: Hy het ons nie gestraf vir ons sondes nie, of ons nie beloon vir wat ons verkeerd gedoen het nie.

original: Even so, every good tree gives good fruit; but the bad tree gives evil fruit.
translation: So gee elke goeie boom goeie vrugte; maar die slegte boom gee slegte vrugte.

original: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven come together in one place, and let the dry land be seen: and it was so.
translation: En God het gesê: Laat die waters onder die hemel bymekaar kom op een plek, en laat die droë grond sigbaar wees: en dit het gebeur.

original: The Lord God of Israel has said, See, I am turning back the instruments of war in your hands, with which you are fighting against the king of Babylon and the Chaldaeans, who are outside the walls and shutting you in; and I will get them together inside this town.
translation: Die Here God van Israel het gesê: Kyk, ek neem die wapens wat julle gebruik om teen die koning van Babel en die Chaldeërs te veg, wat buite die mure is en julle vastrap, terug; en ek sal hulle hier binne die stad bymekaarbring.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sondeoffer.

original: For as the heaven is high over the earth, so great is his mercy to his worshippers.
translation: Want soos die hemel ver bo die aarde is, so groot is God se genade vir sy aanbidders.

original: And he said, Who are you, Lord? And he said, I am Jesus, whom you are attacking:
translation: Hy het gesê, Wie is jy, Here? Hy het gesê, Ek is Jesus, wie jy aanval.

original: And he put all the people in position, every man with his instruments of war in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left, by the altar and the house and all round the king.
translation: En hy het al die mense in plek gebring, elke man met sy wapens in sy hand, van die regterkant van die huis tot die linkerkant, by die altaar en die huis, reg rondom die koning.

original: It is not possible for a good tree to give bad fruit, and a bad tree will not give good fruit.
translation: Dit is nie moontlik vir 'n goeie boom om slegte vrugte te gee nie, en 'n slegte boom kan nie goeie vrugte hê nie.

original: And the priest said, The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you put to death in the valley of Elah, is here folded in a cloth at the back of the ephod: take that, if you will, for there is no other sword here. And David said, there is no other sword like that; give it to me.
translation: En die priester het gesê, die swaard van Goliat die Filistyner, wat jy in die vallei van Elah doodgemaak het, is hier op 'n lap agter die efod gevou: neem dit, as jy wil, want daar is nie 'n ander swaard hier nie. En Dawid het gesê, daar is geen ander swaard soos dit nie; gee dit vir my.

original: And God gave the dry land the name of Earth; and the waters together in their place were named Seas: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En God het die droë land Aarde genoem; en die waters het Hy in hul plek Sees genoem: en God het gesien dit was goed.

original: But get up, and go into the town, and it will be made clear to you what you have to do.
translation: Maar staan op en gaan in die stad in, en dit sal vir jou duidelik wees wat jy moet doen.

original: And I myself will be fighting against you with an outstretched hand and with a strong arm, even with angry feeling and passion and in great wrath.
translation: Ek gaan julle self teëstaan met 'n uitgestrekte hand en 'n sterk arm, met baie woede en hartstog en groot woede.

original: As far as the east is from the west, so far has he put our sins from us.
translation: So ver soos die ooste van die weste is, so ver het Hy ons sondes van ons af verwyder.

original: And the men who were with him were not able to say anything; hearing the voice, but seeing no one.
translation: Die mans wat saam met hom was, kon niks sê nie; hulle het die stem gehoor, maar niemand gesien nie.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Eliasaph, the son of Reuel
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Eliasaph, die seun van Reuel.

original: Every tree which does not give good fruit is cut down and put in the fire.
translation: Elke boom wat nie goeie vrugte gee nie, word afgekap en in die vuur gegooi.

original: Then they made the king's son come out, and they put the crown on his head and gave him the arm-bands and made him king: and Jehoiada and his sons put the holy oil on him and said, Long life to the king.
translation: Toe het hulle die koning se seun laat uitkom, en hulle het die kroon op sy kop gesit en vir hom die armbande gegee en hom koning gemaak: en Jehoiada en sy seuns het die heilige olie op hom gesit en gesê, Lang lewe die koning.

original: And I will send a great disease on the people living in this town, on man and on beast, causing their death.
translation: Ek sal 'n groot siekte na die mense in hierdie dorp stuur, wat die dood van mense en diere sal veroorsaak.

original: Then David got up and went in flight that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish, the king of Gath.
translation: David het toe opgestaan en daardie dag gevlug omdat hy vir Saul bang was, en hy het na Achish, die koning van Gath, gegaan.

original: And God said, Let grass come up on the earth, and plants producing seed, and fruit-trees giving fruit, in which is their seed, after their sort: and it was so.
translation: En God het gesê, Laat gras op die aarde groei, en plante wat sade maak, en vrugtebome wat vrugte dra met hulle saadjies daarin, soos hulle soort is: en dit het gebeur.

original: As a father has pity on his children, so the Lord has pity on his worshippers.
translation: Soos 'n pa wat omgee vir sy kinders, so het die Here ook om vir sy aanbidders.

original: So by their fruits you will get knowledge of them.
translation: Julle sal hulle leer ken deur hulle vrugte.

original: On the seventh day Elishama, the son of Ammihud, chief of the children of Ephraim:
translation: Op die sewende dag het Elishama, die seun van Ammihud, die hoof van die Efraimietes:

original: And Saul got up from the earth, and when his eyes were open, he saw nothing; and he was guided by the hand into Damascus.
translation: En Saul het opgestaan van die aarde, en toe sy oë oop was, het hy niks gesien nie; en hy is met die hand na Damaskus gelei.

original: Now Athaliah, hearing the noise of the people running and praising the king, came to the people in the house of the Lord:
translation: Toe het Athaliah, toe sy die geraas hoor van die mense wat hardloop en die koning prys, na die mense in God se huis gegaan.

original: And grass came up on the earth, and every plant producing seed of its sort, and every tree producing fruit, in which is its seed, of its sort: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En gras het op die aarde gegroei, en elke plant wat sy eie sade maak, en elke boom wat vrugte dra met sy sade daarin: en God het gesien dat dit goed was.

original: And the servants of Achish said to him, Is not this David, the king of the land? did they not make songs about him in their dances, saying, Saul has put to death thousands, and David tens of thousands?
translation: Die dienaars van Achish het vir hom gesê: Is dit nie David nie, die koning van die land? Het hulle nie in hulle danse liedjies oor hom gesing en gesê: Saul het duisende doodgemaak, maar David tienduisende?

original: For he has knowledge of our feeble frame; he sees that we are only dust.
translation: Want Hy weet van ons swak liggaam; Hy sien dat ons net stof is.

original: Not everyone who says to me, Lord, Lord, will go into the kingdom of heaven; but he who does the pleasure of my Father in heaven.
translation: Nie almal wat vir my sê: Here, Here, gaan in die koninkryk van die hemel ingaan nie; maar net die een wat doen wat my Vader in die hemel wil hê.

original: And for three days he was not able to see, and he took no food or drink.
translation: En vir drie dae kon hy nie sien nie, en hy het geen kos of drink gehad nie.

original: And there was evening and there was morning, the third day.
translation: En daar was aand en oggend, die derde dag.

original: As for man, his days are as grass: his beautiful growth is like the flower of the field.
translation: As dit by mense kom, is hulle dae soos gras: hulle pragtige groei is soos die blomme in die veld.

original: And David took these words to heart, fearing Achish, the king of Gath.
translation: En David het hierdie woorde ter harte geneem, bang vir Achis, die koning van Gath.

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was een silwer plaat wat honderd en dertig sekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer kom van sewentig sekels, volgens die skaal van die Heilige plek; hulle was albei vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n ete aanbied.

original: A great number will say to me on that day, Lord, Lord, were we not prophets in your name, and did we not by your name send out evil spirits, and by your name do works of power?
translation: Baie mense sal op daardie dag vir my sê: Here, Here, was ons nie profete in jou naam nie, en het ons nie bose geeste in jou naam uitgestuur nie, en het ons nie wonderwerke in jou naam gedoen nie?

original: The wind goes over it and it is gone; and its place sees it no longer.
translation: Die wind waai oor dit en dit is weg; sy plek kan dit nie meer sien nie.

original: And after that, says the Lord, I will give up Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his servants and his people, even those in the town who have not come to their end from the disease and the sword and from need of food, into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of their haters, and into the hands of those desiring their death: he will put them to the sword; he will not let anyone get away, he will have no pity or mercy.
translation: En daarna, sê die Here, sal ek Zedekiah, die koning van Juda, en sy dienaars en sy mense, selfs dié in die dorp wat nie gesterf het van die siekte, die swaard, of honger nie, oorgee in die hande van Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, en in die hande van hulle wat hulle haat, en in die hande van dié wat hulle dood wil maak: hy sal hulle met die swaard doodmaak; hy sal niemand laat wegkom nie, hy sal nie genade of medelye hê nie.

original: Now there was a certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias; and the Lord said to him in a vision, Ananias! and he said, Here I am, Lord.
translation: Daar was 'n man, Ananias, wat in Damaskus gewoon het; en die Here het vir hom in 'n visioen gesê, Ananias! En hy het geantwoord, Here, hier is ek.

original: And looking, she saw the king in his place by the pillar at the doorway, and the captains and the horns by his side; and all the people of the land were giving signs of joy and sounding the horns; and the makers of melody were playing on instruments of music, taking the chief part in the song of praise. Then Athaliah, violently parting her robes, said, Broken faith, broken faith!
translation: Toe sy kyk, sien sy die koning op sy plek by die pilaar by die deur, en die leiers van die leër en die trompetspelers aan sy kant; en die hele volk van die land was bly en het die trompette geblaas; en die musiekspelers het op instrumente gespeel en hulle het die hoofdeel van die loflied gesing. Toe het Athaliah, wat haar klere met geweld geskeur het, gesê: 'Verbroken geloof, verbroken geloof!'

original: And God said, Let there be lights in the arch of heaven, for a division between the day and the night, and let them be for signs, and for marking the changes of the year, and for days and for years:
translation: En God het gesê: Laat daar ligte wees in die hemel om die dag van die nag af te skei, en hulle moet ook gebruik word as tekens om die seisoene, dae en jare aan te dui.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien skekels, vol speserye.

original: So changing his behaviour before them, he made it seem as if he was off his head, hammering on the doors of the town, and letting the water from his mouth go down his chin.
translation: So het hy sy gedrag voor hulle verander en dit het gelyk of hy mal was, terwyl hy op die deure van die stad geklop het en die water uit sy mond oor sy ken afgekom het.

original: And then will I say to them, I never had knowledge of you: go from me, you workers of evil.
translation: En dan sal ek vir hulle sê, ek het nooit van julle geweet nie: gaan weg van my, julle wat slegte dinge doen.

original: And to this people you are to say, The Lord has said, See, I put before you the way of life and the way of death.
translation: En vir hierdie mense moet jy sê, die Here het gesê, Kyk, ek stel die pad van die lewe en die pad van die dood vir julle voor.

original: But the mercy of the Lord is eternal for his worshippers, and their children's children will see his righteousness;
translation: Maar God se genade is ewiging vir sy mense wat Hom aanbid, en hulle kinders se kinders sal sy regverdigheid sien;

original: Then Achish said to his servants, Look! the man is clearly off his head; why have you let him come before me?
translation: Toe het Achis vir sy dienaars gesê: "Kyk! Die man is duidelik nie reg nie; hoekom het julle hom voor my gebring?"

original: And the Lord said to him, Get up, and go to the street which is named Straight, and make search at the house of Judas for one named Saul of Tarsus: for he is at prayer;
translation: En die Here het vir hom gesê, staan op en gaan na die straat wat Regtig genoem word, en soek in die huis van Judas vir iemand wat Saul van Tarsus genoem word, want hy is aan die bid.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, 'n manlike skaap, 'n ram van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: Everyone, then, to whom my words come and who does them, will be like a wise man who made his house on a rock;
translation: Almal wat my woorde hoor en dit ook doen, sal soos 'n wyse man wees wat sy huis op 'n rots gebou het.

original: And let them be for lights in the arch of heaven to give light on the earth: and it was so.
translation: Laat hulle ligte wees in die lug om die aarde te verlig: en dit het gebeur.

original: Then Jehoiada the priest gave orders to the captains of hundreds who had authority over the army, saying, Take her outside the lines, and let anyone who goes after her be put to death with the sword. For the priest said, Let her not be put to death in the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe het die priester Jehojada opdragte gegee aan die leiers van honderde wat oor die soldate was, en het gesê, "Neem haar buite die grense, en laat enigeen wat haar agtervolg, met die swaard doodgemaak word. Want die priester het gesê, "Laat haar nie in die huis van die Here doodgemaak word."

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok vir 'n sondoffer;

original: And he has seen a man named Ananias coming in and putting his hands on him, so that he may be able to see.
translation: En hy het 'n man gesien wat Ananias genoem word, wat binnegekom het en sy hande op hom gelê het, sodat hy weer kon sien.

original: If they keep his agreement, and have his laws in mind to do them.
translation: As hulle sy ooreenkoms nakom en sy wette in hulle gedagtes hou om dit te doen.

original: And God made the two great lights: the greater light to be the ruler of the day, and the smaller light to be the ruler of the night: and he made the stars.
translation: En God het die twee groot ligte gemaak: die een lig om oor die dag te regeer, en die ander lig om oor die nag te regeer: en Hy het die sterre gemaak.

original: So they put their hands on her, and she went to the king's house by the doorway of the king's horses; and there she was put to death.
translation: Hulle het hande op haar gelê en sy het na die koning se huis gegaan deur die deur van die koning se perde; en daar is sy doodgemaak.

original: Are there not enough unbalanced men about me, that you have let this person come and do such tricks before me? is such a man to come into my house?
translation: Is daar nie genoeg ongebalanseerde mans om my nie, dat jy hierdie persoon laat kom het om sulke truuks voor my te doen? Moet so 'n man in my huis kom?

original: And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house, but it was not moved; because it was based on the rock.
translation: En die reën het geval en daar was 'n stroom van water, en die winde het teen daardie huis geblaas, maar dit het nie beweeg nie; omdat dit op die rots gebou was.

original: He who keeps in this town will come to his death by the sword and through need of food and through disease; but he who goes out and gives himself up to the Chaldaeans who are shutting you in, will go on living, and will keep his life safe.
translation: Hy wat in hierdie stad bly, sal deur die swaard sterf en honger en siekte ly; maar hy wat uitgaan en hom oorgee aan die Chaldeërs wat julle opsluit, sal voortleef en sy lewe veilig hou.

original: The Lord has made ready his high seat in the heavens; his kingdom is ruling over all.
translation: Die Here het sy troon in die hemel reggekry; sy koninkryk heers oor alles.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Elishama, the son of Ammihud.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammers wat nog nie een jaar oud was nie: dit was die aanbod van Elishama, die seun van Ammihud.

original: But Ananias said, Lord, I have had accounts of this man from a number of people, how much evil he has done to your saints at Jerusalem:
translation: Maar Ananias het gesê, Here, ek het van 'n paar mense gehoor oor hierdie man, hoeveel slegte dinge hy aan jou mense in Jerusalem gedoen het:

original: And Jehoiada made an agreement between the Lord and all the people and the king, that they would be the Lord's people.
translation: En Jehoiada het 'n ooreenkoms gemaakt tussen die Here, al die mense en die koning, dat hulle God se mense sal wees.

original: And everyone to whom my words come and who does them not, will be like a foolish man who made his house on sand;
translation: En almal wat na my woorde luister en dit nie doen nie, sal soos 'n dom man wees wat sy huis op sand gebou het.

original: And God put them in the arch of heaven, to give light on the earth;
translation: En God het hulle in die lug gesit om lig op die aarde te gee;

original: So David went away from there and took cover in a strong place at Adullam; and his brothers and all his father's people, hearing of it, went down to him there.
translation: So het David van daar af gegaan en 'n skuilplek gevind in 'n sterk plek by Adullam; en sy broers en al sy pa se mense het na hom daar gegaan toe hulle daarvan hoor.

original: And here he has authority from the chief priests to make prisoners all who give worship to your name.
translation: En hier het hy die gesag van die hoof priester om almal wat jou naam aanbid in die tronk te sit.

original: On the eighth day Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur, chief of the children of Manasseh:
translation: Op die agtste dag het Gamaliel, die seun van Pedahzur, die hoof van die Manassiete, gesê:

original: For my face is turned to this town for evil and not for good, says the Lord: it will be given into the hands of the king of Babylon, and he will have it burned with fire.
translation: Want ek kyk na hierdie stad met slegte bedoelings en nie met goeie nie, sê die Here: dit sal in die hande van die koning van Babel gegee word, en hy sal dit met vuur laat verbrand.

original: Give praise to the Lord, you his angels, who are great in strength, doing his orders, and waiting for his voice.
translation: Gee lof aan die Here, julle sy engele, wat sterk is en sy opdragte doen en wag vir sy stem.

original: About the family of the king of Judah. Give ear to the word of the Lord;
translation: Oor die familie van die koning van Juda. Luister na God se boodskap;

original: And everyone who was in trouble, and everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was bitter in soul, came together to him, and he became captain over them: about four hundred men were joined to him.
translation: En almal wat in moeilikheid was, almal wat skuld gehad het, en almal wat seergemaak was, het saamgekom en na hom gegaan, en hy het hulle leier geword: daar het sowat vierhonderd manne by hom aangesluit.

original: Then all the people went to the house of Baal and had it pulled down, and its altars and images broken up; and Mattan, the priest of Baal, they put to death before the altars.
translation: Toe het al die mense na Baal se huis gegaan en dit afgebreek, en sy altare en beelde gebroke; en hulle het Mattan, die priester van Baal, voor die altare doodgemaak.

original: And the rain came down and there was a rush of waters and the winds were driving against that house; and it came down and great was its fall.
translation: En die reën het neergedaal en daar was 'n stroom van water, en die winde het teen daardie huis geblaas; en dit het ingekruk, en dit was 'n groot val.

original: Give praise to the Lord, all you his armies; and you his servants who do his pleasure.
translation: Lof die Here, almal van sy leërs; en julle, sy dienaars, wat doen wat Hy wil.

original: But the Lord said, Go without fear: for he is a special vessel for me, to give to the Gentiles and kings and to the children of Israel the knowledge of my name:
translation: Maar die Here het gesê, gaan sonder vrees: want hy is 'n spesiale persoon vir my, om vir die heidene, konings en die kinders van Israel te vertel van my naam.

original: To have rule over the day and the night, and for a division between the light and the dark: and God saw that it was good.
translation: Om oor die dag en die nag te heers, en om 'n skeiding tussen die lig en die donker te hê: en God het gesien dit is goed.

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was 'n silwer bord wat honderddertig shekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer bak wat sewentig shekels geweeg het, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; die twee was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n voedseloffer.

original: And there was evening and there was morning, the fourth day.
translation: Daar was aand en daar was oggend, die vierde dag.

original: For I will make clear to him what troubles he will have to undergo for me.
translation: Ek sal vir hom wys watter moeilikhede hy vir My gaan ervaar.

original: Give praise to the Lord, all his works, in all places under his rule: give praise to the Lord, O my soul.
translation: Loof die Here, al sy werke, oral waar Hy die baas is: loof die Here, O my siel.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sikkels, vol speserye;

original: And it came about, when Jesus had come to the end of these words, that the people were surprised at his teaching,
translation: Toe Jesus aan die einde van hierdie woorde gekom het, was die mense verbaas oor sy onderrig.

original: O family of David, this is what the Lord has said: Do what is right in the morning, and make free from the hands of the cruel one him whose goods have been violently taken away, or my wrath will go out like fire, burning so that no one may put it out, because of the evil of your doings.
translation: O familie van David, dit is wat die Here gesê het: Doen wat reg is in die oggend, en stel vry diegene wie se dinge met geweld afgeneem is uit die hande van die wrede, anders sal my woede soos 'n vuur uitbreek wat niemand kan blus nie, omdat julle kwaad gedoen het.

original: Give praise to the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, you are very great; you are robed with honour and power.
translation: Loof die Here, my siel. O Here, my God, U is baie groot; U is vol eer en krag.

original: And God said, Let the waters be full of living things, and let birds be in flight over the earth under the arch of heaven.
translation: Toe het God gesê: Laat die waters vol wees van lewende dinge, en laat voëls oor die aarde vlieg onder die hemel.

original: And Jehoiada put the work and the care of the house of the Lord into the hands of the priests and the Levites, who had been grouped in divisions by David to make burned offerings to the Lord, as it is recorded in the law of Moses, with joy and song as David had said.
translation: En Jehoiada het die werk en sorg van God se huis in die hande van die priesters en die Leviete gegee, wat in groepe deur Dawid saamgestel is om brandoffers aan die Here te bied, soos dit in Moses se wet geskryf staan, met vreugde en sang, soos wat Dawid gesê het.

original: And from there David went to Mizpeh in the land of Moab: and he said to the king of Moab, Let my father and mother come and make their living-place with you till it is clear to me what God will do for me.
translation: En van daar het David na Mizpeh in die land van Moab gegaan en hy het vir die koning van Moab gesê: Laat my pa en ma kom en vir 'n tyd by julle bly totdat ek weet wat God vir my gaan doen.

original: for he was teaching as one having authority, and not as their scribes.
translation: want hy het geleer soos iemand met werklike gesag, en nie soos hulle skrifgeleerders nie.

original: You are clothed with light as with a robe; stretching out the heavens like a curtain:
translation: Jy is geklee in lig soos met 'n rok; jy strek die hemel uit soos 'n gordyn.

original: And he put door-keepers at the doors of the Lord's house, to see that no one who was unclean in any way might come in.
translation: En hy het wagters by die deure van God se huis gesit om te kyk dat niemand wat op enige manier nie skoon is, binne mag kom nie.

original: And he took them to the king of Moab and they went on living with him while David was in his safe place.
translation: Hy het hulle na die koning van Moab geneem en hulle het saam met hom gebly terwyl David veilig was.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, 'n ram van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: See, I am against you, you who are living on the rock of the valley, says the Lord; you who say, Who will come down against us? or who will get into our houses?
translation: Kyk, Ek is teen julle, julle wat op die rots van die vallei woon, sê die Here; julle wat sê, Wie sal teen ons kom? of wie sal in ons huise kom?

original: And when he had come down from the mountain, great numbers of people came after him.
translation: En toe hy van die berg af gekom het, het 'n groot aantal mense hom gevolg.

original: And Ananias went out and came to the house, and putting his hands on him, said, Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus, whom you saw when you were on your journey, has sent me, so that you may be able to see, and be full of the Holy Spirit.
translation: En Ananias het uit gegaan en na die huis gegaan. Toe hy sy hande op hom gelê het, het hy gesê: Broer Saul, die Here Jesus, wat jy gesien het terwyl jy op pad was, het my gestuur sodat jy weer kan sien en vol kan wees van die Heilige Gees.

original: And God made great sea-beasts, and every sort of living and moving thing with which the waters were full, and every sort of winged bird: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En God het groot see-diere gemaak, en elke soort lewende en bewegende ding waarvan die waters vol was, en elke soort gevleugelde voël; en God het gesien dit is goed.

original: The arch of your house is based on the waters; you make the clouds your carriage; you go on the wings of the wind:
translation: Die boog van jou huis staan op die waters; jy maak die wolke jou vervoer; jy vlieg op die vlerke van die wind.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok vir 'n sonde-offering;

original: I will send punishment on you in keeping with the fruit of your doings, says the Lord: and I will put a fire in her woodlands, burning up everything round about her.
translation: Ek sal julle straf volgens wat julle gedoen het, sê die Here: en ek sal 'n vuur in haar woude aansteek wat alles om haar vernietig.

original: And a leper came and gave him worship, saying, Lord, if it is your pleasure, you have power to make me clean.
translation: 'N Melaatse het na Jesus gekom en hom aangebid, en gesê: "Here, as dit u wil is, kan U my skoonmaak."

original: And straight away it seemed as if a veil was taken from his eyes, and he was able to see; and he got up, and had baptism;
translation: En dadelik het dit gelyk asof 'n doek van sy oë afgehaal is, en hy kon sien; en hy het opgestaan en is gedoop.

original: And the prophet Gad said to David, Do not go on living in this place but go into the land of Judah. Then David went away and came to the woodland of Hereth.
translation: Die profeet Gad het vir Dawid gesê: “Moet nie hier bly nie, maar gaan na die land van Juda.” Toe het Dawid weggegaan en by die bos van Hereth gekom.

original: He makes winds his angels, and flames of fire his servants.
translation: Hy maak die winde sy engele, en vlamme van vuur sy dienaars.

original: Then he took the captains of hundreds and the chiefs and the rulers of the people and all the people of the land, and they came down with the king from the house of the Lord through the higher doorway into the king's house, and put the king on the seat of the kingdom.
translation: Toe het hy die leiers van honderd en die hoofde van die mense, en al die mense van die land, saam met die koning van God se huis af gekom deur die hoër deur in die koning se huis, en die koning het op die sitplek van die koninkryk gesit.

original: And God gave them his blessing, saying, Be fertile and have increase, making all the waters of the seas full, and let the birds be increased in the earth.
translation: En God het hulle sy seën gegee en gesê: "Wees vrugbaar en vermeerder, vul al die waters van die see, en laat die voëls meer word op die aarde."

original: This is what the Lord has said: Go down to the house of the king of Judah and there give him this word,
translation: Dit is wat die Here gesê het: Gaan na die huis van die koning van Juda en sê vir hom hierdie boodskap.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers was daar twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf manlike lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Gamaliel, die seun van Pedahzur.

original: And when he had taken food his strength came back. And for some days he kept with the disciples who were in Damascus.
translation: En toe hy kos geëet het, het sy krag teruggekom. En vir 'n paar dae het hy saam met die dissipels in Damaskus gebly.

original: And he put his hand on him, saying, It is my pleasure; be clean. And straight away he was made clean.
translation: Hy het sy hand op hom gesit en gesê: "Ek is bly; wees skoon." En sommer dadelik was hy skoon.

original: He has made the earth strong on its bases, so that it may not be moved for ever and ever;
translation: Hy het die aarde sterk gemaak op sy grond, sodat dit nie vir altyd en ewig kan beweeg nie;

original: So all the people of the land were glad and the town was quiet, for they had put Athaliah to death with the sword.
translation: So al die mense van die land was vrolik en die dorp was rustig, want hulle het Athaliah met die swaard doodgemaak.

original: And there was evening and there was morning, the fifth day.
translation: Dit was aand en dit was oggend, die vyfde dag.

original: On the ninth day Abidan, the son of Gideoni, chief of the children of Benjamin:
translation: Op die negende dag het Abidan, die seun van Gideoni, die leier van die Benjamin kinders:

original: Covering it with the sea as with a robe: the waters were high over the mountains;
translation: Die see het dit bedek soos 'n klere, die waters was hoog oor die berge.

original: And say, Give ear to the word of the Lord, O king of Judah, seated on the seat of David, you and your servants and your people who come in by these doors.
translation: En sê, Luister na God se boodskap, O koning van Juda, wat op Dawid se troon sit, jy en jou dienaars en jou mense wat deur hierdie deure inkom.

original: And straight away, in the Synagogues, he was preaching Jesus as the Son of God.
translation: En dadelik, in die sinagoges, het hy Jesus preek as God se Seun.

original: And news was given to Saul that David had been seen, and the men who were with him: now Saul was in Gibeah, seated under the tree in the high place, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants were in their places before him.
translation: Die nuus het vir Saul gekom dat David gesien is, saam met die mense wat met hom was. Saul was in Gibeah, en hy het onder die boom op die hoë plek gesit, met sy spies in sy hand, terwyl al sy dienaars voor hom gestaan het.

original: And Jesus said to him, See that you say nothing about this to anyone; but go and let the priest see you and make the offering which was ordered by Moses, for a witness to them.
translation: En Jesus sê vir hom, moenie vir iemand hiervan vertel nie; maar gaan en laat die priester jou sien en maak die offer wat Moses gesê het, as 'n getuienis vir hulle.

original: At the voice of your word they went in flight; at the sound of your thunder they went away in fear;
translation: By die klank van jou woorde het hulle gevlug; by die gedreun van jou donder het hulle bang weggehardloop.

original: Joash was seven years old when he became king, and he was ruling for forty years in Jerusalem: his mother's name was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
translation: Joash was sewe jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het veertig jaar in Jerusalem geregeer: sy ma se naam was Zibiah van Beer-sheba.

original: And all those hearing him were full of wonder and said, Is not this the man who in Jerusalem was attacking all the worshippers of this name? and he had come here so that he might take them as prisoners before the chief priests.
translation: Die mense wat na hom geluister het, was verstom en het gesê: Is dit nie die man wat in Jerusalem al die aanhangers van hierdie naam aangeval het nie? En hy het hierheen gekom om hulle as gevangenes na die hoëpriesters te neem.

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbieding was 'n silwer plaat wat honderd en dertig shekels geweeg het, en 'n silwer bakkie van sewentig shekels volgens die maatstaf van die heilige plek; albei was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graan aanbieding.

original: And God said, Let the earth give birth to all sorts of living things, cattle and all things moving on the earth, and beasts of the earth after their sort: and it was so.
translation: En God het gesê, laat die aarde vol wees van al die lewensvorme, van diere en alles wat op die aarde beweeg, en wilde diere van die aarde volgens hul soort: en dit was so.

original: The mountains came up and the valleys went down into the place which you had made ready for them.
translation: Die berge het opgekom en die valleie het afgedaal na die plek wat jy vir hulle reg gemaak het.

original: And when Jesus was come into Capernaum, a certain captain came to him with a request,
translation: Toe Jesus by Kapernaum aankom, kom daar 'n offisier na Hom met 'n versoek.

original: Then Saul said to his servants who were there about him, Give ear now, you Benjamites; will the son of Jesse give to every one of you fields and vine-gardens, will he make you all captains of hundreds and captains of thousands;
translation: Toe het Saul vir sy dienaars gesê wat daar om hom was, Luister nou, julle van Benjamin; sal die seun van Jesse vir elkeen van julle grond en wingerde gee, sal hy julle almal hoofde van honderde en hoofde van duisende maak?

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sekels, vol speserye;

original: And Joash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord as long as Jehoiada the priest was living.
translation: En Joash het gedoen wat reg was in God se oë solank Jehoiada, die priester, nog gelewe het.

original: But Saul went on increasing in power, and the Jews in Damascus were not able to give answers to the arguments by which he made it clear that Jesus was the Christ.
translation: Maar Saul het al meer krag gekry, en die Jode in Damaskus kon nie vir sy argumente antwoordgee waaruit dit duidelik geword het dat Jesus die Christus was nie.

original: You made a limit over which they might not go, so that the earth would never again be covered by them.
translation: Jy het 'n grens gestel waaroor hulle nie mag gaan nie, sodat die aarde nooit weer deur hulle bedek sal word nie.

original: Saying, Lord, my servant is ill in bed at the house, with no power in his body, and in great pain.
translation:
Here is the final translation:

Here, my Heer, my dienaar is siek in die bed by die huis, hy het nie krag in sy liggaam nie, en hy ly baie.

original: And God made the beast of the earth after its sort, and the cattle after their sort, and everything moving on the face of the earth after its sort: and God saw that it was good.
translation: En God het die diere op die aarde geskep volgens hul soort, en die vee volgens hul soort, en alles wat op die aarde beweeg volgens sy soort: en God het gesien dit was goed.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, een speenlam van die eerste jaar vir 'n brandoffer.

original: And Jehoiada took two wives for him, and he became the father of sons and daughters.
translation: En Jehoiada het vir hom twee vrouens geneem, en hy het pa van seuns en dogters geword.

original: And he said to him, I will come and make him well.
translation: Hy het vir hom gesê, ek gaan kom en hom gesond maak.

original: Then, after some days, the Jews made an agreement together to put him to death:
translation: Toe, na 'n paar dae, het die Jode saam 'n ooreenkoms gemaak om hom dood te maak:

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sonde offer;

original: You sent the springs into the valleys; they are flowing between the hills.
translation: Jy het die fonteine in die dale gestuur; hulle vloei tussen die heuwels.

original: That all of you have made designs against me, and not one of you gave me word when my son made an agreement with the son of Jesse, and not one of you has pity for me or has made my eyes open to the fact that my servant has been moved by my son against me, as at this day?
translation: Julle het almal teen my saamgewerk, en niemand van julle het my iets gesê toe my seun 'n ooreenkoms met die seun van Jesse gemaak het nie. Niemand het jammer vir my gevoel of my oë geopen dat my dienaar deur my seun teen my gedoen is, soos vandag nie?

original: This is what the Lord has said: Do what is right, judging uprightly, and make free from the hands of the cruel one him whose goods have been violently taken away: do no wrong and be not violent to the man from a strange country and the child without a father and the widow, and let not those who have done no wrong be put to death in this place.
translation: Hier is wat die Here gesê het: Doen wat reg is, oordeel eerlik, en stel vry diegene wie se goed met geweld gesteel is uit die hande van die wrede. Moet nie kwaad doen nie en wees nie gewelddadig teen die man van 'n ander land, die kind sonder 'n pa, of die weduwee nie, en moenie toelaat dat diegene wat niks verkeerd gedoen het, in hierdie plek doodgemaak word nie.

original: Now after this Joash had a desire to put the house of the Lord into good order again;
translation: Toe het Joash graag gewil dat God se huis weer in orde gebring moet word.

original: But Saul got knowledge of their design. And they kept watch day and night on the roads out of the town, so that they might put him to death:
translation: Maar Saul het van hul plan geweet. Hulle het dag en nag op die paaie buite die dorp gewaak, sodat hulle hom kon doodmaak.

original: And the captain in answer said, Lord, I am not good enough for you to come under my roof; but only say the word, and my servant will be made well.
translation: Die hoofman het geantwoord en gesê, Here, ek is nie goed genoeg dat U onder my dak kom nie; maar sê net die woord, en my diener sal gesond wees.

original: They give drink to every beast of the field; the mountain asses come to them for water.
translation: Hulle gee vir elke dier in die veld om te drink; die bergesels kom na hulle toe vir water.

original: And God said, Let us make man in our image, like us: and let him have rule over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over the cattle and over all the earth and over every living thing which goes flat on the earth.
translation: En God het gesê, Kom ons maak die mens soos ons, in ons beeld: en laat hom regeer oor die vissies in die see, die voëls in die lug, die diere, oor die hele aarde en oor elke lewende ding wat op die aarde rondbeweeg.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Abidan, the son of Gideoni.
translation: En vir die vrede-offergawes, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Abidan, die seun van Gideoni.

original: Then Doeg, the Edomite, who was by the side of the servants of Saul, in answer said, I saw the son of Jesse coming to Nob, to Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub.
translation: Toe het Doeg, die Edomiet, wat by Saul se dienaars was, geantwoord: Ek het die seun van Jesse gesien wat na Nob kom, by Ahimelech, die seun van Ahitub.

original: The birds of the air have their resting-places by them, and make their song among the branches.
translation: Die voëls in die lug het plekke om te rus en sing hul lied tussen die takke.

original: But his disciples took him by night and let him down from the wall in a basket.
translation: maar sy dissipels het hom snags geneem en in 'n mandjie van die muur af laat sak.

original: And God made man in his image, in the image of God he made him: male and female he made them.
translation: En God het die mens in sy beeld gemaak; man en vrou het Hy gemaak.

original: For if you truly do this, then there will come in through the doors of this house kings seated on the seat of David, going in carriages and on horseback, he and his servants and his people
translation: As jy dit regtig doen, sal konings deur die deure van hierdie huis inkom, wat op Dawid se troon sit, en wat in waens en op perde ry, hy, sy helpers en sy mense.

original: Because I myself am a man under authority, having under me fighting men; and I say to this one, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my servant, Do this, and he does it.
translation: Ek is 'n man onder gesag, met soldate onder my. Ek sê vir hierdie een: Gaan, en hy gaan. Ek sê vir 'n ander: Kom, en hy kom. Ek sê vir my dienskneg: Doen dit, en hy doen dit.

original: On the tenth day Ahiezer; the son of Ammishaddai, chief of the children of Dan:
translation: Op die tiende dag het Ahiezer, die seun van Ammishaddai, die hoof van die Dan-stam, begin.

original: And getting together the priests and Levites, he said to them, Go out into the towns of Judah year by year, and get from all Israel money to keep the house of your God in good condition; and see that this is done without loss of time. The Levites, however, were slow in doing so.
translation: En toe hy die priesters en Leviete bymekaar gebring het, het hy vir hulle gesê: Gaan jaar na jaar in die dorpe van Juda uit, en kry geld van heel Israel om die huis van julle God in 'n goeie toestand te hou; en sorg dat dit gou gedoen word. Die Leviete was egter stadig om dit te doen.

original: He sends down rain from his store-houses on the hills: the earth is full of the fruit of his works.
translation: Hy stuur reën uit sy voorrade op die heuwels: die aarde is vol van die vrugte van wat Hy gedoen het.

original: And when he came to Jerusalem, he made an attempt to be joined to the disciples, but they were all in fear of him, not taking him for a disciple.
translation: En toe hy in Jerusalem kom, het hy probeer om by die dissipels aan te sluit, maar hulle was almal bang vir hom en het hom nie as 'n dissipel gesien nie.

original: But if you do not give ear to these words, I give you my oath by myself, says the Lord, that this house will become a waste.
translation: Maar as julle nie na hierdie woorde luister nie, maak ek vir julle 'n eed, sê die Here, dat hierdie huis 'n puinhoop sal wees.

original: And he got directions from the Lord for him, and gave him food, and put in his hand the sword of Goliath the Philistine.
translation: En hy het instruksies van die Here gekry, en hom kos gegee, en die swaard van Goliat, die Filistyn, in sy hand gesit.

original: And when these words came to the ears of Jesus he was surprised, and said to those who came after him, Truly I say to you, I have not seen such great faith, no, not in Israel.
translation: En toe hierdie woorde by Jesus gekom het, was hy verbaas en het vir die mense wat hom gevolg het gesê: "Ek sê vir julle, ek het nie so 'n groot geloof gesien nie, nie eers in Israel nie."

original: And God gave them his blessing and said to them, Be fertile and have increase, and make the earth full and be masters of it; be rulers over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the air and over every living thing moving on the earth.
translation: En God het vir hulle sy seën gegee en gesê: 'Wees vrugbaar en vermeerder, maak die aarde vol en wees in beheer daarvan; wees die heersers oor die visse in die see, oor die voëls in die lug en oor alles wat op die aarde beweeg.'

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy aanbod was 'n silwer skinkbord wat honderd en dertig sikkels gewig was, 'n silwer bak van sewentig sikkels, volgens die skaal van die heilige plek; die twee was vol van die lekkerste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanoffer.

original: He makes the grass come up for the cattle, and plants for the use of man; so that bread may come out of the earth;
translation: Hy laat die gras groei vir die diere en plante wat mense kan gebruik, sodat daar brood uit die grond kan kom.

original: And I say to you that numbers will come from the east and the west, and will take their seats with Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, in the kingdom of heaven:
translation: Ek sê vir julle dat daar mense van die ooste en die weste gaan kom, en hulle gaan saam met Abraham, Isak en Jakob in die hemel se koninkryk sit.

original: For this is what the Lord has said about the family of the king of Judah: You are Gilead to me, and the top of Lebanon: but, truly, I will make you waste, with towns unpeopled.
translation: Want dit is wat die Here gesê het oor die familie van die koning van Juda: Jy is vir My soos Gilead en die hoogste punt van Libanon; maar, regtig, ek sal jou verwoes en dorpe sonder mense maak.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien shekel, vol speserye;

original: Then the king sent for Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and for all the men of his father's family who were priests in Nob: and they all came to the king.
translation: Toe het die koning vir Ahimelech die priester gestuur, die seun van Ahitub, en vir al die mans van sy pa se familie wat priesters in Nob was: en hulle het almal na die koning gekom.

original: And God said, See, I have given you every plant producing seed, on the face of all the earth, and every tree which has fruit producing seed: they will be for your food:
translation: En God het gesê, Kyk, ek het vir julle elke plant wat saad maak gegee reg oor die aarde, en elke boom wat vrugte het wat saad het: hulle sal vir julle kos wees.

original: Then the king sent for Jehoiada, the chief priest, and said to him, Why have you not given the Levites orders that the tax fixed by Moses, the servant of the Lord, and by the meeting of Israel, for the Tent of witness, is to be got in from Judah and Jerusalem and handed over?
translation: Toe het die koning vir Jehoiada, die hoëpriester, gestuur en vir hom gesê: Waarom het jy nie vir die Leviete gesê dat hulle die belasting wat Moses, God se dienaar, gemaak het, van Juda en Jerusalem moet insamel en aan die Tent van die getuienis moet gee nie?

original: But Barnabas took him to the Apostles and gave them an account of how he had seen the Lord on the road, and had given hearing to his words, and how at Damascus he had been preaching in the name of Jesus without fear.
translation: Maar Barnabas het hom na die Apostels geneem en vir hulle vertel hoe hy die Here op die pad gesien het, en hoe hy na sy woorde geluister het, en hoe hy in Damaskus in die naam van Jesus gepreek het sonder om bang te wees.

original: And wine to make glad the heart of man, and oil to make his face shining, and bread giving strength to his heart.
translation: en wyn om die mens se hart bly te maak, en olie om sy gesig te laat skyn, en brood wat krag aan sy hart gee.

original: But the sons of the kingdom will be put out into the dark, and there will be weeping and cries of pain.
translation: Maar die seuns van die koninkryk sal in die donker geplaas word, en daar sal gehuil en geroep word van pyn.

original: And he was with them, going in and out at Jerusalem,
translation: En hy was saam met hulle, en het in en uit Jerusalem gegaan.

original: For the house of the Lord had been broken up by Athaliah, that evil woman, and her sons; and all its holy things they had given to the Baals.
translation: Die huis van die Here is deur die slegte vrou Athaliah en haar seuns afgebreek, en hulle het al die heilige goed aan die Baäls gegee.

original: And Saul said, Give ear now, O son of Ahitub. And answering he said, Here I am, my lord.
translation: En Saul het gesê, Luister nou, O seun van Ahitub. En hy het geantwoord, Hier is ek, my heer.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, 'n manlike skaap, 'n manlike lammertjie van die eerste jaar, vir 'n vuuroffer;

original: And Jesus said to the captain, Go in peace; as your faith is, so let it be done to you. And the servant was made well in that hour.
translation: [Translation failed: __mp_main__.setup_agents.<locals>.transfer_to_qa() argument after ** must be a mapping, not NoneType]
error: __mp_main__.setup_agents.<locals>.transfer_to_qa() argument after ** must be a mapping, not NoneType

original: And to every beast of the earth and to every bird of the air and every living thing moving on the face of the earth I have given every green plant for food: and it was so.
translation: Ek het vir elke dier op die aarde, elke voël in die lug, en elke lewende ding wat op die grond beweeg, elke groen plant as kos gegee: en dit was so.

original: And I will make ready those who will send destruction on you, everyone armed for war: by them your best cedar-trees will be cut down and put in the fire.
translation: Ek sal mense gereedmaak wat verwoesting aan julle gaan bring, almal gewapend vir oorlog: deur hulle sal julle mooiste sederbome afgekap en in die vuur gegooi word.

original: The trees of the Lord are full of growth, the cedars of Lebanon of his planting;
translation: Die bome van die Here is vol groei, die sederbome van Libanon wat Hy geplant het.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok vir 'n sonde-offer;

original: So at the king's order they made a chest and put it outside the doorway of the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe die koning gesê het, het hulle 'n kis gemaak en dit buite die deur van God se huis gesit.

original: And when Jesus had come into Peter's house, he saw his wife's mother in bed, very ill.
translation: En toe Jesus by Petrus se huis aankom, het hy sy vrou se ma in die bed gesien, sy was baie siek.

original: Preaching in the name of the Lord without fear; and he had discussions with the Greek Jews; but they were working for his death.
translation: Preek in die naam van die Here sonder vrees; en hy het met die Griekse Jode gepraat; maar hulle het probeer om hom dood te maak.

original: And Saul said to him, Why have you made designs against me with the son of Jesse, giving him food and a sword and getting directions from the Lord for him, and helping him to take up arms against me, and to be on the watch to make a secret attack on me as he is doing now?
translation: En Saul het vir hom gesê, hoekom het jy planne teen my gemaak saam met die seun van Isai? Jy het vir hom kos en 'n swaard gegee, en die Here se leiding vir hom gekry, en hom gehelp om teen my te veg, en om op die uitkyk te wees om 'n geheime aanval op my te maak soos hy nou doen?

original: And God saw everything which he had made and it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day.
translation: En God het alles gesien wat Hy gemaak het en dit was baie goed. En daar was aand en daar was oggend, die sesde dag.

original: And an order was sent out through all Judah and Jerusalem that payment was to be made to the Lord of the tax which Moses, the servant of God, had put on Israel in the waste land.
translation: Daar was 'n bevel wat deur heel Juda en Jerusalem gestuur is dat daar betaling gemaak moes word aan die Here vir die belasting wat Moses, God se dienaar, op Israel in die woestyn gestel het.

original: And when the brothers had knowledge of it, they took him to Caesarea and sent him to Tarsus.
translation: Toe die broers daarvan verneem, het hulle hom na Caesarea gestuur en daarna na Tarsus.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Ahiezer, die seun van Ammishaddai.

original: And nations from all sides will go past this town, and every man will say to his neighbour, Why has the Lord done such things to this great town?
translation: En mense van oral sal verby hierdie dorp gaan, en elke man sal vir sy buurman sê, Hoekom het die Here sulke dinge aan hierdie groot dorp gedoen?

original: Where the birds have their resting-places; as for the stork, the tall trees are her house.
translation: Waar die voëls hul nes het; en vir die ooievaar, die lang bome is haar huis.

original: And he put his hand on hers and the disease went from her, and she got up and took care of his needs.
translation: Hy het sy hand op haarne gegee en die siekte het van haar af gegaan, en sy het opgestaan en vir hom gesorg.

original: On the eleventh day Pagiel, the son of Ochran, chief of the children of Asher:
translation: Op die elfde dag het Pagiel, die seun van Ochran, die hoof van die kinders van Aser:

original: And all the chiefs and all the people came gladly and put their money into the chest, till they had all given.
translation: En al die leiers en al die mense het bly bymekaargekom en hul geld in die boks gesit, totdat hulle almal gegee het.

original: And they will say, Because they gave up the agreement of the Lord their God, and became worshippers and servants of other gods.
translation: Hulle sal sê dat hulle die ooreenkoms met God, hulle Here, opgegee het en dat hulle aanbidders en dienaars van ander gode geword het.

original: Then Ahimelech answering said to the king, Who among all your servants is so true to you as David, who is the king's son-in-law, and is a captain of your armed men, and has a place of honour in your house?
translation: Toe het Ahimelech geantwoord en vir die koning gesê: Wie onder al jou dienaars is so getrou aan jou soos David, wat jou skoonseun is, en 'n leier van jou soldate is, en 'n plek van eer in jou huis het?

original: And the heaven and the earth and all things in them were complete.
translation: En die hemel en die aarde en al die dinge daarin was voltooi.

original: The high hills are a safe place for the mountain goats, and the rocks for the small beasts.
translation: Die hoë heuwels is 'n veilige plek vir die bergbokke, en die klippe is vir die klein diertjies.

original: And so the church through all Judaea and Galilee and Samaria had peace and was made strong; and, living in the fear of the Lord and in the comfort of the Holy Spirit, was increased greatly.
translation: Die kerk het vrede gehad en is sterk gemaak regoor Juda, Galilea en Samaria. Hulle het in die vrees van die Here geleef en die troos van die Heilige Gees ervaar, en hulle het baie gegroei.

original: And in the evening, they took to him a number of people who had evil spirits; and he sent the spirits out of them with a word, and made well all who were ill;
translation: En in die aand het hulle 'n paar mense na hom gebring wat slegte geeste gehad het; en hy het die geeste met 'n woord uit hulle gestuur, en almal wat siek was, gesond gemaak.

original: His offering was one silver plate; a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was 'n silwer skottel van honderddertig sikels, en 'n silwer bak van sewentig sikels, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; albei was vol van die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanoffer.

original: And it came about that while Peter was going through all parts of the country he came to the saints who were living at Lydda.
translation: En terwyl Petrus deur al die plekke van die land gegaan het, het hy by die gelowiges in Lydda gegaan.

original: Is this the first time I have got directions from God for him? Far be the thought! let the king make no such statement against his servant or my father's family, for your servant has no knowledge, great or small, of this thing.
translation: Is dit die eerste keer dat ek God se rigting vir hom ontvang? Niks van die gedagte! Laat die koning nie so iets teen sy dienaar of my pa se familie sê nie, want ek weet glad nie hiervan nie, groot of klein.

original: He made the moon for a sign of the divisions of the year; teaching the sun the time of its going down.
translation: Hy het die maan gemaak as 'n teken van die seisoene en wys die son wanneer dit ondergaan.

original: Let there be no weeping for the dead, and make no songs of grief for him: but make bitter weeping for him who has gone away, for he will never come back or see again the country of his birth.
translation: Moet nie vir die wat gesterf het huil nie, en maak nie treurliedere vir hom nie: maar huil hartseer vir die een wat weggegaan het, want hy sal nooit weer terugkom of sy geboorteland weer sien.

original: So when the chest was taken to the king's servants by the Levites, and they saw that there was much money in it, the king's scribe and the chief priest's servant took the money out, and put the chest back in its place. They did this day by day, and got together a great amount of money.
translation: Toe die Leviete die boksie na die koning se dienaars gebring het en hulle gesien het daar is baie geld daarin, het die koning se skrywer en die hoëpriester se dienaar die geld uitgehaal en die boksie weer op sy plek gesit. Hulle het dit elke dag gedoen en 'n groot hoeveelheid geld bymekaar gemaak.

original: So that the word of Isaiah the prophet might come true: He himself took our pains and our diseases.
translation: So dat die woorde van die profeet Jesaja waar kan word: Hy het ons pyn en siektes op Hom geneem.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sikkels, vol speserye;

original: And on the seventh day God came to the end of all his work; and on the seventh day he took his rest from all the work which he had done.
translation: Op die sewende dag het God sy werk afgehandel; en op die sewende dag het Hy gerus van al die werk wat Hy gedoen het.

original: When you make it dark, it is night, when all the beasts of the woods come quietly out of their secret places.
translation: Wanneer dit donker raak, is dit nag, wanneer al die diere van die bos stil uit hul verborge plekke kom.

original: And the king said, You will certainly be put to death, Ahimelech, you and all your father's family.
translation: Die koning het gesê: "Jy gaan beslis doodgemaak word, Ahimelech, jy en jou hele pa se gesin."

original: And there was a certain man there, named Aeneas, who for eight years had been in bed, without power of moving.
translation: En daar was 'n man daar, wat Aeneas genoem word, wat al agt jaar in die bed gelê het, sonder om te kan beweeg.

original: Then the king and Jehoiada gave it to those who were responsible for getting the work done on the Lord's house, and with it they got wall-builders and woodworkers and metal-workers to put the house of the Lord in good order again.
translation: Toe het die koning en Jehoiada dit aan die mense gegee wat verantwoordelik was vir die werk aan God se huis, en so het hulle muurmakers, houtwerkers en metaalwerkers gekry om God se huis weer reg te maak.

original: For this is what the Lord has said about Shallum, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, who became king in place of Josiah his father, who went out from this place: He will never come back there again:
translation: Want dit is wat die Here gesê het oor Shallum, die seun van Josia, die koning van Juda, wat koning geword het in die plek van sy pa Josia, wat uit hierdie plek gegaan het: Hy sal nooit weer daarheen terugkom nie.

original: Now when Jesus saw a great mass of people about him, he gave an order to go to the other side.
translation: Toe Jesus 'n groot groep mense om hom sien, het hy gesê hulle moet oorsteek na die ander kant.

original: And God gave his blessing to the seventh day and made it holy: because on that day he took his rest from all the work which he had made and done.
translation: En God het sy seën gegee aan die sewende dag en dit heilig gemaak, omdat Hy op daardie dag van al die werk wat Hy gedoen het, rus geneem het.
