original: The young lions go thundering after their food; searching for their meat from God.
translation: Die jong leeus jaag na hulle kos; hulle soek vir die vlees wat God voorsien.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, 'n ram, 'n lammetjie van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: The sun comes up, and they come together, and go back to their secret places to take their rest.
translation: Die son kom op, en hulle kom saam, dan gaan hulle terug na hulle geheime plekke om te rus.

original: And there came a scribe and said to him, Master, I will come after you wherever you go.
translation: En daar het 'n skrifgeleerde na Hom toe gekom en gesê: Meester, ek sal jou volg, waar jy ook al gaan.

original: But death will come to him in the place where they have taken him away prisoner, and he will never see this land again.
translation: Maar die dood sal hom tref op die plek waar hulle hom as 'n gevangene weg geneem het, en hy sal hierdie land nooit weer sien nie.

original: And Peter said to him, Aeneas, Jesus Christ makes you well: get up and make your bed. And straight away he got up.
translation: En Peter het vir hom gesê, Aeneas, Jesus Christus maak jou gesond: staan op en maak jou bed. En hy het dadelik opgestaan.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: 'n Manlike bok vir 'n sonde-offering;

original: Then the king said to the runners who were waiting near him, Put the priests of the Lord to death; because they are on David's side, and having knowledge of his flight, did not give me word of it. But the king's servants would not put out their hands to make an attack on the Lord's priests.
translation: Toe sê die koning vir die boodskappers wat naby hom gewag het, 'Maak die priesters van die Here dood; omdat hulle aan David se kant is en geweet het van sy vlug, maar nie vir my gesê het nie.' Maar die koning se dienaars wou nie hulle hande uitsteke om die Here se priesters aan te val nie.

original: Man goes out to his work, and to his business, till the evening.
translation: Die man gaan uit na sy werk en sy besigheid, tot in die aand.

original: So the workmen did their work, making good what was damaged and building up the house of God till it was strong and beautiful again.
translation: Die werkers het hul werk gedoen, hulle het reggemaak wat beskadig was en God se huis weer opgebou until dit sterk en mooi geword het.

original: These are the generations of the heaven and the earth when they were made.
translation: Dit is die geslagte van die hemel en die aarde toe hulle gemaak is.

original: And all those living in Lydda and Sharon saw him, and were turned to the Lord.
translation: En al die mense wat in Lydda en Sharon gewoon het, het hom gesien en het na die Here gedraai.

original: And Jesus said to him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of heaven have a resting-place; but the Son of man has nowhere to put his head.
translation: En Jesus het vir hom gesê: Die jakkals het gate om in te gaan, en die voëls van die lug het 'n plek om te sit; maar die Seun van die mens het nêrens om sy kop neer te lê nie.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Pagiel, the son of Ochran.
translation: En vir die vrede-offers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies wat een jaar oud is: dit was die offer van Pagiel, die seun van Ochran.

original: On the twelfth day Ahira, the son of Enan, chief of the children of Naphtali:
translation: Op die twaalfde dag het Ahira, Enan se seun, die hoof van die Naphtali-kinders, gebring:

original: And another of the disciples said to him, Lord, let me first go and give the last honours to my father.
translation: En een van die dissipels het vir Hom gesê: "Here, laat my eers gaan om my pa se laaste eer te betoon."

original: Now there was at Joppa a certain disciple named Tabitha, that is, Dorcas: this woman was given to good works and acts of mercy at all times.
translation: Daar was in Joppe 'n leerder met die naam Tabitha, wat ook Dorcas genoem word. Hierdie vrou het altyd goeie dinge gedoen en ander gehelp.

original: A curse is on him who is building his house by wrongdoing, and his rooms by doing what is not right; who makes use of his neighbour without payment, and gives him nothing for his work;
translation: Hy is onder 'n vloek omdat hy sy huis op onregverdigheid bou en sy kamers nie reg is nie; hy gebruik sy buurman sonder om hom te betaal en gee hom niks vir sy werk nie.

original: O Lord, how great is the number of your works! in wisdom you have made them all; the earth is full of the things you have made.
translation: O Here, hoe groot is die aantal van U werke! U het hulle almal met wysheid gemaak; die aarde is vol van alles wat U geskep het.

original: And when the work was done, they took the rest of the money to the king and Jehoiada, and it was used for making the vessels for the house of the Lord, all the vessels needed for the offerings, the spoons and the vessels of gold and silver. And as long as Jehoiada was living, the regular burned offerings were offered in the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe hulle klaar was met die werk, het hulle die oorblywende geld na die koning en Jehoiada geneem. Dit is gebruik om goed te maak vir God se huis, alles wat nodig was vir die offerings, soos die lepels en die voorwerpe van goud en silwer. Solank Jehoiada gelewe het, het hulle gereeld gebrande offers in God se huis gebring.

original: In the day when the Lord God made earth and heaven there were no plants of the field on the earth, and no grass had come up: for the Lord God had not sent rain on the earth and there was no man to do work on the land.
translation: In die dag toe die Here God die aarde en die hemel gemaak het, was daar geen plante op die aarde nie, en geen gras het gegroei nie, want die Here God het nie reën op die aarde gestuur nie, en daar was niemand om op die grond te werk nie.

original: Then the king said to Doeg, You are to put the priests to death. And Doeg the Edomite, turning on the priests and attacking them, put to death that day eighty-five men who took up the ephod.
translation: Toe sê die koning vir Doeg, jy moet die priesters doodmaak. En Doeg die Edomiet het die priesters aangeval en daardie dag het hy vyf-en-tagtig mense doodgemaak wat die efod gedra het.

original: And it came about, in those days, that she got ill and came to her death: and when she had been washed, they put her in a room which was high up.
translation: In daardie dae het sy siek geword en gesterf. Nadat hulle haar gewas het, het hulle haar in 'n hoë kamer neergelê.

original: Who says, I will make a wide house for myself, and rooms of great size, and has windows cut out, and has it roofed with cedar and painted with bright red.
translation: Wie sê, ek gaan 'n groot huis vir myself maak met groot kamers, vensters en 'n dak van sederhout wat helder rooi geverf is.

original: But Jesus said to him, Come after me; and let the dead take care of their dead.
translation: Maar Jesus het vir hom gesê, kom na my toe; en laat die dooies om hul eie sorg.

original: But Jehoiada became old and full of days, and he came to his end; he was a hundred and thirty years old at the time of his death.
translation: Maar Jehoiada het oud geword en 'n vol lewe gehad, en toe het sy tyd gekom; hy was honderd en dertig jaar oud toe hy gesterf het.

original: His offering was one silver plate, a hundred and thirty shekels in weight, one silver basin of seventy shekels, by the scale of the holy place; the two of them full of the best meal mixed with oil for a meal offering;
translation: Sy offer was 'n silwer skottel wat honderd en dertig shekels weeg, 'n silwer bak van sewentig shekels, volgens die maat van die heilige plek; hulle was albei vol met die beste meel gemeng met olie vir 'n graanoffer.

original: There is the great, wide sea, where there are living things, great and small, more than may be numbered.
translation: Daar is die groot, wye see, waar daar lewende dinge is, groot en klein, meer as wat jy kan tel.

original: But a mist went up from the earth, watering all the face of the land.
translation: Maar 'n mis het uit die grond gestyg en die hele aarde natgemaak.

original: And when he had got into a boat, his disciples went after him.
translation: En toe hy in 'n boot geklim het, het sy dissipels hom gevolg.

original: Are you to be a king because you make more use of cedar than your father? did not your father take food and drink and do right, judging in righteousness, and then it was well for him?
translation: Is jy 'n koning omdat jy meer sederbome gebruik as jou pa? Het jou pa nie kos en drink geneem en reg gedoen deur regverdig te oordeel nie? Toe het dit goed gegaan met hom.

original: There go the ships; there is that great beast, which you have made as a plaything.
translation: Kyk hoe vaar die skepe; daar is daardie groot dier wat jy as 'n speelding gemaak het.

original: One gold spoon of ten shekels, full of spice;
translation: Een goue lepel van tien sikels, vol speserye;

original: And Nob, the town of the priests, he put to the sword, all the men and women, children and babies at the breast, and oxen and asses and sheep.
translation: En Nob, die dorpie van die priesters, het hy met die swaard doodgemaak, al die mans en vroue, kinders en babas, sowel as osse, esels en skape.

original: And the Lord God made man from the dust of the earth, breathing into him the breath of life: and man became a living soul.
translation: Die Here God het die mens uit die stof van die aarde gemaak en vir hom die asem van die lewe gegee: en die mens het 'n lewende siel geword.

original: And because Lydda was near Joppa, the disciples, having knowledge that Peter was there, sent two men to him, requesting him to come to them straight away.
translation: En omdat Lydda naby Joppa was, het die dissipels geweet dat Petrus daar was, en hulle het twee mans na hom gestuur om hom te vra om dadelik na hulle toe te kom.

original: All of them are waiting for you, to give them their food in its time.
translation: Hulle wag almal vir jou om vir hulle kos te gee wanneer dit tyd is.

original: And there came up a great storm in the sea, so that the boat was covered with the waves: but he was sleeping.
translation: Daar het 'n groot storm op die see ontstaan, sodat die boot deur die golwe bedek was: maar hy het geslaap.

original: One young ox, one male sheep, one he-lamb of the first year, for a burned offering;
translation: Een jong os, een ram, een manlike lam van die eerste jaar, vir 'n brandoffer;

original: And they put him into his last resting-place in the town of David, among the kings, because he had done good in Israel for God and for his house.
translation: Hulle het hom in sy laaste rusplek in die dorp van Dawid gesit, tussen die konings, want hy het goed gedoen in Israel vir God en sy familie.

original: And Abiathar, one of the sons of Ahimelech, the son of Ahitub, got away and went in flight after David;
translation: En Abiathar, een van Ahimelech se seuns, het ontsnap en na David gevlug.

original: He was judge in the cause of the poor and those in need; then it was well. Was not this to have knowledge of me? says the Lord.
translation: Hy het oor die arme mense en diegene in nood geoordeel; toe was dit reg. Was dit nie om my te verstaan nie? sê die Here.

original: One male of the goats for a sin-offering;
translation: Een manlike bok as 'n sonde-offer.

original: And they came to him, and, awaking him, said, Help, Lord; destruction is near.
translation: Hulle het na hom toe gegaan en hom wakker gemaak, en gesê: "Help, Here; die ondergang is naby."

original: And the Lord God made a garden in the east, in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had made.
translation: En die Here God het 'n tuin in die ooste gemaak, in Eden; en daar het Hy die man wat Hy gemaak het, geplaas.

original: And gave him the news of how Saul had put to death the Lord's priests.
translation: Hy het vir hom vertel hoe Saul die Here se priesters doodgemaak het.

original: They take what you give them; they are full of the good things which come from your open hand.
translation: Hulle neem wat jy hulle gee; hulle is vol van die goeie dinge wat uit jou oop hand kom.

original: Now after the death of Jehoiada, the chiefs of Judah came and went down on their faces before the king. Then the king gave ear to them.
translation: Nou, nadat Jehojada gesterf het, het die leiers van Juda gekom en voor die koning neergeval. Toe het die koning na hulle geluister.

original: And Peter went with them. And when he had come, they took him into the room: and all the widows were there, weeping and putting before him the coats and clothing which Dorcas had made while she was with them.
translation: En Petrus het saam met hulle gegaan. Toe hy aankom, het hulle hom in die kamer ingeneem: en al die verlate vroue was daar en het gehuil en het vir hom die klere en goedjies gewys wat Dorcas gemaak het terwyl sy saam met hulle was.

original: If your face is veiled, they are troubled; when you take away their breath, they come to an end, and go back to the dust.
translation: As jou gesig bedek is, raak hulle ontsteld; wanneer jy hulle asem wegneem, kom hulle tot 'n einde en gaan terug na die stof.

original: And out of the earth the Lord made every tree to come, delighting the eye and good for food; and in the middle of the garden, the tree of life and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
translation: En uit die grond het die Here elke boom gemaakt wat mooi is om na te kyk en lekker om te eet; en in die middel van die tuin was die boom van die lewe en die boom van die kennis van goed en sleg.

original: And for the peace-offerings, two oxen, five male sheep, five he-goats, five he-lambs of the first year: this was the offering of Ahira, the son of Enan.
translation: En vir die vredesoffers, twee osse, vyf ramme, vyf bokke, vyf lammetjies van die eerste jaar: dit was die offer van Ahira, die seun van Enan.

original: And he said to them, Why are you full of fear, O you of little faith? Then he got up and gave orders to the winds and the sea; and there was a great calm.
translation: En hy het vir hulle gesê, Hoekom is julle so bang, julle met 'n klein geloof? Toe het hy opgestaan en vir die winde en die see gesê om stil te wees; en dit het baie kalm geword.

original: And David said to Abiathar, I was certain that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would take the news to Saul: I am responsible for the lives of all your father's family.
translation: En David het vir Abiathar gesê: "Ek was daardie dag seker, toe Doeg die Edomiet daar was, dat hy die nuus na Saul sou neem: Ek is verantwoordelik vir die lewens van julle pa se hele familie."

original: But your eyes and your heart are fixed only on profit for yourself, on causing the death of him who has done no wrong, and on violent and cruel acts.
translation: Maar jou oë en jou hart kyk net na jou eie wins, om iemand wat niks verkeerd gedoen het, se dood te laat gebeur, en om gewelddadige en wrede dinge te doen.

original: And a river went out of Eden giving water to the garden; and from there it was parted and became four streams.
translation: En 'n rivier het uit Eden uitgekom om die tuin van water te gee; en van daar het dit in vier strome verdeel.

original: If you send out your spirit, they are given life; you make new the face of the earth.
translation: As jy jou Gees uitstuur, kry hulle lewe; jy maak die aarde weer nuut.

original: And they gave up the house of the Lord God of their fathers, and became worshippers of pillars of wood and of the images; and because of this sin of theirs, wrath came on Judah and Jerusalem.
translation: Hulle het God se huis van hul vaders opgegee en het begin om pille van hout en beelde aan te bid; en omdat hulle dit gedoen het, het woede oor Juda en Jerusalem gekom.

original: These were the offerings given for the altar by the chiefs of Israel, when the holy oil was put on it: twelve silver plates, twelve silver basins, twelve gold spoons;
translation: Dit was die aanbiedinge wat die leiers van Israel vir die altaar gegee het, toe die heilige olie daarop gesit is: twaalf silwerplate, twaalf silwerbakke, twaalf goue lepels;

original: But Peter made them all go outside, and went down on his knees in prayer; and turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, get up. And, opening her eyes, she saw Peter and got up.
translation: Maar Petrus het vir almal gesê om buite te gaan, en hy het op sy knieë gebid; toe hy na die liggaam kyk, het hy gesê: 'Tabitha, staan op.' Toe sy haar oë oopmaak, het sy Petrus gesien en opgestaan.

original: And the Lord sent them prophets to make them come back to him; and they gave witness against them, but they would not give ear.
translation: En die Here het profete na hulle gestuur om hulle terug na Hom te bring; maar hulle het nie geluister nie.

original: And the men were full of wonder, saying, What sort of man is this, that even the winds and the sea do his orders?
translation: En die mense was verbysterd en het gesê: Wat vir 'n man is hierdie, wat selfs die winde en die see op sy bevel luister?

original: So this is what the Lord has said about Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah: They will make no weeping for him, saying, Ah my brother! or, Ah sister! they will make no weeping for him, saying, Ah lord! or, Ah his glory!
translation: So dit is wat die Here gesê het oor Jehoiakim, die seun van Josia, die koning van Juda: Hulle gaan nie vir hom huil nie en sê, Ah my broer! of, Ah suster! Hulle gaan nie vir hom huil nie en sê, Ah meneer! of, Ah sy eer!

original: Let the glory of the Lord be for ever; let the Lord have joy in his works:
translation: Laat die heerlikheid van die Here altyd daar wees; laat die Here bly wees oor sy werke.

original: Keep here with me and have no fear; for he who has designs on my life has designs on yours: but with me you will be safe.
translation: Bly hier by my en moenie bang wees nie; want hy wat vir my lewe beplan, beplan ook vir jou. Maar saam met my sal jy veilig wees.

original: The name of the first is Pishon, which goes round about all the land of Havilah where there is gold.
translation: Die naam van die eerste is Pishon, wat rondom die hele land van Havilah loop waar daar goud is.

original: At whose look the earth is shaking; at whose touch the mountains send out smoke.
translation: Wanneer Hy kyk, bewe die aarde; wanneer Hy aanraak, stuur die berge rook uit.

original: The weight of every silver plate was a hundred and thirty shekels, and of every basin seventy; the weight of all the silver of the vessels was two thousand and four hundred shekels, by the scale of the holy place;
translation: Die gewig van elke silwer plaat was dertienhonderd shekels en van elke bak sewentig; die gewig van al die silwer van die houers was twee duisend en vierhonderd shekels, volgens die skaal van die heilige plek.

original: And they sent word to David, saying, The Philistines are fighting against Keilah and taking the grain from the grain-floors.
translation: Hulle het vir David gestuur om te sê dat die Filisteine teen Keilah veg en die graan van die graanvloere neem.

original: And he took her hand, lifting her up; and, sending for the saints and widows, he gave her to them, living.
translation: Hy het haar handgeneem en haar opgetel; en hy het die gelowiges en weduwees gestuur en haar lewendig aan hulle gegee.

original: They will do to him what they do to the dead body of an ass; his body will be pulled out and placed on the earth outside the doors of Jerusalem.
translation: Hulle gaan met hom maak soos wat hulle met die dood liggaam van 'n donkie maak; sy liggaam gaan uitgehaal en op die grond buite die deure van Jerusalem neergesit word.

original: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.
translation: En die goud van daardie land is goed: daar is bdellium en oniks.

original: And when he had come to the other side, to the country of the Gadarenes, there came out to him from the place of the dead, two who had evil spirits, so violent that no man was able to go that way.
translation: En toe hy aan die ander kant gekom het, in die land van die Gadareners, het daar twee mense met slegte geeste uit die dood na hom toe gekom, so gewelddadig dat niemand daardie pad kon loop nie.

original: I will make songs to the Lord all my life; I will make melody to my God while I have my being.
translation: Ek sal my hele lewe liedere vir die Here maak; ek sal melodieë vir my God maak solank ek leef.

original: Then the spirit of God came on Zechariah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, and, getting up before the people, he said to them, God has said, Why do you go against the orders of the Lord, so that everything goes badly for you? because you have given up the Lord, he has given you up.
translation: Toe het die Gees van God op Sagaria, die seun van Jehojada, die priester, gekom, en hy het voor die mense gestaan en vir hulle gesê: God sê, Hoekom gaan julle teen God se opdragte, sodat dit sleg met julle gaan? Omdat julle die Here losgelate het, het Hy ook julle verlaat.

original: And news of it went all through Joppa, and a number of people had faith in the Lord.
translation: Die nuus het oor Joppa versprei, en 'n paar mense het in die Here geglo.

original: So David, questioning the Lord, said, Am I to go and make an attack on these Philistines? And the Lord said to David, Go and make an attack on the Philistines so that Keilah may be kept from falling into their hands.
translation: Toe David die Here vra, het hy gesê: "Moet ek hierdie Filistyne aanval?" En die Here het vir David gesê: "Gaan en aanval die Filistyne sodat Keilah nie in hulle hande val nie."

original: And the name of the second river is Gihon: this river goes round all the land of Cush.
translation: Die naam van die tweede rivier is Gihon: hierdie rivier draai om al die land van Kus.

original: Let my thoughts be sweet to him: I will be glad in the Lord.
translation: Laat my gedagtes goed vir Hom wees: Ek sal bly wees in die Here.

original: The weight of the twelve gold spoons of spice for burning was ten shekels for every one, by the scale of the holy place; all the gold of the spoons was a hundred and twenty shekels;
translation: Die gewig van die twaalf goue lepels speserye om te brand was tien shekels elkeen, volgens die skaal van die heilige plek; al die goud van die lepels was honderd en twintig shekels.

original: But when they had made a secret design against him, he was stoned with stones, by the king's order, in the outer square of the Lord's house.
translation: Maar toe hulle 'n geheime plan teen hom gemaak het, is hy met klippe doodgestenig, op die koning se bevel, in die buiteplek van God se huis.

original: Go up to Lebanon and give a cry; let your voice be loud in Bashan, crying out from Abarim; for all your lovers have come to destruction
translation: Klim op na Libanon en skree; laat jou stem hard klink in Bashan, skree uit van Abarim; want al jou geliefdes is vernietig.

original: And he was living in Joppa for some time with Simon, a leather-worker.
translation: Hy het 'n tyd in Joppa gewoon saam met Simon, wat leerder was.

original: And David's men said to him, Even here in Judah we are full of fear: how much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?
translation: David se manne het vir hom gesê: hier in Juda is ons al vol vrees. Hoeveel meer sal ons wees as ons na Keilah gaan om teen die leër van die Filistyne te veg?

original: And they gave a loud cry, saying, What have we to do with you, you Son of God? Have you come here to give us punishment before the time?
translation: Hulle het hard geskree en gesê, Wat het ons met jou te doen, jy Seun van God? Het jy hierheen gekom om ons voordat dit tyd is te straf?

original: And the name of the third river is Tigris, which goes to the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.
translation: Die naam van die derde rivier is Tigris, wat na die ooste van Assirië vloei. Die vierde rivier is die Eufraat.

original: All the oxen, for the burned offering were twelve, the male sheep twelve, the he-lambs of the first year twelve, with their meal offering; and the males of the goats for sin-offering twelve;
translation: Al die osse vir die brandoffer was twaalf, die ramme twaalf, die manlike lammetjies van die eerste jaar twaalf, saam met hul graanoffer; en die manlike bokke vir die sondeoffer was ook twaalf.

original: Let sinners be cut off from the earth, and let all evil-doers come to an end. Give praise to the Lord, O my soul. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: Laat die sondenaars van die aarde wegraak, en laat al die slegte mense hul einde bereik. Lof die Here, my siel. Lof die Here.

original: My word came to you in the time of your well-being; but you said, I will not give ear. This has been your way from your earliest years, you did not give attention to my voice.
translation: My woord het na jou gekom toe dit goed met jou gegaan het; maar jy het gesê, ek gaan nie luister nie. Dit was al van jou jong dae af so, jy het nie na my stem geluister nie.

original: So King Joash did not keep in mind how good Jehoiada his father had been to him, but put his son to death. And in the hour of his death he said, May the Lord see it and take payment!
translation: Koning Joash het nie onthou hoe goed Jehoiada sy pa vir hom was nie, maar hy het sy seun doodgemaak. Toe hy doodgaan, het hy gesê: 'Mag die Here dit sien en regmaak!'

original: Now there was a certain man in Caesarea, named Cornelius, the captain of the Italian band of the army;
translation: Daar was 'n man in Caesarea, sy naam was Cornelius, die kaptein van die Italiaanse groep soldate.

original: Now there was, some distance away, a great herd of pigs taking their food.
translation: Nou was daar, 'n entjie verder, 'n groot groep varke wat hulle kos geniet.

original: O give praise to the Lord; give honour to his name, talking of his doings among the peoples.
translation: Loof die Here; gee eer aan sy naam en praat oor wat Hy onder die mense gedoen het.

original: All the keepers of your sheep will be food for the wind, and your lovers will be taken away prisoners: truly, then you will be shamed and unhonoured because of all your evil-doing.
translation: Al die mense wat jou skape oppas, sal soos kos vir die wind wees, en jou geliefdes sal as gevangenes weg geneem word: werklik, dan sal jy geskam en ongeërd wees oor al jou slegte dade.

original: Then David put the question to the Lord again, and the Lord answering said, Up! go down to Keilah; for I will give the Philistines into your hands.
translation: Toe het David weer vir die Here gevra, en die Here het geantwoord, "Staan op! Gaan na Keilah toe; want ek sal die Filistyne in jou hande gee."

original: And the Lord God took the man and put him in the garden of Eden to do work in it and take care of it.
translation: En die Here God het die man geneem en in die tuin van Eden gesit om daarin te werk en dit te versorg.

original: A serious-minded man, fearing God with all his family; he gave much money to the poor, and made prayer to God at all times.
translation: Hy was 'n ernstige man wat vir God vrees gehad het saam met sy hele gesin; hy het baie geld aan die armes gegee en altyd gebid tot God.

original: And the evil spirits made strong prayers to him, saying, If you send us out, let us go into the herd of pigs.
translation: Die bose geeste het vir hom sterk gebid en gesê: "As jy ons wegstuur, laat ons in die varke gaan."

original: And all the oxen for the peace-offerings, twenty-four oxen, the male sheep sixty, and the he-goats sixty, the he-lambs of the first year sixty. This was given for the altar after the holy oil was put on it.
translation: En al die osse vir die vredesoffers, vier-en-twintig osse, sestig manlike skape, sestig bokke en sestig rammetjies van die eerste jaar. Dit is gegee vir die altaar nadat die heilige olie daarop gesit is.

original: So David and his men went to Keilah, and had a fight with the Philistines, and took away their cattle, and put them to the sword with great destruction. So David was the saviour of the people of Keilah.
translation: So het David en sy manne na Keilah gegaan, en hulle het met die Filistyne geveg, hulle se diere weggevat en baie vernietiging veroorsaak. So was David die redder van die mense van Keilah.

original: O you who are living in Lebanon, making your living-place in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied will you be when pains come on you, as on a woman in childbirth!
translation: O julle wat in Libanon woon en julle huis tussen die sederbome bou, julle gaan baie sleg voel wanneer pyn julle oorval, soos 'n vrou wat geboorte gee!

original: Now in the spring, the army of the Aramaeans came up against him; they came against Judah and Jerusalem, putting to death all the great men of the people and sending all the goods they took from them to the king of Damascus.
translation: Nou in die lente het die Arameerse leër teen hom gekom. Hulle het Juda en Jerusalem aangeval, al die belangrike mense van die volk doodgemaak, en al die goed wat hulle van hulle geneem het, na die koning van Damaskus gestuur.

original: He saw in a vision, clearly, at about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of the Lord coming to him and saying to him, Cornelius!
translation: Hy het in 'n visie duidelik gesien, omtrent die negende uur van die dag, 'n engel van die Here wat na hom toe kom en vir hom sê, Cornelius!

original: And the Lord God gave the man orders, saying, You may freely take of the fruit of every tree of the garden:
translation: Die Here God het vir die man gesê dat hy gratis vrugte van elke boom in die tuin mag pluk.

original: Let your voice be sounding in songs and melody; let all your thoughts be of the wonder of his works.
translation: Laat jou stem klink in liedjies en musiek; maak seker jou gedagtes is vol van die wonder van wat Hy doen.

original: And he said to them, Go. And they came out, and went into the pigs; and the herd went rushing down a sharp slope into the sea and came to their end in the water.
translation: Hy het vir hulle gesê, Gaan. En hulle het uitgekom en in die varke ingegaan; toe het die kudde af die steile helling in die see gelaai en in die water geëindig.

original: Now when Abiathar, the son of Ahimelech, went in flight to David, he came down to Keilah with the ephod in his hand.
translation: Toe Abiathar, die seun van Ahimelech, na David gevlug het, het hy na Keilah gegaan met die efod in sy hand.

original: For though the army of Aram was only a small one, the Lord gave a very great army into their hands, because they had given up the Lord, the God of their fathers. So they put into effect the punishment of Joash.
translation: Al was die leër van Aram net klein, het die Here 'n baie groot leër in hulle hande gegee, omdat hulle die Here, hulle pa se God, verlaat het. So het hulle die straf van Joash begin uitvoer.

original: But of the fruit of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you may not take; for on the day when you take of it, death will certainly come to you.
translation: Maar jy mag nie die vrug van die boom van die kennis van goed en kwaad neem nie; want op die dag wanneer jy dit neem, sal jy beslis doodgaan.

original: By my life, says the Lord, even if Coniah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, was the ring on my right hand, even from there I would have you pulled off;
translation: Ek sê, sê God, al was Coniah, die seun van Jehoiakim, die koning van Juda, die ring aan my regterhand, ek sou jou nog daar verwerp.

original: And their keepers went in flight to the town and gave an account of everything, and of the men who had the evil spirits.
translation: En hulle se oppassers het na die dorp gevlug en het alles vertel, insluitend van die mense met die slegte geeste.

original: And when Moses went into the Tent of meeting to have talk with him, then the Voice came to his ears from over the cover which was on the ark of witness, from between the two winged ones. And he had talk with him.
translation: En toe Moses in die Tent van ontmoeting gaan om met Hom te praat, het die Stem in sy ore geklink van oor die bedekking van die ark van getuienis, van tussen die twee gevleuelde skepsele. Hy het met Hom gepraat.

original: Have glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who are searching after the Lord be glad.
translation: Gee eer aan sy heilige naam; laat die harte van almal wat na die Here soek, bly wees.

original: And he, looking on him in fear, said, What is it, Lord? And he said to him, Your prayers and your offerings have come up to God, and he has kept them in mind.
translation: En hy het hom met vrees aangekyk en gesê: Wat is dit, Here? En hy het vir hom gesê: Jou gebede en jou offers het by God opgeduik, en Hy het dit in gedagte gehou.

original: And the Lord God said, It is not good for the man to be by himself: I will make one like himself as a help to him
translation: En die Here God het gesê, Dit is nie goed dat die man alleen is nie: Ek sal iemand maak wat soos hy is om hom te help.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: And all the town came out to Jesus; and seeing him they made request that he would go away from their part of the country.
translation: En die hele dorp het na Jesus toe gekom; toe hulle hom gesien het, het hulle hom gevra om van hulle plek af te gaan.

original: And when they had gone away from him, (for he was broken with disease,) his servants made a secret design against him because of the blood of the son of Jehoiada the priest, and they put him to death on his bed; and they put his body into the earth in the town of David, but not in the resting-place of the kings.
translation: Toe hulle van hom weggegaan het, omdat hy baie siek was, het sy mense 'n geheime plan teen hom gemaak oor die bloed van die seun van die priester Jehoiada. Hulle het hom op sy bed doodgemaak en sy liggaam in die grond in die stad van David begrawe, maar nie in die plek waar die konings begrawe word nie.

original: Now send men to Joppa, and get one Simon, named Peter,
translation: Stuur nou mense na Joppa toe en kry 'n man met die naam Simon, wat ook Peter genoem word.

original: And news was given to Saul that David had come to Keilah. And Saul said, Now God has given him into my hands; for by going into a walled town with locked doors, he has let himself be shut in.
translation: Saul het gehoor dat David na Keilah gekom het. Saul het gesê: "Nou het God hom in my hande gegee; want deur in 'n stad met mure en geslote deure in te gaan, het hy homself vasgevang."

original: And I will give you into the hands of those desiring your death, and into the hands of those whom you are fearing, even into the hands of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, and into the hands of the Chaldaeans.
translation: Ek sal jou oorgee aan die mense wat jou dood wil hê, en aan diegene wat jy bang is vir, selfs aan Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, en aan die Chaldeërs.

original: Who is living with Simon, a leather-worker, whose house is by the sea.
translation: Wie woon saam met Simon, 'n leerwerker, wie se huis is by die see?

original: Let your search be for the Lord and for his strength; let your hearts ever be turned to him.
translation: Soek altyd die Here en sy krag; laat julle harte altyd na Hom kyk.

original: Say to Aaron, When you put the lights in their places, the seven lights will give light in front of the support.
translation: Sê vir Aaron, wanneer jy die ligte op hul plekke sit, sal die sewe ligte helder skyn voor die steun.

original: And he got into a boat and went across and came to his town.
translation: Hy het in 'n boot geklim en oor die water gegaan en by sy dorp aangekom.

original: Those who made designs against him were Zabad, the son of Shimeath, an Ammonite woman, and Jehozabad, the son of Shimrith, a Moabite woman.
translation: Die mense wat teen hom beplan het, was Zabad, die seun van Shimeath, 'n Ammoniet vrou, en Jehozabad, die seun van Shimrith, 'n Moabiet vrou.

original: And Saul sent for all the people to come to the fight, and go down to Keilah to make an attack on David and his men.
translation: En Saul het vir almal gestuur om by die geveg te kom en om na Keilah te gaan om David en sy manne aan te val.

original: And from the earth the Lord God made every beast of the field and every bird of the air, and took them to the man to see what names he would give them: and whatever name he gave to any living thing, that was its name.
translation: En die Here God het uit die aarde elke dier van die veld en elke voël van die lug gemaak en dit na die man gebring om te kyk watter name hy vir hulle sou gee: en enige naam wat hy aan enige lewende ding gegee het, dit was sy naam.

original: Keep in mind the great works which he has done; his wonders, and the decisions of his mouth;
translation: Hou in gedagte die groot dinge wat hy gedoen het; sy wonderwerke, en die dinge wat hy gesê het;

original: I will send you out, and your mother who gave you birth, into another country not the land of your birth; and there death will come to you.
translation: Ek sal jou uitstuur, saam met jou ma wat jou gebring het, na 'n ander land wat nie jou geboorteland is nie; en daar sal die dood jou ontvang.

original: And Aaron did so; he put the lights in their places so that they gave light in front of the support, as the Lord gave orders to Moses.
translation: En Aäron het dit so gedoen; hy het die ligte op hulle plekke gesit sodat hulle lig gegee het voor die steun, soos die Here aan Moses gesê het.

original: And when the angel who said these words to him had gone away, he sent for two of his house-servants, and a God-fearing man of the army, one of those who were waiting on him at all times;
translation: Toe die engel wat hierdie woorde vir hom gesê het, weggegaan het, het hy twee van sy huisdienaars gestuur, en 'n man wat vir God respekteer van die soldate, een van hulle wat altyd vir hom gewag het.

original: But to the land on which their soul's desire is fixed, they will never come back.
translation: Maar hulle sal nooit terugkom na die land waar hulle siel se begeerte is.

original: And it was clear to David that Saul had evil designs against him, and he said to Abiathar the priest, Come here with the ephod.
translation: David het gesien dat Saul slegte planne teen hom gehad het, en hy het vir Abiathar die priester gesê: “Kom hier met die efod.”

original: And having given them an account of everything, he sent them to Joppa.
translation: En nadat hy vir hulle alles vertel het, het hy hulle na Joppa gestuur.

original: O you seed of Abraham, his servant, you children of Jacob, his loved ones.
translation: O julle, nageslag van Abraham, sy dienaar, julle kinders van Jakob, sy geliefdes.

original: And the man gave names to all cattle and to the birds of the air and to every beast of the field; but Adam had no one like himself as a help.
translation: En die man het name gegee aan al die diere en aan al die voëls in die lug; maar Adam het niemand gehad soos hy om hom te help nie.

original: The support for the lights was of hammered gold work, from its base to its flowers it was of hammered work; from the design which the Lord had given to Moses, he made the support for the lights.
translation: Die steun vir die ligte was van gesmeed goud, van die onderkant tot by die blomme was dit van gesmeed werk; volgens die ontwerp wat God aan Moses gegee het, het hy die steun vir die ligte gemaak.

original: And they took to him a man stretched on a bed who had no power of moving; and Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the man who was ill, Son, take heart; you have forgiveness for your sins.
translation: Hulle het vir Jesus 'n man gebring wat op 'n bed gele het en nie kon beweeg nie. Toe Jesus hulle geloof sien, het Hy vir die siek man gesê: 'Seun, moenie ontsteld wees nie; jy het vergifnis vir jou sondes.'

original: He is the Lord our God: he is judge of all the earth.
translation: Hy is die Here, ons God: hy is die regter van alles op aarde.

original: Now the day after, when they were on their journey and were near the town, Peter went up to the top of the house for prayer, about the sixth hour:
translation: Nou, die dag daarna, terwyl hulle op pad was en naby die dorpie was, het Peter op die dak van die huis gegaan om te bid, ongeveer sesuur.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: Then David said, O Lord, the God of Israel, news has been given to your servant that it is Saul's purpose to come to Keilah and send destruction on the town because of me.
translation: Toe het David gesê, O Here, God van Israel, ek het gehoor dat Saul van plan is om na Keilah te kom en die stad te verwoes omdat ek daar is.

original: Now the story of his sons, and all the words said by the prophet against him, and the building up again of the Lord's house, are recorded in the account in the book of the kings. And Amaziah his son became king in his place.
translation: Nou die verhaal van sy seuns, en al die woorde wat die profeet teen hom gesê het, en die herbou van God se huis, is in die boek van die konings opgeteken. En sy seun Amazia het in sy plek koning geword.

original: Is this man Coniah a broken vessel of no value? is he a vessel in which there is no pleasure? why are they violently sent out, he and his seed, into a land which is strange to them?
translation: Is hierdie man Coniah 'n gebroke vat sonder waarde? Is hy 'n vat waarin daar geen genot is nie? Hoekom stuur hulle hom en sy nageslag met geweld weg na 'n vreemde land?

original: Take the Levites out from among the children of Israel and make them clean.
translation: Haal die Leviete uit die Israeliete en maak hulle skoon.

original: He has kept his agreement in mind for ever, the word which he gave for a thousand generations;
translation: Hy onthou sy ooreenkoms vir altyd, die woord wat Hy gegee het vir duisend geslagte.

original: And he was in need of food: but while they were getting it ready, a deep sleep came on him;
translation: Hy het kos nodig gehad, maar terwyl hulle dit voorbereid het, het 'n diep slaap oor hom gekom.

original: And some of the scribes said among themselves, This man has no respect for God.
translation: En party van die skrifkenners het vir mekaar gesê, Hierdie man het nie respek vir God nie.

original: O earth, earth, earth, give ear to the word of the Lord!
translation: O aarde, aarde, aarde, luister na die woorde van die Here!

original: And the Lord God sent a deep sleep on the man, and took one of the bones from his side while he was sleeping, joining up the flesh again in its place:
translation: En die Here God het 'n diep slaap oor die man gestuur, en terwyl hy geslaap het, het Hy een van sy ribbes geneem en die vleis weer op sy plek gesit.

original: The agreement which he made with Abraham, and his oath to Isaac;
translation: Die ooreenkoms wat hy met Abraham gemaak het, en sy eed aan Isak;

original: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for twenty-nine years; his mother's name was Jehoaddan of Jerusalem.
translation: Amaziah was vyf-en-twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het nege-en-twintig jaar in Jerusalem regeer; sy ma se naam was Jehoaddan van Jerusalem.

original: And now, is it true, as they have said to me, that Saul is coming? O Lord, the God of Israel, give ear to your servant, and say if these things are so. And the Lord said, He is coming down.
translation: En nou, is dit waar, soos hulle vir my gesê het, dat Saul kom? O Heer, God van Israel, luister na U dienaar, en sê of dit so is. En die Heer het gesê, Hy kom af.

original: And he saw the heavens opening, and a vessel coming down, like a great cloth let down on the earth,
translation: En hy het gesien hoe die hemel oopgaan, en 'n houer wat neerdaal, soos 'n groot doek wat op die aarde neergelaat word.

original: And Jesus, having knowledge of what was in their minds, said, Why are your thoughts evil?
translation: En Jesus, wat geweet het wat in hulle gedagtes was, het gesê: Hoekom is julle gedagtes so verkeerd?

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, but his heart was not completely true to the Lord.
translation: Hy het gedoen wat reg was in God se oë, maar sy hart was nie heeltemal opreg teenoor God nie.

original: And this is how you are to make them clean: let the holy water which takes away sin be put on them, and let the hair all over their bodies be cut off with a sharp blade, and let their clothing be washed and their bodies made clean.
translation: En so maak jy hulle skoon: laat die heilige water wat sonde wegneem, op hulle gesit word, sny al die hare oor hul liggame met 'n skerp mes af, was hulle klere en maak hulle liggame skoon.

original: In which were all sorts of beasts and birds.
translation: Waarin was al soort diere en voëls.

original: Then David said, Will the men of Keilah give me and my men up to Saul? and the Lord said, They will give you up.
translation: Toe het David gesê: Sal die mense van Keilah my en my mense aan Saul oorgee? En die Here het gesê: Hulle sal jou oorgee.

original: And he gave it to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an eternal agreement;
translation: En hy het dit aan Jakob gegee as 'n wet, en aan Israel as 'n ooreenkoms wat vir altyd geld;

original: The Lord has said, Let this man be recorded as having no children, a man who will not do well in all his life: for no man of his seed will do well, seated on the seat of the kingdom of David and ruling again in Judah.
translation: Die Here het gesê, Laat hierdie man as iemand sonder kinders neergeskryf word, 'n man wat in sy hele lewe nie goed sal doen nie: want niemand van sy nageslag sal goed doen nie, terwyl hy op die troon van die koninkryk van Dawid sit en weer in Juda regeer.

original: For which is the simpler, to say, You have forgiveness for your sins; or to say, Get up and go?
translation: Wat is makliker om te sê: "Jy is vergewe van jou sondes"; of om te sê: "Staan op en gaan?"

original: Then let them take a young ox and its meal offering, crushed grain mixed with oil, and take another ox for a sin-offering.
translation: Laat hulle dan 'n jong os en sy maaltyd aanbieding neem, wat gemaalde graan gemeng met olie is, en neem nog 'n os vir 'n sonde-offer.

original: And a voice came to him, saying, Come, Peter; take them for food.
translation: En 'n stem het na hom toe gekom en gesê: Kom, Peter; neem hulle vir kos.

original: Then David and his men, about six hundred of them, went out of Keilah, and got away wherever they were able to go. And Saul, hearing that David had got away from Keilah, did not go there.
translation: Toe het David en sy manne, omtrent ses honderd van hulle, uit Keilah gegaan en weggesper waar hulle kon. En Saul, toe hy hoor dat David weg is van Keilah, het nie daarheen gegaan nie.

original: And the bone which the Lord God had taken from the man he made into a woman, and took her to the man.
translation: En die been wat die Here God van die man gehaal het, het Hy in 'n vrou verander en haar na die man gebring.

original: Now when he became strong in the kingdom, he put to death those men who had taken the life of the king his father.
translation: Toe hy sterk geword het in die koninkryk, het hy die mense doodgemaak wat sy pa, die koning, se lewe geneem het.

original: A curse is on the keepers who are causing the destruction and loss of the sheep of my field, says the Lord.
translation: Daar is 'n vloek op die mense wat die skape in my veld laat ineenstort en vergaan, sê die Here.

original: And the man said, This is now bone of my bone and flesh of my flesh: let her name be Woman because she was taken out of Man.
translation: Die man het gesê, "Dit is nou been van my been en vlees van my vlees: laat haar naam Vrou wees omdat sy uit die Man geneem is."

original: And make the Levites come forward in front of the Tent of meeting, and let all the children of Israel come together:
translation: Laat die Leviete vorentoe kom voor die Tent waar ons God ontmoet, en laat al die kinders van Israel bymekaar kom.

original: Saying, To you will I give the land of Canaan, the measured line of your heritage:
translation: Ek sal jou die land van Kanaan gee, die grens van jou erfenis.

original: And David kept in the waste land, in safe places, waiting in the hill-country in the waste land of Ziph. And Saul was searching for him every day, but God did not give him up into his hands.
translation: En David het in die woestyn gebly, in veilige plekke, en gewag in die heuwels van die woestyn by Zif. En Saul het elke dag na hom gesoek, maar God het hom nie in sy hande gegee nie.

original: But Peter said, No, Lord; for I have never taken food which is common or unclean.
translation: Maar Petrus het gesê, Nee, Here; ek het nog nooit kos geëet wat gewoon of onrein is nie.

original: But so that you may see that on earth the Son of man has authority for the forgiveness of sins, (then said he to the man who was ill,) Get up, and take up your bed, and go to your house.
translation: Maar sodat julle kan sien dat die Seun van die mens hier op aarde die mag het om sondes te vergewe, het Hy vir die man wat siek was gesê: Staan op, neem jou bed op en gaan huis toe.

original: So this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said against the keepers who have the care of my people: You have let my flock be broken up, driving them away and not caring for them; see, I will send on you the punishment for the evil of your doings, says the Lord.
translation: So sê die Here, die God van Israel, teen die oppassers wat vir my volk sorg: Julle het my skape laat weggaan, hulle weggejaag en nie na hulle omgegee nie; kyk, ek sal julle straf vir die slegte dinge wat julle gedoen het, sê die Here.

original: When they were still small in number, and strange in the land;
translation: Toe hulle nog min was en vreemdelinge in die land.

original: For this cause will a man go away from his father and his mother and be joined to his wife; and they will be one flesh.
translation: Daarom sal 'n man sy ma en pa verlaat en by sy vrou wees; en hulle sal een wees.

original: And you are to take the Levites before the Lord: and the children of Israel are to put their hands on them:
translation: En julle moet die Leviete voor God bring, en die kinders van Israel moet hulle hande op hulle lê.

original: And the voice came to him a second time, What God has made clean, do not you make common.
translation: En die stem het 'n tweede keer na hom gesê: Wat God skoon gemaak het, moet jy nie as gewone dinge behandel nie.

original: And he got up and went away to his house.
translation: En hy het opgestaan en na sy huis gegaan.

original: And David was full of fear, in the knowledge that Saul had come out to take his life; and David was in the waste land of Ziph, in Horesh.
translation: En David was baie bang, omdat hy geweet het dat Saul hom wou doodmaak; en David was in die woestyn van Zif, in Horesh.

original: And Aaron is to give the Levites to the Lord as a wave offering from the children of Israel, so that they may do the Lord's work.
translation: En Aäron moet die Leviete aan die Here gee as 'n golfoffer van die kinders van Israel, sodat hulle die Here se werk kan doen.

original: But he did not put their children to death, for he kept the orders of the Lord recorded in the book of the law of Moses, saying, The fathers are not to be put to death for their children or the children for their fathers, but a man is to be put to death for the sin which he himself has done.
translation: Maar hy het nie hulle kinders doodgemaak nie, want hy het die opdragte van die Here gehou soos dit in die wetboek van Moses geskryf is, wat sê: Die vaders mag nie vir hulle kinders doodgemaak word nie, en die kinders nie vir hulle vaders nie, maar 'n man moet doodgemaak word vir die sonde wat hy self gedoen het.

original: And the man and his wife were without clothing, and they had no sense of shame.
translation: Die man en sy vrou was kaal, en hulle het nie skaam gevoel nie.

original: When they went about from one nation to another, and from one kingdom to another people.
translation: Toe hulle van een nasie na 'n ander gegaan het, en van een koninkryk na 'n ander mense.

original: And I will get the rest of my flock together from all the countries where I have sent them, and will make them come back again to their resting-place; and they will have offspring and be increased.
translation: Ek sal die res van my skape bymekaarmaak uit al die plekke waar ek hulle gestuur het, en hulle terugbring na hul rusplek; hulle sal jong skape hê en sal groei.

original: And this was done three times: and then the vessel was taken back into heaven.
translation: En dit is drie keer gedoen: toe is die vaartuig weer na die hemel geneem.

original: But when the people saw it they were full of fear, and gave glory to God who had given such authority to men.
translation: Maar toe die mense dit gesien het, het hulle baie bang geword, en hulle het God se eer gegee, omdat Hy so 'n gesag aan mense gegee het.

original: Now the snake was wiser than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said to the woman, Has God truly said that you may not take of the fruit of any tree in the garden?
translation: Die slang was slimmer as enige ander dier wat die Here God gemaak het. En hy het vir die vrou gesê: Het God regtig gesê dat julle nie van die vrug van enige boom in die tuin mag eet nie?

original: He would not let anyone do them wrong; he even kept back kings because of them,
translation: Hy sou nie toelaat dat iemand hulle seergemaak het nie; selfs konings het hy keer gehou oor hulle.

original: And Saul's son Jonathan went to David in Horesh, and made his hands strong in God;
translation: En Saul se seun Jonathan het na David in Horesh gegaan en hom in God bemoedig.

original: And when Jesus was going from there, he saw a man whose name was Matthew, seated at the place where taxes were taken; and he said to him, Come after me. And he got up and went after him.
translation: En toe Jesus daar weggaan, sien hy 'n man met die naam Matteus wat sit waar hulle belasting insamel; en hy sê vir hom, “Kom volg my.” En hy het opgestaan en agter Hom gegaan.

original: And the Levites are to put their hands on the heads of the oxen, and one of the oxen is to be offered for a sin-offering and the other for a burned offering to the Lord to take away the sin of the Levites.
translation: En die Lewiete moet hulle hande op die koppe van die bulle sit, en een van die bulle moet geoffer word as 'n sondeoffer, en die ander as 'n brandoffer vir God om die sonde van die Lewiete weg te neem.

original: Then Amaziah got all Judah together and put them in order by their families, even all Judah and Benjamin, under captains of thousands and captains of hundreds: and he had those of twenty years old and over numbered, and they came to three hundred thousand of the best fighting-men, trained for war and in the use of the spear and the body-cover.
translation: Toe het Amaziah al Juda bymekaar gekry en hulle volgens gesinne georden, al Juda en Benjamin, onder leiers van duisende en leiers van honderde. Hy het die wat twintig jaar en ouer was getel, en hulle was drie honderd duisend van die beste vegters, opgelei vir oorlog en bekend met die spies en skild.

original: And I will put over them keepers who will take care of them: never again will they be overcome with fear or be troubled, and there will not be the loss of one of them, says the Lord.
translation: En Ek sal oor hulle oppas wat vir hulle sal sorg: nooit weer sal hulle oorweldig word deur vrees of probleme nie, en daar sal nie een van hulle verlore gaan nie, sê die Here.

original: Saying, Put not your hand on those who have been marked with my holy oil, and do my prophets no wrong.
translation: Moet nie aan dié wat met my heilige olie gemerk is nie, en behandel my profete goed.

original: Now while Peter was in doubt as to the purpose of this vision, the men who were sent by Cornelius, having made search for Simon's house, came to the door,
translation: Terwyl Petrus gewonder het oor wat hierdie visie beteken, het die manne wat deur Kornelius gestuur is, vir Simon se huis gesoek en by die deur geklop.

original: And the woman said, We may take of the fruit of the trees in the garden:
translation: En die vrou het gesê, Ons mag van die vrugte van die bome in die tuin eet.

original: And said to him, Have no fear, for Saul my father will not get you into his power; and you will be king of Israel, and I will be by your side, and my father Saul is certain of this.
translation: En het vir hom gesê, Moet nie bang wees nie, want my pa Saul sal jou nie in sy mag kry nie; en jy sal die koning van Israel wees, en ek sal by jou wees, en my pa Saul is seker hiervan.

original: To see if Simon, named Peter, was living there.
translation: Om te kyk of Simon, wat Petrus genoem word, daar woon.

original: And for a hundred talents of silver, he got a hundred thousand fighting-men from Israel.
translation: En vir 'n honderd talent silwer het hy honderd duisend soldate uit Israel gekry.

original: And he took away all food from the land, so that the people were without bread.
translation: Hy het al die kos uit die land geneem, sodat die mense nie meer brood gehad het nie.

original: And it came about, when he was in the house taking food, that a number of tax-farmers and sinners came and took their places with Jesus and his disciples.
translation: En toe dit gebeur het, was hy in die huis aan die eet, toe 'n paar belastingamptenare en sondaars gekom het en saam met Jesus en sy dissipels gaan sit het.

original: Then the Levites are to be put before Aaron and his sons, to be offered as a wave offering to the Lord.
translation: Die Leviete moet voor Aaron en sy seuns gestel word om as 'n golfoffer aan die Here aangebied te word.

original: But of the fruit of the tree in the middle of the garden, God has said, If you take of it or put your hands on it, death will come to you.
translation: maar van die vrug van die boom in die middel van die tuin, het God gesê, as julle daarvan neem of julle hande daarop sit, sal die dood julle oorkom.

original: And the two of them made an agreement before the Lord: and David went on living in Horesh, and Jonathan went back to his house.
translation: En hulle het 'n afspraak gemaak voor God: en David het in Horesh gebly, en Jonathan het huis toe teruggegaan.

original: See, the days are coming, says the Lord, when I will give to David a true Branch, and he will be ruling as king, acting wisely, doing what is right, and judging uprightly in the land.
translation: Kyk, die dae kom, sê die Here, wanneer ek vir Dawid 'n ware tak sal gee, en hy sal as koning heers, verstandig optree, die regte dinge doen, en regverdig oordeel in die land.

original: And, while Peter was turning the vision over in his mind, the Spirit said to him, See, three men are looking for you.
translation: En terwyl Petrus oor die visioen gedink het, het die Gees vir hom gesê: Kyk, drie mense soek jou.

original: And the snake said, Death will not certainly come to you:
translation: En die slang het gesê, Dood sal nie beslis na jou toe kom nie:

original: But a man of God came to him, saying, O king, let not the army of Israel go with you; for the Lord is not with Israel, that is, the children of Ephraim.
translation: Maar 'n man van God het na hom gekom en gesê: O koning, laat nie die Israelitiese leër saam met jou gaan nie; want die Here is nie met Israel nie, dis die kinders van Efraim.

original: He sent a man before them, even Joseph, who was given as a servant for a price:
translation: Hy het 'n man voor hulle gestuur, naamlik Josef, wat as 'n dienaar vir 'n prys verkoop is.

original: So you are to make the Levites separate from the children of Israel, and the Levites will be mine.
translation: Julle moet die Leviete van die ander Israeliete afsonder, en die Leviete sal vir My wees.

original: And when the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples, Why does your Master take food with tax-farmers and sinners?
translation: Toe die Fariseërs dit gesien het, het hulle vir sy dissipels gesê: Hoekom eet julle Meester saam met belastingpligtige en sondaars?

original: Then the Ziphites came up to Gibeah to see Saul, and said, Is not David living secretly among us in the strong places in Horesh, in the hill of Hachilah to the south of the waste land?
translation: Toe het die Zifiete na Gibea gegaan om Saul te sien en gesê: "Is David nie stil tussen ons nie, in die veilige plekke in Horesh, op die heuwel van Hachilah suid van die verlate grond?"

original: His feet were fixed in chains; his neck was put in iron bands;
translation: Sy voete was met kettings vasgemaak; sy nek was met yster bande vasgemaak;

original: Go down, then, and go with them, doubting nothing, for I have sent them.
translation: Gaan dan af en gaan saam met hulle, moenie twyfel nie, want ek het hulle gestuur.

original: In his days Judah will have salvation and Israel will be living without fear: and this is the name by which he will be named, The Lord is our righteousness.
translation: In sy tyd sal Juda gered word en Israel sal sonder vrees leef: en dit is die naam wat hy sal hê, Die Here is ons regverdigheid.

original: After that, the Levites will go in to do whatever has to be done in the Tent of meeting; you are to make them clean and give them as a wave offering.
translation: Daarna sal die Leviete inkom om al die werk in die Tent van ontmoeting te doen; julle moet hulle skoonmaak en as 'n skudoffer aanbied.

original: For God sees that on the day when you take of its fruit, your eyes will be open, and you will be as gods, having knowledge of good and evil.
translation: Want God sien dat op die dag wanneer jy van die vrugte eet, jou oë sal oopgaan, en jy sal soos gode wees, met kennis van goed en kwaad.

original: But on hearing this he said, Those who are well have no need of a medical man, but those who are ill.
translation: Maar toe hy dit hoor, het hy gesê: Mense wat gesond is, het nie 'n dokter nodig nie, maar mense wat siek is.

original: And Peter went down to the men, and said, I am the man you are looking for: why have you come?
translation: En Petrus het na die mans toe gegaan en gesê: Ek is die man wat julle soek. Hoekom het julle gekom?

original: So now, O king, have your soul's desire and come down, and we, for our part, will give him up into the king's hands.
translation: Nou, koning, kry wat jy wil hê en kom hierheen, dan sal ons hom aan jou oorhandig.

original: But go yourself, and be strong in war; God will not let you go down before those who are fighting against you; for God has power to give help or to send you down before your attackers.
translation: Maar gaan jy self en wees dapper in die oorlog; God sal nie toelaat dat jy voor dié wat teen jou veg, val nie; want God het die krag om jou te help of jou neer te laat voor jou aanvallers.

original: For they have been given to me from among the children of Israel; in place of every mother's first son, the first to come to birth in Israel, I have taken them for myself.
translation: Hulle is vir my gegee uit die kinders van Israel; in die plek van elke ma se eerste seun, die eerste wat in Israel gebore is, het ek hulle vir myself geneem.

original: Till the time when his word came true; he was tested by the word of the Lord.
translation: Tot die tyd wanneer sy woord waar geword het; is hy op die proef gestel deur die woord van die Here.

original: And so, truly, the days are coming when they will say no longer, By the living Lord, who took the children of Israel up out of the land of Egypt;
translation: Die dae kom werklik wanneer hulle nie meer sal sê nie, By die Lewende Here, wat die kinders van Israel uit Egipte uitgebring het.

original: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and a delight to the eyes, and to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit, and gave it to her husband.
translation: Toe die vrou gesien het dat die boom goed was om te eet, mooi was om na te kyk, en dat jy slim kon word van dit, het sy van die vrug gevat en dit aan haar man gegee.

original: And Saul said, The Lord's blessing will be yours, for you have had pity on me.
translation: En Saul het gesê: God se seën sal joune wees, want jy het medelye met my gehad.

original: And they said, Cornelius, a captain, an upright and God-fearing man, respected by all the nation of the Jews, had word from God by an angel to send for you to his house, and to give hearing to your words.
translation: En hulle het gesê, Cornelius, 'n kaptein, 'n regverdig en godvresende man, wat deur die hele Joodse nasie gerespekteer word, het 'n boodskap van God deur 'n engel gekry om jou na sy huis te stuur en na jou woorde te luister.

original: But go and take to heart the sense of these words, My desire is for mercy, not offerings: for I have come not to get the upright, but sinners.
translation: Gaan en dink goed oor wat hierdie woorde beteken: Ek wil genade gee, nie offers nie; want Ek het nie gekom om die regverdiges te soek nie, maar sondaars.

original: The king sent men to take off his chains; even the ruler of the people, who let him go free.
translation: Die koning het mense gestuur om sy kettings af te haal; selfs die leier van die mense, wat hom vrygelaat het.

original: Go now, and take more steps, and see where he is living: for they say that he is expert in deceit.
translation: Gaan nou, en neem meer stappe, en kyk waar hy woon: want hulle sê hy is baie goed om ander te mislei.

original: Then Amaziah said to the man of God, But what is to be done about the hundred talents which I have given for the armed band of Israel? And the man of God in answer said, God is able to give you much more than this.
translation: Toe het Amazia met die man van God gepraat en gesê: Maar wat moet ek doen van die honderd talent wat ek gegee het vir die gewapende span van Israel? En die man van God het geantwoord: God kan jou baie meer gee as dit.

original: For every mother's first son among the children of Israel is mine, the first male birth of man or beast: on the day when I sent death on all the first sons in the land of Egypt, I made them mine.
translation: Elkeen se eerste seun onder die kinders van Israel behoort aan My, die eerste seun wat gebore is, of dit nou 'n mens of 'n dier is: op die dag toe ek dood oor al die eerste seuns in die land Egipte gestuur het, het ek hulle vir My geneem.

original: But, By the living Lord, who took up the seed of Israel, and made them come out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had sent them; and they will be living in the land which is theirs.
translation: Maar, by die lewende Here, wat die nageslag van Israel opgeneem het en hulle uit die noorde gehaal het, en uit al die plekke waarheen ek hulle gestuur het; hulle sal woon in die land wat van hulle is.

original: And their eyes were open and they were conscious that they had no clothing and they made themselves coats of leaves stitched together.
translation: Hulle se oë was oop en hulle het besef dat hulle nie klere gehad het nie, en hulle het vir hulself jasse van blare gemaak wat aanmekaar gestik is.

original: Then the disciples of John came to him, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees frequently go without food, but your disciples do not?
translation: Die dissipels van Johannes het na hom toe gekom en gesê: Waarom gaan ons en die Fariseërs dikwels sonder kos, maar jou dissipels nie?

original: He made him lord of his house, and ruler over everything he had;
translation: Hy het hom die baas van sy huis gemaak, en hy het oor alles wat hy gehad het, regeer.

original: So he took them in for the night. And the day after, he went with them, taking some of the brothers from Joppa with him.
translation: Hy het hulle vir die nag ingeneem. En die volgende dag het hy saam met hulle gegaan, saam met 'n paar van die broers van Joppa.

original: And in place of the first sons among the children of Israel, I have taken the Levites.
translation: En in plaas van die eerstesone van die kinders van Israel, het ek die Leviete gekies.

original: To give his chiefs teaching at his pleasure, and so that his law-givers might get wisdom from him.
translation: Om sy leiers te onderrig soos hy wil, sodat sy wetgewers wysheid van hom kan kry.

original: So take care to get knowledge of all the secret places where he is taking cover, and be certain to come back to me, and I will go with you: and without doubt, if he is anywhere in the land, I will get him, among all the families of Judah.
translation: Ken al die geheime plekke waar hy wegkruip, en kom terug na my toe, dan sal ek saam met jou gaan. Ek is seker, as hy enige plek in die land is, sal ek hom tussen al die families van Juda vind.

original: And there came to them the sound of the Lord God walking in the garden in the evening wind: and the man and his wife went to a secret place among the trees of the garden, away from the eyes of the Lord God.
translation: En daar het hulle die geluid van die Here God gehoor wat in die tuin stap in die aandwind, en die man en sy vrou het na 'n geheim plek tussen die bome van die tuin gegaan, weg van God se oog.

original: And Jesus said to them, Will the friends of the newly-married man be sad as long as he is with them? But the days will come when he will be taken away from them, and then will they go without food.
translation: En Jesus het vir hulle gesê: Sal die vriende van die pasgetroude man hartseer wees solank hy by hulle is? Maar daar sal dae kom wanneer hy van hulle weggeneem word, en dan sal hulle honger wees.

original: So Amaziah, separating the armed band which had come to him from Ephraim, sent them back again; which made them very angry with Judah, and they went back burning with wrath.
translation: So Amaziah het die gewapende groep wat van Efraim na hom gekom het, afsonderlik gemaak en hulle teruggestuur. Dit het hulle baie kwaad gemaak vir Juda, en hulle is in woede teruggegaan.

original: And the day after that, they came to Caesarea. And Cornelius was waiting for them, having got together his relations and his near friends.
translation: Die volgende dag het hulle in Caesarea aangekom. Cornelius het op hulle gewag en sy familie en naby vriende bymekaargebring.

original: Then Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob was living in the land of Ham.
translation: Toe het Israel in Egipte gekom, en Jakob het in die land van Ham gebly.

original: About the prophets. My heart is broken in me, all my bones are shaking; I am like a man full of strong drink, like a man overcome by wine; because of the Lord, and because of his holy words.
translation: Oor die profete. My hart is gebroke, en my bene bewe; ek voel soos iemand wat te veel gedrink het, soos iemand wat nie meer kan klaar te kom met wyn nie; vanweë die Here, en sy heilige woorde.

original: And no man puts a bit of new cloth on an old coat, for by pulling away from the old, it makes a worse hole.
translation: En niemand sit 'n stuk nuwe materiaal op 'n oujas nie, want as jy dit van die ou een af trek, maak dit 'n groter gat.

original: And the voice of the Lord God came to the man, saying, Where are you?
translation: En die stem van God het vir die man gesê, Waar is jy?

original: And I have given them to Aaron and to his sons, from among the children of Israel, to undertake for them all the work of the Tent of meeting, and to take away sin from the children of Israel so that no evil may come on them when they come near the holy place.
translation: Ek het hulle aan Aaron en sy seuns gegee uit die kinders van Israel, om al die werk van die ontmoetings tent vir hulle te doen en om sonde van die kinders van Israel weg te neem, sodat daar geen kwaad op hulle kan kom wanneer hulle na die heilige plek kom.

original: And they went back and came to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men were in the waste land of Maon, in the dry land south of the waste land.
translation: En hulle het teruggegaan en na Ziph gegaan om met Saul te praat, maar David en sy mense was in die woestyn van Maon, in die droë land suid van die woestyn.

original: Then Amaziah took heart, and went out at the head of his people and came to the Valley of Salt, where he put to death ten thousand of the children of Seir;
translation: Toe het Amazia moed ingesep, en hy het voor sy mense uitgegaan en na die Soutvallei gegaan, waar hy tienduisend van die Seir mense doodgemaak het.

original: And when Peter came in, Cornelius came to him and, falling down at his feet, gave him worship.
translation: Toe Petrus binnekom, het Kornelius na hom toe gekom en, terwyl hy voor sy voete geval het, het hy hom geëer.

original: And his people were greatly increased, and became stronger than those who were against them.
translation: En sy mense het baie gegroei, en hulle was sterker as diegene wat teen hulle was.

original: And men do not put new wine into old wine-skins; or the skins will be burst and the wine will come out, and the skins are of no more use: but they put new wine into new wine-skins, and so the two will be safe.
translation: Mense sit nie nuwe wyn in ou wynsakke nie, want die sakke sal bars en die wyn sal uitkom, en die sakke is nie meer nuttig nie. Maar hulle sit nuwe wyn in nuwe wynsakke, en dan is albei veilig.

original: But Peter, lifting him up, said, Get up, for I am a man as you are.
translation: Maar Petrus het hom opgetel en gesê: "Staan op, ek is net 'n man soos jy."

original: All these things Moses and Aaron and the children of Israel did to the Levites; as the Lord gave orders to Moses about the Levites, so the children of Israel did.
translation: Al hierdie dinge het Moses en Aäron en die kinders van Israel aan die Leviete gedoen; soos God aan Moses gesê het oor die Leviete, so het die kinders van Israel dit ook gedoen.

original: And he said, Hearing your voice in the garden I was full of fear, because I was without clothing: and I kept myself from your eyes.
translation: En hy het gesê, Toe ek jou stem in die tuin hoor, was ek vol vrees, omdat ek glad nie klere aan gehad het nie: en ek het myself van jou afgekeer.

original: Their hearts were turned to hate against his people, so that they made secret designs against them.
translation: Hulle harte het na haat teen sy mense gedraai, so hulle het geheim planne teen hulle gemaak.

original: For the land is full of men who are untrue to their wives; because of the curse the land is full of grief; the green fields of the waste land have become dry; and they are quick to do evil, their strength is for what is not right.
translation: Die land is vol mans wat nie by hul vroue bly nie. As gevolg van slegte dinge is die land vol hartseer. Die groen velde van die onvrugbare grond het droog geword. Hulle is vinnig om slegte dinge te doen; hulle gebruik hul krag vir wat nie reg is nie.

original: And saying these words, he went in, and saw that a great number of people had come together;
translation: En terwyl hy hierdie woorde gesê het, het hy ingegaan en gesien dat 'n groot aantal mense bymekaar gekom het;

original: And the Levites were made clean from sin, and their clothing was washed, and Aaron gave them for a wave offering before the Lord; and Aaron took away their sin and made them clean.
translation: Die Leviete is van sonde skoongemaak, hulle klere is gewas, en Aaron het hulle as 'n aanbodgolwe voor die Here gegee; en Aaron het hulle sonde weggeneem en hulle skoon gemaak.

original: And he said, Who gave you the knowledge that you were without clothing? Have you taken of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take?
translation: Hy het gesê, Wie het jou laat weet dat jy sonder klere was? Het jy van die vrug van die boom geëet waarvan ek gesê het jy moet nie eet nie?

original: And Saul and his men went in search of him. And David had word of it, so he came down to the rock in the waste land of Maon. And Saul, hearing of this, went after David into the waste land of Maon.
translation: Saul en sy manne het vir hom gesoek. David het daarvan gehoor, so hy het na die klip in die woesterny van Maon gekom. En Saul, wat hiervan gehoor het, het na David in die woesterny van Maon gegaan.

original: While he was saying these things to them, there came a ruler and gave him worship, saying, My daughter is even now dead; but come and put your hand on her, and she will come back to life.
translation: Terwyl hy hierdie dinge vir hulle gesê het, het daar 'n leier gekom en hom vereer. Hy het gesê, my dogter is nou al dood; maar kom en sit jou hand op haar, dan sal sy weer lewe.

original: And ten thousand more the children of Israel took living, and made them go up to the top of the rock, pushing them down from the top of the rock so that their bodies were broken by the fall.
translation: En nog tienduisend het die kinders van Israel lewendig geneem en hulle na die bokant van die rots gevat, en hulle van die bokant van die rots af gestoot, sodat hulle liggame gebroke is van die val.

original: He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, the man of his selection.
translation: Hy het Moses, sy dienaar, en Aäron, die man wat hy gekies het, gestuur.

original: And the man said, The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me the fruit of the tree and I took it.
translation: En die man het gesê, Die vrou wat U vir my gegee het om saam met my te wees, het my die vrug van die boom gegee en ek het dit geneem.

original: And Jesus got up and went after him, and so did his disciples.
translation: En Jesus het opgestaan en agter Hom aan gegaan, en sy dissipels het ook dieselfde gedoen.

original: And then the Levites went in to do their work in the Tent of meeting before Aaron and his sons: all the orders which the Lord had given Moses about the Levites were put into effect.
translation: Toe het die Leviete ingegaan om hul werk in die ontmoetings tent voor Aaron en sy seuns te doen: al die opdragte wat die Here aan Moses gegee het oor die Leviete, is uitgevoer.

original: He let his signs be seen among the people, and his wonders in the land of Ham.
translation: Hy het sy tekens aan die mense gewys en sy wonders in die land van Ham gedoen.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: And he said to them, You yourselves have knowledge that it is against the law for a man who is a Jew to be in the company of one who is of another nation; but God has made it clear to me that no man may be named common or unclean:
translation: Hy het vir hulle gesê, julle weet self dat dit teen die wette is vir 'n Jood om saam met iemand van 'n ander nasie te wees; maar God het vir my duidelik gemaak dat geen man as gewone of onrein gesien mag word nie.

original: And the Lord God said to the woman, What have you done? And the woman said, I was tricked by the deceit of the snake and I took it.
translation: Toe het die Here God vir die vrou gesê: Wat het jy gedoen? En die vrou het geantwoord: Ek is bedrieg deur die slang en ek het dit geneem.

original: And a woman, who for twelve years had had a flow of blood, came after him, and put her hand on the edge of his robe:
translation: En 'n vrou wat al twaalf jaar lank gebloei het, het van agter gekom en haar hand op die rand van sy rok gesit.

original: For the prophet as well as the priest is unclean; even in my house I have seen their evil-doing, says the Lord.
