translation: Want die profeet en die priester is onrein; selfs in my huis het ek hulle slegte dade gesien, sê die Here.

original: And Saul and his men went on one side of the mountain, and David and his men went on the other: and David's purpose was to get away as quickly as possible, for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men were making a circle round David and his men in order to take them.
translation: Saul en sy mense het aan die een kant van die berg gegaan, en David en sy mense aan die ander kant. David het probeer om so vinnig as moontlik weg te kom, omdat hy bang was vir Saul; Saul en sy mense het 'n sirkel om David en sy mense gemaak om hulle te vang.

original: But the men of the band which Amaziah sent back and did not take with him to the fight, made attacks on the towns of Judah from Samaria to Beth-horon, putting to death three thousand of their people and taking away a great store of their goods.
translation: Maar die mense van die groep wat Amazía teruggestuur het en nie saam met hom na die geveg gegaan het nie, het dorpe in Juda van Samaria tot Bet-horon aangeval. Hulle het drie duisend van die mense doodgemaak en 'n groot hoeveelheid van hulle goedere weg geneem.

original: He sent black night and made it dark; and they did not go against his word.
translation: Hy het 'n swart nag gestuur en dit donker gemaak; en hulle het nie teen sy woordgekyk nie.

original: And so I came without question, when I was sent for. What then is your purpose in sending for me?
translation: En so het ek sonder vrae gekom toe jy my geroep het. Wat is jou rede om my te stuur?

original: This is the rule for the Levites: those of twenty-five years old and over are to go in and do the work of the Tent of meeting;
translation: Dit is die reël vir die Leviete: diegene wat vyf-en-twintig jaar en ouer is, moet binne gaan en die werk van die ontmoetingsplek doen;

original: And the Lord God said to the snake, Because you have done this you are cursed more than all cattle and every beast of the field; you will go flat on the earth, and dust will be your food all the days of your life:
translation: Toe het die Here God vir die slang gesê: "Omdat jy dit gedoen het, is jy meer vervloek as al die diere en al die wilde diere; jy sal op die grond kruip en stof sal jou kos wees al die dae van jou lewe."

original: Because, she said to herself, if I may but put my hand on his robe, I will be made well.
translation: Want, het sy vir haarself gesê, as ek net my hand op sy rok kan sit, sal ek gesond wees.

original: At his word their waters were turned to blood, and he sent death on all their fish.
translation: Op sy woord het hulle water in bloed verander, en hy het dood op al hulle visse gestuur.

original: For this cause their steps will be slipping on their way: they will be forced on into the dark and have a fall there: for I will send evil on them in the year of their punishment, says the Lord.
translation: Hulle se stappe gaan gly op hulle pad: hulle sal in die donker gedwing word en daar val: want Ek sal slegte dinge oor hulle stuur in die jaar van hulle straf, sê die Here.

original: But a man came to Saul saying, Be quick and come; for the Philistines have made an attack on the land.
translation: Maar 'n man het na Saul gekom en gesê, 'Wees gou en kom; want die Filistyne het die land aangeval.'

original: But after they are fifty years old, they are to give up their work and do no more;
translation: Maar nadat hulle vyftig jaar oud is, moet hulle hul werk laat staan en nie meer werk nie.

original: And there will be war between you and the woman and between your seed and her seed: by him will your head be crushed and by you his foot will be wounded.
translation: Daar sal oorlog wees tussen jou en die vrou en tussen jou kinders en haar kinders: hy sal jou kop verpletter en jy sal sy voet seergemaak.

original: Their land was full of frogs, even in the rooms of the king.
translation: Hul land was vol van paddas, selfs in die kamers van die koning.

original: Now when Amaziah came back from the destruction of the Edomites, he took the gods of the children of Seir and made them his gods, worshipping them and burning offerings before them.
translation: Toe Amaziah teruggekom het van die vernietiging van die Edomiete, het hy die gode van die Seir mense geneem en hulle sy gode gemaak. Hy het voor hulle gebuig en offers vir hulle gebrand.

original: But Jesus, turning and seeing her, said, Daughter, take heart; your faith has made you well. And the woman was made well from that hour.
translation: Maar Jesus, toe Hy haar sien, het gesê: Dogter, hou moed; jou geloof het jou gesond gemaak. En die vrou was vanaf daardie oomblik gesond.

original: And Cornelius said, Four days from now I was in my house in prayer at the ninth hour; and I saw before me a man in shining clothing,
translation: En Cornelius het gesê: "Oor vier dae was ek in my huis en het ek by die negende uur gebid; en ek het voor my 'n man in helder klere gesien."

original: He gave the word, and there came the dog-fly, and insects over all the land.
translation: Hy het die woord gegee, en daar het die vlieg gekom, en insekte oor die hele land.

original: And when Jesus came into the ruler's house and saw the players with their instruments and the people making a noise,
translation: En toe Jesus in die leier se huis kom, het hy die musiekkunstenaars met hul instrumente gesien en die mense wat lawaai maak.

original: But be with their brothers in the Tent of meeting, taking care of it but doing no work. This is what you are to do in connection with the Levites and their work.
translation: Wees saam met hul broers in die Tent van ontmoeting, sorg vir dit, maar doen geen werk nie. Dit is wat julle moet doen in verband met die Leviete en wat hulle doen.

original: And I have seen ways without sense in the prophets of Samaria; they became prophets of the Baal, causing my people Israel to go wrong.
translation: Ek het sinnelose paaie gesien by die profete van Samaria; hulle het profete van die Baal geword en my mense Israel verkeerd gelok.

original: To the woman he said, Great will be your pain in childbirth; in sorrow will your children come to birth; still your desire will be for your husband, but he will be your master.
translation: Aan die vrou het Hy gesê, jy sal baie pyn hê wanneer jy jou kind kry; in hartseer sal jou kinders gebore word; maar jy sal steeds vir jou man wil hê, en hy sal jou baas wees.

original: And so the wrath of the Lord was moved against Amaziah, and he sent a prophet to him, who said, Why have you gone after the gods of the people who have not given their people salvation from your hands?
translation: Die Here was kwaad vir Amazia, en Hy het 'n profeet na hom gestuur wat gesê het: Hoekom volg jy die gode van die mense wat nie vir hulle mense gehelp het om uit jou hande te kom nie?

original: So turning back from going after David, Saul went against the Philistines: so that place was named Sela-hammah-lekoth.
translation: Toe Saul dus van sy soektog na David omdraai, het hy teen die Filistyne gegaan: daarom het hulle daardie plek Sela-hammah-lekoth genoem.

original: Who said, Cornelius, your prayer has come to the ears of God, and your offerings are kept in his memory.
translation: Cornelius, jou gebed het God se aandag getrek, en jou offergawes is in sy gedagtes.

original: He said, Make room; for the girl is not dead, but sleeping. And they were laughing at him.
translation: Hy het gesê, Maak plek; want die meisie is nie dood nie, sy slaap net. En hulle het vir hom gelag.

original: He gave them ice for rain, and flaming fire in their land.
translation: Hy het vir hulle ys gegee in plaas van reën, en brandende vuur in hulle land.

original: And from there, David went up and took cover in the safe place of En-gedi.
translation: En van daar het David opgevaar en in die veilige plek van En-gedi ingegaan.

original: And the Lord said to Moses, in the waste land of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt,
translation: Toe het die Here vir Moses gesê, in die woestyn van Sinai, in die eerste maand van die tweede jaar nadat hulle uit Egipte gekom het.

original: But when the people were sent out, he went in and took her by the hand; and the girl got up.
translation: Maar toe die mense wegwas, het hy ingegaan en haar hand gevat; en die meisie het opgestaan.

original: And to Adam he said, Because you gave ear to the voice of your wife and took of the fruit of the tree which I said you were not to take, the earth is cursed on your account; in pain you will get your food from it all your life.
translation: En vir Adam het Hy gesê, Omdat jy na jou vrou se stem geluister het en van die vrug van die boom geneem het wat ek gesê het jy nie mag neem nie, is die aarde vervloek weens jou; in pyn sal jy jou kos uit dit kry vir al jou lewe.

original: Send, then, to Joppa, and get Simon, named Peter, to come to you; he is living in the house of Simon, a leather-worker, by the sea.
translation: Stuur dan na Joppa en vra Simon, wat Peter genoem word, om na jou toe te kom; hy woon in die huis van Simon, 'n leerwerker, by die see.

original: He gave their vines and their fig-trees to destruction, and the trees of their land were broken down.
translation: Hy het hulle wingerde en vyebome vernietig, en die bome van hulle grond is omgekap.

original: And the news of it went out into all that land.
translation: En die nuus daarvan het in hele land versprei.

original: Let the children of Israel keep the Passover at its regular time.
translation: Laat die kinders van Israel die Paasfees op die tyd hou soos gewoonlik.

original: Thorns and waste plants will come up, and the plants of the field will be your food;
translation: Doringdraad en onkruid sal groei, en die plante van die veld sal jou kos wees.

original: But while he was talking to him the king said to him, Have we made you one of the king's government? say no more, or it will be the cause of your death. Then the prophet gave up protesting, and said, It is clear to me that God's purpose is your destruction, because you have done this and have not given ear to my words.
translation:
Maar terwyl hy met hom gepraat het, het die koning vir hom gesê: “Het ons jou een van die koning se regering gemaak? Moet nie meer sê nie, anders gaan dit jou doodmaak.” 

Toe het die profeet opgehou om te praat en gesê: “Ek kan duidelik sien dat God se plan jou ondergang is, omdat jy dit gedoen het en nie na my woorde geluister het nie.”

original: At his word the locusts came, and young locusts more than might be numbered,
translation: Op sy woord het die sprinkane gekom, en daar was soveel jong sprinkane dat jy hulle nie kon tel nie.

original: And in the prophets of Jerusalem I have seen a shocking thing; they are untrue to their wives, walking in deceit, and they make strong the hands of evil-doers, so that a man may not be turned back from his evil-doing: they have all become like Sodom to me, and its people like Gomorrah.
translation: Ek het iets vreesliks in die profete van Jerusalem gesien; hulle is nie waaragtig teenoor hul vroue nie, hulle lewe in bedrog, en hulle steun die slegte mense, sodat 'n man nie kan wegbly van sy boosheid nie. Hulle het vir my soos Sodom geword, en hulle mense soos Gomorra.

original: So, straight away, I sent for you; and you have done well to come. And now, we are all present before God, ready to give attention to all the things which the Lord has given you to say.
translation: So, ek het jou onmiddellik gestuur om te kom; en jy het goed gemaak om te kom. En nou is ons almal hier voor God, reg om te luister na alles wat die Here jou gegee het om te sê.

original: Now when Saul came back from fighting the Philistines, news was given him that David was in the waste land of En-gedi.
translation: Toe Saul terugkom van die geveg teen die Filistyne, het hulle vir hom gesê dat David in die woesteny van En-gedi is.

original: In the fourteenth day of this month, at evening, you are to keep it at the regular time, and in the way ordered in the law.
translation: Op die veertiende dag van hierdie maand, in die aand, moet julle dit op die gewone tyd hou, op die manier wat die wet sê.

original: And when Jesus went on from there, two blind men came after him, crying out, Have mercy on us, you Son of David.
translation: En toe Jesus van daar af verder gegaan het, het twee blindemanne agter hom gekom en uitgeroep: "Moet asseblief vir ons Lig genoeg, Seun van David."

original: And put an end to all the plants of their land, taking all the fruit of the earth for food.
translation: En maak 'n einde aan al die plante in hulle land, terwyl hulle al die vrugte van die aarde vir kos neem.

original: Then Amaziah, king of Judah, acting on the suggestion of his servants, sent to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us have a meeting face to face.
translation: Toe het Amazia, die koning van Juda, op sy dienaars se voorstel, Joash gestuur, die seun van Jehoahaz, die seun van Jehu, die koning van Israel, en gesê: Kom, kom ons ontmoet mekaar.

original: And Moses gave orders to the children of Israel to keep the Passover.
translation: Moses het vir die kinders van Israel gesê hulle moet die Pasga hou.

original: With the hard work of your hands you will get your bread till you go back to the earth from which you were taken: for dust you are and to the dust you will go back.
translation: Met die harde werk van jou hande, sal jy jou brood kry totdat jy teruggaan na die aarde waarvan jy gemaak is: want jy is stof en na die stof sal jy weer teruggaan.

original: Then Peter said, Truly, I see clearly that God is no respecter of persons:
translation: Toe het Petrus gesê, Ek sien duidelik dat God nie mense verskillend behandel nie.

original: Then Saul took three thousand of the best men out of all Israel, and went in search of David and his men on the rocks of the mountain goats.
translation: Toe het Saul drie duisend van die beste mans uit die hele Israel geneem en het hy David en sy manne op die rotse van die bergbokke gesoek.

original: He put to death the first child of every family in the land, the first-fruits of their strength.
translation: Hy het die eerste kind van elke gesin in die land doodgemaak, die eerste vrugte van hul krag.

original: And when he had come into the house, the blind men came to him; and Jesus said to them, Have you faith that I am able to do this? They said to him, Yes, Lord.
translation: Toe Hy in die huis ingegaan het, het die blindes na Hom toe gekom; en Jesus het vir hulle gesê, Glo julle dat Ek dit kan doen? Hulle het vir Hom gesê, Ja, Here.

original: And the man gave his wife the name of Eve because she was the mother of all who have life.
translation: Die man het sy vrou Eva genoem omdat sy die moeder van almal is wat lewe het.

original: So this is what the Lord of armies has said about the prophets: See, I will give them a bitter plant for their food, and bitter water for their drink: for from the prophets of Jerusalem unclean behaviour has gone out into all the land.
translation: So dit is wat die Here van die leërs oor die profete gesê het: Kyk, ek sal vir hulle 'n slegte plant vir hul kos gee en slegte water vir hul drink: want van die profete in Jerusalem het onwelgevallige gedrag oor die hele land versprei.

original: So they kept the Passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at evening, in the waste land of Sinai: as the Lord gave orders to Moses, so the children of Israel did.
translation: Hulle het die Paasfees gevier in die eerste maand, op die veertiende dag van die maand, in die aand, in die woestyn van Sinai: soos wat die Here Moses gesê het, het die Israeliete dit gedoen.

original: But in every nation, the man who has fear of him and does righteousness is pleasing to him.
translation: Maar in elke land is die man wat respek vir hom het en regverdig is, vir hom welkom.

original: And on the way he came to a place where sheep were kept, where there was a hollow in the rock; and Saul went in for a private purpose. Now David and his men were in the deepest part of the hollow.
translation: En op die pad het hy by 'n plek gekom waar skape gebly het, daar was 'n holte in die rots; en Saul het ingegaan vir 'n private rede. David en sy manne was toe in die diepste deel van die holte.

original: And Joash, king of Israel, sent to Amaziah, king of Judah, saying, The thorn-tree in Lebanon sent to the cedar in Lebanon, saying, Give your daughter to my son for a wife: and a beast from the woodland in Lebanon went by, crushing the thorn under his feet.
translation: En Joash, die koning van Israel, het vir Amaziah, die koning van Juda, gesê: "Die kardoesboom in Libanon het vir die sedertree in Libanon gesê: Gee jou dogter aan my seun as 'n vrou." En toe loop 'n dier uit die bos in Libanon verby en vergruis die kardoes onder sy voete.

original: And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife coats of skins for their clothing.
translation: En die Here God het vir Adam en sy vrou klere van dierehuid gemaak om hulle aan te trek.

original: Then he put his hand on their eyes, saying, As your faith is, let it be done to you.
translation: Toe sit hy sy hand op hulle oë en sê: "Soos julle geloof is, mag dit aan julle gebeur."

original: This is what the Lord of armies has said: Do not give ear to the words which the prophets say to you: they give you teaching of no value: it is from themselves that their vision comes, and not out of the mouth of the Lord.
translation: Dit is wat die Here van leërs gesê het: Moet nie na die woorde luister wat die profete vir julle sê nie; hulle leer julle dinge wat nie waardevol is nie: hulle se vision kom van hulself en nie uit die mond van die Here nie.

original: And their eyes were made open. And Jesus said to them sharply, Let no man have knowledge of it.
translation: Hulle oë is oopgemaak. En Jesus het vir hulle gesê: Moet dit vir niemand vertel nie.

original: You say, See, I have overcome Edom; and your heart is lifted up with pride: now keep in your country; why do you make causes of trouble, putting yourself, and Judah with you, in danger of downfall?
translation: Jy sê, kyk, ek het Edom oorwin; en jy is weer so trots: bly nou maar in jou land; hoekom maak jy moeilikheid en sit jouself en Juda in gevaar om te val?

original: And there were certain men who were unclean because of a dead body, so that they were not able to keep the Passover on that day; and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day:
translation: Daar was sekere mense wat nie skoon was nie omdat hulle 'n dood liggaam aangeraak het, en hulle kon nie die Pasga op daardie dag hou nie; en hulle het daardie dag voor Moses en Aaron gekom.

original: He took his people out with silver and gold: there was not one feeble person among them.
translation: Hy het sy mense uitgebring met silwer en goud: daar was nie een swakkeling tussen hulle nie.

original: And the Lord God said, Now the man has become like one of us, having knowledge of good and evil; and now if he puts out his hand and takes of the fruit of the tree of life, he will go on living for ever.
translation: En die Here God het gesê, nou het die mens soos een van ons geword, met kennis van goed en kwaad; en nou, as hy sy hand uitsteek en die vrug van die boom van die lewe neem, sal hy vir altyd bly lewe.

original: The word which he sent to the children of Israel, giving the good news of peace through Jesus Christ (who is Lord of all) —
translation: Die boodskap wat Hy na die kinders van Israel gestuur het, wat die goeie nuus van vrede deur Jesus Christus bring (wat oor almal heers) —

original: But they went out and gave news of him in all that land.
translation: Maar hulle het uit gegaan en van hom in die hele land vertel.

original: And David's men said to him, Now is the time when the Lord says to you, I will give up your hater into your hands to do with him whatever seems good to you. Then David, getting up, took the skirt of Saul's robe in his hand, cutting off the end of it without his knowledge.
translation: En David se mense het vir hom gesê, nou is dit die tyd wanneer die Here vir jou sê, Ek gaan jou vyand in jou hande gee om met hom te doen wat goed vir jou is. Toe het David opgestaan, die punt van Saul se rok in sy hand geneem en dit afgesny sonder dat Saul dit geweet het.

original: Egypt was glad when they went; for the fear of them had come down on them.
translation: Egipte was bly toe hulle gegaan het; want hulle het bang vir hulle geword.

original: So the Lord God sent him out of the garden of Eden to be a worker on the earth from which he was taken.
translation: Die Here God het hom uit die tuin van Eden gestuur om op die aarde te werk, waaruit hy gemaak is.

original: And while they were going away, there came to him a man without the power of talking, and with an evil spirit.
translation: Terwyl hulle weggaan, het 'n man na hom toe gekom wat nie kon praat nie en 'n slegte gees gehad het.

original: And later, David was full of regret for cutting off Saul's skirt.
translation: Later het David baie spyt gehad oor dit hy Saul se rok afgesny het.

original: But Amaziah gave no attention; and this was the purpose of God, so that he might give them up into the hands of Joash, because they had gone after the gods of Edom.
translation: Maar Amaziah het nie gelet nie; en dit was God se plan, sodat Hy hulle in die hande van Joash kon oorgee, want hulle het na die gode van Edom gegaan.

original: That word you yourselves have knowledge of, which was made public through all Judaea, starting from Galilee, after the baptism of which John was the preacher,
translation: Die woord waarvan julle weet, wat in die hele Judea bekend gemaak is, begin in Galilea, na die doop waar Johannes gepreek het.

original: They keep on saying to those who have no respect for the word of the Lord, You will have peace; and to everyone who goes on his way in the pride of his heart, they say, No evil will come to you.
translation: Hulle hou aan om vir diegene wat nie respek het vir God se boodskap, te sê: 'Jy gaan vrede hê;' en vir almal wat in die trots van hulle harte hul pad loop, sê hulle: 'Geen kwaad sal jou oorkom.'

original: And these men said to him, We have been made unclean by the dead body of a man; why may we not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time among the children of Israel?
translation: En hierdie mans het vir hom gesê, Ons is nie skoon nie omdat ons 'n dooie liggaam aangeraak het; hoekom kan ons nie die offering aan die Here op die gewone tyd by die Israeliete bring nie?

original: A cloud was stretched over them for a cover; and he sent fire to give light in the night.
translation: 'n Wolk het oor hulle gesweef soos 'n kombers; en hy het vuur gestuur om lig te gee in die nag.

original: And when the evil spirit had been sent out, the man had the power of talking: and they were all surprised, saying, Such a thing has never been seen in Israel.
translation: Toe die bose gees weggejaag is, het die man begin praat, en almal was verbaas en het gesê: So iets het nog nooit in Israel gebeur nie.

original: And so Joash, king of Israel, went up; and he and Amaziah, king of Judah, came face to face at Beth-shemesh in Judah.
translation: En so het Joash, die koning van Israel, daarheen gegaan; en hy en Amaziah, die koning van Juda, het mekaar ontmoet by Beth-shemesh in Juda.

original: So he sent the man out; and at the east of the garden of Eden he put winged ones and a flaming sword turning every way to keep the way to the tree of life.
translation: So het hy die man weggestuur; en aan die ooskant van die tuin van Eden het hy geeste met vlerke en 'n vlamende swaard geplaas wat in elke rigting draai om die pad na die boom van die lewe te beskerm.

original: And Moses said to them, Do nothing till the Lord gives me directions about you.
translation: En Mooses het vir hulle gesê: Moet niks doen totdat die Here vir my sê wat om te doen met julle.

original: And David said to his men, Before the Lord, never let it be said that my hand was lifted up against my lord, the man of the Lord's selection, for the Lord's holy oil has been put on him.
translation: En David het vir sy mense gesê, Voor God, moenie ooit sê dat ek my hand teen my Meester opgehef het nie, die man wat God gekies het, want God se heilige olie is op hom gesit.

original: For which of them has knowledge of the secret of the Lord, and has seen him, and given ear to his word? which of them has taken note of his word and given attention to it?
translation: Wie van hulle het kennis van God se geheim, Hom gesien, en na Sy boodskap geluister? Wie van hulle het op Sy woorde gelet en daaroor aandag gegee?

original: And Judah was overcome before Israel, and they went in flight, every man to his tent.
translation: En Juda is oorwin deur Israel, en hulle het gevlug, elke man na sy tent.

original: At the people's request he sent birds, and gave them the bread of heaven for food.
translation: Op die mense se versoek het hy voëls gestuur en vir hulle die brood van die hemel gegee om te eet.

original: But the Pharisees said, By the ruler of evil spirits, he sends evil spirits out of men.
translation: Maar die Fariseërs het gesê, Hy stuur slegte geeste uit mense uit deur die heerser van slegte geeste.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: So with these words David kept his servants back, and did not let them make an attack on Saul. And Saul got up and went on his way.
translation: Met hierdie woorde het David sy dienaars weerhou en hulle nie toegelaat om Saul aan te val nie. En Saul het opgestaan en verder gegaan.

original: About Jesus of Nazareth, how God gave the Holy Spirit to him, with power: and how he went about doing good and making well all who were troubled by evil spirits, for God was with him.
translation: Van Jesus van Nasaret, hoe God die Heilige Gees aan Hom gegee het, met krag: en hoe hy goed gedoen het en almal wat deur bose geeste lastiggevallen is, gesond gemaak het, want God was by Hom.

original: See, the storm-wind of the Lord, even the heat of his wrath, has gone out, a rolling storm, bursting on the heads of the evil-doers.
translation: Kyk, die stormwind van die Here, die hitte van sy woede, kom aan, soos 'n tornado, wat op die slegte mense neerslaan.

original: His hand made the rock open, and the waters came streaming out; they went down through the dry places like a river.
translation: Sy hand het die klip oopgemaak, en die water het met 'n stroom uitgekom; dit het deur die droë plekke gegaan soos 'n rivier.

original: And the man had connection with Eve his wife, and she became with child and gave birth to Cain, and said, I have got a man from the Lord.
translation: Die man het sy vrou Eva ontmoet, en sy het swanger geword en vir Kain gebaar, en gesê, Ek het 'n man van die Here gekry.

original: And we are witnesses of all the things which he did in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem; whom they put to death, hanging him on a tree.
translation: En ons is getuies van alles wat hy in die land van die Jode en in Jerusalem gedoen het; hulle het hom doodgemaak deur hom aan 'n boom op te hang.

original: Say to the children of Israel, If any one of you or of your families is unclean because of a dead body, or is on a journey far away, still he is to keep the Passover to the Lord:
translation: Sê vir die kinders van Israel, as een van julle of julle gesinne onrein is weens 'n dooie liggaam, of as julle op 'n lang reis is, moet hy steeds die Pasga vir die Here hou.

original: And Jesus went about all the towns and small places, teaching in their Synagogues and preaching the good news of the kingdom and making well all sorts of disease and pain.
translation: En Jesus het in al die dorpe en klein plekke rondgegaan, hulle in die sinagoges geleer, die goeie nuus van die koninkryk verkondig, en al die verskillende siektes en pyn gesond gemaak.

original: And after that David came out of the hollow rock, and crying after Saul said, My lord the king. And when Saul gave a look back, David went down on his face and gave him honour.
translation: En toe het David uit die holle klip uitgekom en vir Saul geskreeu, my meneer, die koning. Toe Saul omkyk, het David sy gesig op die grond neergelê en hom geëer.

original: For he kept in mind his holy word, and Abraham, his servant.
translation: Hy het sy heilige boodskap in gedagte gehou, en Abraham, sy dienaar.

original: Then again she became with child and gave birth to Abel, his brother. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a farmer.
translation: Toe raak sy weer swanger en het Abel, sy broer, gebore. Abel was 'n skaapwagter, maar Kain was 'n boer.

original: On the third day God gave him back to life, and let him be seen,
translation: Op die derde dag het God hom weer lewendig gemaak en dit laat mense sien.

original: And Joash, king of Israel, made Amaziah, king of Judah, the son of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, prisoner at Beth-shemesh, and took him to Jerusalem; and he had the wall of Jerusalem pulled down from the doorway of Ephraim to the doorway in the angle, four hundred cubits.
translation: En Joash, die koning van Israel, het Amaziah, die koning van Juda, die seun van Joash, die seun van Jehoahaz, gevangen geneem by Beth-shemesh en hom na Jerusalem geneem; en hy het die muur van Jerusalem afgebreek van die deur van Efraim tot by die deur in die hoek, vier honderd el.

original: The wrath of the Lord will not be turned back till he has done, till he has put into effect, the purposes of his heart: in days to come you will have full knowledge of this.
translation: Die woede van die Here sal nie teruggehou word voordat Hy dit gedoen het, voordat Hy sy doelwitte laat gebeur het nie: in die komende dae sal julle dit heeltemal verstaan.

original: In the second month, on the fourteenth day, in the evening, they are to keep it, taking it with unleavened bread and bitter-tasting plants;
translation: In die tweede maand, op die veertiende dag, in die aand, moet hulle dit hou, saam met ongesuurde brood en plante wat bitter smaak.

original: And he took his people out with joy, the men of his selection with glad cries:
translation: Hy het sy mense met vreugde uitgelei, die mense wat hy gekies het, met blye geskree.

original: And after a time, Cain gave to the Lord an offering of the fruits of the earth.
translation: En na 'n tyd het Kain vir God 'n aanbod van die vrugte van die aarde gegee.

original: And David said to Saul, Why do you give any attention to those who say that it is my desire to do you wrong?
translation: en David het vir Saul gesê, waarom gee jy aandag aan hulle wat sê dat ek jou wil seergmaak?

original: I did not send these prophets, but they went running: I said nothing to them, but they gave out the prophet's word.
translation: Ek het nie hierdie profete gestuur nie, maar hulle het self gaan hardloop. Ek het niks vir hulle gesê nie, maar hulle het die profete se boodskap gegee.

original: Not by all the people, but by witnesses marked out before by God, even by us, who took food and drink with him after he came back from the dead.
translation: Nie deur almal nie, maar deur die mense wat God vooraf gekies het om te getuig, ook deur ons wat saam met hom geëet en gedrink het nadat hy uit die dood teruggekom het.

original: But when he saw all the people he was moved with pity for them, because they were troubled and wandering like sheep without a keeper.
translation: Maar toe hy al die mense sien, het hy medelye met hulle gehad, omdat hulle ontsteld was en rondbeweeg het soos skape sonder 'n herder.

original: Nothing of it is to be kept till the morning, and no bone of it is to be broken: they are to keep it by the rules of the Passover.
translation: Niks daarvan mag tot môre gehou word nie, en geen been mag gebroke word nie: hulle moet dit volgens die reëls van die Paasfees hou.

original: And Abel gave an offering of the young lambs of his flock and of their fat. And the Lord was pleased with Abel's offering;
translation: En Abel het 'n aanbod van die jonglammetjies van sy kudde en hulle vet gegee. En die Here was gelukkig met Abel se aanbod.

original: And gave them the lands of the nations; and they took the work of the peoples for a heritage;
translation: En het vir hulle die lande van die nasies gegee; en hulle het die werk van die mense as 'n erfenis geneem.

original: Look! you have seen today how the Lord gave you up into my hands even now in the hollow of the rocks: and some would have had me put you to death, but I had pity on you: for I said, Never will my hand be lifted up against my lord, who has been marked with the holy oil.
translation: Kyk! Jy het vandag gesien hoe die Here jou in my hande gegee het, selfs in die holtes van die rotse. Party het vir my gesê ek moet jou doodmaak, maar ek het jammer vir jou gevoel. Ek het gesê, ek sal nooit my hand teen my heer ophef nie, hy wat met heilige olie as koning gekies is.

original: But if they had been in my secret, then they would have made my people give ear to my words, turning them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.
translation: Maar as hulle my geheim geken het, sou hulle my mense laat luister na my woorde en hulle van hulle slegte pad en dade afgetrek het.

original: And he took all the gold and silver and all the vessels which were in the house of the Lord, under the care of Obed-edom, and all the wealth from the king's house, as well as those whose lives would be the price of broken faith, and went back to Samaria.
translation: Hy het al die goud en silwer en al die goed wat in God se huis was, onder Obed-edom se sorg, asook al die rykdom van die koning se huis, en die mense wie se lewens die prys van gebroke vertroue sou wees, geneem en teruggegaan na Samaria.

original: And he gave us orders to give news of this to the people, and to give public witness that this is he whom God has made judge of the living and the dead.
translation: Hy het vir ons gesê om vir die mense hiervan te vertel en om openlik te sê dat hy die een is wat God aangestel het om oor die lewendes en die dooies te oordeel.

original: So that they might keep his orders, and be true to his laws. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: So hulle kan sy opdragte hou en getrou wees aan sy wette. Loof die Here.

original: But the man who, not being unclean or on a journey, does not keep the Passover, will be cut off from his people: because he did not make the offering of the Lord at the regular time, his sin will be on him.
translation: Maar die man wat nie onrein is of op 'n reis is nie, en nie die Paasfees hou nie, sal van sy mense afgesny word: omdat hy nie die offer aan die Here op die regte tyd gemaak het nie, sal sy sonde op hom wees.

original: Then he said to his disciples, There is much grain but not enough men to get it in.
translation: Toe het hy vir sy dissipels gesê, daar is baie graan, maar nie genoeg mense om dit in te bring nie.

original: But in Cain and his offering he had no pleasure. And Cain was angry and his face became sad.
translation: Maar God het nie gehou van Kain en sy aanbieding nie. En Kain was kwaad en sy gesig het hartseer gelyk.

original: Am I only a God who is near, says the Lord, and not a God at a distance?
translation: Is ek net 'n God wat naby is, sê die Here, en nie 'n God wat ver weg is nie?

original: And the Lord said to Cain, Why are you angry? and why is your face sad?
translation: En God het vir Kain gesê, Waarom is jy kwaad? en waarom lyk jy so hartseer?

original: Amaziah, son of Joash, king of Judah, went on living for fifteen years after the death of Joash, the son of Jehoahaz, king of Israel.
translation: Amaziah, die seun van Joash, koning van Juda, het vyftien jaar langer geleef nadat Joash, die seun van Jehoahaz, koning van Israel, gesterf het.

original: In what secret place may a man take cover without my seeing him? says the Lord. Is there any place in heaven or earth where I am not? says the Lord.
translation: Waar kan iemand hom wegsteek sodat ek hom nie kan sien nie? sê die Here. Is daar enige plek in die hemel of op aarde waar ek nie is nie? sê die Here.

original: And see, my father, see the skirt of your robe in my hand: for the fact that I took off the skirt of your robe and did not put you to death is witness that I have no evil purpose, and I have done you no wrong, though you are waiting for my life to take it.
translation: Kyk, my pa, kyk na die rand van jou rok in my hande: want die feit dat ek die rand van jou rok afgehaal het en jou nie doodgemaak het nie, wys dat ek geen slegte bedoelings het nie, en ek het jou geen kwaad aangedoen nie, al wag jy vir my lewe om dit te neem.

original: To him all the prophets give witness, that through his name everyone who has faith in him will have forgiveness of sins.
translation: Die profete sê van Hom dat deur sy naam, almal wat in Hom glo, vergifnis van hulle sondes sal kry.

original: Let the Lord be praised. O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.
translation: Prys die Here. O, gee prys aan die Here, want Hy is goed: sy genade bly altyd dieselfde.

original: Make prayer, then, to the Lord of the grain-fields, that he may send out workers to get in his grain.
translation: Bid dan tot die Here van die graanvelde dat Hy werkers kan uitstuur om Sy graan in te bring.

original: And if a man from another country is among you and has a desire to keep the Passover to the Lord, let him do as is ordered in the law of the Passover: there is to be the same rule for the man from another nation and for him who had his birth in the land.
translation: As 'n man van 'n ander land by julle is en hy wil die Pasga vir God hou, laat hom dan doen soos dit in die Pasga wet gesê word: daar moet dieselfde reël wees vir die man van 'n ander nasie as vir hom wat in die land gebore is.

original: My ears have been open to what the prophets have said, who say false words in my name, saying, I have had a dream, I have had a dream, I have had a dream,
translation: My ore was oop vir wat die profete gesê het, wat leuens in my naam vertel en sê, Ek het 'n droom gehad, Ek het 'n droom gehad, Ek het 'n droom gehad.

original: May the Lord be judge between me and you, and may the Lord give me my rights against you, but my hand will never be lifted up against you.
translation: Mag die Here tussen my en jou oordeel, en mag die Here my regte teen jou gee, maar ek sal nooit my hand teen jou oplig nie.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, are they not recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?
translation: Nou is die res van Amaziah se dade, van die begin tot die einde, nie in die boek van die konings van Juda en Israel opgeskryf nie?

original: While Peter was saying these words, the Holy Spirit came on all those who were hearing the word.
translation: Terwyl Peter hierdie woorde gesê het, het die Heilige Gees oor almal gekom wat na die boodskap geluister het.

original: Who is able to give an account of the great acts of the Lord, or to make clear all his praise?
translation: Wie kan vertel van die groot dade van die Here of al sy lof duidelik maak?

original: And he got together his twelve disciples and gave them the power of driving out unclean spirits, and of making well all sorts of disease and pain.
translation: Hy het sy twaalf dissipels bymekaargemaak en vir hulle die krag gegee om slegte geeste uit te jaag en om verskillende siektes en pyn te genees.

original: There is an old saying, From the evil-doer comes evil: but my hand will never be lifted up against you.
translation: Daar is 'n ou spreekwoord: slegte mense bring slegte dinge, maar ek sal jou nooit seergemaak nie.

original: Now from the time when Amaziah gave up worshipping the Lord, they made secret designs against him in Jerusalem; and he went in flight to Lachish: but they sent to Lachish after him and put him to death there.
translation: Toe Amaziah opgehou het om die Here te aanbid, het hulle geheime planne teen hom in Jerusalem gemaak; hy het na Lachish gevlug, maar hulle het hom daar na gegaan en hom doodgemaak.

original: Happy are they whose decisions are upright, and he who does righteousness at all times.
translation: Gelukkig is hulle wie se besluitings reg is, en hy wat altyd die regte ding doen.

original: And the Jews of the faith, who had come with Peter, were full of wonder, because the Holy Spirit was given to the Gentiles,
translation: En die Jode van die geloof wat saam met Petrus gekom het, was vol van verwondering, omdat die Heilige Gees aan die nie-Jode gegee is.

original: If you do well, will you not have honour? and if you do wrong, sin is waiting at the door, desiring to have you, but do not let it be your master.
translation: As jy goed doen, gaan jy nie eer kry nie? Maar as jy verkeerd doen, is sonde daar by die deur en wil jou hê. Moet nie toelaat dat dit jou baas is nie.

original: And on the day when the House was put up, the cloud came down on it, on the Tent of witness; and in the evening there was a light like fire over the House till the morning.
translation: En op die dag toe die huis opgerig is, het die wolk daaroor neergedaal, op die tent van getuienis; en in die aand was daar 'n lig soos vuur oor die huis tot die oggend.

original: And they took his body on horseback and put it into the earth with his fathers in the town of David.
translation: Hulle het sy liggaam op 'n perd geneem en dit in die grond saam met sy vaders in die stad van David begrawe.

original: After whom has the king of Israel come out? for whom are you searching? for a dead dog, an insect.
translation: Na wie het die koning van Israel uitgekom? Vir wie soek jy? Vir 'n dooie hond, 'n insekt.

original: Is (my word) in the hearts of the prophets who give out false words, even the prophets of the deceit of their hearts?
translation: Is (my woord) in die harte van die profete wat leuens praat, selfs die profete van die bedrog van hulle harte?

original: Keep me in mind, O Lord, when you are good to your people; O let your salvation come to me;
translation: Onthou my, Here, wanneer U goed is vir U mense; laat U redding my toe.

original: Now the names of the twelve are these: The first, Simon, who is named Peter, and Andrew, his brother; James, the son of Zebedee, and John, his brother;
translation: Die name van die twaalf is soos volg: Die eerste is Simon, wat Petrus genoem word, en Andreas, sy broer; Jakobus, die seun van Sebedee, en Johannes, sy broer.

original: And they were talking in tongues, and giving glory to God. Then Peter said,
translation: En hulle het in ander tale gepraat en God se eer gegee. Toe sê Petrus,

original: And so it was at all times: it was covered by the cloud, and by a light as of fire by night.
translation: En so was dit altyd: dit was bedek met die wolk, en met 'n lig soos vuur in die nag.

original: Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in place of his father Amaziah.
translation: Toe het al die mense van Juda Uzziah geneem, wat sestien jaar oud was, en hom koning gemaak in plaas van sy pa Amaziah.

original: And Cain said to his brother, Let us go into the field: and when they were in the field, Cain made an attack on his brother Abel and put him to death.
translation: En Kain het vir sy broer gesê: "Kom ons gaan in die veld." En toe hulle in die veld was, het Kain sy broer Abel aangeval en hom doodgemaak.

original: So that I may see the well-being of the people of your selection, and have a part in the joy of your nation, and take pride in your heritage.
translation: Ek wil sien hoe goed dit gaan met die mense wat jy gekies het, deelneem aan die vreugde van jou nasie, en trots wees op jou erfenis.

original: Will any man say that these may not have baptism who have been given the Holy Spirit as we have?
translation: Sal iemand sê dat hierdie mense nie gedoop kan word nie, terwyl hulle die Heilige Gees ontvang het soos ons?

original: Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew, the tax-farmer; James, the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
translation: Filippus en Bartolomeus; Thomas en Matteus, die belastingman; Jakobus, die seun van Alfeus, en Taddeus;

original: So let the Lord be judge, and give a decision between me and you, and see and give support to my cause, and keep me from falling into your hands.
translation: Laat die Here oordeel en besluit tussen my en jou, kyk en help my met my saak, en verhoed dat ek in jou hande val.

original: Whose purpose is to take away the memory of my name from my people by their dreams, of which every man is talking to his neighbour, as their fathers gave up the memory of my name for the Baal.
translation: Wie se doel is om my mense se herinnering van my naam te vergeet deur hulle drome, waarvan elke man met sy buurman praat, soos wat hulle vaders die herinnering van my naam vir die Baal opgegee het.

original: And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the House, then the children of Israel went journeying on; and in the place where the cloud came to rest, there the children of Israel put up their tents.
translation: En wanneer die wolk van bo die huis opgetel is, het die Israeliete verder gereis; en op die plek waar die wolk gaan stilhou het, het die Israeliete hulle tente opgeslaan.

original: And he gave orders for them to have baptism in the name of Jesus Christ. Then they kept him with them for some days.
translation: Hy het gesê hulle moet gedoop word in Jesus se naam. Toe het hulle hom vir 'n paar dae by hulle gehad.

original: He was the builder of Eloth, which he got back for Judah after the death of the king.
translation: Hy was die ou wat Eloth gebou het en dit weer vir Juda teruggekry het nadat die koning nie meer gelewe het nie.

original: And the Lord said to Cain, Where is your brother Abel? And he said, I have no idea: am I my brother's keeper?
translation: Die Here het vir Kain gesê, Waar is jou broer Abel? En hy het gesê, Ek weet nie: is ek my broer se oppasser?

original: Simon the Zealot, and Judas Iscariot, who was false to him.
translation: Simon die Ywerige, en Judas Iskariot, wat nie regverdig was nie.

original: We are sinners like our fathers, we have done wrong, our acts are evil.
translation: Ons maak foute soos ons vaders, ons het verkeerd opgetree, ons dade is sleg.

original: At the order of the Lord the children of Israel went forward, and at the order of the Lord they put up their tents: as long as the cloud was resting on the House, they did not go away from that place.
translation: Op die opdrag van die Here het die kinders van Israel vorentoe gegaan, en op die opdrag van die Here het hulle hul tente opgeslaan. So lank as wat die wolk oor die Huis gebly het, het hulle nie van daardie plek weggegaan nie.

original: Now when David had said these words to Saul, Saul said, Is this your voice, David, my son? And Saul was overcome with weeping.
translation: Toe David hierdie woorde vir Saul gesê het, het Saul geantwoord: "Is dit regtig jou stem, David, my seun?" En Saul het begin huil.

original: If a prophet has a dream, let him give out his dream; and he who has my word, let him give out my word in good faith. What has the dry stem to do with the grain? says the Lord.
translation: As 'n profeet 'n droom het, moet hy dit deel; en hy wat my boodskap het, moet dit op 'n eerlike manier deel. Wat het die droë stingel met die graan te doen? sê die Here.

original: And he said, What have you done? the voice of your brother's blood is crying to me from the earth.
translation: Hy het gesê: Wat het jy gedoen? Jou broer se bloed roep na my vanaf die grond.

original: Uzziah was sixteen years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for fifty-two years; his mother's name was Jechiliah of Jerusalem.
translation: Uzziah was sestien jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het twee-en-vyftig jaar in Jerusalem regeer; sy ma se naam was Jechiliah van Jerusalem.

original: These twelve Jesus sent out and gave them orders, saying, Do not go among the Gentiles, or into any town of Samaria,
translation: Jesus het hierdie twaalf gestuur en vir hulle gesê: Moet nie na die nie-Jode gaan nie, of na enige dorpie van Samaria nie.

original: Now the Apostles and the brothers who were in Judaea had news that the word of God had been given to the Gentiles.
translation: Nou het die Apostels en die broers in Judea gehoor dat God se boodskap aan die nie-Jode gegee is.

original: Our fathers did not give thought to your wonders in Egypt; they did not keep in memory the great number of your mercies, but gave you cause for wrath at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
translation: Ons vaders het nie aan jou wonders in Egipte gedink nie; hulle het nie onthou van al die genade wat jy gegee het nie, maar hulle het jou kwaad gemaak by die see, selfs by die Rooi See.

original: And he said to David, You are right and I am wrong: for you have given me back good, but I have given you evil.
translation: Hy het vir David gesê, jy is reg en ek is verkeerd: jy het vir my goed gegee, maar ek het vir jou sleg gegee.

original: When the cloud was resting on the House for a long time the children of Israel, waiting for the order of the Lord, did not go on.
translation: Toe die wolk vir 'n lang tyd op die Huis gebly het, het die kinders van Israel, wat gewag het op die opdrag van die Here, nie verder gegaan nie.

original: Is not my word like fire? says the Lord; and like a hammer, smashing the rock to bits?
translation: Is my woord nie soos vuur nie? vra die Here; en soos 'n hamer wat die klip in stukke breek?

original: But go to the wandering sheep of the house of Israel,
translation: Maar gaan na die afgedwaalde skape van die huis van Israel.

original: And now you are cursed from the earth, whose mouth is open to take your brother's blood from your hand;
translation: En nou is jy vervloek van die aarde, waarvan die mond oop is om jou broer se bloed uit jou hand te neem;

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Amaziah had done.
translation: Hy het gemaak wat reg was in God se oë, net soos sy pa Amazia gedoen het.

original: And when Peter came to Jerusalem, those who kept the rule of circumcision had an argument with him,
translation: En toe Petrus in Jerusalem aankom, het die mense wat die reëls van besny gevolg het, met hom gestruikel.

original: Sometimes the cloud was resting on the House for two or three days; then, by the order of the Lord, they kept their tents in that place, and when the Lord gave the order they went on.
translation: Soms het die wolk vir twee of drie dae oor die Huis gebly; toe, op die opdrag van die Here, het hulle hulle tente daar gehou, en wanneer die Here die opdrag gegee het, het hulle verder gegaan.

original: But he was their saviour because of his name, so that men might see his great power.
translation: Maar hy was hulle redder omdat sy naam dit moontlik gemaak het, sodat mense sy groot krag kon sien.

original: And you have made clear to me how good you have been to me today: because, when the Lord gave me up into your hands, you did not put me to death.
translation: En jy het vir my gewys hoe goed jy vandag vir my was: want toe die Here my aan jou oorhandig het, het jy my nie doodgemaak nie.

original: For this cause I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who take my words, every one from his neighbour.
translation: Ek is teen die profete, sê die Here, wat my woorde neem van elkeen van sy buurman.

original: And, on your way, say, The kingdom of heaven is near.
translation: En, op jou pad, sê, God se koninkryk is naby.

original: He gave himself to searching after God in the days of Zechariah, who made men wise in the fear of God; and as long as he was true to the Lord, God made things go well for him.
translation: Hy het homself gegee om God te soek in die dae van Sagaria, wat mense gewys het hoe om God te respekteer; en solank hy getrou aan die Here was, het God dit goed met hom laat gaan.

original: And sometimes the cloud was there only from evening to morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning they went on their journey again: or if it was resting there by day and by night, whenever the cloud was taken up they went forward.
translation: En soms was die wolk net daar van aand tot oggend; en wanneer die wolk in die oggend opgetel is, het hulle weer op pad gegaan: of as dit dag en nag daar gebly het, het hulle elke keer wanneer die wolk opgetel is, vorentoe gegaan.

original: Saying, You went to men without circumcision, and took food with them.
translation: Jy het na mense wat nie besny is nie gegaan en saam met hulle geëet.

original: By his word the Red Sea was made dry: and he took them through the deep waters as through the waste land.
translation: Met sy woord het Hy die Rooi See droog gemaak, en Hy het hulle deur die diep waters gelei soos deur 'n woestyn.

original: If a man comes across his hater, will he let him get away safe? so may you be rewarded by the Lord for what you have done for me today.
translation: As 'n man sy vyand raakloop, sal hy hom dan laat gaan? Julle kan so deur die Here beloon word vir wat julle vandag vir my gedoen het.

original: No longer will the earth give you her fruit as the reward of your work; you will be a wanderer in flight over the earth.
translation: Die aarde sal nie meer vir jou haar vrugte as beloning vir jou werk gee nie; jy sal 'n rondloper op die aarde wees.

original: See, I am against the prophets, says the Lord, who let their tongues say, He has said.
translation: Kyk, ek is teen die profete, sê die Here, wat hul tale laat sê, Hy het gesê.

original: Make well those who are ill, give life to the dead, make lepers clean, send evil spirits out of men; freely it has been given to you, freely give.
translation: Maak mense wat siek is gesond, gee lewe aan mense wat dood is, maak lewendes wat lewersiek is gesond, stuur slegte geeste uit mense uit; dit is gratis aan julle gegee, gee dit ook gratis.

original: But Peter gave them an account of it all in order, saying to them,
translation: Maar Petrus het vir hulle alles op 'n keer vertel en vir hulle gesê,

original: And he took them safely out of the hands of their haters, and kept them from the attacks of those who were against them.
translation: En Hy het hulle veilig uit die hande van hulle vyande gehaal en hulle beskerm teen die aanvalle van diegene wat teen hulle was.

original: And Cain said, My punishment is greater than my strength.
translation: En Kain het gesê, my straf is groter as wat ek kan dra.

original: Or if the cloud came to rest on the House for two days or a month or a year without moving, the children of Israel went on waiting there and did not go on; but whenever it was taken up they went forward on their journey.
translation: As die wolk vir twee dae of 'n maand of 'n jaar by die Huis stilstaan sonder om te beweeg, het die kinders van Israel daar gewag en nie verder gegaan nie; maar wanneer dit wegbeweeg, het hulle voortgegaan met hulle reis.

original: And now I am certain that you will be king, and that the kingdom of Israel will be made strong under your authority.
translation: En nou is ek seker dat jy koning gaan wees, en dat die koninkryk van Israel sterk gaan wees onder jou leiding.

original: Take no gold or silver or copper in your pockets;
translation: Neem geen goud, silwer of koper in jou sak nie;

original: He went out and made war against the Philistines, pulling down the walls of Gath and Jabneh and Ashdod, and building towns in the country round Ashdod and among the Philistines.
translation: Hy het uitgegaan en oorlog gemaak teen die Filistyne, die mure van Gath, Jabneh en Ashdod afgebreek, en dorpe gebou in die gebied rondom Ashdod en onder die Filistyne.

original: And the waters went over their haters; all of them came to an end.
translation: En die waters het oor hulle wat haat gegaan, almal het geëindig.

original: You have sent me out this day from the face of the earth and from before your face; I will be a wanderer in flight over the earth, and whoever sees me will put me to death.
translation: Jy het my vandag van die aarde en van jou gesig gestuur; ek sal 'n rondtrekkende mens op die aarde wees, en enige iemand wat my sien, sal my doodmaak.

original: At the word of the Lord they put up their tents, and at the word of the Lord they went forward on their journey: they kept the orders of the Lord as he gave them by Moses.
translation: Volgens God se woord het hulle hul tente opgeslaan, en volgens God se woord het hulle vorentoe gegaan op hul reis. Hulle het God se opdragte gehou soos Hy dit aan Moses gegee het.

original: See, I am against the prophets of false dreams, says the Lord, who give them out and make my people go out of the way by their deceit and their uncontrolled words: but I did not send them or give them orders; and they will be of no profit to this people, says the Lord.
translation: Kyk, ek is teen die profete van vals drome, sê die Here, wat dit versprei en my mense laat afdwaal met hulle bedrog en onbeheersde woorde. Maar ek het hulle nie gestuur of vir hulle opdragte gegee nie; en hulle sal nie vir hierdie mense enige hulp bring nie, sê die Here.

original: So give me your oath by the Lord, that you will not put an end to my seed after me or let my name be cut off from my father's family.
translation: Gee my asseblief jou belofte aan die Here, dat jy nie my nageslag na my nie sal uitskakel nie, of my naam uit my pa se familie sal wegneem nie.

original: I was in the town of Joppa, at prayer: and falling into a deep sleep, I saw in a vision a vessel like a great cloth let down from heaven, and it came down to me:
translation: Ek was in die stad Joppa terwyl ek gebid het, en toe ek in 'n diep slaap geval het, het ek in 'n visioen gesien hoe 'n houer soos 'n groot doek uit die hemel neergesak het, en dit het na my toe gekom.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het aan Moses gesê,

original: Then they had faith in his words; they gave him songs of praise.
translation: Toe het hulle in sy woorde geglo; hulle het vir hom lofliedere gesing.

original: And God gave him help against the Philistines, and against the Arabians living in Gur-baal, and against the Meunim.
translation: En God het vir hom help gegee teen die Filistyne, teen die Arabiërs wat in Gur-baal bly, en teen die Meunim.

original: And the Lord said, Truly, if Cain is put to death, seven lives will be taken for his. And the Lord put a mark on Cain so that no one might put him to death.
translation: En die Here het gesê, Dit is waar, as Kain doodgemaak word, sal sewe lewens vir hom geneem word. En die Here het 'n teken op Kain gesit sodat niemand hom doodmaak nie.

original: And David gave Saul his oath. And Saul went back to his house; but David and his men went up to their safe place.
translation: En David het vir Saul belowe. En Saul het teruggegaan huis toe; maar David en sy mense het na hulle veilige plek gegaan.

original: Take no bag for your journey and do not take two coats or shoes or a stick: for the workman has a right to his food.
translation: Neem nie 'n tas vir jou reis nie, en neem nie twee jakke of skoene of 'n stok nie, want 'n werker het reg op sy kos.

original: And looking on it with attention I saw in it all sorts of beasts and birds.
translation: Toe ek goed daarop kyk, het ek al soort diere en voëls daarin gesien.

original: And if this people, or the prophet, or a priest, questioning you, says, What word of weight is there from the Lord? then you are to say to them, You are the word, for I will not be troubled with you any more, says the Lord.
translation: As hierdie mense, of die profeet, of 'n priester jou vra en sê: Watter belangrike boodskap het God? dan moet jy vir hulle sê: Julle is die boodskap, want ek sal nie meer met julle te doen hê nie, sê God.

original: But their memory of his works was short; not waiting to be guided by him,
translation: Maar hulle het gou vergeet van wat hy gedoen het; hulle het nie gewag om deur hom gelei te word nie.

original: The Ammonites gave offerings to Uzziah: and news of him went out as far as the limit of Egypt; for he became very great in power.
translation: Die Ammoniete het offers aan Uzziah gegee, en nuus van hom het tot by die grens van Egipte gegaan, want hy het baie kragtig geword.

original: Make two silver horns of hammered work, to be used for getting the people together and to give the sign for the moving of the tents.
translation: Maak twee silwer horings van gesmede werk, om die mense bymekaar te kry en om die teken te gee wanneer die tente verskuif.

original: And a voice came to my ears saying, Come, Peter; take them for food.
translation: En 'n stem het in my ore gekom en gesê, Kom, Petrus; neem hulle om te eet.

original: And into whatever town or small place you go, make search there for someone who is respected, and make his house your resting-place till you go away.
translation: En waar jy ook al gaan, in enige dorp of klein plek, soek iemand wat gerespekteer word, en maak sy huis jou plek om te ontspan totdat jy vertrek.

original: And death came to Samuel; and all Israel came together, weeping for him, and put his body in its resting-place in his house at Ramah. Then David went down to the waste land of Maon.
translation: En die dood het Samuel bereik; al die mense van Israel het bymekaargekom, huilend vir hom, en het sy liggaam in sy rusplek in sy huis in Rama neergelê. Toe het Dawid na die woeste grond van Maon gegaan.

original: They gave way to their evil desires in the waste land, and put God to the test in the dry places.
translation: Hulle het hulle slegte begeertes gevolg in die woestyn en het God uitgedaag in die droë plekke.

original: And as for the prophet and the priest and the people who say, A word of weight from the Lord! I will send punishment on that man and on his house.
translation: En wat die profeet, die priester en die mense sê: "‘n Belangrike boodskap van die Here!" Ek sal straf oor daardie man en sy huis stuur.

original: But I said, No, Lord; for nothing common or unclean has ever come into my mouth.
translation: Maar ek het gesê, Nee, Here; want niks onrein of vuil het ooit in my mond gekom nie.

original: And when you go in, say, May peace be on this house.
translation: En wanneer julle inkom, sê, Mag daar vrede in hierdie huis wees.

original: And Cain went away from before the face of the Lord, and made his living-place in the land of Nod on the east of Eden.
translation: En Kain het weggegaan van God se teenwoordigheid en het 'n plek om te woon gemaak in die land van Nod, oos van Eden.

original: And he gave them their request, but sent a wasting disease into their souls.
translation: En Hy het hulle versoek in vervulling laat gaan, maar het 'n siekte in hulle siele gestuur.

original: When they are sounded, all the people are to come together to you at the door of the Tent of meeting.
translation: Wanneer hulle gebel word, moet al die mense by die deur van die tent van ontmoeting saamkom.

original: But the voice, coming a second time from heaven, said, What God has made clean, do not you make common.
translation: Maar die stem wat weer van die hemel gekom het, het gesê: Wat God skoon gemaak het, moet jy nie as vuil beskou nie.

original: But this is what you are to say, every man to his neighbour and every man to his brother, What answer has the Lord given? and, What has the Lord said?
translation: Maar dit is wat julle moet sê, elkeen aan sy buurman en elkeen aan sy broer: Wat het die Here geantwoord? En, wat het die Here gesê?

original: And if the house is good enough, let your peace come on it: but if not, let your peace come back to you.
translation: En as die huis goed genoeg is, laat jou vrede daar bly; maar as dit nie is nie, kom jou vrede terug na jou.

original: Uzziah made towers in Jerusalem, at the doorway in the angle and at the doorway in the valley and at the turn of the wall, arming them.
translation: Uzziah het torings in Jerusalem gebou, by die deure in die hoek, en by die deure in die vallei, en by die draai van die muur, en het hulle gewapen.

original: Now there was a man in Maon whose business was in Carmel; he was a great man and had three thousand sheep and a thousand goats: and he was cutting the wool of his sheep in Carmel.
translation: Daar was 'n man in Maon wat sy besigheid in Karmel gehad het; hy was 'n groot man en het drie duisend skape en 'n duisend bokke gehad. Hy was besig om die wol van sy skape in Karmel af te sny.

original: And this was done three times, and they were all taken up again into heaven.
translation: En dit het drie keer gebeur, en hulle is almal weer in die hemel opgeneem.

original: And Cain had connection with his wife and she became with child and gave birth to Enoch: and he made a town, and gave the town the name of Enoch after his son.
translation: En Kain het 'n verhouding met sy vrou gehad en sy het swanger geword en 'n seun, Enoch, gehad. Hy het 'n stad gebou en die stad na sy seun, Enoch, genoem.

original: They were full of envy against Moses among the tents, and against Aaron, the holy one of the Lord.
translation: Hulle was vol jaloesie teenoor Moses tussen die tente, en teenoor Aaron, die heilige van die Here.

original: If only one of them is sounded, then the chiefs, the heads of the thousands of Israel, are to come to you.
translation: As een van hulle geklink word, moet die leiers, die hoofde van die duisende van Israel, na jou toe kom.

original: And you will no longer put people in mind of the word of weight of the Lord: for every man's word will be a weight on himself; for the words of the living God, of the Lord of armies, our God, have been twisted by you.
translation: En julle sal nie meer mense herinner aan wat die Here op julle harte lê nie; want elkeen se woorde sal vir homself tel; want die woorde van die lewende God, die Here van die leërs, ons God, is deur julle verdraai.

original: And at that minute, three men, sent from Caesarea, came to the house where we were.
translation: En op daardie oomblik het drie mans van Kesarea by die huis gekom waar ons was.

original: And whoever will not take you in, or give ear to your words, when you go out from that house or that town, put off its dust from your feet.
translation: En wie nie vir jou kom help nie, of nie na jou woorde luister nie, wanneer jy uit daardie huis of daardie dorp gaan, skud die stof van jou voete af.

original: And he put up towers in the waste land and made places for storing water, for he had much cattle, in the low hills and in the table land; and he had farmers and vine-keepers in the mountains and in the fertile land, for he was a lover of farming.
translation: Hy het torings in die woestyn gebou en plekke gemaak om water te stoor, want hy het baie vee gehad, in die lae heuwels en in die vlaktes; en hy het boere en oppassers van wingerde in die berge en in die vrugbare grond gehad, want hy was lief vir boerdery.

original: And Enoch had a son Irad: and Irad became the father of Mehujael: and Mehujael became the father of Methushael: and Methushael became the father of Lamech.
translation: Enoch het 'n seun gehad, Irad, en Irad het die vader van Mehujael geword. Mehujael het die vader van Methushael geword en Methushael het die vader van Lamech geword.

original: The earth opening put an end to Dathan, covering up Abiram and his band.
translation: Die grond het oopgegaan en Dathan se lewe beëindig, en het Abiram en sy mense bedek.

original: Now this man was named Nabal, and his wife's name was Abigail: she was a woman of good sense and pleasing looks: but the man was cruel and evil in his ways; he was of the family of Caleb.
translation: Nou was hierdie man Nabal genoem, en sy vrou se naam was Abigail: sy was 'n vrou met goeie verstand en 'n mooi voorkoms: maar die man was wreed en sleg in sy gedrag; hy was van die familie van Kaleb.

original: When a loud note is sounded, the tents placed on the east side are to go forward.
translation: Wanneer 'n harde klank gehoor word, moet die tente aan die ooskant voortgaan.

original: This is what you are to say to the prophet, What answer has the Lord given to you? and, What has the Lord said?
translation: Dit is wat julle vir die profeet moet sê: Wat het die Here vir jou geantwoord? en, Wat het die Here gesê?

original: And Lamech had two wives; the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.
translation: En Lamech het twee vroue gehad; die een se naam was Adah, en die ander se naam was Zillah.

original: And a fire was lighted among their tents; the sinners were burned up by the flames.
translation: Daar is 'n vuur aangesteek tussen hulle se tente; die sondaars is deur die vlamme verbrand.

original: And David had word in the waste land that Nabal was cutting the wool of his sheep.
translation: David het gehoor in die woestyn dat Nabal sy skaap se wol sny.

original: Truly I say to you, It will be better for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of God's judging than for that town.
translation: Ek sê vir julle, dit sal beter wees vir Sodom en Gomorra op die dag van God se oordeel as vir daardie dorp.

original: At the sound of a second loud note, the tents on the south side are to go forward: the loud note will be the sign to go forward.
translation: Wanneer die tweede harde geluid klink, moet die tent aan die suidkant vorentoe beweeg: die harde geluid sal die teken wees om vorentoe te gaan.

original: And Adah gave birth to Jabal: he was the father of such as are living in tents and keep cattle.
translation: En Adah het Jabal gebaar: hy was die pa van die mense wat in tente woon en bees hou.

original: They made a young ox in Horeb, and gave worship to an image of gold.
translation: Hulle het 'n jong os by Horeb gemaak en 'n beeld van goud aanbid.

original: And the Spirit gave me orders to go with them, doubting nothing. And these six brothers came with me; and we went into that man's house:
translation: En die Gees het vir my gesê om saam met hulle te gaan, sonder om te twyfel. En hierdie ses broers het saam met my gekom; en ons het in daardie man se huis ingegaan.

original: In addition, Uzziah had an army of fighting-men who went out to war in bands, as they had been listed by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the ruler, under the authority of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.
translation: Daarby het Uzzia 'n leër van soldate gehad wat in groepe oorlog toe gegaan het, soos wat Jeiel die skrywer en Maaseiah die leier dit opgeteken het, onder die gesag van Hananiah, een van die koning se kapteins.

original: But when all the people are to come together, the horn is to be sounded but not loudly.
translation: Maar wanneer al die mense bymekaar kom, moet die horing geblaas word, maar nie te hard nie.

original: See, I send you out as sheep among wolves. Be then as wise as snakes, and as gentle as doves.
translation: Kyk, ek stuur julle uit soos skape tussen wolwe. Wees dan so slim soos slange en so vriendelik soos duiwe.

original: And he gave us an account of how he had seen the angel in his house, saying, Send to Joppa, and get Simon, named Peter, to come to you;
translation: Hy het vir ons vertel hoe hy die engel in sy huis gesien het en gesê: Stuur na Joppa en haal Simon, wat Petrus genoem word, na jou toe.

original: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all players on instruments of music.
translation: En sy broer se naam was Jubal: hy was die pa van almal wat musiek speel.

original: The heads of families, the strong men of war, were two thousand, six hundred.
translation: Die hoofde van families, die sterk mans van oorlog, was twee duisend seshonderd.

original: And David sent ten young men, and said to them, Go up to Carmel and go to Nabal, and say kind words to him in my name;
translation: En David het tien jong manne gestuur en vir hulle gesê: Gaan na Karmel toe en praat lekker met Nabal in my naam.

original: And their glory was changed into the image of an ox, whose food is grass.
translation: En hulle se glorie het in die beeld van 'n os verander, wat gras eet.

original: But if you say, The word of weight of the Lord; this is what the Lord has said: Because you say, The weight of the Lord, and I have sent to you, saying, You are not to say, The weight of the Lord;
translation: Maar as jy sê, God se boodskap; dit is wat God gesê het: Want jy sê, God se boodskap, en ek het na jou gestuur en gesê, jy moet nie sê, God se boodskap nie;

original: The horns are to be sounded by the sons of Aaron, the priests; this is to be a law for you for ever, from generation to generation.
translation: Die horings moet deur die seuns van Aäron, die priesters, geblaas word; dit moet vir julle altyd 'n reël wees, van een geslag na die volgende.

original: Who will say words to you through which you and all your family may get salvation.
translation: Wie sal vir jou woorde sê waardeur jy en jou hele gesin gered kan word?

original: And Zillah gave birth to Tubal-cain, who is the father of every maker of cutting instruments of brass and iron: and the sister of Tubal-cain was Naamah.
translation: En Zillah het Tubal-kain gebaar, die vader van elke maker van gereedskap van brons en yster. Tubal-kain se suster was Naamah.

original: And under their orders was a trained army of three hundred and seven thousand, five hundred, of great strength in war, helping the king against any who came against him.
translation: Onder hulle bevel was 'n getrainde leër van 307 500 soldate, wat baie sterk in die oorlog was en die koning gehelp het teen enigiemand wat hom teëkom.

original: And say this to my brother, May all be well for you: peace be to you and your house and all you have.
translation: En sê dit vir my broer: Mag alles goed gaan met jou; vrede wees met jou, jou huis en al wat jy het.

original: But be on the watch against men: for they will give you up to the Sanhedrins, and in their Synagogues they will give you blows;
translation: Maar wees op julle hoede vir mense: hulle sal jou aan die Sanhedrin oorlewer, en in hul sinagoges sal hulle jou slaan.

original: They had no memory of God their saviour, who had done great things in Egypt;
translation: Hulle het nie onthou van God, hulle redder, wat groot dinge in Egipte gedoen het nie.

original: And if you go to war in your land against any who do you wrong, then let the loud note of the horn be sounded; and the Lord your God will keep you in mind and give you salvation from those who are against you.
translation: As jy oorlog voer in jou land teen iemand wat jou kwaad doen, laat dan die groot horing blaas; en die Here jou God sal aan jou dink en jou red van dié wat teen jou is.

original: For this reason, truly, I will put you completely out of my memory, and I will put you, and the town which I gave to you and to your fathers, away from before my face:
translation: Om hierdie rede sal ek jou heeltemal uit my gedagtes laat verdwijn, en ek sal jou en die dorp wat ek aan jou en jou vaders gegee het, uit my gesig hou.

original: And Lamech said to his wives, Adah and Zillah, give ear to my voice; you wives of Lamech, give attention to my words, for I would put a man to death for a wound, and a young man for a blow;
translation: Toe het Lamech vir sy vroue, Adah en Zillah, gesê: "Luister na my; julle vroue van Lamech, let op wat ek sê, want ek sal 'n man doodmaak vir 'n wond, en 'n jong man vir 'n klap."

original: And Uzziah had all these forces armed with body-covers and spears and head-covers and coats of metal and bows and stones for sending from leather bands.
translation: En Uzziah het al hierdie soldate gewapen met liggamebedekkings, spiesse, helms, metaaljasse, boë en klippe om met leerbande te gooi.

original: I have had word that you have wool-cutters: now the keepers of your sheep have been with us, and we have done them no evil, and taken nothing of theirs while they were in Carmel.
translation: Ek het gehoor julle het wol snyers: die oppassers van julle skape was by ons en ons het niks sleg gedoen nie, en ons het niks van hulle geneem terwyl hulle in Karmel was.

original: And you will come before rulers and kings because of me, for a witness to them and to the Gentiles.
translation: En julle sal voor regeerders en konings kom oor my, as 'n getuienis vir hulle en vir die nie-Joodse mense.

original: Works of wonder in the land of Ham, and things of fear by the Red Sea.
translation: Wonderwerke in die land van Ham, en dinge wat mense bang maak by die Rooi See.

original: And, while I was talking to them, the Holy Spirit came on them, as on us at first.
translation: En terwyl ek met hulle gepraat het, het God se Gees op hulle gekom, soos wat dit aan ons in die begin gebeur het.

original: And I will give you a name without honour for ever, and unending shame which will never go from the memory of men.
translation: Ek sal vir julle 'n naam gee wat nooit eer sal ontvang nie, en 'n skande wat nooit uit mense se gedagtes sal verdwyn nie.

original: And on days of joy and on your regular feasts and on the first day of every month, let the horns be sounded over your burned offerings and your peace-offerings; and they will put the Lord in mind of you: I am the Lord your God.
translation: En op tye van vreugde, op julle gewone feeste en op die eerste dag van elke maand, moet julle die horings blaas oor julle brandoffers en vreedsames; en dit sal die Here aan julle herinner: Ek is die Here julle God.

original: If seven lives are to be taken as punishment for Cain's death, seventy-seven will be taken for Lamech's.
translation: As sewe lewens as straf vir Kain se dood geneem gaan word, sal sewetig-en-sewe vir Lamech s'n geneem word.

original: And the words of the Lord came into my mind, how he said, The baptism of John was with water, but you will have baptism with the Holy Spirit.
translation: En die woorde van die Here het in my gedagtes gekom, hoe Hy gesê het, Die doop van Johannes was met water, maar julle sal 'n doop hê met die Heilige Gees.

original: And he was purposing to put an end to them if Moses, his special servant, had not gone up before him, between him and his people, turning back his wrath, to keep them from destruction.
translation: En hy het beplan om hulle te vernietig, maar Moses, sy spesiale dienaar, het voor hom gaan staan, tussen hom en sy mense, en sy woede afgebuig om hulle van ondergang te red.

original: But when you are given up into their hands, do not be troubled about what to say or how to say it: for in that hour what you are to say will be given to you;
translation: Maar wanneer julle in hulle hande gegee word, moenie julle bekommer oor wat julle moet sê of hoe om dit te sê nie: in daardie uur sal julle gegee word wat julle moet sê.

original: Now in the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud was taken up from over the Tent of witness.
translation: Nou, in die tweede jaar, op die twintigste dag van die tweede maand, is die wolk van die Tent van getuienis afgeneem.

original: And in Jerusalem he made machines, the invention of expert men, to be placed on the towers and angles of the walls for sending arrows and great stones. And his name was honoured far and wide; for he was greatly helped till he was strong.
translation: En in Jerusalem het hy masjiene gemaak, wat vakmanne uitgevind het, om op die torings en hoeke van die mure te sit om pyle en groot klippe te stuur. En sy naam was oral geëer; want hy is baie gehelp totdat hy sterk was.
