original: And Adam had connection with his wife again, and she gave birth to a son to whom she gave the name of Seth: for she said, God has given me another seed in place of Abel, whom Cain put to death.
translation: En Adam het weer met sy vrou gekom, en sy het 'n seun gehad aan wie sy die naam Seth gegee het, omdat sy gesê het, God het vir my 'n ander seun gegee in plaas van Abel, wat Kain doodgemaak het.

original: If your young men are questioned they will say the same thing. So now, let my young men have grace in your eyes, for we are come at a good time; please give anything you may have by you to your servants and to your son David.
translation: As jou jong manne gevra word, sal hulle dieselfde sê. Laat my jong manne nou genade in jou oë hê, want ons het op 'n goeie tyd gekom. Gee asseblief enigiets wat jy by jou het aan jou dienaars en aan jou seun David.

original: Because it is not you who say the words, but the Spirit of your Father in you.
translation: Want dit is nie julle wat die woorde sê nie, maar die Gees van julle Vader in julle.

original: And the children of Israel went on their journey out of the waste land of Sinai; and the cloud came to rest in the waste land of Paran.
translation: Die kinders van Israel het hul reis voortgegaan uit die woestyn van Sinai; en die wolk het gaan rus in die woestyn van Paran.

original: They were disgusted with the good land; they had no belief in his word;
translation: Hulle was teleurgesteld in die goeie grond; hulle het nie in sy woord geglo nie;

original: The Lord gave me a vision, and I saw two baskets full of figs put in front of the Temple of the Lord, after Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, had taken prisoner Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the chiefs of Judah, and the expert workmen and metal-workers from Jerusalem, and had taken them to Babylon.
translation: Die Here het vir my ‘n visioen gegee, en ek het twee mandjies vol vye gesien wat voor die Tempel van die Here neergestel is, nadat Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, Jeconiah, die seun van Jehoiakim, die koning van Juda, gevangene gemaak het, asook die leiers van Juda en die vakmanne en metaalwerkers uit Jerusalem, en hulle na Babilon geneem het.

original: And when David's young men came, they said all this to Nabal, in David's name, and said nothing more.
translation: Toe David se jong manne gekom het, het hulle alles aan Nabal gesê in David se naam en niks meer nie.

original: And Seth had a son, and he gave him the name of Enosh: at this time men first made use of the name of the Lord in worship.
translation: En Seth het 'n seun gehad, en hy het hom Enosh genoem: in daardie tyd het mense vir die eerste keer die naam van God in aanbidding gebruik.

original: If then God gave them, when they had faith in the Lord Jesus Christ, the same as he gave to us, who was I to go against God?
translation: As God vir hulle gegee het toe hulle in die Here Jesus geglo het, net soos wat Hy vir ons gegee het, wie was ek om teen God te gaan?

original: They went forward for the first time on their journey as the Lord had given orders by the hand of Moses.
translation: Hulle het vir die eerste keer op hul reis gegaan soos wat God aan Moses gesê het om te doen.

original: And brother will give up brother to death, and the father his child: and children will go against their fathers and mothers, and put them to death.
translation: En 'n broer sal sy broer doodmaak, en 'n vader sy kind: en kinders sal teen hulle vaders en moeders gaan en hulle doodmaak.

original: But when he had become strong, his heart was lifted up in pride, causing his destruction; and he did evil against the Lord his God; for he went into the Temple of the Lord for the purpose of burning perfumes on the altar of perfumes.
translation: Maar toe hy sterker geword het, het hy baie trots geword, wat sy ondergang veroorsaak het; en hy het slegte dinge teen God, sy Here, gedoen; want hy het in God se tempel gegaan om doeke op die altaar te brand.

original: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day when God made man, he made him in the image of God;
translation: Dit is die boek van Adam se geslagte. In die dag toe God die mens geskep het, het Hy hom in God se beeld gemaak;

original: And Nabal gave them his answer and said, Who is David? who is the son of Jesse? there are a number of servants in these days running away from their masters.
translation: En Nabal het vir hulle geantwoord en gesê: "Wie is David? Wie is die seun van Jesse? Daar is baie dienaars wat vandag van hulle meesters weghardloop."

original: And hearing these things they said nothing more, but gave glory to God, saying, Then to the Gentiles as to us has God given a change of heart, so that they may have life.
translation: Toe hulle dit gehoor het, het hulle niks meer gesê nie, maar het God geprys en gesê: Toe het God vir die nie-Jode, net soos vir ons, 'n nuwe hart gegee, sodat hulle kan lewe.

original: One basket had very good figs, like the figs which first come to growth: and the other basket had very bad figs, so bad that they were of no use for food.
translation: Een mandjie het baie goeie vye gehad, soos die vye wat eerste groei. Die ander mandjie het baie slegte vye gehad, so sleg dat hulle nie gebruik kon word vir kos nie.

original: And you will be hated by all men because of my name: but he who is strong to the end will have salvation.
translation: En julle sal deur almal gehaat word weens my naam: maar hy wat sterk is tot die einde, sal gered word.

original: Talking against him secretly in their tents, they did not give ear to the voice of the Lord.
translation: Hulle het stilletjies oor hom in hul tente gepraat en nie na God se stem geluister nie.

original: First the flag of the children of Judah went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.
translation: Eerst het die vlag van die kinders van Juda vorentoe gegaan met hulle leërs, en aan die hoof van sy leër was Nahshon, die seun van Amminadab.

original: Am I to take my bread and my wine and the meat I have got ready for my wool-cutters and give it to men coming from I have no idea where?
translation: Moet ek my brood, wyn en die vleis wat ek vir my wol-skeerders reggemaak het, aan mense gee wat ek nie weet waar hulle vandaan kom nie?

original: Male and female he made them, naming them Man, and giving them his blessing on the day when they were made.
translation: Hy het hulle man en vrou gemaak, hulle Man genoem, en hulle op die dag wat hulle geskep is, geseën.

original: So he made an oath against them, to put an end to them in the waste land:
translation: So het hy 'n belofte gemaak om hulle in die woestyn uit te wis.

original: And Azariah the priest went in after him, with eighty of the Lord's priests, who were strong men;
translation: En die priester Azariah het agterna gegaan met tagtig van God se priesters, wat sterk mans was.

original: Then those who had gone away at the time of the trouble about Stephen, went as far as Phoenicia and Cyprus, preaching to the Jews only.
translation: Toe het die mense wat weggeloop het tydens die probleme met Stefanus, so ver as Phoenicië en Siprus gegaan en net vir die Jode gesê.

original: Adam had been living for a hundred and thirty years when he had a son like himself, after his image, and gave him the name of Seth:
translation: Adam was honder dertig jaar oud toe hy 'n seun gehad het wat soos hy was, en hy het hom Seth genoem.

original: So David's young men, turning away, went back and gave him an account of everything he had said.
translation: So David se jong manne het omgedraai, teruggegaan en vir hom vertel wat hy alles gesê het.

original: Then the Lord said to me, What do you see, Jeremiah? And I said, Figs; the good figs are very good, and the bad very bad, and of no use for food, they are so bad.
translation: Toe het die Here vir my gesê, wat sien jy, Jeremia? En ek het gesê, Vye; die goeie vye is baie goed, en die slegte vye is baie sleg, en is nie geskik vir kos nie, hulle is so sleg.

original: That their children might be mixed among the nations, and sent away into other lands.
translation: dat hulle kinders tussen die nasies kan meng en na ander lande gestuur kan word.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Issachar was Nethanel, the son of Zuar.
translation: En die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Issachar was Nethanel, die seun van Zuar.

original: But some of them, men of Cyprus and Cyrene, when they came to Antioch, gave the good news about the Lord Jesus to the Greeks.
translation: Maar sommige van hulle, mense van Siprus en Sirene, het, toe hulle in Antiog aankom, die goeie nuus oor die Here Jesus aan die Grieke vertel.

original: And they were joined to Baal-peor, and took part in the offerings to the dead.
translation: Hulle het by Baal-peor aangesluit en het deelgeneem aan die offers vir die dooies.

original: And after the birth of Seth, Adam went on living for eight hundred years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Seth gebore is, het Adam nog agthonderd jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Zebulun was Eliab, the son of Helon.
translation: En aan die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Sebulon was Eliab, die seun van Helon.

original: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
translation: En God se boodskap het na my gekom en gesê,

original: And David said to his men, Put on your swords, every one of you. And every man put on his sword; and David did the same; and about four hundred men went up with David, and two hundred kept watch over their goods.
translation: Toe het David vir sy mense gesê: "Trek julle swerte aan, almal van julle." En elke man het sy swaard aangetrek; en David het ook so gedoen. En omtrent vierhonderd manne het saam met David gegaan, en tweehonderd het oor hulle goed gesorg.

original: But when they are cruel to you in one town, go in flight to another: for truly, I say to you, You will not have gone through the towns of Israel before the Son of man comes.
translation: Maar as hulle gemeen teenoor jou is in 'n dorp, hardloop na 'n ander; want regtig, ek sê vir julle, julle sal nie deur die dorpe van Israel gegaan het nie voordat die Mens se Seun kom.

original: And all the years of Adam's life were nine hundred and thirty: and he came to his end.
translation: Adam het nege honderd en dertig jaar geleef en toe het hy gesterf.

original: And the power of the Lord was with them, and a great number had faith and were turned to the Lord.
translation: En die krag van die Here was by hulle, en baie mense het in God begin glo en het na die Here toe gegaan.

original: So they made him angry by their behaviour; and he sent disease on them.
translation: Hulle het hom kwaad gemaak met hulle gedrag; en hy het siektes oor hulle gestuur.

original: And they made protests to Uzziah the king, and said to him, The burning of perfumes, Uzziah, is not your business but that of the priests, the sons of Aaron, who have been made holy for this work: go out of the holy place, for you have done wrong, and it will not be to your honour before God.
translation: Hulle het teen koning Uzziah geprotesteer en vir hom gesê: "Die brand van geure is nie jou saak nie, dit is die priesters, die seuns van Aaron, wat vir hierdie werk heilig gemaak is. Gaan uit die heilige plek uit, want jy het verkeerd gedoen. Dit sal nie tot jou eer voor God wees nie."

original: And Seth was a hundred and five years old when he became the father of Enosh:
translation: En Seth was honderd vyf jaar oud toe hy die pa van Enosh geword het.

original: A disciple is not greater than his master, or a servant than his lord.
translation: "'n Volgeling is nie groter as sy leier nie, of 'n helper as sy baas."

original: But one of the young men said to Nabal's wife Abigail, David sent men from the waste land to say kind words to our master, and he gave them a rough answer.
translation: Maar een van die jong manne het vir Nabal se vrou Abigail gesê: David het mense uit die woestyn gestuur om vir ons meester vriendelike dinge te sê, maar hy het vir hulle 'n harde antwoord gegee.

original: And news of them came to the ears of the church at Jerusalem: and they sent Barnabas as far as Antioch:
translation: Die nuus oor hulle het by die kerk in Jerusalem gekom, en hulle het Barnabas tot by Antiochië gestuur.

original: Then the House was taken down; and the sons of Gershon and the sons of Merari, who were responsible for moving the House, went forward.
translation: Toe is die Huis afgebreek; en die seuns van Gershon en die seuns van Merari, wat verantwoordelik was om die Huis te beweeg, het vorentoe gegaan.

original: This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said: Like these good figs, so in my eyes will be the prisoners of Judah, whom I have sent from this place into the land of the Chaldaeans for their good.
translation: Dit is wat die Here, die God van Israel, gesê het: Soos hierdie goeie vye, so sal die gevangenes van Juda in my oë wees, wat ek uit hierdie plek in die Chaldeërs gestuur het om goed vir hulle te wees.

original: And he went on living after the birth of Enosh for eight hundred and seven years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En hy het nog agt honderd en sewe jaar geleef nadat Enosh gebore is, en hy het seuns en dogters gehad.

original: Then Phinehas got up, and made prayer for them; and the disease went no farther.
translation: Toe het Pinhas opgestaan en vir hulle gebid, en die siekte het nie verder versprei nie.

original: But these men have been very good to us; they did us no wrong and nothing of ours was touched while we were with them in the fields:
translation: Maar hierdie mense was baie goed vir ons; hulle het ons nie kwaad aangedoen nie en niks van ons is aangeraak terwyl ons saam met hulle in die veld was.

original: Who, when he came and saw the grace of God, was glad; and he made clear to them the need of keeping near the Lord with all the strength of their hearts:
translation: Toe hy gekom het en God se genade gesien het, was hy bly; en hy het vir hulle verduidelik hoe belangrik dit is om naby die Here te wees met al julle harte se krag.

original: For I will keep my eyes on them for good, and I will take them back again to this land, building them up and not pulling them down, planting them and not uprooting them.
translation: Ek sal op hulle let vir die goeie, en ek sal hulle weer na hierdie land terugbring, ek sal hulle opbou en nie afbreek nie, ek sal hulle plant en nie uitruk nie.

original: And all the years of Seth's life were nine hundred and twelve: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Seth se lewe was nege honderd en twaalf: en hy het sy laaste dag gesien.

original: And all the generations coming after him kept the memory of his righteousness for ever.
translation: En al die geslagte wat na hom gekom het, het die herinnering aan sy regverdigheid vir altyd gehou.

original: But day and night they were like a wall round us while we were with them, looking after the sheep.
translation: Maar dag en nag was hulle soos 'n muur om ons terwyl ons by hulle was, en die skape na te gaan.

original: Then Uzziah was angry; and he had in his hand a vessel for burning perfume; and while his wrath was bitter against the priests, the mark of the leper's disease came out on his brow, before the eyes of the priests in the house of the Lord by the altar of perfumes.
translation: Toe was Uzziah kwaad; hy het 'n houer vir geurige olie in sy hand gehad. Terwyl hy bitter boos teen die priesters was, het die teken van melaatsheid op sy voorkop verskyn, voor die priester se oë in die Here se huis by die altaar van geurige olie.

original: Then the flag of the children of Reuben went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Elizur, the son of Shedeur.
translation: Toe het die vlag van die kinders van Ruben vorentoe gegaan met hulle leër: en aan die voorpunt van sy leër was Elizur, die seun van Shedeur.

original: And Enosh was ninety years old when he became the father of Kenan:
translation: Enosh was negentig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Kenan geword het.

original: It is enough for the disciple that he may be as his master, and the servant as his lord. If they have given the name Beelzebub to the master of the house, how much more to those of his house!
translation: Dit is genoeg vir die volgeling dat hy soos sy meester kan wees, en die dienaar soos sy baas. As hulle die naam Beelzebul aan die baas van die huis gegee het, hoeveel te meer aan die mense van sy huis!

original: They made God angry again at the waters of Meribah, so that Moses was troubled because of them;
translation: Hulle het weer vir God kwaad gemaak by die waters van Meribah, en dit het Moses ontstel oor hulle.

original: For he was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and of faith: and a great number were joined to the Lord.
translation: Hy was 'n goeie man, vol van die Heilige Gees en geloof, en 'n groot groep mense het by die Here aangekom.

original: So now, give thought to what you are going to do; for evil is in store for our master and all his house: for he is such a good-for-nothing person that it is not possible to say anything to him.
translation: Dink goed na oor wat jy gaan doen; want daar is slegte dinge op pad vir ons meester en sy hele huis. Hy is so 'n luiaard dat jy glad niks vir hom kan sê nie.

original: And I will give them a heart to have knowledge of me, that I am the Lord: and they will be my people, and I will be their God: for they will come back to me with all their heart.
translation: Ek sal vir hulle 'n hart gee om my te verstaan, dat Ek die Here is: hulle sal my mense wees, en Ek sal hul God wees, omdat hulle met hul hele hart na my sal terugkom.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Simeon was Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.
translation: En by die voorhoede van die kinders van Simeon was Shelumiel, die seun van Zurishaddai.

original: And after the birth of Kenan, Enosh went on living for eight hundred and fifteen years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Kenan gebore is, het Enosh nog agthonderd en vyftien jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: Have, then, no fear of them: because nothing is covered which will not come to light, or secret which will not be made clear.
translation: Wees dan nie bang vir hulle nie: niks is verborge wat nie aan die lig gaan kom nie, of geheim wat nie duidelik gemaak sal word nie.

original: For they made his spirit bitter, and he said unwise things.
translation: Want hulle het sy gees bitter gemaak, en hy het onnozele dinge gesê.

original: And Azariah, the chief priest, and all the priests, looking at him, saw the mark of the leper on his brow, and they sent him out quickly and he himself went out straight away, for the Lord's punishment had come on him.
translation: En Azariah, die hoofpriester, en al die priesters, wat na hom kyk, het die teken van die melaatse op sy voorkop gesien. Hulle het hom vinnig gestuur en hy het onmiddellik gegaan, want God se straf het op hom gekom.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Gad was Eliasaph, the son of Reuel.
translation: Die leër van die kinders van Gad is gelei deur Eliasaph, die seun van Reuel.

original: Then he went on to Tarsus, looking for Saul;
translation: Toe het hy verder gegaan na Tarsus, om Saul te soek.

original: And all the years of Enosh were nine hundred and five: and he came to his end.
translation: Enosh se jare was negehonderd en vyf, en toe het hy gesterf.

original: What I say to you in the dark, say in the light: and what comes to your ear secretly, say publicly from the house-tops.
translation: Wat ek vir julle in die donker sê, moet julle in die lig sê: en wat stilletjies in julle ore kom, moet julle openlik van die dakke af vertel.

original: Then Abigail quickly took two hundred cakes of bread and two skins full of wine and five sheep ready for cooking and five measures of dry grain and a hundred parcels of dry grapes and two hundred cakes of figs, and put them on asses.
translation: Toe het Abigail vinnig tweehonderd broodjies, twee leer vol wyn, vyf skaap wat bereid is om te kook, vyf maate droë graan, honderd pakkies droë druiwe en tweehonderd vyekoe-kaggels geneem en dit op donkies gesit.

original: They did not put an end to the peoples, as the Lord had said;
translation: Hulle het nie die mense beëindig nie, soos die Here gesê het;

original: Then the Kohathites went forward with the holy place; the others put up the House ready for their coming.
translation: Toe het die Kohathiete vorentoe gegaan met die heilige plek; die ander het die huis reg gemaak vir hulle aankoms.

original: And like the bad figs which are so bad that they are of no use for food, so I will give up Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his chiefs and the rest of Jerusalem who are still in this land, and those who are in the land of Egypt:
translation: En soos die slegte vye wat so sleg is dat hulle nie eens vir kos nuttig is nie, sal ek Zedekiah, die koning van Juda, en sy leiers, en die res van Jerusalem wat nog in hierdie land is, en diegene wat in Egipte is, oorgee.

original: So King Uzziah was a leper till the day of his death, living separately in his private house; for he was cut off from the house of God; and Jotham his son was ruling over his house, judging the people of the land.
translation: Koning Uzzia was 'n melaatse tot sy dood en het in sy eie huis gewoon, want hy kon nie by die huis van God wees nie. Jotam, sy seun, het oor sy huis geregeer en die mense van die land geoordeel.

original: And Kenan was seventy years old when he became the father of Mahalalel:
translation: En Kenan was sewentig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Mahalalel geword het.

original: And when he had come across him, he took him to Antioch. And they were with the church there for a year, teaching the people; and the disciples were first given the name of Christians in Antioch.
translation: En toe hy hom gesien het, het hy hom na Antiog geneem. En hulle was 'n jaar lank by die kerk daar, waar hulle die mense geleer het; en die dissipels het eers die naam Christene in Antiog ontvang.

original: But they were joined to the nations, learning their works.
translation: Maar hulle het by die nasies aangesluit en het van hulle dinge geleer.

original: I will give them up to be a cause of fear and of trouble among all the kingdoms of the earth; to be a name of shame and common talk and a cutting word and a curse in all the places wherever I will send them wandering.
translation: Ek sal hulle oorgee sodat hulle 'n rede vir vrees en probleme sal wees onder al die koninkryke op aarde; hulle sal 'n naam van skaamte, 'n onderwerp van gesprek, 'n seergestelde woord en 'n vloek wees op al die plekke waar ek hulle laat rondwander.

original: Now in those days prophets came from Jerusalem to Antioch.
translation: In daardie tyd het profete van Jerusalem na Antiog gegaan.

original: And have no fear of those who put to death the body, but are not able to put to death the soul. But have fear of him who has power to give soul and body to destruction in hell.
translation: Moet nie bang wees vir mense wat die liggaam kan doodmaak nie, maar nie die siel nie. Wees eerder bang vir Hom wat die krag het om siel en liggaam in die hel te vernietig.

original: And they gave worship to images; which were a danger to them:
translation: Hulle het aan beelde aanbid; dit was gevaarlik vir hulle:

original: And she said to her young men, Go on in front of me and I will come after you. But she said nothing to her husband Nabal.
translation: En sy het vir haar jong seuns gesê, Gaan vooruit en ek sal agter julle aankom. Maar sy het niks vir haar man Nabal gesê nie.

original: Then the flag of the children of Ephraim went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Elishama, the son of Ammihud.
translation: Dan het die vlag van Efraim vorentoe gegaan met hulle leërs, en aan die voorpunt van sy leër was Elishama, die seun van Ammihud.

original: Are not sparrows two a farthing? and not one of them comes to an end without your Father:
translation: Is daar nie twee mussen vir 'n kwart nie? En nie een van hulle raak verlore sonder jou Vader nie.

original: And after the birth of Mahalalel, Kenan went on living for eight hundred and forty years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En na Mahalalel se geboorte het Kenan nog acht honderd veertig jaar geleef en het seuns en dogters gehad:

original: And one of them, named Agabus, said publicly through the Spirit that there would be serious need of food all over the earth: which came about in the time of Claudius.
translation: En een van hulle, genaamd Agabus, het deur die Gees vir almal gesê dat daar 'n groot honger regoor die wêreld gaan wees: dit het gebeur in die tyd van Claudius.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, were recorded by Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
translation: Nou is die oorblywende dade van Uzzia, van die begin tot die einde, opgeskryf deur die profeet Jesaja, die seun van Amoz.

original: Now while she was going down under cover of the mountain on her ass, David and his men came down against her, and suddenly she came face to face with them.
translation: Toe sy onder die berg afkom op haar donkie, het David en sy manne ook daar aangekom, en skielik het sy hulle in die oë gekyk.

original: But the hairs of your head are all numbered.
translation: Maar God het al jou hare getel.

original: And I will send the sword, and need of food, and disease, among them till they are all cut off from the land which I gave to them and to their fathers.
translation: Ek sal die swaard, gebrek aan kos, en siektes onder hulle stuur totdat hulle almal weg is van die grond wat Ek aan hulle en aan hulle vaders gegee het.

original: And all the years of Kenan's life were nine hundred and ten; and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Kenan se lewe was negehonderd en tien; en hy het sy einde gekom.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Manasseh was Gamaliel, the son of Pedahzur.
translation: Aan die voorpunt van die leër van die kinders van Manasse was Gamaliel, die seun van Pedahzur.

original: And the disciples, everyone as he was able, made a decision to send help to the brothers living in Judaea:
translation: En die leerlinge, elkeen op sy eie manier, het besluit om hulp te stuur na die broers wat in Judaea woon.

original: They even made offerings of their sons and their daughters to evil spirits,
translation: Hulle het selfs geskenke van hulle seuns en dogters aan slegte geeste gemaak.

original: Now David had said, What was the use of my taking care of this man's goods in the waste land, so that there was no loss of anything which was his? he has only given me back evil for good.
translation: David het gesê, wat was die nut daarvan dat ek na hierdie man se goed in die woestyn omsien, sodat daar niks van hom verloor gaan het nie? Hy het my net slegter teruggegee vir die goeie wat ek gedoen het.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Benjamin was Abidan, the son of Gideoni.
translation: Aan die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Benjamin was Abidan, die seun van Gideoni.

original: And Mahalalel was sixty-five years old when he became the father of Jared:
translation: en Mahalalel was vyf-en-sestig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Jared geword het:

original: Which they did, sending it to the rulers of the church by the hand of Barnabas and Saul.
translation: Hulle het dit gedoen en dit gestuur na die leiers van die gemeente deur Barnabas en Saulus.

original: So Uzziah went to rest with his fathers; and they put his body into the earth in the field used for the resting-place of the kings, for they said, He is a leper: and Jotham his son became king in his place.
translation: So Uzziah het gaan rus by sy voorvaders; hulle het sy liggaam in die grond neergelê in die veld wat as die graf van die konings gebruik word, want hulle het gesê hy is 'n melaatse; en sy seun Jotham het in sy plek koning geword.

original: Then have no fear; you are of more value than a flock of sparrows.
translation: Moet dan nie bang wees nie; jy is meer waardevol as 'n skare voëltjies.

original: The word which came to Jeremiah about all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah king of Judah; this was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon.
translation: Die boodskap wat aan Jeremia gekom het oor al die mense van Juda in die vierde jaar van Jehoiakim, die seun van Josia, koning van Juda; dit was die eerste jaar van Nebukadnesar, koning van Babilon.

original: And gave the blood of their sons and their daughters who had done no wrong, offering them to the images of Canaan; and the land was made unclean with blood.
translation: En het die bloed van hulle seuns en dogters gegee wat niks verkeerd gedoen het nie, en hulle aan die beelde van Kanaän geoffer; en die land is onrein gemaak met bloed.

original: May God's punishment be on David, if when morning comes there is so much as one male of his people still living.
translation: Mag God se straf oor David kom, as daar, wanneer die oggend aanbreek, nog een man van sy mense lewendig is.

original: Now, about that time, Herod the king made cruel attacks on the Christians.
translation: Nou, rondom daardie tyd, het koning Herodes gemeen om hard teen die Christene op te tree.

original: And after the birth of Jared, Mahalalel went on living for eight hundred and thirty years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Jared gebore is, het Mahalalel nog agt honderd en dertig jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And the flag of the children of Dan, whose tents were moved last of all, went forward with their armies: and at the head of his army was Ahiezer, the son of Ammishaddai.
translation: En die vlag van die kinders van Dan, waarvan die tente laaste verskuif is, het vorentoe gegaan met hul leërs: en aan die hoof van sy leër was Ahiezer, die seun van Ammishaddai.

original: So they became unclean through their works, going after their evil desires.
translation: Hulle het onrein geword deur wat hulle gedoen het, omdat hulle hulle slegte begeertes nagejaag het.

original: This word Jeremiah gave out to all the people of Judah and to those living in Jerusalem, saying,
translation: Hierdie boodskap het Jeremia aan al die mense van Juda en aan diegene wat in Jerusalem woon, gegee en gesê,

original: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he became king; and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years; and his mother's name was Jerushah, the daughter of Zadok.
translation: Jotham was vyf-en-twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het; en hy het sestien jaar in Jerusalem geregeer; en sy ma se naam was Jerushah, die dogter van Zadok.

original: And he put James, the brother of John, to death with the sword.
translation: Hy het Jakob, die broer van Johannes, met die swaard doodgemaak.

original: And when Abigail saw David, she quickly got off her ass, falling down on her face before him.
translation: En toe Abigail David sien, het sy vinnig van haar donkie afgeklim en op haar gesig voor hom neergeval.

original: And all the years of Mahalalel's life were eight hundred and ninety-five: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Mahalalel se lewe was agthonderd vyf-en-negentig: en hy het sy lewe beëindig.

original: To everyone, then, who gives witness to me before men, I will give witness before my Father in heaven.
translation: Vir elkeen wat oor my getuig voor mense, sal ek ook voor my Vader in die hemel oor hulle getuig.

original: Then the wrath of the Lord was burning against his people, and he was angry with his heritage.
translation: Toe was God se woede teen sy mense aan die brand, en Hy was kwaad vir sy erfdeel.

original: And Jared was a hundred and sixty-two years old when he became the father of Enoch:
translation: Jared was 162 jaar oud toe hy Enoch se pa geword het.

original: At the head of the army of the children of Asher was Pagiel, the son of Ochran.
translation: Pagiel, die seun van Ochran, was die hoof van die leër van die kinders van Aser.

original: And when he saw that this was pleasing to the Jews he went on to take Peter in addition. This was at the time of the feast of unleavened bread.
translation: En toe hy gesien het dat die Jode dit geniet, het hy voortgegaan om Peter ook te kry. Dit was tydens die feestyd van die ongesuurde brood.

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father Uzziah had done; but he did not go into the Temple of the Lord. And the people still went on in their evil ways.
translation: Hy het gedoen wat reg was in God se oë, net soos sy pa Uzzia gedoen het; maar hy het nie na God se Tempel gegaan nie. En die mense het steeds in hulle slegte paaie aangehou.

original: But if anyone says before men that he has no knowledge of me, I will say that I have no knowledge of him before my Father in heaven.
translation: Maar as iemand vir mense sê dat hy niks van My weet nie, sal ek ook sê dat ek niks van hom weet nie voor My Vader in die hemel.

original: And falling at his feet she said, May the wrong be on me, my lord, on me: let your servant say a word to you, and give ear to the words of your servant.
translation: Toe sy voor sy voete val, sê sy: Laat die skuld op my wees, my heer, laat ek 'n woord vir jou sê, en luister na die woorde van jou dienaar.

original: From the thirteenth year of Josiah, the son of Amon, king of Judah, even till this day, for twenty-three years, the word of the Lord has been coming to me, and I have given it to you, getting up early and talking to you; but you have not given ear.
translation: Van die dertiende jaar van Josia, die seun van Amon, die koning van Juda, tot vandag toe, al vir drie-en-twintig jaar, het God se boodskap na my toe gekom, en ek het dit aan julle gegee, ek het vroeg opgestaan en met julle gepraat; maar julle het nie geluister nie.

original: And Jared went on living after the birth of Enoch for eight hundred years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En Jared het nog agthonderd jaar geleef nadat Enoch gebore is, en hy het seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And he gave them into the hands of the nations; and they were ruled by their haters.
translation: Hy het hulle in die hande van die nasies gegee; en hulle is regeer deur diegene wat hulle haat.

original: And at the head of the army of the children of Naphtali was Ahira, the son of Enan.
translation: En die leier van die groep van die kinders van Naftali was Ahira, die seun van Enan.

original: Do not have the thought that I have come to send peace on the earth; I came not to send peace but a sword.
translation: Dink nie dat ek gekom het om vrede op die aarde te bring nie; ek het nie gekom om vrede te bring nie, maar 'n swaard.

original: And having taken him, he put him in prison, with four bands of armed men to keep watch over him; his purpose being to take him out to the people after the Passover.
translation: Hy het hom geneem en in die tronk gesit, met vier groepies gewapende mense wat oor hom oppas; sy plan was om hom na die Pesach by die mense te bring.

original: He put up the higher doorway of the house of the Lord, and did much building on the wall of the Ophel.
translation: Hy het die hoër deur van God se huis opgesit en baie gebou aan die muur van Ophel.

original: By them they were crushed, and made low under their hands.
translation: Hulle is gebroke en laag gemaak onder hulle hande.

original: Let my lord give no attention to Nabal, that good-for-nothing: for as his name is, so is he, a man without sense: but I, your servant, did not see the young men whom my lord sent.
translation: Moet asseblief nie na Nabal, daardie nuttelose man, kyk nie: want soos sy naam is, so is hy, 'n man sonder verstand: maar ek, u dienskneg, het nie die jong mans gesien wat my heer gestuur het nie.

original: And all the years of Jared's life were nine hundred and sixty-two: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Jared se lewe was negehonderd en twee-en-sestig: en hy het gesterf.

original: For I have come to put a man against his father, and the daughter against her mother, and the daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law:
translation: Ek het gekom om 'n man teen sy pa te las, en 'n dogter teen haar ma, en 'n skoondogter teen haar skoonma aan te dui:

original: This was the order in which the children of Israel were journeying by armies; so they went forward.
translation: Dit was die manier hoe die kinders van Israel in groepe gereis het; so het hulle aangestap.

original: In addition, he made towns in the hill-country of Judah, and strong buildings and towers in the woodlands.
translation: Hy het ook dorpe in die heuwels van Juda gebou, en sterk geboue en torings in die woude.

original: So Peter was kept in prison: but the church made strong prayer to God for him.
translation: So Petrus was in die tronk, maar die kerk het sterk vir God gebid vir hom.

original: And the Lord has sent to you all his servants the prophets, getting up early and sending them; but you have not given attention and your ear has not been open to give hearing;
translation: Die Here het al sy dienaars, die profete, na julle gestuur. Hulle het vroeg opgestaan om julle te waarsku, maar julle het nie opgelet nie en julle het nie geluister nie.

original: Again and again he made them free; but their hearts were turned against his purpose, and they were overcome by their sins.
translation: Hy het hulle weer en weer vrygemaak; maar hulle harte het teen sy bedoeling gedraai, en hulle is oorwin deur hulle sondes.

original: And Enoch was sixty-five years old when he became the father of Methuselah:
translation: Enoch was vyf-en-sestig jaar oud toe hy die pa van Metusalag geword het.

original: And a man will be hated by those of his house.
translation: En 'n man sal haat van die mense in sy huis ervaar.

original: So now, my lord, by the living God and by your living soul, seeing that the Lord has kept you from the crime of blood and from taking into your hands the punishment for your wrongs, may all your haters, and those who would do evil to my lord, be like Nabal.
translation: So nou, my meneer, in die naam van die lewende God en deur jou lewende siel, omdat die Here jou beskerm het teen moord en jy nie self wraak moet neem nie, mag al jou vyande en dié wat jou kwaad wil doen, soos Nabal wees.

original: He went to war with the king of the children of Ammon and overcame them. That year, the children of Ammon gave him a hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of grain and ten thousand measures of barley. And the children of Ammon gave him the same amount the second year and the third.
translation: Hy het oorlog gevoer met die koning van die Ammoniete en hulle oorwin. Daardie jaar het die Ammoniete vir hom honderd talent silwer gegee, sowel as tienduisend maat graan en tienduisend maat gars. En die Ammoniete het hom dieselfde hoeveelheid in die tweede en derde jaar gegee.

original: And when Herod was about to take him out, the same night Peter was sleeping in chains between two armed men, and the watchmen were keeping watch before the door of the prison.
translation: En toe Herodes hom wou uithaal, het Peter daardie nag in kettings tussen twee gewapende mense geslaap, en die wagte het voor die deur van die tronk gewaak.

original: But when their cry came to his ears, he had pity on their trouble:
translation: Maar toe hulle se kreun by hom aankom, het hy jammer gekry oor hulle moeilikheid.

original: Then Moses said to Hobab, the son of his father-in-law Reuel the Midianite, We are journeying to that place of which the Lord has said, I will give it to you: so come with us, and it will be for your profit: for the Lord has good things in store for Israel.
translation: Toe sê Moses vir Hobab, die seun van sy skoonpa Reuel die Midianiet, "Ons is op pad na die plek waarvan die Here gesê het, Ek sal dit aan julle gee. Kom saam met ons, dit sal vir jou goed wees, want die Here het goeie dinge in store vir Israel."

original: He who has more love for his father or mother than for me is not good enough for me; he who has more love for son or daughter than for me is not good enough for me.
translation: Hy wat meer van sy pa of ma hou as van My, is nie goed genoeg vir My nie; hy wat meer van sy seun of dogter hou as van My, is nie goed genoeg vir My nie.

original: And after the birth of Methuselah, Enoch went on in God's ways for three hundred years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Metusalag gebore is, het Henog vir driehonderd jaar in God se paaie voortgegaan en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And let this offering, which your servant gives to my lord, be given to the young men who are with my lord.
translation: Laat hierdie aanbod wat jy aan my gee, aan die jong mense gegee word wat saam met jou is.

original: Saying, Come back now, everyone from his evil way and from the evil of your doings, and keep your place in the land which the Lord has given to you and to your fathers, from times long past even for ever:
translation: Kom nou terug, julle almal, van julle slegte pad en van die kwaad wat julle doen. Hou julle plek in die land wat God aan julle en julle vaders gegee het, van baie lank gelede, selfs vir altyd.

original: And he who does not take his cross and come after me is not good enough for me.
translation: En iemand wat nie sy kruis opneem en my volg nie, is nie genoeg vir my nie.

original: But he said, I will not go with you, I will go back to the land of my birth and to my relations.
translation: Maar hy het gesê, ek gaan nie saam met julle nie, ek gaan terug na die plek waar ek gebore is en na my familie.

original: And kept in mind his agreement with them, and in his great mercy gave them forgiveness.
translation: en het onthou van sy ooreenkoms met hulle, en in sy groot genade het hy vir hulle vergewe.

original: And all the years of Enoch's life were three hundred and sixty-five:
translation: En al die jare van Enoch se lewe was driehonderd vyf en sestig.

original: So Jotham became strong, because in all his ways he made the Lord his guide.
translation: So het Jotham sterker geword, omdat hy in alles wat hy gedoen het, die Here as sy gids gehad het.

original: And may the sin of your servant have forgiveness: for the Lord will certainly make your family strong, because my lord is fighting in the Lord's war; and no evil will be seen in you all your days.
translation: En mag die sonde van jou dienaar vergewe word, want die Here sal jou gesin sterk maak, omdat my heer in die Here se oorlog veg; en geen kwaad sal jou al die dae oorval nie.

original: He who has the desire to keep his life will have it taken from him, and he who gives up his life because of me will have it given back to him.
translation: Wie sy lewe wil hou, sal dit verloor, maar wie sy lewe om my ontwil opgee, sal dit weer terugkry.

original: And he said, Do not go from us; for you will be eyes for us, guiding us to the right places in the waste land to put up our tents.
translation: En hy het gesê, Moet nie van ons weggaan nie; want jy sal vir ons help om die regte plekke in die woestyn te vind om ons tente op te slaan.

original: He put pity into the hearts of those who made them prisoners.
translation: Hy het medelye in die harte van die mense gesit wat hulle gevangenes gemaak het.

original: And Enoch went on in God's ways: and he was not seen again, for God took him.
translation: En Enoch het aanhou om in God se pad te loop: en hy is nie weer gesien nie, want God het hom geneem.

original: Do not go after other gods to be their servants and to give them worship, and do not make me angry with the work of your hands, causing evil to yourselves.
translation: Moet nie ander gode volg om vir hulle te dien en hulle te aanbid nie, en maak my nie kwaad met die goed wat julle doen nie, wat sleg vir julle is.

original: And a great light was seen shining in the room, and an angel of the Lord came to Peter and, touching him on his side so that he came out of his sleep, said, Get up quickly. And his chains came off his hands.
translation: En 'n groot lig het in die kamer geskyn, en 'n engel van die Here het na Pieter toe gekom en, terwyl hy hom aan sy sy raak, het hy hom wakker gemaak en gesê, staan vinnig op. En sy kettings het van sy hande afgekom.

original: And if you come with us, we will give you a part in whatever good the Lord does for us.
translation: As jy saam met ons kom, sal ons jou 'n deel gee in alles wat goed is wat die Here vir ons doen.

original: He who gives honour to you gives honour to me; and he who gives honour to me gives honour to him who sent me.
translation: Die persoon wat jou eer gee, gee ook vir my eer; en die persoon wat my eer gee, gee eer aan Hom wat my gestuur het.

original: And Methuselah was a hundred and eighty-seven years old when he became the father of Lamech:
translation: En Metusela was 187 jaar oud toe hy die pa van Lamech geword het.

original: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars and his ways, are recorded in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.
translation: Die ander dade van Jotam, al sy oorloë en wat hy gedoen het, is op skrif in die boek van die konings van Israel en Juda.

original: Be our saviour, O Lord our God, and let us come back together from among the nations, so that we may give honour to your holy name, and have glory in your praise.
translation: Wees ons verlosser, O Here ons God, en laat ons weer saamkom uit die volke, sodat ons u heilige naam kan eer en u kan prys.

original: But you have not given ear to me, says the Lord; so that you have made me angry with the work of your hands, causing evil to yourselves.
translation: Maar julle het nie na my geluister nie, sê die Here; julle het my kwaad gemaak met wat julle doen, en dit bring slegte dinge oor julle.

original: Then the angel said, Put on your shoes and get ready to go. And he did so. And he said, Put your coat round you and come with me.
translation: Toe het die engel gesê, sit jou skoene aan en maak jouself reg om te gaan. En hy het dit gedaan. Hy het ook gesê, sit jou baadjie aan en kom saam met my.

original: So they went forward three days' journey from the mountain of the Lord; and the ark of the Lord's agreement went three days' journey before them, looking for a resting-place for them;
translation: So hulle het drie dae se reis van God se berg af gevorder; en God se verbond se ark het drie dae se reis voor hulle gegaan, op soek na 'n plek om te rus.

original: He was twenty-five years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years.
translation: Hy was vyf-en-twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het sestien jaar lank in Jerusalem geheers.

original: And though a man has taken up arms against you, putting your life in danger, still the soul of my lord will be kept safe among the band of the living with the Lord your God; and the souls of those who are against you he will send violently away from him, like stones from a bag.
translation: Al het 'n man wapens teen jou opgeneem en jou lewe in gevaar gestel, sal my heer se siel steeds veilig wees tussen die lewendes by die Here jou God; en die siele van dié wat teen jou is, sal Hy met geweld van Hom af wegstuur, soos klippe uit 'n sak.

original: Praise be to the Lord God of Israel for ever and for ever; and let all the people say, So be it. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: Laat die Here God van Israel vir ewig geprys word; en laat al die mense sê, So wees dit. Gee prys aan die Here.

original: He who gives honour to a prophet, in the name of a prophet, will be given a prophet's reward; and he who gives honour to an upright man, in the name of an upright man, will be given an upright man's reward.
translation: Hy wat eer aan 'n profeet gee, in die naam van 'n profeet, sal 'n profeet se beloning kry; en hy wat eer aan 'n regverdige man gee, in die naam van 'n regverdige man, sal 'n regverdige man se beloning kry.

original: And after the birth of Lamech, Methuselah went on living for seven hundred and eighty-two years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En nadat Lamech gebore is, het Metusala nog vir sewe honderd twee-en-agtig jaar geleef en seuns en dogters gehad.

original: And he went out after him; and he was not certain if what was done by the angel was a fact, for it seemed to him that he was seeing a vision.
translation: En hy het agter hom uitgegaan; en hy was nie seker of wat die engel gedoen het, werklik was nie, want dit het vir hom gelyk asof hy 'n visioen gesien het.

original: So this is what the Lord of armies has said: Because you have not given ear to my words,
translation: So dit is wat die Here van die leërs gesê het: Omdat julle nie na my woorde geluister het nie,

original: And Jotham went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the earth in the town of David; and Ahaz his son became king in his place.
translation: Jotham het gaan rus by sy voorvaders, en hulle het sy liggaam in die aarde in die stad van David gelê; sy seun Ahaz het in sy plek koning geword.

original: And when the Lord has done for my lord all those good things which he has said he will do for you, and has made you a ruler over Israel;
translation: En wanneer die Here alles wat Hy vir my heer belowe het, vir jou gedoen het, en jou 'n heerser oor Israel gemaak het;

original: O give praise to the Lord, for he is good: for his mercy is unchanging for ever.
translation: Lof die Here, want Hy is goed: sy genade verander nooit.

original: And all the years of Methuselah's life were nine hundred and sixty-nine: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Metusela se lewe was negentienhonderd nege en sestig: en hy het gesterwe.

original: And whoever gives to one of these little ones a cup of cold water only, in the name of a disciple, truly I say to you, he will not go without his reward.
translation: En almal wat een van hierdie klein ouens net 'n koppie koue water gee, in die naam van 'n volgeling, sê ek vir julle, hy gaan nie sonder sy beloning weg nie.

original: And when they had gone past the first and second watchmen they came to the iron door into the town, which came open by itself: and they went out and down one street; and then the angel went away.
translation: En toe hulle by die eerste en tweede wagte verbygegaan het, het hulle by die ysterdeur van die dorp gekom, wat vanself oopgemaak het. Hulle het uitgehardloop en 'n straat af gegaan, en toe het die engel weggegaan.

original: And by day the cloud of the Lord went over them, when they went forward from the place where they had put up their tents.
translation: En gedurende die dag het God se wolk oor hulle beweeg toe hulle vorentoe gegaan het vanwaar hulle hulle tente opgeslaan het.

original: And Lamech was a hundred and eighty-two years old when he had a son:
translation: En Lamech was honderdtwee jaar oud toe hy 'n seun gehad het.

original: Ahaz was twenty years old when he became king, and he was ruling in Jerusalem for sixteen years; he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord, like David his father:
translation: Ahaz was twintig jaar oud toe hy koning geword het, en hy het vir sestien jaar in Jerusalem geheers; hy het nie gedoen wat reg was in God se oë nie, soos sy pa David.

original: Let those whose cause the Lord has taken up say so, his people whom he has taken out of the hands of their haters;
translation: Laat die mense vir wie God sorg, dit sê, sy mense wat hy uit die hand van hul hateres gehaal het;

original: Then you will have no cause for grief, and my lord's heart will not be troubled because you have taken life without cause and have yourself given punishment for your wrongs: and when the Lord has been good to you, then give a thought to your servant.
translation: Dan sal jy nie meer hartseer wees nie, en my heer se hart sal nie meer pla nie omdat jy sonder rede lewe geneem het en jouself gestraf het vir jou foute: en wanneer die Here goed vir jou is, onthou dan jou dienaar.

original: And it came about that when Jesus had come to the end of giving these orders to his twelve disciples, he went away from there, teaching and preaching in their towns.
translation: Toe Jesus klaar was om sy opdragte aan sy twaalf dissipels te gee, het hy daar weggegaan en in hulle dorpe geleer en gepreek.

original: But he went in the ways of the kings of Israel and made images of metal for the Baals.
translation: Maar hy het in die paaie van die konings van Israel gegaan en metaalbeelde vir die Baäls gemaak.

original: Making them come together out of all the lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
translation: Laat hulle saamkom uit al die lande, van die ooste en van die weste, van die noorde en van die suide.

original: And David said to Abigail, May the Lord, the God of Israel, be praised, who sent you to me today:
translation: En David het vir Abigail gesê: Mag die Here, die God van Israel, geprys wees, wat jou vandag na my gestuur het.

original: See, I will send and take all the families of the north, says the Lord, and Nebuchadrezzar, king of Babylon, my servant, and make them come against this land, and against its people, and against all these nations on every side; and I will give them up to complete destruction, and make them a cause of fear and surprise and a waste place for ever.
translation: Kyk, ek sal al die families van die noorde stuur, sê die Here, en Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, my dienaar, en hulle teen hierdie land laat kom, teen sy mense, en teen al hierdie nasies rondom; ek sal hulle oorgee aan totale vernietiging, en hulle sal 'n rede vir vrees en verbasing wees, en dit sal vir ewig 'n verwoeste plek wees.

original: And when Peter came to his senses he said, Now, truly, I am certain that the Lord has sent his angel and taken me out of the hands of Herod, against all the hopes of the Jews.
translation: En toe Petrus weer by homself kom, sê hy: Nou weet ek regtig, die Here het sy engel gestuur en my uit die hande van Herodes geneem, teen al die hoop van die Jode.

original: And when the ark went forward Moses said, Come up, O Lord, and let the armies of those who are against you be broken, and let your haters go in flight before you.
translation: Toe die ark vorentoe beweeg, het Moses gesê: Kom op, O Here, en laat die leërs van diegene wat teen U is, gebroke word, en laat U vyande voor U vlug.

original: Now when John had news in prison of the works of the Christ, he sent his disciples
translation: Toe Johannes in die tronke hoor van wat Jesus doen, het hy sy dissipels gestuur.

original: And he gave him the name of Noah, saying, Truly, he will give us rest from our trouble and the hard work of our hands, because of the earth which was cursed by God.
translation: En hy het vir hom die naam Noag gegee en gesê: Regtig, hy sal vir ons rus bring van ons probleme en die harde werk van ons hande, omdat die aarde deur God vervloek is.

original: They were wandering in the waste places; they saw no way to a resting-place.
translation: Hulle het rondgedwaal in die dor plekke; hulle het nie geweet hoe om rus te vind nie.

original: A blessing on your good sense and on you, who have kept me today from the crime of blood and from taking into my hands the punishment for my wrongs.
translation: Ek sê dankie vir jou goeie oordeel en vir jou wat my vandag gehelp het om weg te bly van moord en om nie self wraak te neem vir my foute nie.

original: To say to him, Are you he who is to come, or are we waiting for another?
translation: Om vir hom te sê, Is jy die een wat moet kom, of wag ons vir iemand anders?

original: And when it came to rest, he said, Take rest, O Lord, and give a blessing to the families of Israel.
translation: Toe dit stil geword het, het hy gesê, Neem 'n breek, O Here, en gee 'n seën aan die families van Israel.

original: And when he became clear about this, he went to the house of Mary, the mother of John named Mark, where a number of them had come together for prayer.
translation: En toe hy dit verstaan het, het hy na Maria se huis gegaan, die ma van Johannes wat Mark genoem word, waar ‘n paar van hulle bymekaar was om te bid.

original: And after the birth of Noah, Lamech went on living for five hundred and ninety-five years, and had sons and daughters:
translation: En na Noag se geboorte het Lamech nog vyfhonderd vyf-en-negentig jaar gelewe en seuns en dogters gehad:

original: Their souls became feeble for need of food and drink.
translation: Hul siele het swak geword omdat hulle kos en drink nodig gehad het.

original: And more than this, I will take from them the sound of laughing voices, the voice of joy, the voice of the newly-married man, and the voice of the bride, the sound of the stones crushing the grain, and the shining of lights.
translation: En meer as dit, sal ek van hulle die geluid van laggende stemme, die stem van vreugde, die stem van die pasgetroude man, en die stem van die bruid, die geluid van die klippe wat die graan maal, en die skyn van ligte neem.

original: And he gave a blow on the door, and a young girl came to it, named Rhoda.
translation: Hy het aan die deur geklop, en 'n jong meisie, Rhoda, het gekom.

original: More than this, he had offerings burned in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and made his children go through fire, copying the disgusting ways of the nations whom the Lord had sent out of the land before the children of Israel.
translation: Hy het ook offers gebring wat in die Hinnom-vallei gebrand is en sy kinders deur die vuur laat gaan. Hy het die afschuwelike gewoontes van die nasies gevolg, waarvan die Here die mense voor die Israeliete uit die land gestuur het.

original: And all the years of Lamech's life were seven hundred and seventy-seven: and he came to his end.
translation: En al die jare van Lamech se lewe was sewe honderd en sewe-en-sewentig, en hy het sy einde bereik.

original: Then they sent up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gave them salvation out of all their troubles;
translation: Toe het hulle in hul verdriet na die Here geroep, en Hy het hulle uit al hulle probleme gered.

original: Now the people were saying evil against the Lord; and the Lord, hearing it, was angry and sent fire on them, burning the outer parts of the tent-circle.
translation: Die mense het slegte dinge oor die Here gesê; en die Here het dit gehoor en was kwaad, en het vuur na hulle gestuur wat die buitekant van die tent verbrand het.

original: All this land will be a waste and a cause of wonder; and these nations will be the servants of the king of Babylon for seventy years.
translation: Hierdie land sal 'n woesterny wees en mense sal wonder oor dit; en hierdie nasies sal vir sewentig jaar lank die dienaars van die koning van Babel wees.

original: And Jesus, answering, said to them, Go and give news to John of the things which you are seeing and hearing:
translation: En Jesus sê vir hulle, Gaan en vertel vir Johannes van die goed wat julle sien en hoor:

original: And hearing the voice of Peter, in her joy she went running, without opening the door, to say that Peter was outside.
translation: En toe sy Peter se stem hoor, het sy van blydskap begin hardloop, sonder om die deur oop te maak, om te sê Peter is buite.

original: And when Noah was five hundred years old, he became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Toe Noag vyfhonderd jaar oud was, het hy die pa van Sem, Gam en Jafet geword.

original: Guiding them in the right way, so that they might come into the town of their resting-place.
translation: Hulpe om die regte pad te volg, sodat hulle in die dorpie van hulle rusplek kan aankom.

original: And he made offerings and had perfumes burned in the high places and on the hills and under every green tree.
translation: Hy het offers gebring en geurige olie op die hoë plekke gebrand, op die heuwels en onder elke groen boom.

original: For truly, by the living Lord, the God of Israel, who has kept me from doing you evil, if you had not been so quick in coming to me and meeting me, by dawn there would not have been in Nabal's house so much as one male living.
translation: Want werklik, by die lewende Here, die God van Israel, wat my keer om jou kwaad te doen, as jy nie so vinnig na my toe gekom het en my ontmoet het nie, teen die môre sou daar in Nabal se huis nie eens een man oorleef het nie.

original: And the people made an outcry to Moses, and Moses made prayer to the Lord, and the fire was stopped.
translation: En die mense het uitgeroep na Moses, en Moses het gebid tot die Here, en die vuur het gestop.

original: And it will come about, after seventy years are ended, that I will send punishment on the king of Babylon, and on that nation, says the Lord, for their evil-doing, and on the land of the Chaldaeans; and I will make it a waste for ever.
translation: En dit gaan gebeur, nadat sewentig jaar verby is, dat Ek straf op die koning van Babilon en op daardie volk gaan stuur, sê die Here, vir hulle slegte dade, en op die land van die Chaldeërs; en Ek sal dit vir altyd verwoes.

original: The blind see; those who were not able to, are walking; lepers are made clean; those who were without hearing, now have their ears open; the dead come to life again, and the poor have the good news given to them.
translation: Die blindes sien; die wat nie kon, stap; melaatses word skoon gemaak; die wat nie kon hoor nie, het nou hulle ore oop; die dooies kom weer tot lewe, en die armes kry die goeie nuus.

original: And after a time, when men were increasing on the earth, and had daughters,
translation: En na 'n tyd, toe daar al hoe meer mense op die aarde was en hulle dogters gehad het,

original: And they said to her, You are off your head. But still she said, with decision, that it was so. And they said, It is his angel.
translation: Hulle het vir haar gesê, Jy is nie reg in jou kop nie. Maar sy het steeds met oortuiging gesê dat dit so is. En hulle het gesê, Dit is sy engel.

original: And a blessing will be on him who has no doubts about me.
translation: En 'n seën sal op hom wees wat geen twyfel oor my het nie.

original: So that place was named Taberah, because of the fire of the Lord which had been burning among them.
translation: Die plek is Taberah genoem omdat God se vuur onder hulle gebrand het.

original: So the Lord his God gave him up into the hands of the king of Aram; and they overcame him, and took away a great number of his people as prisoners to Damascus. Then he was given into the hands of the king of Israel, who sent great destruction on him.
translation: So het die Here, sy God, hom oorgegee aan die koning van Aram; en hulle het hom oorwin en 'n groot aantal van sy mense as gevangenes na Damaskus geneem. Toe is hy in die hande van die koning van Israel gegee, wat groot skade aan hom gedoen het.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense die Here prys vir sy liefde, en vir die wonders wat Hy doen vir die mense.

original: The sons of God saw that the daughters of men were fair; and they took wives for themselves from those who were pleasing to them.
translation: Die seuns van God het gesien dat die dogters van mense mooi was; en hulle het vrouens vir hulleself gekoop uit die een wat vir hulle goed lyk.

original: And I will make that land undergo everything I have said against it, even everything recorded in this book, which Jeremiah the prophet has said against all the nations.
translation: Ek sal hierdie land laat deurmaak wat ek teen dit gesê het, alles wat in hierdie boek geskryf staan, wat Jeremia die profeet oor al die nasies gesê het.

original: Then David took from her hands her offering: and he said to her, Go back to your house in peace; see, I have given ear to your voice, and taken your offering with respect.
translation: Toe het Dawid haar offer uit haar hande geneem en vir haar gesê: Gaan terug huis toe in vrede. Kyk, ek het na jou stem geluister en jou offer met respek aanvaar.

original: But Peter went on giving blows on the door: and when it was open and they saw him, they were full of wonder.
translation: Maar Petrus het aanhou klop op die deur, en toe dit oopgaan en hulle hom sien, was hulle baie verbaas.

original: He gives its desire to the unresting soul, so that it is full of good things.
translation: Hy gee wat die siel wat nie rustigheid kry verlang, sodat dit vol goeie dinge is.

original: And the Lord said, My spirit will not be in man for ever, for he is only flesh; so the days of his life will be a hundred and twenty years.
translation: Die Here het gesê: My gees sal nie vir altyd in mense wees nie, want hulle is net vlees; daarom sal hulle vir honderd en twintig jaar leef.

original: And when they were going away, Jesus, talking of John, said to all the people, What went you out into the waste land to see? a tall stem moving in the wind?
translation: Toe hulle weggaan, het Jesus, terwyl Hy van Johannes praat, vir die mense gesê: "Waarom het julle na die woestyn gegaan om te kyk? 'n Lang bietjie wat in die wind beweeg?"

original: For a number of nations and great kings will make servants of them, even of them: and I will give them the reward of their acts, even the reward of the work of their hands.
translation: Baie nasies en groot konings sal hulle as dienaars gebruik, en ek sal hulle beloon vir wat hulle doen, en ook vir die werk van hulle hande.

original: And the mixed band of people who went with them were overcome by desire: and the children of Israel, weeping again, said, Who will give us flesh for our food?
translation: Die gemengde groep mense wat saam met hulle gegaan het, was oorweldig deur begeerte, en die Israeliete, wat weer huil, sê: "Wie gaan vir ons vleis gee om te eet?"

original: And Abigail went back to Nabal; and he was feasting in his house like a king; and Nabal's heart was full of joy, for he had taken much wine; so she said nothing to him till dawn came.
translation: En Abigail het teruggegaan na Nabal; hy was besig om soos 'n koning in sy huis te fees; Nabal se hart was vol vreugde omdat hy baie wyn gedrink het; sy het vir hom niks gesê totdat dit daglig geword het.

original: For Pekah, the son of Remaliah, in one day put to death a hundred and twenty thousand men of Judah, all of them good fighting-men; because they had given up the Lord, the God of their fathers.
translation: Pekah, die seun van Remaliah, het op 'n dag honderdtwintig duisend mense van Juda doodgemaak, almal goeie vegters; omdat hulle die Here, die God van hulle vaders, in die steek gelaat het.

original: Those who were in the dark, in the black night, in chains of sorrow and iron;
translation: Die mense wat in die donker was, in die swart nag, in kettings van hartseer en yster;

original: There were men of great strength and size on the earth in those days; and after that, when the sons of God had connection with the daughters of men, they gave birth to children: these were the great men of old days, the men of great name.
translation: Daar was mense van grootsterkte en grootte op die aarde in daardie dae; en daarna, toe die seuns van God met die dogters van mense in aanraking gekom het, het hulle kinders gehad: dit was die groot mense van ou dae, die mense met groot name.

original: But what went you out to see? a man delicately clothed? Those who have fair robes are in kings' houses.
translation: Maar wat het julle gaan kyk? 'n Man wat mooi aantrek? Die mense met mooi klere is in die koning se huis.

original: And Zichri, a great fighting-man of Ephraim, put to death Maaseiah, the king's son, and Azrikam, the controller of his house, and Elkanah, who was second in authority to the king.
translation: En Zichri, 'n groot vegter van Efraim, het Maaseiah, die seun van die koning, Azrikam, wat oor sy huis gegaan het, en Elkanah, wat tweede in bevel na die koning was, doodgemaak.

original: For this is what the Lord, the God of Israel, has said to me: Take the cup of the wine of this wrath from my hand, and make all the nations to whom I send you take of it.
translation: Want dit is wat die Here, God van Israel, vir my gesê het: Neem die beker met die wyn van hierdie woede uit my hand en laat al die nasies waarheen ek jou stuur, daarvan drink.

original: Because they went against the words of God, and gave no thought to the laws of the Most High:
translation: Omdat hulle teen God se woorde opgetree het en nie aan die wette van die Hoogste gedink het nie.

original: And in the morning, when the effect of the wine was gone, Nabal's wife gave him an account of all these things, and all the heart went out of him, and he became like stone.
translation: En in die oggend, toe die wyn se invloed weg was, het Nabal se vrou hom vertel van al hierdie dinge, en sy hart het gebroke, en hy het soos 'n klip geword.

original: And the Lord saw that the sin of man was great on the earth, and that all the thoughts of his heart were evil.
translation: En die Here het gesien dat die mens se sonde groot was op die aarde, en dat al sy gedagtes sleg was.

original: But why did you go out? to see a prophet? Yes, I say to you, and more than a prophet.
translation: Maar hoekom het julle uitgegaan? Om 'n profeet te sien? Ja, ek sê vir julle, en meer as 'n profeet.

original: So that he made their hearts weighted down with grief; they were falling, and had no helper.
translation: Hy het hulle harte swaar gemaak met hartseer; hulle het val, en hulle het niemand om hulle te help nie.

original: And after drinking it, they will go rolling from side to side, and be off their heads, because of the sword which I will send among them.
translation: En nadat hulle dit gedrink het, sal hulle van kant tot kant rol en nie reg wees nie, omdat Ek die swaard onder hulle sal stuur.

original: And the children of Israel took away as prisoners from their brothers, two hundred thousand, women and sons and daughters, and a great store of their goods, and took them to Samaria.
translation: Die kinders van Israel het tweehonderd duisend vroue, seuns en dogters van hulle broers as gevangenes weggeneem, saam met 'n groot hoeveelheid van hulle goedere, en hulle na Samaria geneem.

original: And the Lord had sorrow because he had made man on the earth, and grief was in his heart.
translation: En God was hartseer omdat Hy die mens op die aarde gemaak het, en daar was pyn in sy hart.

original: And about ten days after, the Lord sent disease on Nabal and death came to him.
translation: Ongeveer tien dae later het die Here siekte op Nabal gestuur en het die dood na hom gekom.

original: This is he of whom it has been said, See, I send my servant before your face, who will make ready your way before you.
translation: Dit is die een van wie daar gesê is: Kyk, ek stuur my dienaar voor jou, wat jou pad reg gaan maak.

original: But he made a sign to them with his hand to be quiet, and gave them an account of how the Lord had taken him out of prison. And he said, Give the news to James and the brothers. And then he went away.
translation: Maar hy het met sy hand vir hulle 'n teken gemaak om stil te wees, en het hulle vertel hoe die Here hom uit die tronk uitgehaal het. Hy het gesê: "Gee die nuus aan Jakobus en die broers." En toe het hy weggegaan.

original: Then they sent up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gave them salvation out of all their troubles.
translation: Toe het hulle in hulle hartseer na die Here geroep, en Hy het hulle uit al hulle probleme gered.

original: Sweet is the memory of the fish we had in Egypt for nothing, and the fruit and green plants of every sort, sharp and pleasing to the taste:
translation: Die herinnering aan die vis wat ons in Egipte gehad het, is lekker, en die vrugte en groen plante van elke soort, lekker en smaaklik.

original: Then I took the cup from the Lord's hand, and gave a drink from it to all the nations to whom the Lord sent me;
translation: Toe het ek die beker uit God se hand geneem en 'n slukkie daarvan vir al die nasies gegee na wie God my gestuur het.

original: He took them out of the dark and the black night, and all their chains were broken.
translation: Hy het hulle uit die donker en die swart nag uitgehaal, en al hulle kettings was gebroke.

original: Truly I say to you, Among the sons of women there has not been a greater than John the Baptist: but he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.
translation: Ek sê vir julle, onder almal wat gebore is uit vroue, was daar nog nooit iemand groter as Johannes die Doper nie, maar die een wat die kleinste in die koninkryk van die hemel is, is groter as hy.

original: And the Lord said, I will take away man, whom I have made, from the face of the earth, even man and beast and that which goes on the earth and every bird of the air; for I have sorrow for having made them.
translation: En die Here het gesê, Ek sal die mens wat Ek gemaak het, van die aarde afneem, sowel as die diere en alles wat op die aarde beweeg en elke voël in die lug; want Ek is hartseer dat Ek hulle gemaak het.

original: Now when it was day, the armed men were greatly troubled about what had become of Peter.
translation: Toe dit dag geword het, was die gewapende manne baie bekommerd oor wat met Peter gebeur het.

original: But now our soul is wasted away; there is nothing at all: we have nothing but this manna before our eyes.
translation: Maar nou is ons siel uitgeput; daar is glad niks nie: ons het net hierdie manna voor ons oë.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense God prys vir sy liefde, en vir die wonderwerke wat Hy doen vir mense!

original: And David, hearing that Nabal was dead, said, May the Lord be praised, who has taken up my cause against Nabal for the shame which he put on me, and has kept back his servant from evil, and has sent on Nabal's head the reward of his evil-doing. And David sent word to Abigail, desiring to take her as his wife.
translation: En David, toe hy hoor dat Nabal dood is, het gesê: Prys die Here, wat my help teen Nabal vir die skande wat hy my aangedoen het, en my van die kwaad gehelp het, en op Nabal se kop die straf vir sy slegte dade gestuur het. En David het vir Abigail laat weet dat hy haar wil hê as sy vrou.

original: But Noah had grace in the eyes of God.
translation: Maar Noag het genade in God se oë gehad.

original: But a prophet of the Lord was there, named Oded; and he went out in front of the army which was coming into Samaria and said to them, Truly, because the Lord, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he gave them up into your hands, and you have put them to death in an outburst of wrath stretching up to heaven.
translation: Maar daar was 'n profeet van die Here, met die naam Oded; en hy het voor die leër uit gegaan wat in Samaria inkom en vir hulle gesê, Kyk, omdat die Here, die God van julle voorouers, kwaad was vir Juda, het Hy hulle in julle hande gegee, en julle het hulle doodgemaak in 'n woede-uitbarsting wat tot in die hemel gestrek het.

original: And from the days of John the Baptist till now, the kingdom of heaven is forcing its way in, and men of force take it.
translation: En vanaf die dae van Johannes die Doper tot nou toe, breek die koninkryk van die hemel deur, en sterk mense neem dit.

original: Jerusalem and the towns of Judah and their kings and their princes, to make them a waste place, a cause of fear and surprise and a curse, as it is this day;
translation: Jerusalem en die dorpe van Juda, saam met hulle konings en prinses, word 'n verlaten plek gemaak, 'n rede vir vrees en verbasing en 'n vloek, soos dit vandag is.

original: And Herod, when he sent for him, and he was not there, after questioning the watchmen, gave orders that they were to be put to death. Then he went down from Judaea to Caesarea for a time.
translation: En Herodes, toe hy vir hom gestuur het en hy was nie daar nie, het, nadat hy die wagte vrae gevra het, opdrag gegee dat hulle doodgemaak moet word. Daarna het hy vir ’n tydjie van Judaea na Caesarea gegaan.

original: Now the manna was like a seed of grain, like small clear drops.
translation: Die manna was soos 'n graankorrel, soos klein deurspoekte druppels.

original: The doors of brass are broken by his arm, and the bands of iron are cut in two.
translation: Die koperdeure word gebroke deur sy arm, en die ysterbande word in twee gesny.

original: For all the prophets and the law were in force till John.
translation: Want al die profete en die wet het gegeld tot by Johannes.

original: Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and his servants and his princes and all his people;
translation: Farao, die koning van Egipte, sy dienaars, prinses en al sy mense;

original: And now your purpose is to keep the children of Judah and Jerusalem as men-servants and women-servants under your yoke: but are there no sins against the Lord your God to be seen among yourselves?
translation: En nou is julle doel om die kinders van Juda en Jerusalem as dienaars en dienskinners onder julle te hou. Maar is daar nie sondes teen julle God wat julle bymekaar kan sien nie?

original: Foolish men, because of their sins, and because of their wrongdoing, are troubled;
translation: Dwase mense, omdat hulle sondes en verkeerde dinge doen, is ongemaklik.

original: And if you are able to see it, this is Elijah who was to come.
translation: En as jy dit kan sien, is dit Elia wat gaan kom.

original: The people went about taking it up from the earth, crushing it between stones or hammering it to powder, and boiling it in pots, and they made cakes of it: its taste was like the taste of cakes cooked with oil.
translation: Die mense het dit van die grond af opgetel, dit tussen klippe verpletter of dit tot poeier geklop, en dit in potte gekook. Hulle het koekies daarvan gemaak: dit het geproe soos koekies wat in olie gaar gemaak is.

original: Now he was very angry with the people of Tyre and Sidon: and they came to him, all together, and having made friends with Blastus, the controller of the king's house, they made a request for peace, because their country was dependent on the king's country for its food.
translation: Hy was baie kwaad vir die mense van Tyrus en Sidon. Hulle het saam na hom toe gegaan en vriende geword met Blastus, die baas van die koning se huis. Hulle het hom gevra om vrede te maak, omdat hulle land afhanklik was van die koning se land vir kos.

original: And when David's servants came to Carmel, to Abigail, they said to her, David has sent us to you to take you to him as his wife.
translation: En toe David se helpers by Karmel aankom, by Abigail, het hulle vir haar gesê: David het ons gestuur om jou na hom toe te neem as sy vrou.

original: These are the generations of Noah. Noah was an upright man and without sin in his generation: he went in the ways of God.
translation: Dit is die geslagte van Noag. Noag was 'n regte man en het nie gesondig in sy tyd nie. Hy het in God se paaie geleef.

original: They are disgusted by all food, and they come near to the doors of death.
translation: Hulle is vies vir al die kos, en hulle kom naby die dood.

original: He who has ears, let him give ear.
translation: Hy wat oë het, moet luister.

original: When the dew came down on the tents at night, the manna came down with it.
translation: Wanneer die dou in die nag op die tente geval het, het die manna saam met dit geval.

original: And Noah had three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
translation: Noah het drie seuns gehad: Shem, Ham en Japheth.
