original: And on the day which had been fixed, Herod, dressed in his robes and seated in his place, made a public statement to them.
translation: En op die dag wat vasgestel is, het Herodes, in sy klere en op sy plek, 'n publieke uitspraak aan hulle gemaak.

original: And now give ear to me, and send back the prisoners whom you have taken from your brothers: for the wrath of the Lord is burning against you.
translation: Luister na my, en stuur die gevangenes terug wat julle van julle broers geneem het: want God se woede is teen julle.

original: And all the mixed people and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon and Gaza and Ekron and the rest of Ashdod;
translation: En al die gemengde mense en al die konings van die land van Uz, en al die konings van die Filistyne, en Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron en die ander mense van Ashdod;

original: But what comparison may I make of this generation? It is like children seated in the market-places, crying out to one another,
translation: Maar wat kan ek van hierdie geslag sê? Dit is soos kinders wat in die mark sit en vir mekaar skree.

original: And she got up, and going down on her face to the earth, said, See, I am ready to be a servant-girl, washing the feet of the servants of my lord.
translation: En sy het opgestaan, en sy het met haar gesig op die grond neergeloop en gesê, Kyk, ek is reg om 'n diensmeisie te wees wat die voete van my heer se dienaars was.

original: Then they send up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gives them salvation out of all their troubles.
translation: Hulle roep na die Here in hul verdriet, en Hy red hulle uit al hulle probleme.

original: Edom and Moab and the children of Ammon,
translation: Edom en Moab en die kinders van Ammon.

original: And the earth was evil in God's eyes and full of violent ways.
translation: En die aarde was sleg in God se oë en vol geweld.

original: And at the sound of the people weeping, every man at his tent-door, the wrath of the Lord was great, and Moses was very angry.
translation: Toe die mense huil, het elke man by sy tent staan, God se woede was groot, en Moses was baie kwaad.

original: And the people, with loud cries, said, It is the voice of a god, not of a man.
translation: En die mense het hard geskreeu, dit is die stem van 'n god, nie van 'n man nie.

original: We made music for you and you did not take part in the dance; we gave cries of sorrow and you made no signs of grief.
translation: Ons het musiek vir jou gemaak, maar jy het nie gedans nie; ons het in hartseer geroep, maar jy het nie jammer gevoel nie.

original: Then certain of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah, the son of Johanan, Berechiah, the son of Meshillemoth Jehizkiah, the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, put themselves against those who had come from the war,
translation: Toe het sommige van die leiers van Efraim, Azariah, die seun van Johanan, Berechiah, die seun van Meshillemoth, Jehizkiah, die seun van Shallum, en Amasa, die seun van Hadlai, teen diegene wat van die oorlog af gekom het, gestaan.

original: Then Abigail got up quickly and went on her ass, with five of her young women, after the men whom David had sent; and she became David's wife.
translation: Toe het Abigail vinnig opgestaan en op haar donkie geklim, saam met vyf van haar jong vroue, om by die manne te gaan wat David gestuur het; en sy het David se vrou geword.

original: He sent his word and made them well, and kept them safe from the underworld.
translation: Hy het sy boodskap gestuur en hulle gesond gemaak, en veilig gehou van die onderwereld.

original: And God, looking on the earth, saw that it was evil: for the way of all flesh had become evil on the earth.
translation: En God het na die aarde gekyk en gesien dat dit sleg was, want die manier waarop mense lewe het sleg geword op die aarde.

original: And all the kings of Tyre, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the lands across the sea;
translation: En al die konings van Tirus, en al die konings van Sidon, en die konings van die lande oor die see;

original: And Moses said to the Lord, Why have you done me this evil? and why have I not grace in your eyes, that you have put on me the care of all this people?
translation: Toe sê Moses vir die Here, Waarom het U my hierdie slegte ding aangedoen? En waarom het ek nie genade in U oë nie, dat U my die sorg van al hierdie mense gegee het?

original: For John came, taking no food or drink, and they say, He has an evil spirit.
translation: Want Johannes het gekom, sonder om kos of drank te neem, en hulle sê hy het 'n slegte gees.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense die Here prys vir sy genade en die wonders wat Hy vir die mense doen!

original: And David had taken Ahinoam of Jezreel, to be his wife; these two were his wives.
translation: David het Ahinoam van Jezreel geneem as sy vrou; hulle twee was sy vroue.

original: And said to them, You are not to let these prisoners come here; for what you are designing to do will be a cause of sin against the Lord to us, making even greater our sin and our wrongdoing, which now are great enough, and his wrath is burning against Israel.
translation: En het vir hulle gesê, julle mag nie hierdie gevangenes hierheen laat kom nie; want wat julle beplan om te doen, sal ons sonde teen die Here groter maak, en ons foute, wat al groot genoeg is, maak sy woede teen Israel erger.

original: Dedan and Tema and Buz, and all who have the ends of their hair cut;
translation: Dedan en Tema en Buz, en almal wat die punte van hulle hare afgeknip het;

original: Let them make offerings of praise, giving news of his works with cries of joy.
translation: Laat hulle lof aanbied en vertel van wat Hy gedoen het met blije geskreeu.

original: Now Saul had given his daughter Michal, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish of Gallim.
translation: Nou het Saul sy dogter Michal, David se vrou, aan Palti, die seun van Laish van Gallim, gegee.

original: And straight away the angel of the Lord sent a disease on him, because he did not give the glory to God: and his flesh was wasted away by worms, and so he came to his end.
translation: En dadelik het die engel van die Here 'n siekte op hom gestuur, omdat hy nie God die eer gegee het nie. Sy liggaam het deur wurms begin vrot, en so het hy sy einde gekom.

original: And God said to Noah, The end of all flesh has come; the earth is full of their violent doings, and now I will put an end to them with the earth.
translation: En God het vir Noag gesê, die einde van almal se lewe het gekom; die aarde is vol van hulle gewelddadige dade, en nou gaan ek dit alles saam met die aarde stop.

original: Those who go down to the sea in ships, who do business in the great waters;
translation: Hulle wat met skepe na die see gaan en besigheid doen in die groot water;

original: And all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mixed people living in the waste land;
translation: En al die konings van Arabië, en al die konings van die mense wat in die woestyn woon;

original: So the armed men gave up the prisoners and the goods they had taken to the heads and the meeting of the people.
translation: Die gewapende mense het die gevangenes en die goedere wat hulle geneem het aan die leiers en die mense se vergadering gegee.

original: Am I the father of all this people? have I given them birth, that you say to me, Take them in your arms, like a child at the breast, to the land which you gave by an oath to their fathers?
translation: Is ek die pa van al hierdie mense? Het ek hulle gebaar? Waarom sê jy vir my, Neem hulle in jou arms soos 'n kind? Na die land wat jy met 'n belofte aan hulle vaders gegee het?

original: The Son of man has come feasting, and they say, See, a lover of food and wine, a friend of tax-farmers and sinners! And wisdom is judged to be right by her works.
translation: Die Seun van die mens het gekom om lekker te eet en te drink, en hulle sê, kyk, 'n persoon wat hou van kos en wyn, 'n vriend van belastinginsamelaars en sondige mense! En wysheid word regverdig deur wat sy doen.

original: But the word of the Lord went on increasing.
translation: maar God se boodskap het aangehou om te groei

original: They see the works of the Lord, and his wonders in the deep.
translation: Hulle sien wat die Here doen en sy wonders in die dieptes.

original: And the Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah, and said, Is not David waiting secretly near us in the hill of Hachilah, before the waste land?
translation: En die Zifiete het by Saul in Gibea gekom en gesê: Is David nie stilletjies naby ons op die Hachilah-heuvel, voor die woestyn nie?

original: Make for yourself an ark of gopher wood with rooms in it, and make it safe from the water inside and out.
translation: Bou vir jouself 'n ark van gopher-hout met kamers in, en maak dit veilig teen die water, binne en buite.

original: Where am I to get flesh to give to all this people? For they are weeping to me and saying, Give us flesh for our food.
translation: Waar moet ek vleis kry om aan al hierdie mense te gee? Hulle huil vir my en sê, Gee vir ons vleis om te eet.

original: And all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;
translation: En al die konings van Zimri, en al die konings van Elam, en al die konings van die Medes;

original: And Barnabas and Saul came back from Jerusalem, when their work was ended, taking with them John named Mark.
translation: En Barnabas en Saul het teruggekom van Jerusalem, toe hulle klaar was met hulle werk, en het Johannes genaamd Mark saamgebring.

original: And this is the way you are to make it: it is to be three hundred cubits long, fifty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.
translation: En so moet jy dit maak: dit moet driehonderd el lank wees, vyftig el breed, en dertig el hoog.

original: I am not able by myself to take the weight of all this people, for it is more than my strength.
translation: Ek kan nie alleen die laste van al hierdie mense dra nie, want dit is te veel vir my om te hanteer.

original: Then Saul went down to the waste land of Ziph, taking with him three thousand of the best men of Israel, to make search for David in the waste land of Ziph.
translation: Toe het Saul na die verlate gebied van Ziph gegaan, saam met drie duisend van die beste mense van Israel, om vir Dawid in daardie gebied te soek.

original: Now there were at Antioch, in the church there, prophets and teachers, Barnabas, and Symeon who was named Niger, and Lucius of Cyrene, and Manaen, a relation of Herod the king, and Saul.
translation: In Antiochië was daar in die kerk profete en onderwysers: Barnabas, Symeon wat Niger genoem word, Lucius van Sirene, Manaen, 'n familielid van koning Herodes, en Saul.

original: For at his word comes up the storm-wind, lifting high the waves.
translation: Want met sy woord kom die stormwind op, en hy lig die golwe hoog.

original: Then he went on to say hard things to the towns where most of his works of power were done, because they had not been turned from their sins.
translation: Toe het hy begin om moeilike goed te sê vir die dorpe waar hy die meeste van sy wonderwerke gedoen het, omdat hulle nie van hulle sondes afgekom het nie.

original: And those men who have been named went up and took the prisoners, clothing those among them who were uncovered, with things from the goods which had been taken in the war, and putting robes on them and shoes on their feet; and they gave them food and drink and oil for their bodies, and seating all the feeble among them on asses, they took them to Jericho, the town of palm-trees, to their people, and then went back to Samaria.
translation: Die mense wat genoem is, het opgestaan en die gevangenes geneem. Hulle het die wat bloot was, aangeklee met goed wat in die oorlog gekry is, en klere en skoene aan hulle voete aangetrek. Hulle het ook vir hulle kos, drinkgoed en olie vir hulle liggame gegee, en al die swakkes onder hulle op donkies laat sit. Hulle het hulle na Jerigo, die stad van palm bome, geneem, na hulle mense toe, en toe weer teruggegaan na Samaria.

original: And all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another; and all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.
translation: En al die konings van die noorde, naby en ver, saam; en al die koninkryke van die wêreld op die aarde.

original: You are to put a window in the ark, a cubit from the roof, and a door in the side of it, and you are to make it with a lower and second and third floors.
translation: Jy moet 'n venster in die ark sit, 'n elle van die dak af, en 'n deur aan die kant daarvan, en jy moet dit met 'n onder-, tweede en derde verdieping maak.

original: At that time King Ahaz sent for help to the king of Assyria.
translation: Toe het koning Ahaz vir hulp gevra by die koning van Assirië.

original: And while they were doing the Lord's work, and going without food, the Holy Spirit said, Let Barnabas and Saul be given to me for the special work for which they have been marked out by me.
translation: En terwyl hulle God se werk doen en nie kos het nie, het die Heilige Gees gesê: Laat Barnabas en Saulus vir die spesiale werk wat ek vir hulle gekies het, aan My gegee word.

original: And Saul put up his tents on the hill of Hachilah, which is in front of the waste land on the road. But David was in the waste land, and he saw that Saul was coming after him.
translation: En Saul het sy tente opgeslaan op die heuwel van Hachilah, wat voor die woeste grond langs die pad is. Maar David was in die woeste grond, en hy het gesien dat Saul hom agtervolg.

original: The sailors go up to heaven, and down into the deep; their souls are wasted because of their trouble.
translation: Die matrose gaan op na die hemel en af in die verdieping; hulle siels is uitgeput deur al hulle moeilikhede.

original: If this is to be my fate, put me to death now in answer to my prayer, if I have grace in your eyes; and let me not see my shame.
translation: As dit my lot is, laat my dan nou sterf as dit is wat jy wil, want ek het genade in jou oë; en laat my nie my skande sien nie.

original: Unhappy are you, Chorazin! Unhappy are you, Beth-saida! For if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have been turned from their sins in days gone by, clothing themselves in haircloth and putting dust on their heads.
translation: Julle is ongelukkig, Chorasin! Julle is ongelukkig, Bet-saida! Want as die kragtige werke wat in julle gedoen is, in Tyros en Sidon gedoen was, sou hulle al lankal van hulle sondes bekeer het, met harige klere aan en stof op hulle koppe.

original: For the Edomites had come again, attacking Judah and taking away prisoners.
translation: Want die Edomiete het weer teruggekom, hulle het Juda aangeval en mense gevang.

original: And you are to say to them, This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: Take of this cup and be overcome, and let it come out again from your lips, and from your fall you will never be lifted up again, because of the sword which I will send among you.
translation: En jy moet vir hulle sê: Dit is wat die Here van die leërs, die God van Israel, gesê het: Neem hierdie beker en hou aan, en laat dit weer uit julle mond kom, en jy sal nooit weer opstaan nie, vanweë die swaard wat ek onder julle sal stuur.

original: Then, after prayer and going without food they put their hands on them, and sent them away.
translation: Toe, na gebed en vas, het hulle hulle hande op hulle geleë en hulle weggestuur.

original: They are turned here and there, rolling like a man who is full of wine; and all their wisdom comes to nothing.
translation: Hulle draai hier en daar, rol soos 'n man wat vol wyn is; en al hulle wysheid beteken niks.

original: And the Lord said to Moses, Send for seventy of the responsible men of Israel, who are in your opinion men of weight and authority over the people; make them come to the Tent of meeting and be there with you.
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê: "Stuur vir sewentig van die verantwoordelike manne van Israel, wat volgens jou belangrike en invloedryke mense oor die volk is; laat hulle na die ontmoetingsplek kom en daar by jou wees."

original: But I say to you, It will be better for Tyre and Sidon in the day of judging, than for you.
translation: Maar ek sê vir julle, dit sal beter wees vir Tirus en Sidon op die dag van oordeel, as vir julle.

original: For truly, I will send a great flow of waters over the earth, for the destruction from under the heaven of all flesh in which is the breath of life; everything on the earth will come to an end.
translation: Want ek sê, ek gaan 'n groot vloed water oor die aarde stuur om al die lewende dinge wat asemhaal te vernietig; alles op die aarde sal vergaan.

original: And so David sent out watchers, and got word from them that Saul was certainly coming.
translation: En so het David mense gestuur om te kyk, en hulle het vir hom gesê dat Saul beslis oppad was.

original: And it will be, if they will not take of the cup in your hand, then you are to say to them, This is what the Lord of armies has said: You will certainly take of it.
translation: En dit sal wees, as hulle nie die beker in jou hand wil neem nie, dan moet jy vir hulle sê, dit is wat die Here van die leërskare gesê het: Julle sal dit beslis neem.

original: So, being sent out by the Holy Spirit, they went down to Seleucia; and from there they went by ship to Cyprus.
translation: Toe hulle deur die Heilige Gees gestuur is, het hulle na Seleucia gegaan; en van daar het hulle per skip na Siprus gegaan.

original: But with you I will make an agreement; and you will come into the ark, you and your sons and your wife and your sons' wives with you.
translation: Maar ek sal 'n ooreenkoms met jou maak; julle sal in die ark kom, jy en jou seuns, jou vrou en jou seuns se vroue saam met jou.

original: Then they send up their cry to the Lord in their sorrow, and he gives them salvation out of all their troubles.
translation: Toe roep hulle na die Here in hulle hartseer, en Hy red hulle uit al hulle probleme.

original: And I will come down and have talk with you there: and I will take some of the spirit which is on you and put it on them, and they will take part of the weight of the people off you, so that you do not have to take it by yourself.
translation: Ek sal afkom en daar met jou praat: ek sal 'n deel van die Gees wat op jou is neem en dit op hulle plaas, sodat hulle jou kan help om die gewig van die mense van jou af te neem, sodat jy dit nie alleen hoef te dra nie.

original: And the Philistines, forcing their way into the towns of the lowlands and the south of Judah, had taken Beth-shemesh and Aijalon and Gederoth and Soco, with their daughter-towns, as well as Timnah and Gimzo and their daughter-towns, and were living there.
translation: En die Filistyne het hul pad gemaak in die dorpe van die laagliggende gebied en die suide van Juda. Hulle het Beth-shemesh, Aijalon, Gederoth en Soco geneem, saam met hulle dorpe, ook Timnah en Gimzo en hulle dorpe, en het daar gewoon.

original: And you, Capernaum, were you not to be lifted up to heaven? you will go down into hell: for if the works of power which were done in you had been done in Sodom, it would have been here to this day.
translation: En jy, Kapernaum, was jy nie bedoel om na die hemel opgeneem te word nie? Jy gaan in die hel af: want as die kragtige werke wat in jou gedoen is, in Sodom gedoen was, sou dit tot vandag toe daar gewees het.

original: And at Salamis they were preaching the word of God in the Synagogues of the Jews: and John was with them, helping them.
translation: En in Salamis het hulle God se boodskap in die Joodse sinagoges gepreek, en Johannes was saam met hulle om hulle te help.

original: And David got up and came to the place where Saul's tents were: and David had a view of the place where Saul was sleeping with Abner, the son of Ner, the captain of his army: and Saul was sleeping inside the ring of carts, and the tents of the people were all round him.
translation: En David het opgestaan en na die plek gegaan waar Saul se tente was. David het gesien waar Saul en Abner, die seun van Ner, die kaptein van sy leër, slaap. Saul het binne die kring van waens geslaap, en die tente van die mense was rondom hom.

original: For see, I am starting to send evil on the town which is named by my name, and are you to be without any punishment? You will not be without punishment: for I will send a sword on all people living on the earth, says the Lord of armies.
translation: Ek begin slegte dinge oor die stad wat my naam dra, en dink julle gaan daarmee wegkom? Julle sal nie ongestraf bly nie: want ek gaan 'n swaard stuur oor al die mense op aarde, sê die Here van die leërskare.

original: And you will take with you into the ark two of every sort of living thing, and keep them safe with you; they will be male and female.
translation: En julle sal twee van elke soort lewende ding saam met julle in die ark neem en hulle veilig hou; hulle sal manlike en vroulike wees.

original: He makes the storm into a calm, so that the waves are at peace.
translation: Hy maak die storms stil, sodat die golwe rustig is.

original: But I say to you that it will be better for the land of Sodom in the day of judging, than for you.
translation: Maar ek sê vir julle, dit gaan beter wees vir die land van Sodom op die dag van oordeel as vir julle.

original: For the Lord made Judah low, because of Ahaz, king of Israel; for he had given up all self-control in Judah, sinning greatly against the Lord.
translation: Die Here het Juda laag gemaak omdat Ahaz, die koning van Israël, sy selfbeheersing in Juda prysgegee het en groot sonde teen die Here gepleeg het.

original: And when they had gone through all the island to Paphos, they came across a certain wonder-worker and false prophet, a Jew whose name was Bar-Jesus;
translation: En toe hulle deur die hele eiland na Paphos gegaan het, het hulle 'n wonderwerker en vals profeet teëgekom, 'n Jood wat Bar-Jesus genoem is;

original: And say to the people, Make yourselves clean before tomorrow and you will have flesh for your food: for in the ears of the Lord you have been weeping and saying, Who will give us flesh for food? for we were well off in Egypt: and so the Lord will give you flesh, and it will be your food;
translation: Sê vir die mense, maak julle skoon voor môre en julle sal vleis hê om te eet; want julle het in God se oë gehuil en gesê, Wie sal vir ons vleis gee om te eet? ons het goed gegaan in Egipte; daarom sal God julle vleis gee, en dit sal julle kos wees.

original: Then they are glad, because the sea is quiet, and he takes them to the harbour of their desire.
translation: Dan is hulle bly, want die see is stil, en hy neem hulle na die hawe waar hulle graag wil wees.

original: Then David said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai, the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, Who will go down with me to the tents of Saul? And Abishai said, I will go down with you.
translation: Toe het David vir Ahimelech die Hittiet en vir Abishai, die seun van Zeruiah, Joab se broer, gevra: "Wie gaan saam met my na Saul se tente?" En Abishai het gesê: "Ek sal saam met jou gaan."

original: Two of every sort of bird and cattle and of every sort of living thing which goes on the earth will you take with you to keep them from destruction.
translation: Neem twee van elke soort voël en bees, en van elke soort lewende ding wat op die aarde rondbeweeg, saam met jou om hulle te red van vernietiging.

original: Then Tiglath-pileser, king of Assyria, came to him, but was a cause of trouble and not of strength to him.
translation: Toe kom Tiglath-pileser, die koning van Assirië, na hom toe, maar hy het net probleme gebring en nie help nie.

original: Who was with the ruler, Sergius Paulus, an able man. This man sent for Barnabas and Saul, desiring to have knowledge of the word of God.
translation: Wie was by die leier, Sergius Paulus, 'n vaardige man? Hierdie man het vir Barnabas en Saul gestuur, omdat hy meer wou weet van God se boodskap.

original: At that time Jesus made answer and said, I give praise to you, O Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have kept these things secret from the wise and the men of learning, and have made them clear to little children.
translation: In daardie tyd het Jesus geantwoord en gesê, ek prys U, O Vader, Here van die hemel en die aarde, omdat U hierdie dinge geheim gehou het van die slim mense en die geleerdes, en dit duidelik gemaak het vir klein kinders.

original: So David and Abishai came down to the army by night: and Saul was sleeping inside the ring of carts with his spear planted in the earth by his head: and Abner and the people were sleeping round him.
translation: Toe het David en Abishai snags na die leër gegaan. Saul het tussen die waens geslaap met sy spies in die grond langs sy kop, en Abner en die mense het om hom geslaap.

original: Not for one day only, or even for five or ten or twenty days;
translation: nie net vir een dag nie, of selfs vir vyf, tien of twintig dae nie;

original: And make a store of every sort of food for yourself and them.
translation: Maak 'n voorraad van al die verskillende kosse vir jouself en hulle.

original: For Ahaz took a part of the wealth from the house of the Lord, and from the house of the king and of the great men, and gave it to the king of Assyria; but it was no help to him.
translation: Want Ahaz het 'n stuk van die rykdom uit God se huis geneem, en ook uit die huis van die koning en die groot mense, en dit aan die koning van Assirië gegee; maar dit het nie vir hom gehelp nie.

original: So, as a prophet, give out these words among them, and say to them, The voice of the Lord will be sounding like a lion from on high; he will send out his voice from his holy place, like the loud voice of a lion, against his flock; he will give a cry, like those who are crushing the grapes, against all the people of the earth.
translation: So, as 'n profeet, sê hierdie woorde vir hulle, en sê vir hulle, die stem van die Here sal klink soos 'n leeu van bo; Hy sal sy stem stuur vanaf sy heilige plek, soos die harde stem van 'n leeu, teen sy kudde; Hy sal 'n skree gee, soos dié wat die druiwe trap, teen al die mense van die aarde.

original: And all these things Noah did; as God said, so he did.
translation: En al hierdie dinge het Noag gedoen; soos God gesê het, so het hy gemaak.

original: Let men give praise to the Lord for his mercy, and for the wonders which he does for the children of men!
translation: Laat mense die Here prys vir sy liefde, en vir die wonders wat Hy doen vir mense se kinders!

original: Then Abishai said to David, God has given up your hater into your hands today; now let me give him one blow through to the earth with his spear, and there will be no need to give him a second.
translation: Toe het Abishai vir David gesê, God het jou vyand vandag in jou hande gegee; laat ek hom met sy spies een keer op die grond slaan, en daar sal nie 'n tweede keer nodig wees nie.

original: And in the time of his trouble, this same King Ahaz did even more evil against the Lord.
translation: En in sy moeilike tyd het hierdie koning Ahaz selfs erger teen God gedoen.

original: Let them give glory to him in the meeting of the people, and praise among the chiefs.
translation: Laat hulle hom eer wanneer mense bymekaar is, en prys hom onder die leiers.

original: But every day for a month, till you are tired of it, turning from it in disgust: because you have gone against the Lord who is with you, and have been weeping before him saying, Why did we come out of Egypt?
translation: Maar elke dag vir 'n maand, totdat jy moeg is daarvan, draai jy daarvandaan weg met afsku, omdat jy teen die Here wat by jou is, gesondig het, en voor Hom gehuil het en gesê het, Hoekom het ons uit Egipte gekom?

original: But Elymas, the wonder-worker (for that is the sense of his name), put himself against them, with the purpose of turning the ruler from the faith.
translation: Maar Elymas, die wonderwerker (want dit is wat sy naam beteken), het teen hulle gaan staan om die leier van die geloof af te draai.

original: And the Lord said to Noah, Take all your family and go into the ark, for you only in this generation have I seen to be upright.
translation: En die Here het vir Noag gesê: Neem jou hele familie en gaan in die ark, want ek het net jou in hierdie geslag gesien as regverdig.

original: Yes, Father, for so it was pleasing in your eyes.
translation: Ja, Vader, dit was werklik goed in u oë.

original: And David said to Abishai Do not put him to death; for who, without sin, may put out his hand against the man on whom the Lord has put the holy oil?
translation: David het vir Abishai gesê: "Moet hom nie doodmaak nie; want wie, sonder sonde, kan sy hand teen die man opsteek op wie die Here die heilige olie gesalf het?"

original: For he made offerings to the gods of Damascus, who were attacking him, and said, Because the gods of the kings of Aram are giving them help, I will make offerings to them so that they may give me help. But they were the cause of his downfall, and of that of all Israel.
translation: Hy het offers gebring aan die gode van Damaskus wat hom aangeval het. Hy het gesê dat, omdat die gode van die konings van Aram hulle help, hy ook offers aan hulle gaan maak sodat hulle hom kan help. Maar hulle was die rede vir sy ondergang, en vir die hele Israel.

original: Then Moses said, The people, among whom I am, are six hundred thousand men on foot; and you have said, I will give them flesh to be their food for a month.
translation: Toe het Moses gesê: Die mense hier, waaronder ek, is ses honderd duisend mans wat te voet is; en jy het gesê: Ek sal hulle vleis gee om vir 'n maand te eet.

original: But Saul, whose other name is Paul, being full of the Holy Spirit, looking hard at him, said,
translation: Maar Saul, wat ook Paulus genoem word, vol van die Heilige Gees, kyk hom reg in die oë aan en sê,

original: He makes rivers into waste places, and springs of water into a dry land;
translation: Hy maak riviere tot vuil plekke, en fonteine van water in 'n droë land.

original: All things have been given to me by my Father; and no one has knowledge of the Son, but the Father; and no one has knowledge of the Father, but the Son, and he to whom the Son will make it clear.
translation: Alles is aan my gegee deur my Vader; niemand ken die Seun nie, behalwe die Vader; en niemand ken die Vader nie, behalwe die Seun, en die een aan wie die Seun dit sal verduidelik.

original: A noise will come, even to the end of the earth; for the Lord has a cause against the nations, he will give his decision against all flesh; as for the evil-doers, he will give them to the sword, says the Lord.
translation: Daar sal 'n geluid wees, selfs tot aan die einde van die aarde; want die Here het 'n probleem met die nasies; hy sal sy besluit teen alle mense neem; wat die kwaadwilliges betref, sal hy hulle aan die swaard oorhandig, sê die Here.

original: Of every clean beast you will take seven males and seven females, and of the beasts which are not clean, two, the male and his female;
translation: Van elke skoon dier moet jy sewe manne en sewe vroue neem, en van die onskone diere twee, die man en sy vrou.

original: Are flocks and herds to be put to death for them? or are all the fish in the sea to be got together so that they may be full?
translation: Moet jy skape en bees doodmaak vir hulle? Of moet al die visse in die see bymekaarmaak sodat hulle vol kan wees?

original: O you, who are full of false tricks and evil ways, a son of the Evil One, hating all righteousness, will you for ever be turning people from the right ways of the Lord?
translation: O jy, wat vol is van leuens en slegte maniere, 'n seun van die boosheid, wat alles wat regverdig is haat, gaan jy vir altyd mense wegtrek van die regte paaie van die Here?

original: And David said, By the living Lord, the Lord will send destruction on him; the natural day of his death will come, or he will go into the fight and come to his end.
translation: En David het gesê, By die lewende Here, die Here sal hom straf; die dag van sy dood sal aanbreek, of hy sal in die geveg gaan en dit sal tot sy einde lei.

original: He makes a fertile country into a salt waste, because of the sins of those who are living there.
translation: Hy maak 'n vrugbare land in 'n soutwoestyn, omdat die mense wat daar woon se sonde dit so maak.

original: And of the birds of the air, seven males and seven females, so that their seed may still be living on the face of the earth.
translation: En van die voëls in die lug, sewe manlike en sewe vroulike, sodat hulle saad steeds op die aarde kan leef.

original: Come to me, all you who are troubled and weighted down with care, and I will give you rest.
translation: Kom na my toe, julle wat moeilikheid en bekommernisse het, en ek sal julle laat rus.

original: And Ahaz got together the vessels of the house of God, cutting up all the vessels of the house of God, and shutting the doors of the Lord's house; and he made altars in every part of Jerusalem.
translation: Ahas het al die dinge van God se huis bymekaargekry, al die dinge van God se huis vernietig, en die deure van God se huis toegemaak; hy het altare in elke plek van Jerusalem gemaak.

original: He makes a waste land into a place of water, and a dry land into water-springs.
translation: Hy maak 'n woesteny in 'n plek vol water, en 'n droë grond in waterbronne.

original: And the Lord said to Moses, Has the Lord's hand become short? Now you will see if my word comes true for you or not.
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê: Het die Here se hand te kort geword? Nou gaan jy sien of my woord vir jou waar is of nie.

original: This is what the Lord of armies has said: See, evil is going out from nation to nation, and a great storm will come up from the inmost parts of the earth.
translation: Dit is wat die Here van die leërskare gesê het: Kyk, slegtheid gaan van nasie na nasie, en 'n groot storm sal uit die diepste plekke van die aarde kom.

original: Never will my hand be stretched out against the man marked with the holy oil; but take the spear which is by his head and the vessel of water, and let us go.
translation: Ek sal my hand nooit teen die man wat met die heilige olie gemerk is, uitsteek nie; maar neem die spies wat daar by sy kop is en die waterhouer, en kom ons gaan.

original: And now, see, the hand of the Lord is on you, and you will be blind and not able to see the sun for a time. And straight away a dark mist came down on him; and he went about looking for a guide.
translation: Kyk, die hand van die Here is op jou, en jy sal blind wees en nie die son kan sien nie vir 'n tyd. En dadelik het 'n donker mis oor hom gekom; en hy het rondgestap en gesoek na iemand om hom te help.

original: And in every town of Judah he made high places where perfumes were burned to other gods, awaking the wrath of the Lord, the God of his fathers.
translation: In elke dorpie van Juda het hy hoë plekke gebou waar hulle geure aan ander gode gebrand het, en dit het God se woede, die God van sy voorvaders, wakker gemaak.

original: And there he gives the poor a resting-place, so that they may make themselves a town;
translation: En daar gee Hy vir die armes 'n plek om te rus, sodat hulle vir hulleself 'n dorp kan maak;

original: Take my yoke on you and become like me, for I am gentle and without pride, and you will have rest for your souls;
translation: Neem my las op jou en wees soos ek, want ek is sagmoedig en nie trots nie, en julle sal rustigheid vir julle siele vind.

original: For after seven days I will send rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights, for the destruction of every living thing which I have made on the face of the earth.
translation: Na sewe dae sal ek reën oor die aarde stuur vir veertig dae en veertig nagte, om elke lewende ding wat ek gemaak het op die aarde te vernietig.

original: And Moses went out and gave the people the words of the Lord: and he took seventy of the responsible men of the people, placing them round the Tent.
translation: En Moses het uitgegaan en vir die mense God se woorde gegee: en hy het sewentig van die verantwoordelike mans gekies en hulle rondom die tent geplaas.

original: Then the ruler, when he saw what was done, had faith, being full of wonder at the teaching of the Lord.
translation: Toe die leier gesien het wat gebeur het, het hy geloof gehad en was hy vol verwondering oor wat die Here sê.

original: Now the rest of his acts and all his ways, first and last, are recorded in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.
translation: Nou is die res van wat hy gedoen het en al sy maniere, van die begin tot die einde, in die boek van die konings van Juda en Israel opgeteken.

original: So David took the spear and the vessel of water from Saul's head; and they got away without any man seeing them, or being conscious of their coming, or awaking; for they were all sleeping because a deep sleep from the Lord had come on them.
translation: So David het die spies en die waterbeker van Saul se kop geneem; en hulle het weggekom sonder dat iemand hulle gesien het, of geweer het dat hulle daar was, of wakker geword het; want hulle het almal geslaap omdat 'n diep slaap van die Here op hulle gekom het.

original: And at that day, the bodies of those whom the Lord has put to death will be seen from one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth: there will be no weeping for them, their bodies will not be taken up or put to rest in the earth; they will be like waste on the face of the land.
translation: En op daardie dag sal die liggame van diegene wat die Here doodgemaak het, van een kant van die aarde tot die ander kant gesien word: daar sal geen trane oor hulle wees nie, hulle liggame sal nie opgeneem of in die grond begrawe word nie; hulle sal soos rommel op die aarde wees.

original: And put seed in the fields and make vine-gardens, to give them fruit.
translation: En plant saadjies in die velde en maak wingerde om vrugte te gee.

original: And Noah did everything which the Lord said he was to do.
translation: En Noag het alles gedoen wat die Here vir hom gesê het om te doen.

original: For my yoke is good, and the weight I take up is not hard.
translation: Want my juk is goed, en die las wat ek dra is nie moeilik nie.

original: Then David went over to the other side, and took his place on the top of a mountain some distance away, with a great space between them;
translation: Toe het David na die ander kant gegaan en sy plek bo op 'n berg ingeneem, 'n bietjie verder weg, met 'n groot ruimte tussen hulle.

original: He gives them his blessing so that they are increased greatly, and their cattle do not become less.
translation: Hy gee vir hulle sy seën sodat hulle baie meer kry, en hulle diere raak nie minder nie.

original: Then Paul and those who were with him went by ship from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia: and there John went away from them and came back to Jerusalem.
translation: Paulus en die mense saam met hom het met 'n skip van Paphos gegaan en in Perga in Pamfilië aangekom; en daar het Johannes hulle verlaat en teruggegaan na Jerusalem.

original: Then the Lord came down in the cloud and had talk with him, and put on the seventy men some of the spirit which was on him: now when the spirit came to rest on them, they were like prophets, but only at that time.
translation: Toe kom die Here af in die wolk en het met hom gepraat. Hy het die sewentig manne 'n deel van die gees gegee wat op hom was. Toe die gees op hulle rus, was hulle soos profete, maar dit was net vir daardie tyd.

original: And Ahaz went to rest with his fathers, and they put his body into the earth in Jerusalem; but they did not put him in the resting-place of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son became king in his place.
translation: Ahaz het by sy vaders gaan rus, en hulle het sy liggaam in die grond in Jerusalem neergelê; maar hulle het hom nie in die graf van die konings van Israel gesit nie. Sy seun Hiskia het in sy plek koning geword.

original: And Noah was six hundred years old when the waters came flowing over all the earth.
translation: En Noag was seshonderd jaar oud toe die waters oor die hele aarde begin stroom het.

original: At that time Jesus went through the fields on the Sabbath day; and his disciples, being in need of food, were taking the heads of grain.
translation: Op daardie tyd het Jesus deur die veld gegaan op die Sabbat; en sy dissipels, wat honger was, het die koringkoppe gepluk.

original: And when they are made low, and crushed by trouble and sorrow,
translation: En wanneer hulle onderdruk word en gesukkel en hartseer ervaar,

original: Give cries of grief, you keepers of sheep; give cries for help, rolling yourselves in the dust, you chiefs of the flock: for the days of your destruction have fully come, and I will send you in all directions, and your fall will be like that of the males of the flock.
translation: Huil van hartseer, julle skaapwagters; roep om hulp terwyl julle in die stof rol, julle leiers van die trop: want die dae van julle verwoesting het aangebreek, en ek sal julle in alle rigtings stuur, en julle val sal soos dié van die ramme van die trop wees.

original: But they, going through from Perga, came to Antioch in Pisidia; and they went into the Synagogue on the Sabbath and were seated.
translation: Maar hulle het van Perga af gegaan en in Antiochië in Pisidië aangekom. Hulle het op die Sabbat in die Sinagoge ingegaan en gesit.

original: And Noah, with his sons and his wife and his sons' wives, went into the ark because of the flowing of the waters.
translation: Noag, saam met sy seuns, sy vrou en sy seuns se vroue, het in die ark gegaan omdat die waters vloei.

original: And crying out to the people and to Abner, the son of Ner, David said, Have you no answer to give, Abner? Then Abner said, Who is that crying out to the king?
translation: En terwyl hy na die mense en Abner, die seun van Ner, roep, sê David, "Het julle nie 'n antwoord om te gee nie, Abner?" Toe sê Abner, "Wie is dit wat na die koning roep?"

original: Hezekiah became king when he was twenty-five years old; and he was king in Jerusalem for twenty-nine years; and his mother's name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.
translation: Hiskia het koning geword toe hy vyf-en-twintig jaar oud was. Hy was koning in Jerusalem vir nege-en-twintig jaar. Sy ma se naam was Abijah, die dogter van Sagaria.

original: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, See, your disciples do that which it is not right to do on the Sabbath.
translation: Maar die Fariseërs het, toe hulle dit gesien het, vir hom gesê: Kyk, jou dissipels doen iets wat nie reg is om op die Sabbat te doen nie.

original: There will be no way of flight for the keepers of sheep, no road for the chiefs of the flock to get away safely.
translation: Daar sal geen manier wees vir die skaapwagters om weg te kom nie, geen pad vir die leiers van die kudde om veilig te ontsnap nie.

original: But two men were still in the tent-circle one of them named Eldad and the other Medad: and the spirit came to rest on them; they were among those who had been sent for, but they had not gone out to the Tent: and the prophet's power came on them in the tent-circle.
translation: Maar daar was nog steeds twee mans in die tent, een was Eldad en die ander Medad; en die Gees het op hulle neergedaal; hulle was een van diegene wat geroep is, maar hulle het nie na die tent gegaan nie; en die profeet se krag het op hulle in die tent gekom.

original: Of clean beasts, and of beasts which are not clean, and of birds, and of everything which goes on the earth,
translation: Van skoon diere, van onrein diere, van voëls, en van alles wat op die aarde rondbeweeg.

original: He puts an end to the pride of kings, and sends them wandering in the waste lands where there is no way.
translation: Hy stop die trots van konings en laat hulle rondloop in die woeste plekke waar daar geen paaie is nie.

original: But he said to them, Have you no knowledge of what David did when he had need of food, and those who were with him?
translation: Maar hy het vir hulle gesê: Weet julle nie wat David gedoen het toe hy honger was, saam met die mense wat by hom was nie?

original: And a young man went running to Moses and said, Eldad and Medad are acting as prophets in the tent-circle.
translation: En 'n jong man het na Moses toe gehardloop en gesê: Eldad en Medad is profete in die tent.

original: In twos, male and female, they went into the ark with Noah, as God had said.
translation: In paar, man en vrou, het hulle in die ark saam met Noag gegaan, soos God gesê het.

original: But he puts the poor man on high from his troubles, and gives him families like a flock.
translation: Maar hy help die arme man op om van sy probleme af, en gee vir hom families soos 'n skape.

original: He did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father David had done.
translation: Hy het gedoen wat reg was vir die Here, net soos sy pa Dawid.

original: And after the seven days, the waters came over all the earth.
translation: En na sewe dae het die waters oor die hele aarde gekom.

original: And David said to Abner, Are you not a man of war? is there any other like you in Israel? why then have you not kept watch over your lord the king? for one of the people came in to put the king your lord to death.
translation: En David het vir Abner gesê: Is jy nie 'n man van oorlog nie? Is daar nie iemand anders soos jy in Israel nie? Hoekom het jy dan nie oor jou heer, die koning, opgekyk nie? Want een van die mense het ingekom om jou heer, die koning, dood te maak.

original: Then Joshua, the son of Nun, who had been Moses' servant from the time when he was a child, said, My lord Moses, let them be stopped.
translation: Toe het Josua, die seun van Nun, wat Moses se dienaar was toe hy 'n kind was, gesê: My heer Moses, laat hulle stop.

original: A sound of the cry of the keepers of sheep, and the bitter crying of the chiefs of the flock! for the Lord has made waste their green fields.
translation: Die geskree van die skape se oppassers en die hartseergeluid van die leiers van die kudde! Want die Here het hulle groen weivelde verwoes.

original: And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the Synagogue sent to them, saying, Brothers, if you have a word of comfort for the people, say on.
translation: En na die lees van die wet en die profete, het die leiers van die Sinagoge na hulle gestuur en gesê, Broers, as julle 'n woord van troos vir die mense het, sê dit gerus.

original: The upright see it and are glad: the mouth of the sinner is stopped.
translation: Die regverdiges sien dit en is bly: die mond van die sondaar is toe.

original: In the first year of his rule, in the first month, opening the doors of the Lord's house, he made them strong.
translation: In die eerste jaar van sy heerskappy, in die eerste maand, het hy die deure van God se huis geopen en dit sterker gemaak.

original: How he went into the house of God and took for food the holy bread which it was not right for him or for those who were with him to take, but only for the priests?
translation: Hoe hy in God se huis ingegaan het en heilige brood geneem het vir ete, wat nie reg was vir hom of vir die mense saam met hom om te neem nie, maar net vir die priesters.

original: And Moses said to him, Are you moved by envy on my account? If only all the Lord's people were prophets, and the Lord might put his spirit on them!
translation: Toe sê Moses vir hom: “Is jy jaloers op my? As net al die Here se mense profete kon wees, en die Here sy Gees op hulle kon gee!”

original: And he sent for the priests and the Levites, and got them together in the wide place on the east side,
translation: Hy het die priesters en die Leviete laat kom en hulle bymekaar gemaak in die groot plek aan die ooskant.

original: And there is no sound in the fields of peace, because of the burning wrath of the Lord.
translation: En daar is niks wat klink in die vredevolle velde nie, omdat God se brandende woede daar is.

original: And Paul, getting up and making a sign with his hand, said, Men of Israel, and you who have the fear of God, give ear.
translation: En Paulus het opgestaan en met sy hand 'n teken gemaak en gesê, Mannen van Israel, en julle wat respek vir God het, luister mooi.

original: Let the wise give thought to these things, and see the mercies of the Lord.
translation: Laat die slim mense oor hierdie dinge dink en die genade van die Here sien.

original: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, all the fountains of the great deep came bursting through, and the windows of heaven were open;
translation: In die seshonderdste jaar van Noag se lewe, in die tweede maand, op die sewentiende dag van die maand, het al die fonteine van die groot diep gebars en die vensters van die hemel was oop.

original: What you have done is not good. By the living Lord, death is the right fate for you, because you have not kept watch over your lord, the man on whom the Lord has put the holy oil. Now see, where is the king's spear, and the vessel of water which was by his head?
translation: Wat jy gedoen het, is nie goed nie. Deur die lewende Here, is die dood die regte straf vir jou, omdat jy nie oor jou baas opgelet het nie, die man op wie God die heilige olie gesit het. Kyk, waar is die koning se spies en die houer water wat by sy kop was?

original: Then Moses, with the responsible men of Israel, went back to the tent-circle.
translation: Toe het Moses, saam met die verantwoordelike mense van Israel, teruggegaan na die tent.

original: O God, my heart is fixed; I will make songs and melody, even with my glory.
translation: O God, my hart is reg; ek gaan liedjies en melodieë maak, selfs met my eer.

original: Or is it not said in the law, how the Sabbath is broken by the priests in the Temple and they do no wrong?
translation: Of sê die wet nie hoe die priesters in die Tempel die Sabbat breek en hulle doen niks verkeerd nie?

original: The lion has come out of his secret place, for the land has become a waste because of the cruel sword, and because of the heat of his wrath.
translation: Die leeu het uit sy skuilplek gekom, want die land het 'n woesteny geword weens die wrede swaard en die hitte van sy woede.

original: And said to them, Give ear to me, O Levites: now make yourselves holy, and make holy the house of the Lord, the God of your fathers, and take away everything unclean from the holy place.
translation: En het vir hulle gesê, Luister na my, O Leviete: maak julle nou heilig, en maak die huis van die Here, die God van julle vaders, heilig, en verwyder alles wat onrein is uit die heilige plek.

original: The God of this people Israel made selection of our fathers, lifting the people up from their low condition when they were living in the land of Egypt, and with a strong arm took them out of it.
translation: Die God van hierdie volk Israel het ons voorvaders gekies en hulle uit hul swak toestand gehelp toe hulle in Egipte gewoon het, en met 'n sterk hand het Hy hulle daar weggebring.

original: And rain came down on the earth for forty days and forty nights.
translation: En reën het vir veertig dae en veertig nagte op die aarde geval.

original: And Saul, conscious that the voice was David's, said, Is that your voice, David, my son? And David said, It is my voice, O my lord king.
translation: En Saul, wat geweet het dit was David se stem, het gesê: Is dit jou stem, David, my seun? En David het gesê: Dit is my stem, O my koning.

original: But I say to you that a greater thing than the Temple is here.
translation: Maar ek sê vir julle dat daar iets groter as die Tempel hier is.

original: Give out your sounds, O corded instruments: the dawn will be awaking with my song.
translation: Laat jou klanke hoor, O snaarinstrumente: die oggend sal wakker word met my lied.

original: Then the Lord sent a wind, driving little birds from the sea, so that they came down on the tents, and all round the tent-circle, about a day's journey on this side and on that, in masses about two cubits high over the face of the earth.
translation: Toe het God 'n wind gestuur wat klein voëls van die see af gebring het, sodat hulle op die tente gaan sit het, en reg rondom die tente, oor 'n afstand van 'n dag se reis aan beide kante, in groot klompjies van ongeveer twee el hoog oor die grond.

original: And for about forty years he put up with their ways in the waste land.
translation: En vir ongeveer veertig jaar het hy hulle maniere in die woestyn geduld.

original: When Jehoiakim, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, first became king, this word came from the Lord, saying,
translation: Toe Jehoiakim, die seun van Josia, die koning van Juda, vir die eerste keer koning geword het, het God hierdie woord gestuur en gesê,

original: And he said, Why does my lord go armed against his servant? what have I done? or what evil is there in me?
translation: Hy het gesê: "Waarom gaan my heer gewapen teen sy dienaar? Wat het ek gedoen? Of wat is verkeerd met my?"

original: But if these words had been in your minds, My desire is for mercy and not for offerings, you would not have been judging those who have done no wrong.
translation: Maar as hierdie woorde in julle gedagtes was, ek wil genade en nie offers nie, sou julle nie diegene wat niks verkeerd gedoen het, oordeel nie.

original: I will give you praise, O Lord, among the peoples; I will make melody to you among the nations.
translation: Ek sal jou prys, Here, tussen die volke; ek sal vir jou sing tussen die nasies.

original: On the same day Noah, with Shem, Ham, and Japheth, his sons, and his wife and his sons' wives, went into the ark;
translation: Op dieselfde dag het Noag, saam met sy seuns Sem, Ham en Jafet, sy vrou en sy seuns se vroue, in die ark gegaan;

original: And having put to destruction seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them the land for their heritage for about four hundred and fifty years.
translation: Hy het sewe nasies in Kanaan vernietig en vir hulle die land gegee om vir ongeveer vierhonderd en vyftig jaar daar te woon.

original: For the Son of man is lord of the Sabbath.
translation: Want die Seun van die mens is die baas van die Sabbat.

original: And all that day and all night and the day after, the people were taking up the birds; the smallest amount which anyone got was ten homers: and they put them out all round the tents.
translation: En die hele dag en die hele nag en die volgende dag was die mense besig om die voëls op te tel; die minste wat iemand gekry het, was tien homers, en hulle het dit rondom die tente neergelê.

original: For our fathers have done evil, sinning in the eyes of the Lord our God, and have given him up, turning away their faces from the house of the Lord, and turning their backs on him.
translation: Want ons pa's het slegte dinge gedoen, hulle het gesondig in die oë van die Here ons God, en het Hom verlaat. Hulle het hulle gesigte van die Here se huis afgekeer en hulle het vir Hom die rug toegekeer.

original: Let my lord the king give ear now to the words of his servant. If it is the Lord who is moving you against me, let him take an offering: but if it is the children of men, may they be cursed before the Lord, for driving me out today and keeping me from my place in the heritage of the Lord, saying, Go, be the servant of other gods.
translation: Laat my heer die koning nou luister na die woorde van sy dienaar. As dit die Here is wat jou teen my laat optree, laat Hom 'n offer aanneem; maar as dit mense is wat dit doen, mag hulle voor die Here vervloek word, omdat hulle my vandag verdryf en my van my plek in God se nalatenskap hou deur te sê, "Gaan, dien ander gode."

original: And he went from there into their Synagogue:
translation: En hy het van daar na hulle sinagoge gegaan:

original: And after these things he gave them judges, till the time of Samuel the prophet.
translation: En na hierdie dinge het Hy vir hulle regters gegee, tot Samuel, die profeet se tyd.

original: This is what the Lord has said: Take your place in the open square of the Lord's house and say to all the towns of Judah, who come into the Lord's house for worship, everything I give you orders to say to them: keep back not a word;
translation: Dit is wat die Here gesê het: Neem jou plek in die oop plein van God se huis en sê vir al die dorpe van Juda, wat na God se huis kom om te aanbid, alles wat ek jou sê om vir hulle te sê: hou niks terug nie.

original: For your mercy is higher than the heavens: and your unchanging faith than the clouds.
translation: Jou genade is hoër as die hemel, en jou troue geloof is hoër as die wolke.

original: And with them, every sort of beast and cattle, and every sort of thing which goes on the earth, and every sort of bird.
translation: En saam met hulle, elke soort dier en bees, en elke soort ding wat op die aarde loop, en elke soort voël.

original: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before it was tasted, the wrath of the Lord was moved against the people and he sent a great outburst of disease on them.
translation: Maar terwyl die vleis nog tussen hulle tande was, voordat hulle dit geproe het, het God se woede teen die mense opgekom en Hy het 'n groot golf van siektes oor hulle gestuur.

original: And there was a man with a dead hand. And they put a question to him, saying, Is it right to make a man well on the Sabbath day? so that they might have something against him.
translation: Daar was 'n man met 'n dooie hand. Hulle het vir hom gevra: Is dit reg om iemand op die Sabbat gesond te maak? So hulle kan iets teen hom hê.

original: The doors of his house have been shut and the lights put out; no perfumes have been burned or offerings made to the God of Israel in his holy place.
translation: Die deure van sy huis is toe en die ligte is af. Daar is nie lekkergeure gebrand of offers gemaak aan God van Israel in sy heilige plek nie.

original: Then at their request for a king, God gave them Saul, the son of Kish, a man of the family of Benjamin, who was their king for forty years.
translation: Toe hulle vir 'n koning gevra het, het God vir hulle Saul gegee, die seun van Kis, 'n man van die Benjamin-stam, wat vir veertig jaar hulle koning was.

original: Be lifted up, O God, higher than the heavens; let your glory be over all the earth.
translation: U moet omhoog gaan, O God, hoër as die hemel; laat u glorie oor die hele aarde wees.

original: It may be that they will give ear, and that every man will be turned from his evil way, so that my purpose of sending evil on them because of the evil of their doings may be changed.
translation: Hulle kan dalk luister, en elke persoon kan van sy slegte pad af draai, sodat my plan om kwaad oor hulle te stuur, omdat hulle slegte dade dalk verander kan word.

original: They went with Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh in which is the breath of life.
translation: Hulle het saam met Noag in die ark gegaan, twee en twee van al die lewende dinge wat asem het.

original: So that place was named Kibroth-hattaavah; because there they put in the earth the bodies of the people who had given way to their desires.
translation: Die plek is Kibroth-hattaavah genoem, omdat hulle daar die liggame van die mense wat hulle begeertes gevolg het, in die grond begrawe het.

original: Then do not let my blood be drained out on the earth away from the face of the Lord: for the king of Israel has come out to take my life, like one going after birds in the mountains.
translation: Laat nie my bloed op die aarde uitgestort word nie, weg van God se gesig nie; want die koning van Israel het gekom om my lewe te neem, soos iemand wat voëls in die berge jaag.

original: And he said to them, Which of you, having a sheep, if it gets into a hole on the Sabbath day, will not put out a helping hand and get it back?
translation: Hy het vir hulle gesê: Watter een van julle, as julle 'n skaap het en dit op die Sabbat in 'n gat val, sal nie 'n handjie help om dit terug te kry nie?

original: And you are to say to them, This is what the Lord has said: If you do not give ear to me and go in the way of my law which I have put before you,
translation: En jy moet vir hulle sê: Dit is wat die Here gesê het: As julle nie na my luister nie en nie die pad van my wet volg wat ek voor julle neergelê het nie.

original: And so the wrath of the Lord has come on Judah and Jerusalem, and he has given them up to be a cause of fear and wonder and shame, as your eyes have seen.
translation: En so het God se woede oor Juda en Jerusalem gekom, en Hy het hulle oorgegee om 'n rede van vrees, verwondering en skande te wees, soos julle dit gesien het.

original: Male and female of all flesh went in, as God had said, and the ark was shut by the Lord.
translation: Manne en vroue van alle vlees het ingegaan, soos God gesê het, en die ark is deur die Here gesluit.

original: Of how much more value is a man than a sheep! For this reason it is right to do good on the Sabbath day.
translation: Hoeveel meer waarde het 'n mens as 'n skaap! Daarom is dit reg om goed te doen op die Sabbatdag.

original: And having put him on one side, he made David their king, to whom he gave witness, saying, I have taken David, the son of Jesse, a man dear to my heart, who will do all my pleasure.
translation: En nadat hy hom eenkant gesit het, het hy David hulle koning gemaak, van wie hy getuig het en gesê: Ek het David, die seun van Isai, gekies, 'n man wat my na aan die hart lê, wat alles sal doen wat ek wil.

original: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people went on to Hazeroth; and there they put up their tents.
translation: Van Kibroth-hattaavah het die mense verder gegaan na Hazeroth; en daar het hulle hulle tente opgeslaan.

original: Then Saul said, I have done wrong: come back to me, David my son: I will do you no more wrong, because my life was dear to you today truly, I have been foolish and my error is very great.
translation: Toe het Saul gesê, ek het verkeerd gedoen: kom terug na my, David my seun: ek sal jou nie weer seergemaak nie, omdat my lewe vandag vir jou belangrik was. Regtig, ek was dom en my fout is groot.

original: Let your right hand be stretched out for salvation, and give me an answer, so that your loved ones may be safe from danger.
translation: Laat jou regterhand gestrek wees vir hulp, en gee my 'n antwoord, sodat jou geliefdes veilig kan wees van gevaar.

original: For see, our fathers have been put to death with the sword, and our sons and daughters and wives have been taken away prisoners because of this.
translation: Want kyk, ons vaders is met die swaard doodgemaak, en ons seuns, dogters en vroue is as gevangenes weggeneem oor dit.

original: And give ear to the words of my servants the prophets whom I send to you, getting up early and sending them, though you gave no attention;
translation: Luister na die woorde van my dienaars, die profete, wat ek vir julle stuur. Ek stuur hulle vroeg in die oggend, maar julle gee nie aandag nie.

original: Then David said, Here is the king's spear! let one of the young men come over and get it.
translation: Toe het David gesê: “Hier is die koning se spies! Laat een van die jong manne kom en dit gaan haal.”

original: And for forty days the waters were over all the earth; and the waters were increased so that the ark was lifted up high over the earth.
translation: En vir veertig dae was die water oor die hele aarde; en die water het gestyg sodat die ark hoog bo die aarde opgevaar het.

original: Then said he to the man, Put out your hand. And he put it out, and it was made as well as the other.
translation: Toe sê hy vir die man, "Steek jou hand uit." En hy het dit uitgehou, en dit was so gesond soos die ander.

original: From this man's seed has God given to Israel a Saviour, even Jesus, as he gave his word;
translation: Uit hierdie man se afstammelinge het God vir Israel 'n Verlosser gestuur, naamlik Jesus, soos Hy gesê het.

original: This is the word of the holy God: I will be glad; I will make Shechem a heritage, measuring out the valley of Succoth.
translation: Dit is God se boodskap: Ek sal bly wees; Ek sal Shechem 'n erfdom maak en die vallei van Succoth opmeet.

original: Now it is my purpose to make an agreement with the Lord, the God of Israel, so that the heat of his wrath may be turned away from us.
translation: Nou wil ek 'n ooreenkoms met die Here, die God van Israel, maak, sodat sy woede van ons af gedraai kan word.

original: Now Miriam and Aaron said evil against Moses, because of the Cushite woman to whom he was married, for he had taken a Cushite woman as his wife.
translation: Nou het Miriam en Aäron sleg van Moses gepraat, omdat hy met 'n Kushiet vrou getroud was.

original: And the waters overcame everything and were increased greatly on the earth, and the ark was resting on the face of the waters.
translation: En die waters het alles oorwin en het baie op die aarde toegeneem, en die ark het op die water se oppervlak gerus.

original: For whose coming John made ready the way by preaching to all the people of Israel the baptism which goes with a change of heart.
translation: Johannes het die pad voorberei vir die een wat kom deur vir al die mense van Israel te preek oor die doop wat 'n verandering van hart meebring.

original: Then I will make this house like Shiloh, and will make this town a curse to all the nations of the earth.
translation: Ek sal hierdie huis soos Silo maak, en hierdie dorp 'n vervloeking vir al die nasies op die aarde maak.

original: But the Pharisees went out and made designs against him, how they might put him to death.
translation: Maar die Fariseërs het buite gegaan en planne gemaak om hom dood te maak.

original: And the Lord will give to every man the reward of his righteousness and his faith: because the Lord gave you into my hands today, and I would not put out my hand against the man who has been marked with the holy oil.
translation: En die Here sal aan elke man sy beloning gee vir wat hy regverdig en wat hy glo: want die Here het jou vandag in my hande gegee, en ek sou nie my hand teen die man uitsteek wat met die heilige olie gemerk is nie.

original: And they said, Have the words of the Lord been given to Moses only? have they not come to us? And the Lord took note of it.
translation: En hulle het gesê, is God se woorde net aan Moses gegee? Het dit nie ook vir ons gekom nie? En die Here het daarop gelet.

original: And the waters overcame everything on the earth; and all the mountains under heaven were covered.
translation: en die waters het alles op die aarde oorwin; en al die berge onder die hemel was bedek.

original: My sons, take care now: for you have been marked out by the Lord to come before him and to be his servants, burning offerings to him.
translation: My seuns, kyk mooi: julle is deur die Here gekies om na Hom toe te kom en om sy dienaars te wees, offerings aan Hom te bring.

original: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is the strength of my head; Judah is my law-giver;
translation: Gilead is myne; Manasseh is myne; Ephraim is die krag van my gedagte; Judah is my wetgewer;

original: And in the hearing of the priests and the prophets and all the people, Jeremiah said these words in the house of the Lord.
translation: En in die teenwoordigheid van die priesters, die profete en al die mense, het Jeremia hierdie woorde in God se huis gesê.

original: And Jesus, having knowledge of this, went away from there, and a great number went after him; and he made them all well,
translation: En Jesus, wat hiervan geweet het, het weggegaan, en 'n groot aantal mense het Hom gevolg; en Hy het almal gesond gemaak.

original: Now the man Moses was more gentle than any other man on earth.
translation: Mozes was 'n saggeaarde man, meer as enige ander man op aarde.

original: And so, as your life was dear to me today, may my life be dear to the Lord, and may he make me free from all my troubles.
translation: En so, net soos jou lewe vir my vandag belangrik was, mag my lewe ook vir God belangrik wees, en mag Hy my help om vry te wees van al my probleme.

original: The waters went fifteen cubits higher, till all the mountains were covered.
translation: Die waters het vyftien elbooghoogte hoër gestyg, totdat al die berge bedek was.

original: And when John was completing his work, he said, What do I seem to you to be? I am not he; but one is coming after me, whose shoes I am not good enough to undo.
translation: En toe Johannes sy werk klaar maak, het hy gesê: Hoe lyk ek vir julle? Ek is nie die een nie; maar daar kom iemand na my, wie se skoene ek nie goed genoeg is om los te maak nie.

original: Now, when Jeremiah had come to the end of saying everything the Lord had given him orders to say to all the people, the priests and the prophets and all the people took him by force, saying, Death will certainly be your fate.
translation: Toe Jeremiah klaar was met alles wat die Here hom gesê het om vir die mense te sê, het die priesters en profete, saam met al die mense, hom met geweld gegryp en gesê: “Jy gaan beslis dood.”

original: And suddenly the Lord said to Moses and Aaron and Miriam, Come out, you three, to the Tent of meeting. And the three of them went out.
translation: En skielik het die Here vir Moses, Aäron en Mirjam gesê, Kom uit, julle drie, na die Tent van ontmoeting. En hulle drie het gegaan.

original: Moab is my washpot; on Edom is the resting-place of my shoe; over Philistia will I send out a glad cry.
translation: Moab is my vuilgoedbak; op Edom lê my skoen; oor Filistea sal ek 'n blye kreet laat hoor.

original: Ordering them not to give people word of him:
translation: Hy het vir hulle gesê om nie vir mense van Hom te vertel nie.

original: Then Saul said to David, May a blessing be on you, David, my son; you will do great things and without doubt you will overcome. Then David went on his way, and Saul went back to his place.
translation: Toe het Saul vir David gesê: Mag daar 'n seën op jou wees, David, my seun; jy gaan groot goed doen en jy sal beslis oorwin. Toe het David sy pad voortgegaan, en Saul het teruggegaan na sy plek.

original: My brothers, children of the family of Abraham, and those among you who have the fear of God, to us the word of this salvation is sent.
translation: My broers, kinders van Abraham se gesin, en julle wat vir God bang is, die boodskap van hierdie verlossing is aan ons gestuur.

original: Then the Levites took their places; Mahath, the son of Amasai, and Joel, the son of Azariah, among the Kohathites; and of the sons of Merari, Kish, the son of Abdi, and Azariah, the son of Jehallelel; and of the Gershonites, Joah, the son of Zimmah, and Eden, the son of Joah;
translation: Toe het die Leviete hulle plekke ingeneem; Mahath, die seun van Amasai, en Joel, die seun van Azariah, tussen die Kohathiete; en van die seuns van Merari, Kish, die seun van Abdi, en Azariah, die seun van Jehallelel; en van die Gershoniete, Joah, die seun van Zimmah, en Eden, die seun van Joah;

original: Who will take me into the strong town? who will be my guide into Edom?
translation: Wie sal my na die sterk stad neem? Wie sal my gids wees na Edom?

original: And the Lord came down in a pillar of cloud, taking his place at the door of the Tent, and made Aaron and Miriam come before him.
translation: En God het neergedaal in 'n wolk en by die deur van die tent gaan staan, en Hy het Aaron en Miriam geroep om na Hom toe te kom.

original: Why have you said in the name of the Lord, This house will be like Shiloh, and this land a waste with no one living in it? And all the people had come together to Jeremiah in the house of the Lord.
translation: Hoekom het julle in die naam van die Here gesê dat hierdie huis soos Shiloh sal wees, en hierdie land 'n woesteny met niemand wat daar lewendig is nie? Al die mense het bymekaar gekom by Jeremia in die huis van die Here.

original: So that what was said by Isaiah the prophet might come true,
translation: sodat wat Jesaja die profeet gesê het, waar kan word,

original: And destruction came on every living thing moving on the earth, birds and cattle and beasts and everything which went on the earth, and every man.
translation: En verwoesting het oor alles wat beweeg op die aarde gekom, soos voëls, beeste, diere, en elke mens.

original: Have you not sent us away from you, O God? and you go not out with our armies.
translation: Het U ons nie weggestuur van U nie, O God? En U gaan nie saam met ons leërs nie.

original: For the men of Jerusalem and their rulers, having no knowledge of him, or of the sayings of the prophets which come to their ears every Sabbath day, gave effect to them by judging him.
translation: Die mense van Jerusalem en hulle leiers het nie geweet van Hom nie, of van die woorde van die profete wat elke Saterdag by hulle aankom nie, en hulle het dit toegepas deur Hom te oordeel.

original: And of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeuel; and of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;
translation: En van die seuns van Elizaphan was Shimri en Jeuel; en van die seuns van Asaph was Zakaría en Mattanja;

original: And the rulers of Judah, hearing of these things, came up from the king's house to the house of the Lord, and took their seats by the new door of the Lord's house.
translation: Die leiers van Juda het hiervan gehoor en het van die koning se huis na God se huis gegaan, en hulle het gaan sit by die nuwe deur van God se huis.

original: And he said, Now give ear to my words: if there is a prophet among you I will give him knowledge of myself in a vision and will let my words come to him in a dream.
translation: Hy het gesê: "Luister na my woorde: as daar 'n profeet onder julle is, sal ek hom van myself vertel in 'n visie en my woorde aan hom gee in 'n droom."

original: See my servant, the man of my selection, my loved one in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him, and he will make my decision clear to the Gentiles.
translation: Kyk na my dienaar, die man wat ek gekies het, my geliefde in wie ek bly is: Ek sal my Gees op hom plaas, en hy sal my boodskap vir die mense van ander nasies helder maak.

original: And of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.
translation: En van Heman se seuns was Jehuel en Shimei; en van Jeduthun se seuns was Shemaiah en Uzziel.

original: Everything on the dry land, in which was the breath of life, came to its end.
translation: Alles op die droë grond, waar die asem van die lewe was, het tot 'n einde gekom.

original: Give us help in our trouble; for there is no help in man.
translation: Gee vir ons hulp wanneer dit moeilik is; want daar is nie hulp by mense nie.

original: My servant Moses is not so; he is true to me in all my house:
translation: My dienaar Moses is nie soos hulle nie; hy is altyd getrou aan my in al my huis.

original: Then the priests and the prophets said to the rulers and to all the people, The right fate for this man is death; for he has said words against this town in your hearing.
translation: Toe het die priesters en profete vir die leiers en al die mense gesê: "Die regte straf vir hierdie man is die dood, want hy het dinge oor hierdie stad in julle teenwoordigheid gesê."

original: And David said to himself, Some day death will come to me by the hand of Saul: the only thing for me to do is to get away into the land of the Philistines; then Saul will give up hope of taking me in any part of the land of Israel: and so I may be able to get away from him.
translation: En David het vir homself gesê: Eendag sal die dood my kom deur Saul se hand. Die enigste ding wat ek kan doen, is om weg te gaan na die Filistyne. Dan sal Saul moed verloor om my in enige deel van Israel te vang, en so kan ek dalk van hom wegkom.

original: And though no cause of death was seen in him, they made a request to Pilate that he might be put to death.
translation: Al was daar geen rede vir sy dood nie, het hulle vir Pilatus gevra dat hy doodgemaak kan word.

original: His coming will not be with fighting or loud cries; and his voice will not be lifted up in the streets.
translation: Sy koms sal nie met gevegte of harde skreeu wees nie; en sy stem sal nie in die strate hoorbaar wees nie.

original: Every living thing on the face of all the earth, man and cattle and things moving on the face of the earth, and birds of the air, came to destruction: only Noah and those who were with him in the ark, were kept from death.
translation: Alles wat lewe op die aarde, mense en diere, en al die bewegende goed, en die voëls in die lug, is vernietig: net Noag en die mense wat saam met hom in die ark was, is van die dood beskerm.

original: With God we will do great things; for by him will our haters be crushed underfoot.
translation: Saam met God kan ons groot dinge doen; want deur Hom sal ons vyand onder ons voete verslaan word.

original: Then Jeremiah said to all the rulers and to all the people, The Lord has sent me as his prophet to say against this house and against this town all the words which have come to your ears.
translation: Toe het Jeremia vir al die leiers en vir die hele volk gesê: "Die Here het my gestuur om vir julle te sê wat ek hoor oor hierdie huis en oor hierdie stad."

original: So David and the six hundred men who were with him went over to Achish, the son of Maoch, king of Gath.
translation: So David en die seshonderd mense wat by hom was, het na Achish, die seun van Maoch, die koning van Gath, gegaan.

original: With him I will have talk mouth to mouth, openly and not in dark sayings; and with his eyes he will see the form of the Lord: why then had you no fear of saying evil against my servant Moses?
translation: Ek sal met hom praat soos vriende, openlik en nie in duistere woorde nie; en met sy oë sal hy die vorm van die Here sien: hoekom het julle nie bang gevoel om sleg van my dienaar Moses te praat nie?

original: And the waters were over the earth a hundred and fifty days.
translation: En die water was oor die aarde vir honderd en vyftig dae.

original: And they got their brothers together and made themselves holy, and went in, as the king had said by the word of the Lord, to make the house of the Lord clean.
translation: Hulle het hulle broers bymekaar gekry en hulleself heilig gemaak, en binne gegaan, soos wat die koning gesê het volgens God se boodskap, om die huis van die Here skoon te maak.

original: The crushed stem will not be broken by him; and the feebly burning light will he not put out, till he has made righteousness overcome all.
translation: Die gebroke stam sal hy nie stukkend maak nie; en die lig wat maar net flou brand, sal hy nie doodblaas nie, totdat hy regverdigheid oor almal laat oorwin.

original: And when they had done all the things said in the Writings about him, they took him down from the tree, and put him in the place of the dead.
translation: En toe hulle alles gedoen het wat in die Bybel oor hom gesê is, het hulle hom van die boom afgehaal en in die plek van die dooies gesit.

original: God of my praise, let my prayer be answered;
translation: God van my lof, laat my gebed beantwoord word;

original: And David and his men were living with Achish at Gath; every man had his family with him, and David had his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel, and Abigail of Carmel, who had been the wife of Nabal.
