translation: En David en sy mense het by Achish in Gath gewoon; elke man het sy gesin saamgehad, en David het sy twee vroue gehad, Ahinoam van Jezreel en Abigail van Karmel, wat Nabal se vrou was.

original: And in his name will the Gentiles put their hope.
translation: En in sy naam sal die nie-Jode hulle hoop hê.

original: But God gave him back from the dead:
translation: Maar God het hom uit die dood opgewek.

original: And burning with wrath against them, the Lord went away.
translation: Die Here was woedend op hulle en het weggegaan.

original: So now, make a change for the better in your ways and your doings, and give ear to the voice of the Lord your God; then the Lord will let himself be turned from the decision he has made against you for evil.
translation: Maak 'n verandering vir die beter in die manier waarop jy lewe, en luister na die stem van die Here jou God; dan sal die Here van die besluit wat Hy teen jou gemaak het om kwaad te doen, afsien.

original: For the mouth of the sinner is open against me in deceit: his tongue has said false things against me.
translation: Die mond van die sondaar is teen my open in bedrog: sy tong het leuens oor my gesê.

original: And God kept Noah in mind, and all the living things and the cattle which were with him in the ark: and God sent a wind over the earth, and the waters went down.
translation: En God het aan Noag gedink, en aan al die lewende dinge en die diere wat saam met hom in die ark was: en God het 'n wind oor die aarde gestuur, en die waters het afgeneem.

original: And Saul, hearing that David had gone to Gath, went after him no longer.
translation: En Saul het nie meer achter David aan gegaan toe hy hoor dat David na Gath gegaan het nie.

original: And the priests went into the inner part of the house of the Lord to make it clean, and everything unclean which was to be seen in the Temple of the Lord they took out into the outer square of the Lord's house, and the Levites got it together and took it away to the stream Kidron.
translation: Die priesters het in die huis van die Here gegaan om dit skoon te maak, en alles wat onrein was en gesien kon word in die tempel van die Here, het hulle buite in die buiteplein van die Here se huis geneem, en die Leviete het dit bymekaar gemaak en dit weggeneem na die Kidronrivier.

original: As for me, here I am in your hands: do with me whatever seems good and right in your opinion.
translation: Ek is hier in jou hande: doen met my wat goed en reg lyk vir jou.

original: Then they took to him one with an evil spirit, who was blind and had no power of talking: and he made him well so that he had the power of talking and seeing.
translation: Toe het hulle vir hom iemand gebring wat 'n bose gees gehad het, wat blind was en nie kon praat nie: en hy het hom gesond gemaak sodat hy weer kon praat en sien.

original: And the cloud was moved from over the Tent; and straight away Miriam became a leper, as white as snow: and Aaron, looking at Miriam, saw that she was a leper.
translation: Die wolk het oor die tent beweeg, en toe het Miriam skielik 'n melaatse geword, so wit soos sneeu. Aaron, wat na Miriam gekyk het, het gesien sy is 'n melaatse.

original: And for a number of days he was seen by those who came with him from Galilee to Jerusalem, who are now his witnesses before the people.
translation: En na 'n paar dae is hy gesien deur die mense wat saam met hom van Galilea na Jerusalem gekom het. Hulle is nou sy getuies voor die mense.

original: And the fountains of the deep and the windows of heaven were shut, and the rain from heaven was stopped.
translation: Die fonteine van die diep plek en die vensters van die hemel was toe, en die reën het opgehou.

original: Words of hate are round about me; they have made war against me without cause.
translation: "Woorde van haat is om my; hulle het oorlog teen my gemaak zonder enige rede."

original: And all the people were surprised and said, Is not this the Son of David?
translation: En al die mense was verras en het gesê: Is dit nie die Seun van David nie?

original: Then David said to Achish, If now I have grace in your eyes, let me have a place in one of the smaller towns of your land, to be my living-place; for it is not right for your servant to be living with you in the king's town.
translation: Toe het David vir Achish gesê: As ek regtig vir jou 'n goeie indruk maak, kan jy my asseblief 'n plek gee in een van die kleiner dorpe in jou land om te woon; want dit is nie reg dat ek saam met jou in die koning se stad bly nie.

original: Then Aaron said to Moses, O my lord, let not our sin be on our heads, for we have done foolishly and are sinners.
translation: Toe Aäron vir Moses gesê het: "O my heer, moenie ons sonde op ons koppe laat druk nie, want ons het dom goed gedoen en is sondaars."

original: And the waters went slowly back from the earth, and at the end of a hundred and fifty days the waters were lower.
translation: En die waters het stadig teruggegaan van die aarde, en na honderd en vyftig dae was die waters laer.

original: For my love they give me back hate; but I have given myself to prayer.
translation: Vir my liefde gee hulle terug haat; maar ek het my aan gebed oorhandig.

original: Only be certain that, if you put me to death, you will make yourselves and your town and its people responsible for the blood of one who has done no wrong: for truly, the Lord has sent me to you to say all these words in your ears.
translation: Wees net seker dat, as julle my doodmaak, julle julle self en julle dorp en sy mense verantwoordelik maak vir die bloed van iemand wat niks verkeerd gedoen het nie; want werklik, die Here het my na julle gestuur om al hierdie woorde in julle ore te sê.

original: And we are giving you the good news of the undertaking made to the fathers,
translation: En ons vertel julle die goeie nuus van die belofte aan die voorouers.

original: So Achish straight away gave him Ziklag: and for that reason Ziklag has been the property of the kings of Judah to this day.
translation: Toe het Achish hom dadelik Ziklag gegee, en Ziklag is tot vandag toe die eiendom van die konings van Juda.

original: On the first day of the first month the work of making the house holy was started, and on the eighth day they came to the covered way of the Lord; in eight days they made the Lord's house holy, and on the sixteenth day of the first month the work was done.
translation: Op die eerste dag van die eerste maand het hulle begin om die huis heilig te maak, en op die agtste dag was hulle by die bedekte pad van die Here; binne agt dae het hulle die Here se huis heilig gemaak, en op die sestiende dag van die eerste maand was die werk klaar.

original: Let her not be as one dead, whose flesh is half wasted when he comes out from the body of his mother.
translation: Laat haar nie soos 'n dooie persoon wees nie, wie se liggaam half vergaan is wanneer hy uit sy ma se liggaam kom.

original: And on the seventeenth day of the seventh month the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat.
translation: En op die 17de dag van die 7de maand het die ark stilgehou op die berge van Ararat.

original: But the Pharisees, hearing of it, said, This man only sends evil spirits out of men by Beelzebub, the ruler of evil spirits.
translation: Maar die Fariseërs het, toe hulle hiervan hoor, gesê: Hierdie man stuur net slegte geeste uit mense uit deur Beëlzebub, die baas van die slegte geeste.

original: Which God has now put into effect for our children, by sending Jesus; as it says in the second Psalm, You are my Son; this day I have given you being.
translation: Wat God nou vir ons kinders aan die gang gesit het, deur Jesus te stuur; soos dit in die tweede Psalm gesê word, Jy is my Seun; vandag het ek jou lewe gegee.

original: And David was living in the land of the Philistines for the space of a year and four months.
translation: En David het vir 'n jaar en vier maande in die land van die Filistyne gewoon.

original: They have put on me evil for good; hate in exchange for my love.
translation: Hulle het slegte dinge oor my gesê terwyl ek goed vir hulle gedoen het; haat in plaas van my liefde.

original: Then the rulers and all the people said to the priests and the prophets, It is not right for this man to be put to death: for he has said words to us in the name of the Lord our God.
translation: Toe het die leiers en al die mense vir die priesters en profete gesê, dit is nie reg dat hierdie man doodgemaak moet word nie: want hy het in God se naam vir ons gepraat.

original: And Moses, crying to the Lord, said, Let my prayer come before you, O God, and make her well.
translation: En Moses het tot die Here geroep en gesê: Laat my gebed by U aankom, O God, en maak haar gesond.

original: And still the waters went on falling, till on the first day of the tenth month the tops of the mountains were seen.
translation: En die waters het steeds verder na onder gegaan, totdat op die eerste dag van die tiende maand die punte van die berge gesien is.

original: Put an evil man over him; and let one be placed at his right hand to say evil of him.
translation: Plaas 'n slegte man oor hom; en laat iemand aan sy regterkant sit om sleg van hom te praat.

original: And about his coming back from the dead, never again to go to destruction, he has said these words, I will give you the holy and certain mercies of David.
translation: En oor sy opstanding uit die dood, nooit weer om te sterf nie, het hy gesê, Ek sal jou die heilige en seker genade van Dawid gee.

original: Then they went in to King Hezekiah and said, We have made all the house of the Lord clean, as well as the altar of burned offerings with all its vessels, and the table for the holy bread, with all its vessels.
translation: Toe gaan hulle na koning Hiskia en sê, Ons het die hele huis van God skoon gemaak, asook die altaar vir die brandofferings met al sy goed, en die tafel vir die heilige brood, met al sy goed.

original: Then some of the responsible men of the land got up and said to all the meeting of the people,
translation: Toe het sommige van die verantwoordelike mans van die land opgestaan en vir almal in die vergadering gesê,

original: And David and his men went up and made attacks on the Geshurites and the Girzites and the Amalekites; for these were the people who were living in the land from Telam on the way to Shur, as far as Egypt.
translation: En David en sy manne het op gegaan en aanvalle gemaak op die Geshuriete, die Girziete en die Amalekiete; want dit was die mense wat in die land gewoon het van Telam op die pad na Shur, tot by Egipte.

original: And having knowledge of their thoughts he said to them, Every kingdom having division in itself is made waste, and every town or house having division in itself will come to destruction.
translation: En omdat Hy weet wat hulle dink, het Hy vir hulle gesê: Elke koninkryk wat verdeeld is, sal verwoes word, en elke dorp of huis wat verdeeld is, sal vernietig word.

original: When he is judged, let the decision go against him; and may his prayer become sin.
translation: Wanneer hy geoordeel word, moet die beslissing teen hom wees; en mag sy gebed sonde wees.

original: Because he says in another Psalm, You will not let your Holy One see destruction.
translation: Omdat hy in 'n ander Psalm sê, jy sal nie laat gebeur dat jy Seun vergaan nie.

original: Then, after forty days, through the open window of the ark which he had made,
translation: Toe, na veertig dae, deur die oop venster van die ark wat hy gemaak het,

original: And all the vessels which were turned out by King Ahaz in his sin while he was king, we have put in order and made holy, and now they are in their places before the altar of the Lord.
translation: En al die goed wat koning Agas in sy sonde as koning uit plek gehaal het, het ons reg gemaak en heilig gemaak, en nou is hulle op hul plek voor die Here se altaar.

original: Let his life be short; let another take his position of authority.
translation: Laat sy lewe kort wees; laat iemand anders sy plek van gesag neem.

original: And if Satan sends out Satan, he makes war against himself; how then will he keep his kingdom?
translation: En as Satan Satan uitstuur, maak hy oorlog teen homself; hoe sal hy dan sy koninkryk kan hou?

original: Micah the Morashtite, who was a prophet in the days of Hezekiah, king of Judah, said to all the people of Judah, This is what the Lord of armies has said: Zion will become like a ploughed field, and Jerusalem will become a mass of broken walls, and the mountain of the house like the high places of the woodland.
translation: Miga, die Morasjtiet, wat 'n profeet was tydens Hiskia se regeer, het vir al die mense van Juda gesê: Dit is wat die Here van die leërskare gesê het: Sion sal soos 'n omgeploegde stuk grond wees, en Jerusalem sal 'n hoop gebroke mure wees, en die berg van die huis sal soos die hoë plekke van die woude wees.

original: Now David, having done God's work for his generation, went to sleep, and was put with his fathers, and his body came to destruction:
translation: Nou het David, nadat hy God se werk vir sy generasie gedoen het, gaan slaap, en is saam met sy vaders begrawe, en sy liggaam het vergaan.

original: And the Lord said to Moses, If her father had put a mark of shame on her, would she not be shamed for seven days? Let her be shut up outside the tent-circle for seven days, and after that she may come in again.
translation: Die Here het vir Moses gesê: As haar pa 'n teken van skaamte op haar gesit het, sal sy nie vir sewe dae skaam wees nie? Laat haar buite die tent vir sewe dae wees, en daarna mag sy weer binne kom.

original: Noah sent out a raven, which went this way and that till the waters were gone from the earth.
translation: Noag het 'n kraai gestuur, wat hier en daar rondgegaan het totdat die waters weg was.

original: And if I by Beelzebub send evil spirits out of men, by whom do your sons send them out? So let them be your judges.
translation: En as ek deur Beelzebub slegte geeste uit mense uitdryf, deur wie stuur julle seuns hulle uit? Laat hulle julle regters wees.

original: But he, who was lifted up by God, did not see destruction.
translation: Maar hy, wat deur God verhoog is, het nie ondergang gesien nie.

original: Then Hezekiah the king got up early, and got together the great men of the town, and went up to the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe Hezekia, die koning, vroeg opgestaan het, het hy die belangrike mense van die dorpie bymekaar geroep en na God se huis gegaan.

original: So Miriam was shut up outside the tent-circle for seven days: and the people did not go forward on their journey till Miriam had come in again.
translation: Miriam was sewe dae buite die tent gesluit, en die mense het nie vorentoe beweeg op hulle reis totdat sy weer binne was nie.

original: And he sent out a dove, to see if the waters had gone from the face of the earth;
translation: Hy het 'n duiwe gestuur om te sien of die waters van die aarde af weggegaan het.

original: But if I by the Spirit of God send out evil spirits, then is the kingdom of God come on you.
translation: Maar as ek slegte geeste uitdryf deur God se Gees, dan het God se koninkryk by julle gekom.

original: Did Hezekiah and all Judah put him to death? did he not in the fear of the Lord make prayer for the grace of the Lord, and the Lord let himself be turned from the decision he had made against them for evil? By this act we might do great evil against ourselves.
translation: Het Hiskia en die hele Juda hom doodgemaak? Het hy nie in die ontsag vir die Here gebid om God se genade nie? En het die Here nie sy besluit om slegte goed teen hulle te doen, laat draai nie? Met hierdie daad kan ons onsself baie skade aandoen.

original: Let his children have no father, and his wife be made a widow.
translation: Laat sy kinders geen pa hê nie, en sy vrou moet 'n weduwee wees.

original: And David again and again made attacks on the land till not a man or a woman was still living; and he took away the sheep and the oxen and the asses and the camels and the clothing; and he came back to Achish.
translation: En David het weer en weer die land aangeval totdat daar nie meer 'n man of 'n vrou oor was nie. Hy het die skape, osse, esels, kameles en klere geneem. Toe het hy teruggekom na Achish.

original: And so, let it be clear to you, my brothers, that through this man forgiveness of sins is offered to you:
translation: En so, laat dit vir julle duidelik wees, my broers, dat julle deur hierdie man vergifnis van sondes kan kry.

original: After that, the people went on from Hazeroth and put up their tents in the waste land of Paran.
translation: Daarna het die mense van Hazeroth vertrek en hulle tente in die woestyn van Paran opgeslaan.

original: Let his children be wanderers, looking to others for their food; let them be sent away from the company of their friends.
translation: Laat sy kinders rondsoek, wat op ander staatmaak vir hul kos; laat hulle weggestuur word van hul vriende.

original: And they took with them seven oxen and seven male sheep and seven lambs and seven he-goats as a sin-offering for the kingdom and for the holy house and for Judah. And he gave orders to the sons of Aaron, the priests, that these were to be offered on the altar of the Lord.
translation: Hulle het sewe osse, sewe volwasse skape, sewe lammetjies en sewe bokke saamgeneem as 'n sondeoffer vir die koninkryk, die heilige huis en vir Juda. Hy het aan Aäron se seuns, die priesters, gesê dat hulle dit op die altaar van die Here moes offer.

original: And through him everyone who has faith is made free from all those things, from which the law of Moses was not able to make you free.
translation: Deur Hom word almal wat geloof het, vrygemaak van al die goed waarvan die wet van Moses jou nie kon vrymaak nie.

original: Or how may one go into a strong man's house and take his goods, if he does not first put cords round the strong man? and then he may take his goods.
translation: Of hoe kan iemand in 'n sterk man se huis ingaan en sy goed neem, as hy nie eers tou om die sterk man sit nie? Dan kan hy sy goed neem.

original: And there was another man who was a prophet of the Lord, Uriah, the son of Shemaiah of Kiriath-jearim; he said against this town and against this land all the words which Jeremiah had said:
translation: En daar was 'n ander man, 'n profeet van die Here, Uria, die seun van Semaja van Kiriath-jearim; hy het al die woorde wat Jeremia gesê het, oor hierdie stad en hierdie land herhaal.

original: And every time Achish said, Where have you been fighting today? David said, Against the South of Judah and the South of the Jerahmeelites and the South of the Kenites.
translation: Elke keer het Achish gesê, Waar het jy vandag geveg? David het gesê, Teen die Suide van Juda, die Suide van die Jerahmeeliete en die Suide van die Keniete.

original: But the dove saw no resting-place for her foot, and came back to the ark, for the waters were still over all the earth; and he put out his hand, and took her into the ark.
translation: maar die duiwe het nie 'n plek gevind om te land nie, en het teruggekom na die ark, want die waters was steeds oor die hele aarde; en hy het sy hand uitgestrek en haar in die ark geneem.

original: Let his creditor take all his goods; and let others have the profit of his work.
translation: Laat sy skuldeiser al sy goed neem; en laat ander die voordeel van sy werk kry.

original: And the Lord said to Moses,
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê,

original: And after waiting another seven days, he sent the dove out again;
translation: En nadat hy weer sewe dae gewag het, het hy die duif weer gestuur.

original: Let no man have pity on him, or give help to his children when he is dead.
translation: Moet nie jammer wees vir hom nie, of help aan sy kinders gee wanneer hy dood is.

original: So take care that these words of the prophets do not come true for you;
translation: So sorg dat die profete se woorde nie vir julle waar word nie;

original: Not one living man or woman did David ever take back with him to Gath, fearing that they might give an account of what had taken place, and say, This is what David did, and so has he been doing all the time while he has been living in the land of the Philistines.
translation: Nie een lewende man of vrou het David ooit teruggeneem na Gath nie, omdat hy bang was hulle sou vertel wat gebeur het en sê: "Dit is wat David gedoen het," en so het hy al die tyd gemaak terwyl hy in die land van die Filistyne gewoon het.

original: Whoever is not with me is against me; and he who does not take part with me in getting people together, is driving them away.
translation: Wie nie saam met my is nie, is teen my; en hy wat nie saam met my help om mense bymekaar te kry nie, jaag hulle weg.

original: And when his words came to the ears of Jehoiakim the king and all his men of war and his captains, the king would have put him to death; but Uriah, hearing of it, was full of fear and went in flight into Egypt:
translation: En toe sy woorde by Jehoiakim, die koning, en al sy soldate en sy hoofde kom, wou die koning hom doodmaak; maar Urias, toe hy daarvan hoor, was vol vrees en het na Egipte gevlug.

original: So they put the oxen to death and their blood was given to the priests to be drained out against the altar; then they put the male sheep to death, draining out their blood against the altar, and they put the lambs to death, draining out their blood against the altar.
translation: Hulle het die osse doodgemaak en hulle bloed aan die priesters gegee om teen die altaar uitgegooi te word; toe het hulle die ramme doodgemaak en hulle bloed teen die altaar uitgegooi, en hulle het die lammetjies doodgemaak, hulle bloed is teen die altaar uitgegooi.

original: Send men to get knowledge about the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel; from every tribe of their fathers you are to send a man, every one a chief among them.
translation: Stuur mense om meer te leer oor die land Kanaan, wat ek aan die kinders van Israel gee; julle moet van elke stam van hulle vaders 'n man stuur, elkeen 'n leier onder hulle.

original: Let his seed be cut off; in the coming generation let their name go out of memory.
translation: Laat sy kinders uitgeveil word; laat hulle naam in die volgende geslag vergeet word.

original: And Jehoiakim the king sent Elnathan, the son of Achbor, and certain men with him, into Egypt.
translation: En Jehoiakim, die koning, het Elnathan, die seun van Achbor, en 'n paar mense saam met hom na Egipte gestuur.

original: See, you doubters, have wonder and come to your end; for I will do a thing in your days to which you will not give belief, even if it is made clear to you.
translation: Kyk, julle wat twyfel, wees verbluf en kom tot julle einde; want ek gaan iets in julle tyd doen waaraan julle nie gaan glo nie, selfs al word dit vir julle duidelik gemaak.

original: So I say to you, Every sin and every evil word against God will have forgiveness; but for evil words against the Spirit there will be no forgiveness.
translation: Ek sê vir julle, elke sonde en elke slegte woord teen God sal vergewe word; maar vir slegte woorde teen die Gees sal daar geen vergifnis wees.

original: And Moses sent them from the waste land of Paran as the Lord gave orders, all of them men who were heads of the children of Israel.
translation: En Moses het hulle gestuur uit die woestyn van Paran soos wat die Here gesê het. Hulle was almal leiers van die Israeliete.

original: And the dove came back at evening, and in her mouth was an olive-leaf broken off: so Noah was certain that the waters had gone down on the earth.
translation: En die duiwe het teen die aand teruggekom, en in haar mond was 'n afgebroke olyfblad. So, Noah was seker dat die waters op die aarde afgeneem het.

original: And Achish had belief in what David said, saying, He has made himself hated by all his people Israel, and so he will be my servant for ever.
translation: En Achish het geglo wat David gesê het, hy het homself gehaat deur al sy mense in Israel, en so sal hy my dienaar wees vir altyd.

original: And when they went out, they made a request that these words might be said to them again on the Sabbath after.
translation: En toe hulle uitgegaan het, het hulle gevra dat hierdie woorde weer op die Sabbat aan hulle gesê kan word.

original: Then they took the he-goats for the sin-offering, placing them before the king and the meeting of the people, and they put their hands on them:
translation: Toe het hulle die bokke geneem vir die sonde-offer, hulle het dit voor die koning en die mense se vergadering neergesit, en hulle het hulle hande op die bokke geplaas.

original: Let the Lord keep in mind the wrongdoing of his fathers; and may the sin of his mother have no forgiveness.
translation: Laat die Here onthou wat sy vaders verkeerd gedoen het; en mag die sonde van sy ma geen vergifnis kry.

original: And they took Uriah out of Egypt and came back with him to Jehoiakim the king; who put him to death with the sword, and had his dead body put into the resting-place of the bodies of the common people.
translation: Hulle het Uria uit Egipte gehaal en saam met hom na koning Jehoiakim teruggekom; hy het hom met die swaard doodgemaak en sy liggaam in die graf van gewone mense laat sit.

original: And after seven days more, he sent the dove out again, but she did not come back to him.
translation: Na sewe dae het hy die duiwe weer gestuur, maar sy het nie teruggekom nie.

original: And these were their names: of the tribe of Reuben, Shammua, the son of Zaccur.
translation: En dit was hulle name: van die stam van Ruben, Shammua, die seun van Zaccur.

original: Now in those days the Philistines got their forces together to make war on Israel. And Achish said to David, Certainly you and your men are to go out with me to the fight.
translation: In daardie dae het die Filistyne hulle bande gesmee om oorlog teen Israel te voer. En Achish het vir David gesê: Natuurlik moet jy en jou manne saam met my gaan veg.

original: And whoever says a word against the Son of man, will have forgiveness; but whoever says a word against the Holy Spirit, will not have forgiveness in this life or in that which is to come.
translation: En enige iemand wat iets sê teen die Seun van die mens, sal vergewe word; maar enige iemand wat iets sê teen die Heilige Gees, sal nie vergewe word nie, in hierdie lewe of in die volgende nie.

original: Of the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat, the son of Hori.
translation: Van die stam van Simeon, Shaphat, die seun van Hori.

original: But Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, gave Jeremiah his help, so that he was not given into the hands of the people to be put to death.
translation: Maar Ahikam, die seun van Shaphan, het Jeremia gehelp, so dat hy nie in die hande van die mense gegee is om doodgemaak te word nie.

original: Let them be ever before the eyes of the Lord, so that the memory of them may be cut off from the earth.
translation: Laat hulle altyd voor God se oë wees, sodat hulle herinnering van die aarde weggeneem kan word.

original: Now when the meeting was ended, a number of the Jews and of the God-fearing Gentiles who had become Jews, went after Paul and Barnabas: who put before them how important it was to keep on in the grace of God.
translation: Toe die vergadering klaar was, het 'n paar Jode en Godvaarende nie-Jode wat Jode geword het, na Paulus en Barnabas gegaan. Hulle het vir hulle gesê hoe belangrik dit is om aan te hou in God se genade.

original: And in the six hundred and first year, on the first day of the first month, the waters were dry on the earth: and Noah took the cover off the ark and saw that the face of the earth was dry.
translation: En in die 601ste jaar, op die eerste dag van die eerste maand, was die waters droog op die aarde. Noag het die dek van die ark afgehaal en gesien dat die aarde droog was.

original: And the priests put them to death, and made a sin-offering with their blood on the altar, to take away the sin of all Israel: for the king gave orders that the burned offering and the sin-offering were for all Israel.
translation: Die priesters het hulle doodgemaak en 'n sondoffer met hul bloed op die altaar aangebied om die sonde van heel Israel weg te neem; die koning het beveel dat die brandoffer en die sondoffer vir al die Israel was.

original: And David said to Achish, You will see now what your servant will do. And Achish said to David, Then I will make you keeper of my head for ever.
translation: En David het vir Achis gesê, jy sal nou sien wat jou dienaar gaan doen. En Achis het vir David gesê, dan sal ek jou vir altyd as my oppasser aanstel.

original: When Zedekiah, the son of Josiah, king of Judah, first became king this word came to Jeremiah from the Lord, saying,
translation: Toe Zedekiah, die seun van Josia, koning van Juda, eers koning geword het, het hierdie boodskap van God na Jeremia gekom en gesê,

original: Of the tribe of Judah, Caleb, the son of Jephunneh.
translation: Van die stam van Juda, is dit Kaleb, die seun van Jefunne.

original: And on the twenty-seventh day of the second month the earth was dry.
translation: Op die drie-en-twintigste dag van die tweede maand was die aarde droog.

original: And on the Sabbath after, almost all the town came together to give hearing to the word of God.
translation: En op die Sondagoggend daarna, het amper die hele dorp bymekaar gekom om na God se boodskap te luister.

original: Because he had no mercy, but was cruel to the low and the poor, designing the death of the broken-hearted.
translation: Want hy het geen genade gehad nie, maar was wreed teenoor die armes en die mense wat hulp nodig gehad het, en het die dood van die gebroke hart beplan.

original: And God said to Noah,
translation: En God het vir Noag gesê,

original: This is what the Lord has said to me: Make for yourself bands and yokes and put them on your neck;
translation: Dit is wat die Here vir my gesê het: Maak vir jouself bande en jukke en sit dit om jou nek.

original: Of the tribe of Issachar, Igal, the son of Joseph.
translation: Van die stam van Issachar, Igal, die seun van Joseph.

original: Make the tree good, and its fruit good; or make the tree bad, and its fruit bad; for by its fruit you will get knowledge of the tree.
translation: Maak die boom goed, en sy vrugte goed; of maak die boom sleg, en sy vrugte sleg; want aan sy vrugte sal jy verstaan wat die boom is.

original: But when the Jews saw such a great number of people, they were full of envy and said evil words against Paul's preaching.
translation: Maar toe die Jode so 'n groot aantal mense sien, was hulle vol jaloesie en het hulle slegte dinge oor Paulus se prediking gesê.

original: Go out of the ark, you and your wife and your sons and your sons' wives.
translation: Gaan uit die ark uit, jy en jou vrou, jou seuns en jou seuns se vrouens.

original: As he took pleasure in cursing, so let it come on him; and as he had no delight in blessing, let it be far from him.
translation: Soos hy plesier gehad het om te vloek, kom dit oor hom; en soos hy nie vreugde in seëninge gehad het nie, laat dit ver van hom wees.

original: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea, the son of Nun.
translation: Van die stam van Efraim, was daar Hoshea, die seun van Nun.

original: Then he put the Levites in their places in the house of the Lord, with brass and corded instruments of music as ordered by David and Gad, the king's seer, and Nathan the prophet: for the order was the Lord's, given by his prophets.
translation: Hy het die Leviete op hul plekke in God se huis gesit, met koper- en snaarinstrumente soos David en Gad, die koning se musiekmaker, en Nathan die profeet, gegee het. Die opdrag was van God af, gegee deur sy profete.

original: You offspring of snakes, how are you, being evil, able to say good things? because out of the heart's store come the words of the mouth.
translation: Julle nageslag van slange, hoe kan julle, wat sleg is, goed sê? Want uit die hart se skat kom die woorde van die mond.

original: Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel, after weeping for him, had put his body in its last resting-place in Ramah, his town. And Saul had put away from the land all those who had control of spirits and who made use of secret arts.
translation: Samuel was dood, en heel Israel het vir hom geween en sy liggaam in sy laaste rusplek in Ramah, sy dorp, neergesit. En Saul het al die mense wat geeste beheer het en met geheimenisse gewerk het, uit die land verban.

original: He put on cursing like a robe, and it has come into his body like water, and into his bones like oil.
translation: Hy het vloek soos 'n rok aangetrek, en dit het in sy liggaam ingekom soos water, en in sy bene soos olie.

original: Of the tribe of Benjamin, Palti, the son of Raphu.
translation: Van die Benjamin-stam was daar Palti, die seun van Raphu.

original: The good man out of his good store gives good things; and the evil man out of his evil store gives evil things.
translation: Die goeie mens gee goeie dinge uit sy goeie plek, en die slegte mens gee slegte dinge uit sy slegte plek.

original: Then Paul and Barnabas without fear said, It was necessary for the word of God to be given to you first; but because you will have nothing to do with it, and have no desire for eternal life, it will now be offered to the Gentiles.
translation: Toe het Paulus en Barnabas sonder vrees gesê: "Dit was nodig dat God se boodskap eers vir julle gegee moes word; maar omdat julle niks daarmee te doen wil hê nie en nie hunker na die ewige lewe nie, sal dit nou aan die nie-Jode aangebied word."

original: And send them to the king of Edom, and to the king of Moab, and to the king of the children of Ammon, and to the king of Tyre, and to the king of Zidon, by their servants who come to Jerusalem, to Zedekiah, king of Judah;
translation: Stuur hulle na die koning van Edom, en na die koning van Moab, en na die koning van die Ammoniete, en na die koning van Tirus, en na die koning van Sidon, deur hulle dienaars wat na Jerusalem kom, na Sedekia, die koning van Juda.

original: So the Levites took their places with David's instruments, and the priests with their horns.
translation: So die Leviete het hulle plekke ingeneem met David se musiekinstrumente, en die priesters met hulle horings.

original: And the Philistines came together and put their forces in position in Shunem; and Saul got all Israel together and they took up their positions in Gilboa.
translation: Die Filistyne het bymekaar gekom en hulle soldate in Shunem geposisioneer; en Saul het al Israel bymekaar gekry en hulle het hulle plekke in Gilboa geneem.

original: Take out with you every living thing which is with you, birds and cattle and everything which goes on the earth, so that they may have offspring and be fertile and be increased on the earth.
translation: Neem saam elke lewende ding wat by jou is, voëls en diere en alles wat op die aarde beweeg, sodat hulle nageslag kan hê, vrugbaar kan wees en kan groei op die aarde.

original: Of the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel, the son of Sodi.
translation: Van die stam van Sebulon was daar Gaddiel, die seun van Sodi.

original: Let it be to him as a robe which he puts on, let it be like a band which is round him at all times.
translation: Laat dit vir hom wees soos 'n toga wat hy aantrek, laat dit wees soos 'n band wat hom altyd omring.

original: And I say to you that in the day when they are judged, men will have to give an account of every foolish word they have said.
translation: En ek sê vir julle, op die dag wanneer hulle geoordeel word, sal mense vir elke dom woord wat hulle gesê het, rekenskap moet gee.

original: And give them orders to say to their masters, This is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: Say to your masters,
translation: Gee vir hulle opdragte om vir hulle meesters te sê: Dit is wat die Here van die leërs, die God van Israel, gesê het: Sê vir julle meesters.

original: For so the Lord has given us orders, saying, I have given you for a light to the Gentiles so that you may be for salvation to the ends of the earth.
translation: Want so het die Here ons opdrag gegee en gesê: Ek het jou gemaak om 'n lig vir die nie-Jode te wees, sodat jy redding kan bring tot by die uithoeke van die aarde.

original: Of the tribe of Joseph, that is of the family of Manasseh, Gaddi, the son of Susi.
translation: Van die stam van Josef, wat van die gesin van Manasse is, was daar Gaddi, die seun van Susi.

original: And when Saul saw the Philistine army he was troubled, and his heart was moved with fear.
translation: En toe Saul die Filistyne se leër sien, was hy geskok en sy hart was vol vrees.

original: And Noah went out with his sons and his wife and his sons' wives;
translation: En Noag het saam met sy seuns, sy vrou en sy seuns se vroue buite gegaan.

original: And Hezekiah gave the word for the burned offering to be offered on the altar. And when the burned offering was started, then the song of the Lord was started, with the blowing of horns and with all the instruments of David, king of Israel.
translation: Hizkia het gesê dat die brandoffer op die altaar aangebied moet word. Toe die brandoffer begin het, het die Here se lied saam met die klank van die horings en al die instrumente van David, die koning van Israel, begin.

original: Let this be the reward given to my haters from the Lord, and to those who say evil of my soul.
translation: Laat dit die beloning wees wat die Here aan my vyande gee, en aan dié wat slegte dinge van my sê.

original: For by your words will your righteousness be seen, and by your words you will be judged.
translation: Jou woorde sal wys hoe regverdig jy is, en deur jou woorde sal jy beoordeel word.

original: Of the tribe of Dan, Ammiel, the son of Gemalli.
translation: Van die Dan-stam, Ammiel, die seun van Gemalli.

original: And when Saul went for directions to the Lord, the Lord gave him no answer, by a dream or by the Urim or by the prophets.
translation: Toe Saul vir hulp by die Here gaan, het die Here nie vir hom geantwoord nie, hetsy deur 'n droom, deur die Urim, of deur die profete.

original: I have made the earth, and man and beast on the face of the earth, by my great power and by my outstretched arm; and I will give it to anyone at my pleasure.
translation: Ek het die aarde gemaak, sowel as mense en diere op die aarde, deur my groot krag en my uitgestrekte arm; en ek sal dit aan enigiemand gee wie ek wil.

original: And the Gentiles, hearing this, were glad and gave glory to the word of God: and those marked out by God for eternal life had faith.
translation: En die nie-Jode het dit gehoor en was bly en het God se boodskap geprys: en diegene wat deur God vir die ewige lewe gekies is, het geglo.

original: Then some of the scribes and Pharisees, hearing this, said to him, Master, we are looking for a sign from you.
translation: Toe sommige van die skrifgeleerdes en Fariseërs dit hoor, het hulle vir Hom gesê: Meester, ons soek 'n teken van U.

original: But, O Lord God, give me your help, because of your name; take me out of danger, because your mercy is good.
translation: Maar, O Here God, help my asseblief, oor u naam; haal my uit gevaar, omdat u genade goed is.

original: And every beast and bird and every living thing of every sort which goes on the earth, went out of the ark.
translation: En elke dier en voël en elke lewende ding van elke soort wat op die aarde rondloop, het uit die ark gekom.

original: And all the people gave worship, to the sound of songs and the blowing of horns; and this went on till the burned offering was ended.
translation: En al die mense het aanbidding gebring, saam met die klank van liedere en die geblaas van horings; en dit het aangehou tot die gebrande offering klaargekom het.

original: Of the tribe of Asher, Sethur, the son of Michael
translation: Van die stam van Aser, Sethur, die seun van Michael.

original: For I am poor and in need, and my heart is wounded in me.
translation: Ek is arm en het hulp nodig, en my hart is seergemaak.

original: And the word of the Lord went through all the country.
translation: En God se boodskap het deur die hele land gegaan.

original: And now I have given all these lands into the hands of Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, my servant; and I have given the beasts of the field to him for his use.
translation: Ek het al hierdie lande in die hande van Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, my dienaar gegee; en ek het die diere van die veld aan hom gegee om te gebruik.

original: And Noah made an altar to the Lord, and from every clean beast and bird he made burned offerings on the altar.
translation: Noag het 'n altaar vir die Here gemaak, en uit elke skoon dier en voël het hy brandoffers op die altaar geoffer.

original: But he, answering, said to them, An evil and false generation is looking for a sign; and no sign will be given to it but the sign of the prophet Jonah:
translation: Maar hy het vir hulle geantwoord, 'n slegte en valse geslag soek 'n teken; maar hulle gaan geen teken kry nie, behalwe die teken van die profeet Jona.

original: Of the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi, the son of Vophsi.
translation: Van die stam van Naphtali was daar Nahbi, die seun van Vophsi.

original: And at the end of the offering, the king and all who were present with him gave worship with bent heads.
translation: En aan die einde van die offer het die koning en almal wat saam met hom was, met gebukkede koppe gebid.

original: Then Saul said to his servants, Get me a woman who has control of a spirit so that I may go to her and get directions. And his servants said to him, There is such a woman at En-dor.
translation: Toe het Saul vir sy dienaars gesê: “Soek vir my 'n vrou wat met geeste kan praat, sodat ek na haar toe kan gaan en raad kan kry.” En sy dienaars het vir hom gesê: “Daar is so 'n vrou in En-dor.”

original: I am gone like the shade when it is stretched out: I am forced out of my place like a locust.
translation: Ek is weg soos die skaduwee wanneer dit gespan word: ek word uit my plek gedruk soos 'n sprinkaan.

original: And all the nations will be servants to him and to his son and to his son's son, till the time comes for his land to be overcome: and then a number of nations and great kings will take it for their use.
translation: En al die nasies sal sy dienaars wees, sowel as sy seun en sy seun se seun, totdat die tyd kom dat sy land oorwin word. En dan sal 'n paar nasies en groot konings dit neem om vir hulself te gebruik.

original: Of the tribe of Gad, Gevel, the son of Machi.
translation: Van die stam van Gad was daar Gevel, die seun van Machi.

original: But the Jews, working up the feelings of the God-fearing women of high position and of the chief men of the town, got an attack started against Paul and Barnabas, driving them out of those parts.
translation: Maar die Jode, wat die gevoelens van die Godvresende vroue van hoë posisies en van die belangrikste mense in die dorp aangewakker het, het 'n aanval teen Paul en Barnabas begin en hulle uit daardie omgewing gedryf.

original: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the stomach of the great fish, so will the Son of man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.
translation: Soos Jona drie dae en drie nagte in die maî van die groot vis was, so sal die Seun van die mens drie dae en drie nagte in die hart van die aarde wees.

original: My knees are feeble for need of food; there is no fat on my bones.
translation: My knieë is swak omdat ek honger is; daar is geen vet op my bene nie.

original: So Saul, putting on other clothing, so that he might not be seen to be the king, took two men with him and went to the woman by night; and he said, Now, with the help of the spirit which you have, make the person whose name I will give you come up.
translation: So Saul het ander klere aangetrek, sodat hy nie as koning gesien kan word nie. Hy het twee mans saamgeneem en in die nag na die vrou gegaan. Hy het gesê, "Nou, met die hulp van die gees wat jy het, laat die persoon wie se naam ek jou gaan gee, opkom."

original: And when the sweet smell came up to the Lord, he said in his heart, I will not again put a curse on the earth because of man, for the thoughts of man's heart are evil from his earliest days; never again will I send destruction on all living things as I have done.
translation: Toe die soet geur na die Here opgestyg het, het Hy in sy hart gesê: Ek sal nie weer 'n vloek oor die aarde laat kom oor mense nie, want die gedagtes van mense se harte is sleg van hulle vroegste dae af; ek sal nooit weer verwoesting oor al die lewende dinge stuur soos ek voorheen gedoen het nie.

original: Then King Hezekiah and the captains gave orders to the Levites to give praise to God in the words of David and Asaph the seer. And they made songs of praise with joy, and with bent heads gave worship.
translation: Toe het koning Hiskia en die leiers vir die Leviete gesê om God te prys met die woorde van Dawid en Asaf, die siener. En hulle het met blydskap lofliedere gesing en met gebogen koppe aanbidding gegee.

original: But they, shaking off the dust of that place from their feet, came to Iconium.
translation: Maar hulle het die stof van daardie plek van hulle voete afgekrap en na Ikonium gegaan.

original: These are the names of the men whom Moses sent to get knowledge about the land. And Moses gave to Hoshea, the son of Nun, the name of Joshua.
translation: Hierdie is die name van die mans wat Moses gestuur het om meer oor die land te leer. En Moses het aan Hoshea, die seun van Nun, die naam Josua gegee.

original: As for me, they make sport of me; shaking their heads when they see me.
translation: Hulle maak grappies van my; hulle skud hulle koppe wanneer hulle my sien.

original: While the earth goes on, seed time and the getting in of the grain, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night, will not come to an end.
translation: Terwyl die aarde aangaan, sal daar altyd tyd wees om te saai en te oes, koue en hitte, somer en winter, dag en nag, sal nooit tot 'n einde kom nie.

original: And the woman said to him, But you have knowledge of what Saul has done, how he has put away out of the land those who have control of spirits and the users of secret arts: why would you, by a trick, put me in danger of death?
translation: En die vrou het vir hom gesê: "Maar jy weet wat Saul gedoen het, hoe hy die mense wat spirits beheer en die wat geheimenisse gebruik, uit die land weggestuur het: hoekom wil jy my met 'n truuk in gevaar stel om te sterf?"

original: And the disciples were full of joy and of the Holy Spirit.
translation: En die dissipels was vol vreugde en die Heilige Gees.

original: And it will come about, that if any nation does not become a servant to this same Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and does not put its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon, then I will send punishment on that nation, says the Lord, by the sword and need of food and by disease, till I have given them into his hands.
translation: As 'n volk nie 'n dienaar van hierdie Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, word nie en nie sy nek onder die juk van die koning van Babel plaas nie, dan sal ek straf oor daardie volk stuur, sê die Here, met die swaard, honger en deur siekte, totdat ek hulle in sy hande oorgegee het.

original: Give me help, O Lord my God; in your mercy be my saviour;
translation: Help my, Here my God; wees my redder in u genade.

original: And God gave his blessing to Noah and his sons, and said, Be fertile, and have increase, and make the earth full.
translation: En God het vir Noag en sy seuns sy seën gegee en gesê: Wees vrugbaar, vermeerder en maak die aarde vol.

original: So Moses sent them to have a look at the land of Canaan, and said to them, Go up into the South and into the hill-country;
translation: So het Moses hulle gestuur om die land Kanaan te verken, en het vir hulle gesê, Klim op na die Suide en die heuwels toe;

original: And Saul made an oath to her by the Lord, saying, By the living Lord, no punishment will come to you for this.
translation: En Saul het vir haar 'n eed gemaak by die Here en gesê: "So waar as die Here lewe, jy gaan nie straf ontvang vir dit nie."

original: Then Hezekiah made answer and said, Now that you have given yourselves to the Lord, come near and take offerings and praise-offerings into the house of the Lord. So all the people took in offerings and praise-offerings: and those whose hearts were moved, took in burned offerings.
translation: Toe Hezekia geantwoord het, het hy gesê: Nou dat julle julle aan die Here oorggee het, kom nader en bring offers en dankoffers in die huis van die Here. So het al die mense offers en dankoffers gebring; en diegene wie se harte beweeg was, het brandoffers gebring.

original: The men of Nineveh will come up in the day of judging and give their decision against this generation: because they were turned from their sins at the preaching of Jonah; and now a greater than Jonah is here.
translation: Die mense van Nineveh sal opstaan op die dag van oordeel en teen hierdie generasie getuig: omdat hulle van hulle sondes omgedraai het toe Jonah gepreek het; en nou is daar iemand groter as Jonah hier.

original: Now in Iconium they went together to the Synagogue of the Jews and gave such teaching that a great number of Jews and Greeks had faith.
translation: Nou in Ikonium het hulle saam na die Joodse sinagoge gegaan en sulke lering gegee dat baie Jode en Grieke in God begin glo het.

original: And see what the land is like; and if the people living in it are strong or feeble, small or great in number;
translation: Kyk wat die grond is soos, en of die mense wat daar woon sterk of swak, en min of baie in getal is.

original: Then the woman said, Who am I to let you see? And he said, Make Samuel come up for me.
translation: Toe het die vrou gesê, Wie is ek om jou te laat sien? En hy het gesê, Laat Samuel vir my kom opdaag.

original: So that they may see that it is the work of your hand; that you, Lord, have done it.
translation: sodat hulle kan sien dit is die werk van jou hand; dat jy, Here, dit gedoen het.

original: And you are not to give attention to your prophets or your readers of signs or your dreamers or those who see into the future or those who make use of secret arts, who say to you, You will not become servants of the king of Babylon:
translation: En julle moet nie aandag gee aan julle profete of julle tekenslees nie, of julle dromers of diegene wat in die toekoms kan sien, of diegene wat met geheime kunste werk nie, wat vir julle sê julle gaan nie dienaars van die koning van Babilon word nie.

original: And the fear of you will be strong in every beast of the earth and every bird of the air; everything which goes on the land, and all the fishes of the sea, are given into your hands.
translation: En mense sal jou vrees in elke dier van die aarde en elke voël van die lug hê; alles wat op die grond beweeg, en al die visse van die see is aan jou gegee.

original: The number of burned offerings which the people took in was seventy oxen, a hundred male sheep, and two hundred lambs: all these were for burned offerings to the Lord.
translation: Die aantal gebrande offers wat die mense gebring het, was sewentig bulle, honderd ramme en twee honderd lammetjies: al hierdie was gebrande offers vir die Here.

original: The queen of the South will come up in the day of judging and give her decision against this generation: for she came from the ends of the earth to give ear to the wisdom of Solomon; and now a greater than Solomon is here.
translation: Die koningin van die Suide sal opdaag op die dag van oordeel en haar besluit teen hierdie geslag gee: sy het van die uithoeke van die aarde gekom om na die wysheid van Salomo te luister; en nou is daar iemand groter as Salomo hier.

original: But those Jews who had not the faith, made the minds of the Gentiles bitter against the brothers.
translation: Maar die Jode wat nie geglo het nie, het die gedagtes van die nie-Jode teen die broers sleg gemaak.

original: And the woman saw that it was Saul, and she gave a loud cry, and said to Saul, Why have you made use of deceit? for you are Saul.
translation: En die vrou het gesien dit is Saul, en sy het hard geskree en vir Saul gesê, Hoekom het jy gelieg? Want jy is Saul.

original: For they say false words to you, so that you may be sent away far from your land, and so that you may be forced out by me and come to destruction.
translation: Hulle sê vir jou leuens, sodat jy ver van jou land gestuur kan word, en dat ek jou kan dwing om te gaan en te vernietig.

original: And the holy things were six hundred oxen and three thousand sheep.
translation: En die heilige goedere was seshonderd osse en drie duisend skape.

original: And what sort of land they are living in, if it is good or bad; and what their living-places are, tent-circles or walled towns;
translation: En watter soort grond hulle woon, of dit goed of sleg is; en wat hulle plekke is, tent-kampe of muurtjies.

original: They may give curses but you give blessing; when they come up against me, put them to shame; but let your servant be glad.
translation: Hulle mag jou vervloek, maar jy gee vir hulle seën; as hulle teen my opstaan, laat hulle eerder skaam wees; maar laat jou dienaar gelukkig wees.

original: Every living and moving thing will be food for you; I give them all to you as before I gave you all green things.
translation: Elke lewende en bewegende ding sal vir jou kos wees; Ek gee hulle almal vir jou, soos wat Ek voorheen al die groen dinge aan jou gegee het.

original: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of a man, goes through dry places looking for rest, and getting it not.
translation: Maar die onrein gees, wanneer hy uit 'n man gaan, gaan hy in droë plekke rond op soek na rus, maar hy kry dit nie.

original: And the king said to her, Have no fear: what do you see? And the woman said to Saul, I see a god coming up out of the earth.
translation: Die koning het vir haar gesê: Moet nie bang wees nie: wat sien jy? En die vrou het vir Saul gesê: Ek sien 'n god wat uit die grond opkom.

original: But flesh with the life-blood in it you may not take for food.
translation: maar jy mag nie vleis eet wat nog sy lewensbloed in het nie.

original: So they kept there for a long time, taking heart in the Lord, who gave witness to the word of his grace by causing signs and wonders to be done by their hands.
translation: Hulle het 'n lang tyd daar gebly en moed geskep in die Here, wat getuig het van God se boodskap van sy genade deur tekens en wonders te laat gebeur deur hulle hande.

original: Let my haters be clothed with shame, covering themselves with shame as with a robe.
translation: Laat my vyande met skaamte bedek wees, soos iemand wat 'n baadjie van skaamte aantrek.

original: But as for that nation which puts its neck under the yoke of the king of Babylon and becomes his servant, I will let that nation keep on in its land, farming it and living in it, says the Lord.
translation: Maar wat daardie nasie betref wat sy nek onder die juk van die koning van Babel sit en sy dienaar word, sal ek daardie nasie toelaat om in sy land te bly, om dit te boer en daar te woon, sê die Here.

original: And if the land is fertile or poor, and if there is wood in it or not. And be of good heart, and come back with some of the produce of the land. Now it was the time when the first grapes were ready.
translation: En as die grond vrugbaar is of nie, en of daar bome is of nie. Wees dapper, en kom terug met 'n paar van die vrugte wat die land voortbring. Dit was nou die tyd wanneer die eerste druiwe ryp geword het.

original: There were not enough priests for the work of cutting up all the burned offerings; so their brothers the Levites gave them help till the work was done and the priests had made themselves holy: for the Levites were more upright in heart to make themselves holy than the priests.
translation: Daar was nie genoeg priesters om al die verbrande offers op te sny nie; so het hulle broers, die Leviete, hulle gehelp totdat die werk klaar was en die priesters hulle self heilig gemaak het: want die Leviete was meer regverdig in hul harte om hulleself heilig te maak as die priesters.

original: Then he says, I will go back into my house from which I came out; and when he comes, he sees that there is no one in it, but that it has been made fair and clean.
translation: Toe sê hy, ek gaan terug huis toe waar ek uitgekom het; en wanneer hy kom, sien hy dat daar niemand daar is nie, maar dit is mooi en skoon gemaak.

original: But there was a division among the people of the town; some were on the side of the Jews and some on the side of the Apostles.
translation: Maar daar was 'n verdeeldheid onder die mense van die dorp; sommige het saam met die Jode gestaan en ander saam met die Apostels.

original: And for your blood, which is your life, will I take payment; from every beast I will take it, and from every man will I take payment for the blood of his brother-man.
translation: En vir jou bloed, wat jou lewe is, sal ek betaling vra; ek sal dit van elke dier neem, en van elke man sal ek betaling vra vir die bloed van sy broer.

original: And he said to her, What is his form? And she said, It is an old man coming up covered with a robe. And Saul saw that it was Samuel, and with his face bent down to the earth he gave him honour.
translation: En hy het vir haar gevra, Wat lyk hy soos? En sy het gesê, Dit is 'n ou man wat opkom, bedek met 'n rob. En Saul het gesien dit is Samuel, en hy het sy gesig na die grond gebuig en hom geëer.

original: So they went up and got a view of the land, from the waste land of Zin to Rehob, on the way to Hamath.
translation: Hulle het gegaan kyk na die land, van die woesteny van Zin tot by Rehob, op pad na Hamath.

original: I will give the Lord great praise with my mouth; yes, I will give praise to him among all the people.
translation: Ek sal die Here baie prys met my mond; ja, ek sal hom prys onder almal.

original: And I said all this to Zedekiah, king of Judah, saying, Put your necks under the yoke of the king of Babylon and become his servants and his people, so that you may keep your lives.
translation: Ek het vir Sedekia, die koning van Juda, gesê: "Sit julle nekke onder die juk van die koning van Babel en word sy dienaars, sodat julle julle lewens kan hou."

original: Whoever takes a man's life, by man will his life be taken; because God made man in his image.
translation: Enige iemand wat iemand se lewe neem, sal ook sy lewe verloor; omdat God die mens in sy beeld gemaak het.

original: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits worse than himself, and they go in and make it their living-place: and the last condition of that man is worse than the first. Even so will it be with this evil generation.
translation: Dan gaan hy en neem sewe ander geeste saam met hom, wat erger is as hy, en hulle gaan in en maak dit hulle huis. Die laaste toestand van daardie man is erger as die eerste. So sal dit ook met hierdie slegte geslag wees.

original: And there was a great amount of burned offerings, with the fat of the peace-offerings and the drink offerings for every burned offering. So the work of the Lord's house was put in order.
translation: En daar was baie brandoffers, met die vet van die vredesoffers en die drankoffers vir elke brandoffer. So, die werk van God se huis is reggestel.

original: And when a violent attempt was made by the Gentiles and the Jews, with their rulers, to make an attack on them and have them stoned,
translation: Toe die nie-Jode en die Jode, saam met hulle leiers, 'n gewelddadige poging gemaak het om hulle aan te val en met klippe te gooi,

original: Why are you desiring death, you and your people, by the sword, and because food is gone, and by disease, as the Lord has said of the nation which does not become the servant of the king of Babylon?
translation: Hoekom wil julle doodgaan, julle en julle mense, deur die swaard, omdat daar nie kos is nie, en deur siektes, soos die Here gesê het van die volk wat nie die dienaar van die koning van Babilon wil wees nie?

original: For he is ever at the right hand of the poor, to take him out of the hands of those who go after his soul.
translation: Hy is altyd daar aan die regterkant van die behoeftige, om hom uit die hande van dié wat sy lewe wil vat, te red.

original: Having got news of it, they went in flight to the towns of Lycaonia, Lystra, and Derbe, and the country round about:
translation: Nadat hulle daarvan gehoor het, het hulle gevlug na die dorpies Lykaonie, Lystra en Derbe, en die areas rondom.

original: They went up into the South and came to Hebron; and Ahiman and Sheshai and Talmai, the children of Anak, were living there. (Now the building of Hebron took place seven years before that of Zoan in Egypt.)
translation: Hulle het na die Suide gegaan en by Hebron aangekom, waar Ahiman, Sheshai en Talmai, die kinders van Anak, gewoon het. Die bou van Hebron het sewe jaar voor dié van Zoan in Egipte gebeur.

original: And now, be fertile and have increase; have offspring on the earth and become great in number.
translation: En nou, wees vrugbaar en vermeerder; kry kinders op die aarde en word baie.

original: And Hezekiah and all the people were full of joy, because God had made the people ready: for the thing was done suddenly.
translation: Hezekia en al die mense was baie bly, omdat God die mense reg gemaak het: want dit het skielik gebeur.

original: While he was still talking to the people, his mother and his brothers came, desiring to have talk with him.
translation: Terwyl hy nog met die mense gepraat het, het sy ma en sy broers gekom om met hom te gesels.

original: And God said to Noah and to his sons,
translation: En God het vir Noag en sy seuns gesê.

original: And you are not to give ear to the prophets who say to you, You will not become servants of the king of Babylon: for what they say is not true.
translation: En julle moet nie na die profete luister wat vir julle sê julle sal nie dienaars van die koning van Babilon wees nie, want wat hulle sê is nie waar nie.

original: And went on preaching the good news there.
translation: En het daar aangehou om die goeie nuus te vertel.

original: And one said to him, See, your mother and your brothers are outside, desiring to have talk with you.
translation: En iemand het vir hom gesê: Kyk, jou ma en jou broers is buite en hulle wil met jou praat.

original: The Lord said to my lord, Be seated at my right hand, till I put all those who are against you under your feet.
translation: Die Here het vir my Here gesê: Sit aan my regterhand totdat ek almal wat teen jou is, onder jou voete plaas.

original: Then Hezekiah sent word to all Israel and Judah, and sent letters to Ephraim and Manasseh, requesting them to come to the house of the Lord at Jerusalem, to keep the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel.
translation: Toe Hezekia boodskappe gestuur het na al Israel en Juda, het hy ook briewe gestuur na Efraim en Manasseh, en hulle gevra om na God se huis in Jerusalem te kom om die Pasga vir die Here, die God van Israel, te vier.

original: And Samuel said to Saul, Why have you made me come up, troubling my rest? And Saul in answer said, I am in great danger; for the Philistines are making war on me, and God has gone away from me and will no longer give me any answer, by the prophets or by dreams: so I have sent for you to make clear to me what I am to do.
translation: En Samuel het vir Saul gesê: "Waarom het jy my laat opkom en my rus onderbreek?" En Saul het geantwoord: "Ek is in groot gevaar; die Filistyne maak oorlog teen my. God het van my weggedoen en sal nie meer vir my antwoord gee nie, deur die profete of deur drome. So het ek jou gestuur om vir my te verduidelik wat ek moet doen."

original: And they came to the valley of Eshcol, and cutting down a vine-branch with its grapes, two of them took it on a rod between them; and they took some pomegranates and figs.
translation: En hulle het na die vallei van Eshcol gegaan, en terwyl hulle 'n wingerdtak met sy druiwe afgesny het, het twee van hulle dit op 'n stok tussen hulle geneem; en hulle het 'n paar granaatappels en fygies geneem.

original: Truly, I will make my agreement with you and with your seed after you,
translation: Ek sal beslis my afspraak met jou en jou kinders maak.

original: But he in answer said to him who gave the news, Who is my mother and who are my brothers?
translation: Maar hy het vir die een wat die nuus gebring het gesê: Wie is my ma en my broers?

original: And at Lystra there was a certain man, who from birth had been without the use of his feet, never having had the power of walking.
translation: En in Lystra was daar 'n man wat al van geboorte af nie sy voete kon gebruik nie en nooit die krag gehad het om te stap nie.

original: The Lord will send out the rod of your strength from Zion; be king over your haters.
translation: Die Here sal die stok van jou krag van Sion af stuur; wees die koning oor jou vyande.

original: For the king, after discussion with his chiefs and all the body of the people in Jerusalem, had made a decision to keep the Passover in the second month.
translation: Die koning het, na met sy leiers en al die mense in Jerusalem te praat, besluit om die Pasga in die tweede maand te hou.

original: For I have not sent them, says the Lord, but they are saying what is false in my name, so that I might send you out by force, causing destruction to come on you and on your prophets.
translation: Ek het hulle nie gestuur nie, sê die Here, maar hulle praat leuens in my naam, sodat ek jou met geweld kan uitstuur en verwoesting oor jou en jou profete kan bring.

original: And Samuel said, Why do you put your questions to me, seeing that God has gone away from you and is on the side of him who is against you?
translation: En Samuel het gesê, Waarom vra julle my vrae, as God ver van julle af is en aan die kant van hom wat teen julle is?

original: That place was named the valley of Eshcol because of the grapes which the children of Israel took from there.
translation: Daardie plek werd die Eshcol-vallei genoem omdat die druiwe wat die kinders van Israel daar geneem het.

original: And with every living thing with you, all birds and cattle and every beast of the earth which comes out of the ark with you.
translation: En saam met alles wat lewe, al die voëls en diere en elke soort dier op die aarde wat saam met jou uit die ark kom.

original: And he put out his hand to his disciples and said, See, my mother and my brothers!
translation: En hy het sy hand na sy dissipels uitgestrek en gesê: Kyk, my ma en my broers!

original: This man was giving ear to the preaching of Paul, who, looking at him, and seeing that he had faith to be made well,
translation: Hierdie man het geluister na wat Paulus gesê het. Paulus het na hom gekyk en gesien dat hy geloof gehad het om gesond te word.

original: At the end of forty days they came back from viewing the land.
translation: Aan die einde van veertig dae het hulle teruggekom van die land af.

original: Your people give themselves gladly in the day of your power; like the dew of the morning on the holy mountains is the army of your young men.
translation: Jou mense gee hulle met blydskap in die dag van jou krag; soos die oggenddauw op die heilige berge, is die groep van jou jongmanne.

original: For whoever does the pleasure of my Father in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.
translation: Want elkeen wat doen wat my Vader in die hemel wil hê, is my broer, suster en ma.

original: It was not possible to keep it at that time, because not enough priests had made themselves holy, and the people had not come together in Jerusalem.
translation: Dit was nie moontlik om dit toe te hou nie, want nie genoeg priesters het hulleself heilig gemaak nie, en die mense het nie in Jerusalem bymekaargekom nie.

original: And the Lord himself has done what I said: the Lord has taken the kingdom out of your hand and given it to your neighbour David;
translation: En die Here self het gedoen wat ek gesê het: die Here het die koninkryk uit jou hand uitgehaal en aan jou buurman David gegee.

original: And I will make my agreement with you; never again will all flesh be cut off by the waters; never again will the waters come over all the earth for its destruction.
translation: Ek sal my ooreenkoms met julle maak; nooit weer sal enige vlees deur die waters vernietig word nie; nooit weer sal die waters oor die hele aarde kom om dit te laat verwoes nie.

original: And I said to the priests and to all the people, This is what the Lord has said: Give no attention to the words of your prophets who say to you, See, in a very little time now the vessels of the Lord's house will come back again from Babylon: for what they say to you is false.
translation: Ek het vir die priesters en al die mense gesê: Dit is wat die Here gesê het: Moet nie na die woorde van julle profete luister nie, wat vir julle sê: Kyk, oor 'n kort tydjie sal die dinge van die Here se huis weer uit Babilon terugkom nie: wat hulle vir julle sê, is nie waar nie.

original: Said in a loud voice, Get up on your feet. And, jumping up, he went walking about.
translation: Hy het loudly gesê, "Staan op jou voete." En toe hy opgestaan het, het hy rondgestap.

original: And the thing was right in the eyes of the king and all the people.
translation: En die ding was reg in die oë van die koning en al die mense.

original: The Lord has made an oath, and will not take it back. You are a priest for ever, after the order of Melchizedek.
translation: Die Here het 'n belofte gemaak en sal dit nie terugneem nie. Jy is 'n priester vir altyd, soos Melgisedek.

original: And they came back to Moses and Aaron and all the children of Israel, to Kadesh in the waste land of Paran; and gave an account to them and to all the people and let them see the produce of the land.
translation: Toe het hulle teruggekom na Moses en Aäron en al die Israeliete, na Kadesj in die woestyn van Paran; en hulle het vir hulle vertel wat gebeur het en aan die mense die vrugte van die land gewys.

original: Because you did not do what the Lord said, and did not give effect to his burning wrath against Amalek. So the Lord has done this thing to you today.
translation: Omdat julle nie gedoen het wat die Here gesê het nie en nie sy woede teen Amalek gebruik het nie. Daarom het die Here vandag hierdie ding met julle gebeur.

original: On that day Jesus went out of the house and was seated by the seaside.
translation: Op daardie dag het Jesus uit die huis gegaan en op die strand gesit.

original: And God said, This is the sign of the agreement which I make between me and you and every living thing with you, for all future generations:
translation: En God het gesê, dit is die teken van die ooreenkoms wat ek maak tussen my en julle en al die lewende dinge saam met julle, vir almal wat na julle kom:

original: And great numbers of people came together to him, so that he got into a boat; and the people took up their position by the sea.
translation: En baie mense het bymekaar gekom om na hom te luister, en toe klim hy in 'n boot; en die mense het langs die see gaan staan.

original: And when the people saw what Paul had done, they said in a loud voice, in the language of Lycaonia, The gods have come down to us in the form of men.
translation: Toe die mense gesien het wat Paulus gedoen het, het hulle hard gesê in die Lykaoniese taal: “Die gode het in menslike vorm na ons toe gekom.”

original: And they said, We came to the land where you sent us, and truly it is flowing with milk and honey: and here is some of the produce of it.
translation: En hulle het gesê, Ons het na die land gegaan waar jy ons gestuur het, en dit is regtig vol melk en heuning: en hier is 'n paar van die produkte daarvan.

original: Give no attention to them; become servants of the king of Babylon and keep yourselves from death: why let this town become a waste?
translation: Gee nie aandag aan hulle nie; wees dienaars van die koning van Babel en beskerm julleself teen die dood: hoekom moet hierdie stad 'n verwoeste plek word?

original: In the day of his wrath kings will be wounded by the Lord at your right hand.
translation: In die dag van sy woede sal die Here die konings seergemaak aan jou regterhand.

original: And more than this, the Lord will give Israel up with you into the hands of the Philistines: and tomorrow you and your sons will be with me: and the Lord will give up the army of Israel into the hands of the Philistines.
translation: En meer as dit, sal die Here Israel saam met jou in die hande van die Filistyne oorgee: en môre sal jy en jou seuns by my wees: en die Here sal die leër van Israel in die hande van die Filistyne oorgee.

original: So it was ordered that word was to be sent out through all Israel, from Beer-sheba to Dan, that they were to come to keep the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel, at Jerusalem: because they had not kept it in great numbers in agreement with the law.
translation: Daar is opdrag gegee dat 'n boodskap deur heel Israel gestuur moes word, van Beer-sheba tot in Dan, dat hulle moes kom om die Pasga vir God, die Here van Israel, in Jerusalem te vier: want hulle het dit nie in groot getalle volgens die wet gehou nie.

original: I will put my bow in the cloud and it will be for a sign of the agreement between me and the earth.
translation: Ek sal my reënboog in die wolke sit, en dit sal 'n teken wees van die afspraak tussen my en die aarde.

original: But the people living in the land are strong, and the towns are walled and very great; further, we saw the children of Anak there.
translation: Maar die mense wat in die land woon, is sterk, en die stede is ommuur en baie groot. Ons het daar ook die kinders van Anak gesien.

original: And he gave them teaching in the form of a story, saying, A man went out to put seed in the earth;
translation: Hy het vir hulle geleer met 'n storie en gesê: "Daar was 'n man wat na buite gegaan het om saad in die grond te plant."

original: And they gave the name of Jupiter to Barnabas, and to Paul that of Mercury, because he was the chief talker.
translation: Hulle het Barnabas Jupiter genoem, en Paulus Mercury, omdat hy die hoofpraatjie was.

original: He will be judge among the nations, the valleys will be full of dead bodies; the head over a great country will be wounded by him.
translation: Hy sal as regter oor die nasies wees, die valleie sal vol wees van dooie mense; die leier van 'n groot land sal deur Hom seergemaak word.

original: And whenever I make a cloud come over the earth, the bow will be seen in the cloud,
translation: En wanneer ek 'n wolk oor die aarde laat kom, sal die reënboog in die wolk gesien word.

original: Then Saul went down flat on the earth, and was full of fear because of Samuel's words: and there was no strength in him, for he had taken no food all that day or all that night.
translation: Toe het Saul plat op die grond neergedaal en was bang oor wat Samuel gesê het; daar was geen krag in hom nie, want hy het die hele dag en die hele nag niks geëet.

original: But if they are prophets, and if the word of the Lord is with them, let them now make request to the Lord of armies that the vessels which are still in the house of the Lord and in the house of the king of Judah and at Jerusalem, may not go to Babylon.
translation: Maar as hulle profete is, en as God se boodskap by hulle is, laat hulle nou by die Here van leërskare vra dat die goed wat nog in die huis van die Here en in die huis van die koning van Juda en in Jerusalem is, nie na Babilon moet gaan nie.

original: And while he did so, some seeds were dropped by the wayside, and the birds came and took them for food:
translation: En terwyl hy dit gedoen het, het hy 'n paar sade langs die pad laat val, en die voëls het gekom en dit opgeëet.

original: He will take of the stream by the way; so his head will be lifted up.
translation: Hy sal water uit die stroom langs die pad neem; so sal sy kop opgetel word.

original: And I will keep in mind the agreement between me and you and every living thing; and never again will there be a great flow of waters causing destruction to all flesh.
translation: Ek sal die ooreenkoms tussen my en jou en elke lewende ding onthou; en nooit weer sal daar 'n groot vloed wees wat alles vernietig nie.

original: For this is what the Lord has said about the rest of the vessels which are still in this town,
translation: Want dit is wat die Here gesê het oor die ander houers wat nog in hierdie stad is.

original: And the Amalekites are in the South; and the Hittites and the Jebusites and the Amorites are living in the hill-country; and the Canaanites by the sea and by the side of Jordan.
translation: Die Amalekiete is in die suide; die Hittiete, Jebusiete en Amoriete woon in die heuwels; en die Kanaäniete is langs die see en aan die kant van die Jordaan.

original: So runners went with letters from the king and his chiefs through all Israel and Judah, by the order of the king, saying, O children of Israel, come back again to the Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, so that he may come again to that small band of you which has been kept safe out of the hands of the kings of Assyria.
translation: So hardlopers het met briewe van die koning en sy leiers deur heel Israel en Juda gegaan, soos die koning gesê het, en hulle het gesê: O kinders van Israel, kom terug na die Here, die God van Abraham, Isaac, en Israel, sodat Hy weer na daardie klein groepie van julle kan terugkom wat veilig gehou is uit die hande van die konings van Assirië.

original: And the priest of the image of Jupiter, which was before the town, took oxen and flowers to the doors of the town, and was about to make an offering with the people.
translation: En die priester van die beeld van Jupiter, wat voor die dorpie was, het osse en blomme na die deure van die dorpie geneem, en was besig om 'n offer saam met die mense te maak.

original: And the woman came to Saul and saw that he was in great trouble, and said to him, See now, your servant has given ear to your words, and I have put my life in danger by doing what you said.
translation: En die vrou het na Saul gegaan en gesien dat hy in groot moeilikheid was, en vir hom gesê: "Kyk, ek het na jou woorde geluister, en ek het my lewe in gevaar gestel deur te doen wat jy gesê het."

original: And some of the seed went among the stones, where it had not much earth, and straight away it came up because the earth was not deep:
translation: En sommige van die saadjies het tussen die klippe geval, waar daar nie veel grond was nie, en het vinnig begin groei omdat die grond nie diep was nie.

original: Let the Lord be praised. I will give praise to the Lord with all my heart, among the upright, and in the meeting of the people.
translation: Laat die Here geprys word. Ek sal die Here met my whole hart prys, onder die regverdiges, in die groep van mense.

original: And the bow will be in the cloud, and looking on it, I will keep in mind the eternal agreement between God and every living thing on the earth.
translation: Die boog sal in die wolk wees, en wanneer ek daarna kyk, sal ek die ewige belo meeting onthou tussen God en elke lewende wese op aarde.

original: But when this came to the ears of the Apostles, Paul and Barnabas, they went running out among the people, parting their clothing, and crying out,
translation: Maar toe die Apostels, Paulus en Barnabas dit hoor, het hulle na die mense toe gehardloop, hulle klere geskeur en uitgeroep,
