original: So now, give ear to the voice of your servant, and let me give you a little bread; and take some food to give you strength when you go on your way.
translation: So, luister nou na wat ek sê, en laat my jou 'n bietjie brood gee; en neem kos saam om jou te help wanneer jy op jou pad gaan.

original: Do not be like your fathers and your brothers, who were sinners against the Lord, the God of their fathers, so that he made them a cause of fear, as you see.
translation: Moet nie soos julle vaders en julle broers wees nie, wat teen die Here, die God van hulle vaders, gesondig het, sodat Hy hulle 'n rede tot vrees gemaak het, soos julle kan sien.

original: The works of the Lord are great, searched out by all those who have delight in them.
translation: Die werke van die Here is wonderlik, en almal wat daarvan hou, soek daarna.

original: Then Caleb made signs to the people to keep quiet, and said to Moses, Let us go up straight away and take this land; for we are well able to overcome it.
translation: Toe het Kaleb na die mense gewys om stil te wees en vir Moses gesê: “Kom ons gaan nou reguit op en neem hierdie land in, want ons kan dit maklik oorwin.”

original: And when the sun was high, it was burned; and because it had no root it became dry and dead.
translation: En toe die son hoog was, het dit gebrand; en omdat dit glad nie wortels gehad het nie, het dit droog en dood geword.

original: Which Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, did not take away, when he took Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, a prisoner from Jerusalem to Babylon, with all the great men of Judah and Jerusalem;
translation: Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, het nie weggegaan nie, toe hy Jeconiah, die seun van Jehoiakim, die koning van Juda, as 'n gevangene van Jerusalem na Babel geneem het, saam met al die groot mense van Juda en Jerusalem.

original: And God said to Noah, This is the sign of the agreement which I have made between me and all flesh on the earth.
translation: En God het vir Noag gesê, dit is die teken van die ooreenkoms wat ek gemaak het tussen my en al die mense op die aarde.

original: His work is full of honour and glory; and his righteousness is unchanging for ever.
translation: Sy werk is vol eer en prys; en sy regverdigheid bly altyd dieselfde.

original: But he would not, saying, I have no desire for food. But his servants, together with the woman, made him take food, and he gave way to them. So he got up from the earth, and took his seat on the bed.
translation: Maar hy wou nie, en het gesê hy het nie lus vir kos nie. Sy dienaars, saam met die vrou, het hom egter oortuig om te eet, en hy het daaraan toegegee. Toe het hy opgestaan van die grond en op die bed gaan sit.

original: But the men who had gone up with him said, We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we.
translation: Maar die mans wat saam met hom gegaan het, het gesê: "Ons kan nie teen daardie mense opgaan nie, want hulle is sterker as ons."

original: For this is what the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said about the rest of the vessels in the house of the Lord and in the house of the king of Judah and at Jerusalem:
translation: Want dit is wat die Here van die leërskare, die God van Israel, gesê het oor die ander dinge in die huis van die Here, in die huis van die koning van Juda, en in Jerusalem:

original: Good people, why are you doing these things? We are men with the same feelings as you, and we give you the good news so that you may be turned away from these foolish things to the living God, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all things in them:
translation: Goeie mense, hoekom doen julle hierdie goed? Ons is mense met die selfde gevoelens soos julle, en ons bring die goeie nuus sodat julle van hierdie dom goed kan wegdraai na die lewende God, wat die hemel en die aarde en die see en alles daarin gemaak het.

original: And some seeds went among thorns, and the thorns came up and they had no room for growth:
translation: En sommige sade het tussen dorings geval, en die dorings het gegroei en hulle het nie plek gehad om te groei nie.

original: And the sons of Noah who went out of the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth; and Ham is the father of Canaan.
translation: En die seuns van Noag wat uit die ark gekom het, was Sem, Gam en Jafet; en Gam is die vader van Kanaän.

original: Who in the past let all nations go in the ways which seemed good to them.
translation: Wie het in die verlede al die nasies laat loop op die paaie wat vir hulle goed gelyk het.

original: Certain for ever is the memory of his wonders: the Lord is full of pity and mercy.
translation: Die herinnering aan sy wonders is vir altyd seker: Die Here is vol medelye en genade.

original: Now do not be hard-hearted, as your fathers were; but give yourselves to the Lord, and come into his holy place, which he has made his for ever, and be the servants of the Lord your God, so that the heat of his wrath may be turned away from you.
translation: Moet nie hardkoppig wees soos julle vaders nie; maar gee julle aan die Here oor en kom in sy heilige plek in, wat Hy vir altyd syne gemaak het, en wees sy dienaars, sodat die woede van sy toorn van julle afgekeer kan word.

original: These three were the sons of Noah and from them all the earth was peopled.
translation: Hierdie drie was Noag se seuns, en uit hulle het die hele aarde vol mense geword.

original: And the woman had in the house a young cow, made fat for food; and she put it to death straight away; and she took meal and got it mixed and made unleavened bread;
translation: En die vrou het in die huis 'n jong os gehad wat sy vetgemaak het vir ete; sy het dit dadelik doodgemaak; en sy het meel geneem, dit gemeng en platbrood gemaak.

original: They will be taken away to Babylon, and there they will be till the day when I send their punishment on them, says the Lord. Then I will take them up and put them back in their place.
translation: Hulle sal na Babilon geneem word, en hulle sal daar wees totdat ek hulle straf, sê die Here. Dan sal ek hulle terugbring en hulle weer op hul plek sit.

original: And they gave the children of Israel a bad account of the land they had been to see, saying, This land through which we went is a land causing destruction to those living in it; and all the people we saw there are men of more than common size.
translation: Hulle het die kinders van Israel 'n slegte storie vertel oor die land wat hulle gesien het, en gesê: Hierdie land waarin ons gegaan het, is 'n land wat vernietiging bring vir die mense wat daar woon; en al die mense wat ons daar gesien het, is langer as normale mense.

original: But he was not without witness, because he did good, and gave you rain from heaven and times of fruit, making your hearts full of food and joy.
translation: Maar Hy het nie geen getuies gehad nie, want Hy het vir julle goeie dinge gedoen, reën uit die hemel gegee en tye van vrugte, wat julle harte vol gemaak het met kos en vreugde.

original: And some, falling on good earth, gave fruit, some a hundred, some sixty, some thirty times as much.
translation: En sommige wat op goeie grond val, het vrugte gegee, sommige honderd, sommige sestig, sommige dertig keer soveel.

original: He has given food to his worshippers; he will keep his agreement in mind for ever.
translation: Hy het kos gegee aan sy volgelinge; hy sal sy belofte vir altyd onthou.

original: In those days Noah became a farmer, and he made a vine-garden.
translation: In daardie dae het Noag 'n boer geword en hy het 'n druiweplank aangeplant.

original: And even with these words, it was hard for them to keep the people from making an offering to them.
translation: En selfs met hierdie woorde, was dit moeilik vir hulle om die mense te keer om iets aan hulle te bied.

original: And she put it before Saul and his servants, and they had a meal. Then they got up and went away the same night.
translation: En sy het dit voor Saul en sy dienaars gesit, en hulle het saam gegeten. Toe het hulle opgestaan en die nag weggegaan.

original: There we saw those great men, the sons of Anak, offspring of the Nephilim: and we seemed to ourselves no more than insects, and so we seemed to them.
translation: Daar het ons daardie groot mans gesien, die seuns van Anak, wat van die Nefilim af kom: en ons het vir onsself gelyk soos insekte, en so het ons vir hulle gelyk.

original: For if you come back to the Lord, those who took away your brothers and your children will have pity on them, and let them come back to this land: for the Lord your God is full of grace and mercy, and his face will not be turned away from you if you come back to him.
translation: Want as jy terugkom na die Here, sal die mense wat jou broers en jou kinders weggeneem het, jammer wees oor wat hulle gedoen het, en hulle sal terugkom na hierdie land. Want die Here, jou God, is vol genade en barmhartigheid, en Hy sal nie sy oë van jou afwend nie as jy na Hom terugkom.

original: He who has ears, let him give ear.
translation: Hy wat ore het, moet mooi luister.

original: He has made clear to his people the power of his works, giving them the heritage of the nations.
translation: Hy het vir sy mense duidelik gemaak wat die krag van sy werke is, en hulle die erfenis van die nasies gegee.

original: And it came about in that year, when Zedekiah first became king of Judah, in the fourth year, in the fifth month, that Hananiah, the son of Azzur the prophet, who came from Gibeon, said to Jeremiah in the house of the Lord, before the priests and all the people,
translation: Dit het in daardie jaar gebeur toe Zedekiah vir die eerste keer koning van Juda geword het, in die vierde jaar, in die vyfde maand. Hananiah, die seun van Azzur, die profeet van Gibea, het vir Jeremía in die Here se huis gesê, voor die priesters en al die mense.

original: And he took of the wine of it and was overcome by drink; and he was uncovered in his tent.
translation: Hy het van die wyn gedrink en was dronk; en hy was kaal in sy tent.

original: Then all the people gave load cries of grief, and all that night they gave themselves up to weeping.
translation: Toe het al die mense hard geskreeu van hartseer, en hulle het die hele nag geween.

original: The works of his hands are faith and righteousness; all his laws are unchanging.
translation: Die werk van sy hande is geloof en regverdigheid; al sy wette is altyd die dieselfde.

original: And the disciples came and said to him, Why do you say things to them in the form of stories?
translation: En die dissipels het gekom en vir Hom gesê, Hoekom sê jy vir hulle dinge in die vorm van stories?

original: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw his father unclothed, and gave news of it to his two brothers outside.
translation: Ham, die pa van Kanaan, het sy pa kaal gesien en dit vir sy twee broers buite vertel.

original: Now the Philistines got all their army together at Aphek: and the Israelites put their forces in position by the fountain in Jezreel.
translation: Nou het die Filistyne al hulle soldate bymekaar gebring by Aphek, en die Israeliete het hulle troepe by die fontein in Jezreel opgestel.

original: They are fixed for ever and ever, they are done in faith and righteousness.
translation: Hulle is vir altyd vasgestel, hulle is gebou op geloof en regverdigheid.

original: But some Jews came to that place from Antioch and Iconium, and got control over the people; and after stoning Paul, they had him pulled out of the town, taking him for dead.
translation: Maar sommige Jode het van Antiochië en Ikonium af na daardie plek gekom en het die mense oorhaal; en nadat hulle Paulus met klippe gegooi het, het hulle hom uit die dorp gesleep, dinkend dat hy dood is.

original: These are the words of the Lord of armies, the God of Israel: By me the yoke of the king of Babylon has been broken.
translation: Hierdie is wat die Here van die leërs, die God van Israel, sê: Ek het die juk van die koning van Babilon gebroke.

original: And he said to them in answer, To you is given the knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of heaven, but to them it is not given.
translation: Hy het vir hulle geantwoord, vir julle is die kennis van die geheime van God se koninkryk gegee, maar vir hulle is dit nie gegee nie.

original: And all the children of Israel, crying out against Moses and Aaron, said, If only we had come to our death in the land of Egypt, or even in this waste land!
translation: En al die Israeliete het uitgeroep teen Moses en Aaron, en gesê: As ons tog net in die land van Egipte gesterf het, of selfs in hierdie dorre plek!

original: And the lords of the Philistines went on with their hundreds and their thousands, and David and his men came after with Achish.
translation: Die leiers van die Filistyne het voortgegaan met hulle honderde en duisende, en David en sy mense het daarna saam met Achish aangekom.

original: So the runners went from town to town through all the country of Ephraim and Manasseh as far as Zebulun: but they were laughed at and made sport of.
translation: Die hardlopers het van dorp tot dorp gegaan deur die hele land van Efraim en Manasseh tot by Zebulon, maar hulle is uitgelag en belaglik gemaak.

original: But when the disciples came round him, he got up and went into the town: and the day after he went away with Barnabas to Derbe.
translation: Maar toe die dissipels om hom kom, het hy opgestaan en in die dorp ingegaan; en die dag daarna het hy saam met Barnabas na Derbe gegaan.

original: And Shem and Japheth took a robe, and putting it on their backs went in with their faces turned away, and put it over their father so that they might not see him unclothed.
translation: En Sem en Jafeth het 'n jas geneem, en terwyl hulle dit op hulle skouers gesit het, het hulle met hulle gesigte weg gedraai en dit oor hulle pa gesit sodat hulle hom nie bloot kon sien nie.

original: In the space of two years I will send back into this place all the vessels of the Lord's house which Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, took away from this place to Babylon:
translation: Binne twee jaar sal ek al die goed van God se huis wat Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babel, van hierdie plek na Babel geneem het, terugbring na hierdie plek.

original: Why is the Lord taking us into this land to come to our death by the sword? Our wives and our little ones will get into strange hands: would it not be better for us to go back to Egypt?
translation: Hoekom neem die Here ons in hierdie land in om deur die swaard dood te gaan? Ons vrouens en ons klein kinders gaan in vreemde hande beland: sal dit nie beter wees vir ons om terug Egipte toe te gaan nie?

original: He has sent salvation to his people; he has given his word for ever: holy is his name and greatly to be feared.
translation: Hy het redding na sy mense gestuur; hy het sy woord vir altyd gegee: God se naam is heilig en dit is 'n werklike saak om hom te vrees.

original: Because whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have more; but from him who has not, even what he has will be taken away.
translation: Want wie het, sal meer kry; maar wie nie het nie, selfs wat hy het, sal van hom weggeneem word.

original: However, some of Asher and Manasseh and Zebulun put away their pride and came to Jerusalem.
translation: Maar, sommige van Asher, Manasseh en Zebulun het hul trots neergesit en na Jerusalem gekom.

original: And they said to one another, Let us make a captain over us, and go back to Egypt.
translation: En hulle het vir mekaar gesê, Kom ons kies 'n leier en gaan terug na Egipte.

original: And having made a number of disciples through the preaching of the good news in that town, they went back to Lystra and Iconium and Antioch,
translation: En nadat hulle 'n aantal volgelinge gemaak het deur die boodskap van die goeie nuus in daardie dorp, het hulle teruggegaan na Lystra, Ikonium en Antiog.

original: For this reason I put things into the form of stories; because they see without seeing, and give ear without hearing, and the sense is not clear to them.
translation: Ek vertel dinge as stories; want hulle sien sonder om te sien, en hulle luister sonder om te hoor, en hulle verstaan nie regtig nie.

original: And, awaking from his wine, Noah saw what his youngest son had done to him, and he said,
translation: En toe Noag wakker word uit sy wyn, het hy gesien wat sy jongste seun vir hom gedoen het, en hy het gesê,

original: And I will let Jeconiah, the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, come back to this place, with all the prisoners of Judah who went to Babylon, says the Lord: for I will have the yoke of the king of Babylon broken.
translation: Ek sal Jeconiah, die seun van Jehoiakim, koning van Juda, terugbring na hierdie plek saam met al die gevangenes van Juda wat na Babilon gegaan het, sê die Here: want ek sal die juk van die koning van Babilon breek.

original: Then the rulers of the Philistines said, What are these Hebrews doing here? And Achish said to the rulers of the Philistines, Is this not David, the servant of Saul the king of Israel, who has been with me for a year or two, and I have never seen any wrong in him from the time when he came to me till now?
translation: Toe het die leiers van die Filistyne gesê, wat doen hierdie Hebreërs hier? En Achish het vir die leiers van die Filistyne gesê, is dit nie David nie, die dienaar van Saul, die koning van Israel, wat al vir 'n jaar of twee by my is, en ek het nog nooit iets verkeerd in hom gesien nie, van die tyd toe hy by my gekom het tot nou toe?

original: Then Moses and Aaron went down on their faces before the meeting of the people.
translation: Toe het Moses en Aäron op hulle gesigte voor die mense neergedaal.

original: The fear of the Lord is the best part of wisdom: all those who keep his laws are wise: his praise is eternal.
translation: Respek vir God is die beste deel van wysheid: almal wat sy reëls volg, is slim; sy lof is vir altyd.

original: Making strong the souls of the disciples, saying to them that they were to keep the faith, and that we have to go through troubles of all sorts to come into the kingdom of God.
translation: Hy het die dissipels se siele sterker gemaak en vir hulle gesê hulle moet vas hou aan hulle geloof, en dat ons deur al tipe swaarkry moet gaan om in God se koninkryk in te kom.

original: And in Judah the power of God gave them one heart to do the orders of the king and the captains, which were taken as the word of the Lord.
translation: In Juda het God se krag vir hulle een hart gegee om die opdragte van die koning en die leiers uit te voer wat as God se boodskap beskou is.

original: Cursed be Canaan; let him be a servant of servants to his brothers.
translation: Kanaan is vervloek; laat hy 'n dienaar van sy broers wees.

original: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to the prophet Hananiah, before the priests and all the people who had come into the house of the Lord,
translation: Toe het die profeet Jeremia vir die profeet Hananiah gesê, voor die priesters en al die mense wat in God se huis gekom het.

original: And Joshua, the son of Nun, and Caleb, the son of Jephunneh, two of those who had been to see the land, giving signs of grief,
translation: En Josua, die seun van Nun, en Kaleb, die seun van Jefoenah, twee van die mense wat die land gesien het, het gewys dat hulle hartseer was.

original: And for them the words of Isaiah have come true, Though you give ear, you will not get knowledge; and seeing, you will see, but the sense will not be clear to you:
translation: En vir hulle het die woorde van Jesaja waar geword. Alhoewel jy luister, sal jy nie verstaan nie; en al sien jy, sal jy sien, maar die betekenis sal nie vir jou duidelik wees nie.

original: Let the Lord be praised. Happy is the man who gives honour to the Lord, and has great delight in his laws.
translation: Laat die Here geprys word. Gelukkig is die man wat die Here eer en baie bly is oor sy wette.

original: And he said, Praise to the Lord, the God of Shem; let Canaan be his servant.
translation: En hy het gesê, Loof die Here, die God van Sem; laat Kanaan sy dienaar wees.

original: So a very great number of people came together at Jerusalem to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month.
translation: So 'n baie groot groep mense het bymekaar gekom in Jerusalem om die fees van ongesuurde brood in die tweede maand te vier.

original: Said to all the children of Israel, This land which we went through to see is a very good land.
translation: Ek het vir al die kinders van Israel gesê, hierdie land wat ons deurgegaan het om te sien, is 'n baie goeie land.

original: The prophet Jeremiah said, So be it: may the Lord do so: may the Lord give effect to the words which you have said, and let the vessels of the Lord's house, and all the people who have been taken away, come back from Babylon to this place.
translation: Die profeet Jeremia het gesê: So moet dit wees: mag die Here dit doen: mag die Here die woorde wat julle gesê het, waar maak, en laat die goed van God se huis en al die mense wat weggevat is, terugkom van Babel na hierdie plek.

original: And when they had made selection of some to be rulers in every church, and had given themselves to prayer and kept themselves from food, they put them into the care of the Lord in whom they had faith.
translation: Toe hulle sommige gekies het om leiers in elke kerk te wees, en hulle het gebid en hulle van kos weerhou, het hulle hulle aan die sorg van die Here toevertrou in wie hulle vertrou.

original: But the rulers of the Philistines were angry with him, and said to him, Make the man go back to the place you have given him; do not let him go down with us to the fight, or he may be turned against us and be false to us: for how will this man make peace with his lord? will it not be with the heads of these men?
translation: Maar die Filistyne was kwaad vir hom en het vir hom gesê: “Stuur hom terug na die plek waar jy hom gegee het; laat hom nie saam met ons na die geveg gaan nie, want hy kan teen ons draai en nie loyaal wees nie. Hoe kan hierdie man vrede maak met sy baas? Gaan hy nie eerder met hierdie mans se koppe eindig nie?”

original: His seed will be strong on the earth; blessings will be on the generation of the upright.
translation: Sy nageslag sal sterk wees op die aarde; seëninge sal oor die regverdiges wees.

original: For the heart of this people has become fat and their ears are slow in hearing and their eyes are shut; for fear that they might see with their eyes and give hearing with their ears and become wise in their hearts and be turned again to me, so that I might make them well.
translation: Want die harte van hierdie mense is hard, hulle ore is moeilik om te hoor, en hulle oë is toe; hulle is bang hulle sal met hulle oë sien en met hulle ore luister, en dat hulle dan sal verstaan in hulle harte en weer na my sal terugkeer, sodat ek hulle kan gesond maak.

original: But still, give ear to this word which I am saying to you and to all the people:
translation: Maar luister tog na hierdie woord wat ek vir julle en almal sê:

original: And if the Lord has delight in us, he will take us into this land and give it to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
translation: En as die Here van ons hou, sal Hy ons na hierdie land neem en dit aan ons gee, 'n land wat vol melk en heuning is.

original: And they got to work and took away all the altars in Jerusalem, and they put all the vessels for burning perfumes into the stream Kidron.
translation: Hulle het aan die werk gegaan en al die altare in Jerusalem verwyder, en hulle het al die gereedskap vir die brand van geure in die Kidronrivier gesit.

original: And they went through Pisidia and came to Pamphylia.
translation: Hulle het deur Pisidia gegaan en by Pamfylia aangekom.

original: Is this not David, who was named in their songs, when in the dance they said to one another, Saul has put to death thousands, and David tens of thousands?
translation: Is dit nie David nie, wat in hulle liedjies genoem word, toe hulle in die dans vir mekaar gesê het, Saul het duisende doodgemaak en David tienduisende?

original: A store of wealth will be in his house, and his righteousness will be for ever.
translation: Daar sal 'n plek vol rykdom in sy huis wees, en sy regverdigheid sal vir altyd daar wees.

original: May God make Japheth great, and let his living-place be in the tents of Shem, and let Canaan be his servant.
translation: Mag God Japheth groot maak, en laat sy huis in die tente van Shem wees, en laat Kanaan sy dienaar wees.

original: But a blessing be on your eyes, because they see; and on your ears, because they are open.
translation: Maar julle oë is geseënd, want julle sien; en julle ore, want hulle is oop.

original: Only, do not go against the Lord or go in fear of the people of the land, for they will be our food; their strength has been taken from them and the Lord is with us: have no fear of them.
translation: Moet nie teen die Here optree of vir die mense van die land bang wees nie, want hulle gaan ons nie kan seergemaak nie; hulle se krag is weggeneem en die Here is by ons: moenie vir hulle bang wees nie.

original: The prophets, who were before me and before you, from early times gave word to a number of countries and great kingdoms about war and destruction and disease.
translation: Die profete, wat voor my en jou was, het al vir ’n lang tyd oor 'n paar lande en groot koninkryke gesê, en hulle het gepraat oor oorlog, vernietiging en siektes.

original: And, after preaching the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia;
translation: En, nadat hulle die boodskap in Perga gepraat het, het hulle na Attalia gegaan;

original: For the upright there is a light shining in the dark; he is full of grace and pity.
translation: Vir die regverdiges is daar 'n lig wat in die donker skyn; hulle is vol genade en medelye.

original: For truly, I say to you that prophets and upright men had a desire to see the things which you see, and saw them not; and to have knowledge of the words which have come to your ears, and they had it not.
translation: Ek sê vir julle, profete en regverdige mense het hulle gewens om die dinge te sien wat julle sien, maar hulle het dit nie gesien nie; en om te verstaan wat julle gehoor het, maar hulle het dit nie gehad nie.

original: Then on the fourteenth day of the second month they put the Passover lambs to death: and the priests and the Levites were shamed, and made themselves holy and took burned offerings into the house of the Lord.
translation: Toe, op die veertiende dag van die tweede maand, het hulle die Pasga-lammetjies geslag. Die priesters en die Leviete was skaam. Hulle het hulleself heilig gemaak en gebrande offers in God se huis geneem.

original: The prophet whose words are of peace, when his words come true, will be seen to be a prophet whom the Lord has sent.
translation: Die profeet wat vrede met sy woorde bring, en wanneer sy woorde waar word, sal gesien word as 'n profeet wat die Here gestuur het.

original: And Noah went on living three hundred and fifty years after the great flow of waters;
translation: En Noag het nog driehonderd vyftig jaar geleef na die groot vloed.

original: Then Achish sent for David and said to him, By the living Lord, you are upright, and everything you have done with me in the army has been pleasing to me: I have seen no evil in you from the day when you came to me till now: but still, the lords are not pleased with you.
translation: Toe het Achish vir David gestuur en vir hom gesê: "Ek sê vir jou, by die lewende Here, jy is regverdig. Alles wat jy saam met my in die leër gedoen het, was vir my aangenaam. Ek het geen kwaad in jou gesien van die dag toe jy by my gekom het tot nou toe, maar tog, die here is nie tevrede met jou nie."

original: Give ear, then, to the story of the man who put the seed in the earth.
translation: Luister dan na die storie van die man wat die saadjies in die grond gesit het.

original: All is well for the man who is kind and gives freely to others; he will make good his cause when he is judged.
translation: Alles gaan goed met die man wat vriendelik is en vrygewig aan ander gee. Hy sal sy saak regkry wanneer hy geoordeel word.

original: And from there they went by ship to Antioch, where they had been handed over to the grace of God for the work which they had not done.
translation: En van daar het hulle per skip na Antiochië gegaan, waar hulle aan God se genade oorlaat is vir die werk wat hulle nie gedoen het nie.

original: But all the people said they were to be stoned. Then the glory of the Lord was seen in the Tent of meeting, before the eyes of all the children of Israel.
translation: Maar al die mense het gesê hulle moet met klippe gegooi word. Toe is die glorie van die Here gesien in die ontmoetingsplek, voor die oë van al die Israeliete.

original: So now go back, and go in peace, so that you do not make the lords of the Philistines angry.
translation: Gaan nou terug en gaan in vrede, sodat julle nie die leiers van die Filistyne kwaad maak nie.

original: And they took their places in their right order, as it was ordered in the law of Moses, the man of God: the priests draining out on the altar the blood given them by the Levites.
translation: En hulle het hulle plekke ingeneem in die regte volgorde, soos dit in die wet van Moses, die man van God, gesê is. Die priesters het die bloed wat hulle van die Leviete gekry het, op die altaar uitgegiet.

original: all the years of his life were nine hundred and fifty: and he came to his end.
translation: Sy hele lewe was nege honderd en vyftig jaar, en toe het hy gesterf.

original: Then Hananiah the prophet took the yoke from the neck of the prophet Jeremiah and it was broken by his hands.
translation: Toe het die profeet Hananiah die juk van die nek van die profeet Jeremia afgehaal, en hy het dit met sy hande gebroke.

original: He will not ever be moved; the memory of the upright will be living for ever.
translation: Hy sal nooit van sy plek af beweeg nie; die herinnering van die regverdiges sal vir altyd leef.

original: When the word of the kingdom comes to anyone, and the sense of it is not clear to him, then the Evil One comes, and quickly takes away that which was put in his heart. He is the seed dropped by the wayside.
translation: Wanneer die boodskap van die koninkryk by iemand aankom en hy verstaan dit nie, dan kom die Boze en neem vinnig weg wat in sy hart is. Hy is die saad wat langs die pad val.

original: And David said to Achish, But what have I done? what have you seen in your servant while I have been with you till this day, that I may not go and take up arms against those who are now making war on my lord the king?
translation: En Dawid het vir Achish gesê: Maar wat het ek verkeerd gedoen? Wat het jy in jou dienaar gesien terwyl ek tot vandag toe by jou was, dat ek nie kan gaan en wapens opneem teen dié wat nou oorlog maak teen my heer, die koning nie?

original: And the Lord said to Moses, How long will this people have no respect for me? how long will they be without faith, in the face of all the signs I have done among them?
translation: En die Here het vir Moses gesê: Hoe lank gaan hierdie mense nie vir my respekteer nie? Hoe lank gaan hulle nie glo nie, ondanks al die tekens wat ek onder hulle gewys het?

original: And when they came there, and had got the church together, they gave them an account of all the things which God had done through them, and how he had made open a door of faith to the Gentiles.
translation: Toe hulle daar aankom en die mense bymekaar gehad het, het hulle vir hulle vertel van alles wat God deur hulle gedoen het, en hoe Hy 'n deur van geloof vir die nie-Jode oopgemaak het.

original: He will have no fear of evil news; his heart is fixed, for his hope is in the Lord.
translation: Hy sal nie bang wees vir slegte nuus nie; sy hart is vas, want sy hoop is in die Here.

original: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: these are the sons which they had after the great flow of waters
translation: Hierdie is die geslagte van Noag se seuns, Sem, Gam en Jafet: dit is die seuns wat hulle gehad het na die groot vloed.

original: And before all the people Hananiah said, The Lord has said, Even so will I let the yoke of the king of Babylon be broken off the necks of all the nations in the space of two years. Then the prophet Jeremiah went away.
translation: En voor al die mense het Hananiah gesê: Die Here het gesê, So sal Ek die juk van die koning van Babilon van al die nasies se nekke afhaal binne twee jaar. Toe het die profeet Jeremia weggegaan.

original: For there were still a number of the people there who had not made themselves holy: so the Levites had to put Passover lambs to death for those who were not clean, to make them holy to the Lord.
translation: Daar was nog 'n paar mense daar wat nie heilig gemaak is nie, so die Leviete moes paaslamme doodmaak vir diegene wat nie skoon was nie, om hulle heilig te maak vir die Here.

original: And that which went on the stones, this is he who, hearing the word, straight away takes it with joy;
translation: En dit wat op die klippe geval het, is hy wat, wanneer hy die boodskap hoor, dit dadelik met vreugde aanvaar.

original: And they were with the disciples there for a long time.
translation: En hulle was daar vir 'n lang tyd saam met die dissipels.

original: His heart is resting safely, he will have no fear, till he sees trouble come on his haters.
translation: Sy hart is rustig, hy sal nie bang wees nie, totdat hy moeilikheid oor sy teenstanders sien kom.

original: The sons of Japheth: Gomer and Magog and Madai and Javan and Tubal and Meshech and Tiras.
translation: Die seuns van Jafet: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Jawan, Tubal, Meseg en Tiras.

original: And Achish in answer said, It is true that in my eyes you are good, like an angel of God: but still, the rulers of the Philistines have said, He is not to go up with us to the fight.
translation: Achish het geantwoord: “Dit is waar dat jy in my oë goed is, soos 'n engel van God. Maar die leiers van die Filistyne het gesê, hy mag nie saam met ons gaan veg nie.”

original: Then after the yoke had been broken off the neck of the prophet Jeremiah by Hananiah the prophet, the word of the Lord came to Jeremiah, saying,
translation: Toe die kraag van die profeet Jeremia deur Hanania die profeet verwyder is, het God se boodskap na Jeremia gekom en gesê,

original: And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz and Riphath and Togarmah.
translation: En die seuns van Gomer is Ashkenaz, Riphath, en Togarmah.

original: For a great number of the people from Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not made themselves clean, but they took the Passover meal, though not in the right way. For Hezekiah had made prayer for them, saying, May the good Lord have mercy on everyone
translation: Baie van die mense van Efraim en Manasse, Issagar en Sebulon, het hul nie skoon gemaak nie, maar hulle het die Paasmaal gehou, al was dit nie reg nie. Hezekia het vir hulle gebid en gesê, Mag die goeie Here genade aan almal gee.

original: I will send disease on them for their destruction, and take away their heritage, and I will make of you a nation greater and stronger than they.
translation: Ek sal siekte op hulle stuur om hulle uit te wis en hulle erf wegneem, en ek sal julle 'n nasie maak wat groter en sterker is as hulle.

original: He has given with open hands to the poor; his righteousness is for ever; his horn will be lifted up with honour.
translation: Hy het met oop hande aan die armes gegee; sy regverdigheid is vir altyd; sy eer sal verhoog word.

original: Now certain men came down from Judaea, teaching the brothers and saying that without circumcision, after the rule of Moses, there is no salvation.
translation: Nou het 'n paar mense van Judaea afkom om die broers te leer en te sê dat jy nie gered kan word nie sonder besnydenis volgens wat Moses gesê het.

original: But having no root in himself, he goes on for a time; and when trouble comes or pain, because of the word, he quickly becomes full of doubts.
translation: Maar omdat hy nie 'n wortel in hom het nie, hou hy 'n tydjie aan; en wanneer daar moeilikheid of pyn kom oor die boodskap, word hy vinnig vol twyfel.

original: So get up early in the morning, with the servants of your lord who are with you, and go to the place I have given you, and have no evil design in your heart, for you are good in my eyes; but when there is light enough in the morning, go away.
translation: So, staan vroeg op in die oggend, saam met die mense wat jou baas is, en gaan na die plek wat ek jou gegee het. Moet nie slegte gedagtes in jou hart hê nie, want jy is goed in my oë; maar as daar genoeg lig in die oggend is, gaan weg.

original: And Moses said to the Lord, Then it will come to the ears of the Egyptians; for by your power you took this people out from among them;
translation: Moses het vir die Here gesê, "Dan sal die Egiptenaars daarvan hoor; want deur u krag het u hierdie volk uit hulle uitgebring."

original: Go and say to Hananiah, This is what the Lord has said: Yokes of wood have been broken by you, but in their place I will make yokes of iron.
translation: Gaan sê vir Hananiah, dit is wat die Here gesê het: Jy het die houte jukke gebroke, maar ek sal in hul plek ysterjukke maak.

original: And the sons of Javan: Elishah and Tarshish, the Kittim and the Dodanim.
translation: En die seuns van Jawan: Elisha en Tarsis, die Kitte en die Dodaniete.

original: The sinner will see it with grief; he will be wasted away with envy; the desire of the evil-doers will come to nothing.
translation: Die sondaar sal dit met hartseer sien; hy sal wegkwyn van jaloesie; die slegte mense se begeertes sal niks wees nie.

original: Who, with all his heart, is turned to God the Lord, the God of his fathers, even if he has not been made clean after the rules of the holy place.
translation: Wie met sy hele hart na God, die Here, die God van sy vaders, draai, selfs al is hy nie skoon gemaak volgens die reëls van die heilige plek nie.

original: From these came the nations of the sea-lands, with their different families and languages.
translation: Van hierdie het die nasies van die see lande gekom, met hulle verskillende gesinne en tale.

original: And after Paul and Barnabas had had no little argument and discussion with them, the brothers made a decision to send Paul and Barnabas and certain others of them to the Apostles and the rulers of the church at Jerusalem about this question.
translation: En nadat Paulus en Barnabas ’n groot geselskap en bespreking met hulle gehad het, het die broers besluit om Paulus en Barnabas en nog ’n paar van hulle na die apostels en die leiers van die kerk in Jerusalem oor hierdie vraag te stuur.

original: And the Lord gave ear to Hezekiah, and made the people well.
translation: Die Here het na Hezekia geluister en die mense gesond gemaak.

original: Let the Lord be praised. O you servants of the Lord, give praise to the name of the Lord.
translation: Laat die Here geprys word. O julle dienaars van die Here, gee prys aan die naam van die Here.

original: And that which was dropped among the thorns, this is he who has the word; and the cares of this life, and the deceits of wealth, put a stop to the growth of the word and it gives no fruit.
translation: En wat tussen die doringbome geval het, is die persoon wat die woord het; en die bekommernisse van hierdie lewe en die bedrog van rykdom hou die groei van die woord op en dit bring geen vrug nie.

original: And the sons of Ham: Cush and Mizraim and Put and Canaan.
translation: Die seuns van Ham: Kusj, Egipte, Put en Kanaän.

original: So David and his men got up early in the morning to go back to the land of the Philistines. And the Philistines went up to Jezreel.
translation: So David en sy manne het vroeg in die oggend opgestaan om terug te gaan na die Filistyne se land. En die Filistyne het na Jezreël gegaan.

original: And they will give the news to the people of this land: they have had word that you, Lord, are present with this people, letting yourself be seen face to face, and that your cloud is resting over them, and that you go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
translation: En hulle gaan die nuus aan die mense van hierdie land vertel: Hulle het gehoor dat U, Here, by hierdie mense is, dat U Uself van aangesig tot aangesig wys, en dat U wolk oor hulle rus. U gaan voor hulle uit in 'n wolk gedurende die dag en in 'n vuurkolom gedurende die nag.

original: For the Lord of armies, the God of Israel, has said: I have put a yoke of iron on the necks of all these nations, making them servants to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon; and they are to be his servants: and in addition I have given him the beasts of the field.
translation: Want die Here van die leërskare, die God van Israel, het gesê: Ek het 'n juk van yster op die nekke van al hierdie nasies gesit en ek het hulle dienaars van Nebukadnesar, die koning van Babilon, gemaak; en hulle moet sy dienaars wees. En ek het ook die diere van die veld aan hom gegee.

original: And the seed which was put in good earth, this is he who gives ear to the word, and gets the sense of it; who gives fruit, some a hundred, some sixty, some thirty times as much.
translation: En die saad wat in goeie grond gesit is, is die een wat na die woorde luister en dit verstaan; hy dra vrugte, party honderd keer, party sestig keer, party dertig keer.

original: So they, being sent on their way by the church, went through Phoenicia and Samaria, giving news of the salvation of the Gentiles, to the great joy of all the brothers.
translation: Hulle is deur die kerk gestuur en het deur Fenisië en Samaria gegaan, waar hulle vir die mense van die nie-Jode se redding vertel het. Dit het groot vreugde onder al die broers gebring.

original: Let blessing be on the name of the Lord, from this time and for ever.
translation: Laat seën wees oor die naam van die Here, van nou af en vir altyd.

original: So the children of Israel who were present in Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread for seven days with great joy: and the Levites and the priests gave praise to the Lord day by day, making melody to the Lord with loud instruments.
translation: Die kinders van Israel wat in Jerusalem was, het die ongegistede broodfees vir sewe dae met groot blydskap gevier. Die Leviete en die priesters het elke dag die Here geprys en vir Hom musiek gemaak met harde instrumente.

original: Now if you put to death all this people as one man, then the nations who have had word of your glory will say,
translation: As julle al hierdie mense as een man doodmaak, dan sal die volke wat van julle glorie gehoor het, sê,

original: Now when David and his men came to Ziklag on the third day, the Amalekites had made an attack on the South and on Ziklag, and had overcome Ziklag and put it on fire;
translation: Toe David en sy manne op die derde dag by Ziklag aankom, het die Amalekiete die suide aangeval, Ziklag oorgeneem en dit aan die brand gesteek.

original: And the sons of Cush: Seba and Havilah and Sabtah and Raamah and Sabteca; and the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.
translation: En die seuns van Kus: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah en Sabteka; en die seuns van Raamah: Seba en Dedan.

original: Then the prophet Jeremiah said to Hananiah the prophet, Give ear, now, Hananiah; the Lord has not sent you; but you are making this people put their faith in what is false.
translation: Toe het die profeet Jeremia vir die profeet Hananiah gesê: "Luister, Hananiah; die Here het jou nie gestuur nie; maar jy laat hierdie mense glo in iets wat nie waar is nie."

original: And he gave them another story, saying, The kingdom of heaven is like a man who put good seed in his field:
translation: Hy het vir hulle nog 'n storie vertel en gesê: Die koninkryk van die hemel is soos 'n man wat goeie saad in sy veld gesaai het.

original: From the coming up of the sun to its going down, the Lord's name is to be praised.
translation: Van die son se opkoms tot sy ondergang, moet ons die naam van die Here prys.

original: And when they came to Jerusalem, they had a meeting with the church and the Apostles and the rulers, and they gave an account of all the things which God had done through them.
translation: Toe hulle in Jerusalem aankom, het hulle 'n ontmoeting gehou met die kerk, die Apostels en die leiers, en hulle het vertel van alles wat God deur hulle gedoen het.

original: And Hezekiah said kind words to the Levites who were expert in the ordering of the worship of the Lord: so they kept the feast for seven days, offering peace-offerings and praising the Lord, the God of their fathers.
translation: En Hiskia het vriendelike woorde vir die Leviete gesê wat goed was in die regte orde van die aanbidding van die Here: so het hulle die fees vir sewe dae gehou, vrede-offers aangebied en die Here, God van hulle vaders, geprys.

original: And Cush was the father of Nimrod, who was the first of the great men of the earth.
translation: En Kus was die pa van Nimrod, wat die eerste van die groot mense op aarde was.

original: And had made the women and all who were there, small and great, prisoners: they had not put any of them to death, but had taken them all away.
translation: En het die vroue en almal wat daar was, klein en groot, gevangenes gemaak: hulle het nie een van hulle dood gemaak nie, maar het hulle almal weggevat.

original: Because the Lord was not able to take this people into the land which he made an oath to give them, he sent destruction on them in the waste land.
translation: Omdat die Here nie kon keer dat hierdie mense na die plek gaan wat Hy vir hulle beloof het nie, het Hy ongeluk oor hulle gestuur in die woestyn.

original: But while men were sleeping, one who had hate for him came and put evil seeds among the grain, and went away.
translation: Maar terwyl mense geslaap het, het iemand wat hom gehaat het, gekom en slegte sade tussen die graan gesit, en daarna weggegaan.

original: The Lord is high over all nations, and his glory is higher than the heavens.
translation: Die Here is hoog bo al die nasies, en sy glorie is hoër as die hemel.

original: For this reason the Lord has said, See, I will send you away from off the face of the earth: this year death will overtake you, because you have said words against the Lord.
translation: Om hierdie rede het die Here gesê: Kyk, ek sal jou van die aarde af wegstuur; hierdie jaar sal die dood jou oorkom, omdat jy woorde teen die Here gesê het.

original: But some of the Pharisees, who were of the faith, got up and said, It is necessary for these to have circumcision and to keep the law of Moses.
translation: Maar sommige van die Fariseërs, wat in die geloof was, het opgestaan en gesê: Dit is nodig dat hulle besny word en die wet van Moses hou.

original: And by the desire of all the people, the feast went on for another seven days, and they kept the seven days with joy.
translation: En omdat die mense dit so graag wou, het die fees nog sewe dae aangehou, en hulle het die sewe dae met blijdskap gevier.

original: But when the green stem came up and gave fruit, the evil plants were seen at the same time.
translation: Maar toe die groen stam opkom en vrugte begin dra, het die slegte plante ook op dieselfde tyd verskyn.

original: So now, may my prayer come before you, and let the power of the Lord be great, as you said:
translation: So nou, laat my gebed voor U kom, en laat die krag van die Here groot wees, soos U gesê het:

original: He was a very great bowman, so that there is a saying, Like Nimrod, a very great bowman.
translation: Hy was 'n baie goeie skutter, so daar is 'n gesegde: Soos Nimrod, 'n baie goeie skutter.

original: So death came to Hananiah the prophet the same year, in the seventh month.
translation: So het die dood Hananiah die profeet daardie jaar getref, in die sewende maand.

original: Who is like the Lord our God, who is seated on high,
translation: Wie is soos die Here ons God wat hoog bo alles sit?

original: And when David and his men came to the town, they saw that it had been burned down, and their wives and their sons and daughters had been made prisoners.
translation: Toe David en sy manne by die dorpie aankom, het hulle gesien dat dit afgebrand het en dat hul vroue en kinders gevang is.

original: And the servants of the master of the house came and said to him, Sir, did you not put good seed in your field? how then has it evil plants?
translation: En die dienaars van die huisheer het gekom en vir hom gesê: Mnr., het u nie goeie saad in u veld geplaas nie? Hoe kom is daar dan slegte plante?

original: And at the first, his kingdom was Babel and Erech and Accad and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
translation: En in die begin was sy koninkryk Babel, Erech, Akkad en Kalneh, in die land van Sinar.

original: And the Apostles and the rulers of the church came together and gave thought to the question.
translation: En die apostels en die kerkleiers het bymekaargekom en oor die vraag nagedink.

original: Then David and the people who were with him gave themselves up to weeping till they were able to go on weeping no longer.
translation: Toe het David en die mense saam met hom gehuil totdat hulle nie meer kon huil nie.

original: For Hezekiah, king of Judah, gave to the people for offerings, a thousand oxen and seven thousand sheep; and the rulers gave a thousand oxen and ten thousand sheep; and a great number of priests made themselves holy.
translation: Want Hiskia, die koning van Juda, het vir die mense se offers 'n duisend volwasse bulle en sewe duisend skaap gegee; en die leiers het 'n duisend volwasse bulle en tien duisend skaap gegee; en baie priesters het hulleself heilig gemaak.

original: Looking down on the heavens, and on the earth?
translation: Kyk na die hemel en die aarde?

original: And he said, Someone has done this in hate. And the servants say to him, Is it your pleasure that we go and take them up?
translation: En hy het gesê, Iemand het dit uit haat gedoen. En die diensknegte sê vir hom, Wil jy hê ons moet gaan en hulle optel?

original: The Lord is slow to wrath and great in mercy, overlooking wrongdoing and evil, and will not let wrongdoers go free; sending punishment on children for the sins of their fathers, to the third and fourth generation.
translation: Die Here is stadig om kwaad te word en groot in genade. Hy sien verkeerd doen en boosheid oor, maar Hy sal nie sondaars vrylaat nie. Hy bring straf op kinders oor die sondes van hul vaders, tot die derde en vierde geslag.

original: From that land he went out into Assyria, building Nineveh with its wide streets and Calah,
translation: Van daardie land het hy na Assirië gegaan en Nineveh gebou met sy bredere strate, sowel as Calah.

original: And David's two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail, the wife of Nabal of Carmel, had been made prisoners.
translation: En David se twee vroue, Ahinoam van Jezreel en Abigail, die vrou van Nabal van Karmel, is gevang.

original: He takes the poor man out of the dust, lifting him up from his low position;
translation: Hy haal die arme man uit die stof en lig hom op uit sy laagste plek.

original: And all the people of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and those who had come from Israel, and men from other lands who had come from Israel or who were living in Judah, were glad with great joy.
translation: En al die mense van Juda, saam met die priesters en die Leviete, en diegene wat van Israel gekom het, en mans van ander lande wat van Israel gekom het of in Juda gewoon het, was baie bly.

original: To give him a place among the rulers, even with the rulers of his people.
translation: Om vir hom 'n plek te gee tussen die leiers, selfs by die leiers van sy mense.

original: And when there had been much discussion, Peter got up and said to them, My brothers, you have knowledge that some time back it was God's pleasure that by my mouth the good news might be given to the Gentiles so that they might have faith.
translation: Toe daar baie bespreking was, het Peter opgestaan en vir hulle gesê, My broers, julle weet dat dit 'n tyd terug God se wil was dat die goeie nuus deur my mond aan die nie-Jode gegee sou word sodat hulle geloof kan hê.

original: But he says, No, for fear that by chance while you take up the evil plants, you may be rooting up the grain with them.
translation: Maar hy sê, Nee, want hy is bang dat jy dalk terwyl jy die slegte plante opmaak, die goeie graan saam met hulle uittrek.

original: May the sin of this people have forgiveness, in the measure of your great mercy, as you have had mercy on them from Egypt up till now.
translation: Mag God hulle sonde vergewe, volgens jou groot genade, soos wat jy hulle genade gegee het van Egipte af tot nou toe.

original: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah, which is a very great town.
translation: En Resen is tussen Nineveh en Calah, wat 'n baie groot plek is.

original: And David was greatly troubled; for the people were talking of stoning him, because their hearts were bitter, every man sorrowing for his sons and his daughters: but David made himself strong in the Lord his God.
translation: David was baie ontsteld; want die mense het gepraat oor om hom met klippe te dood, omdat hulle bitter gevoel het. Elke man was hartseer oor sy seuns en dogters, maar David het homself sterk gemaak in die Here, sy God.

original: Now these are the words of the letter which Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the responsible men among those who had been taken away, and to the priests and the prophets and to all the rest of the people whom Nebuchadnezzar had taken away prisoners from Jerusalem to Babylon;
translation: Nou is dit die woorde van die brief wat Jeremía die profeet van Jerusalem gestuur het na die verantwoordelike mense onder diegene wat weggeneem is, en na die priesters, die profete en al die ander mense wat Nebukadnesar as gevangenes van Jerusalem na Babel geneem het.

original: So there was great joy in Jerusalem: for nothing like this had been seen in Jerusalem from the time of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel.
translation: Daar was groot blydskap in Jerusalem, want niks soos dit is ooit in Jerusalem gesien sedert die tyd van Salomo, die seun van Dawid, koning van Israel nie.

original: Let them come up together till the getting in of the grain; and then I will say to the workers, Take up first the evil plants, and put them together for burning: but put the grain into my store-house.
translation: Laat hulle saam opkom tot die oes van die graan; en dan sal ek vir die werkers sê, Pak eers die slegte plante op en gooi hulle saam om te brand; maar plaas die graan in my skuur.

original: And Mizraim was the father of the Ludim and Anamim and Lehabim and Naphtuhim;
translation: En Mizraim was die pa van die Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim en Naphtuhim;

original: And the Lord said, I have had mercy, as you say:
translation: En die Here het gesê, Ek het genade gehad, soos jy sê:

original: And God, the searcher of hearts, was a witness to them, giving them the Holy Spirit even as he did to us;
translation: En God, wat die harte ken, was 'n getuige teenoor hulle en het die Heilige Gees aan hulle gegee soos Hy dit aan ons gegee het;

original: He gives the unfertile woman a family, making her a happy mother of children. Give praise to the Lord.
translation: Hy gee die vrou wat nie kinders kan hê nie 'n gesin en maak haar 'n blije ma van kinders. Loof die Here.

original: And David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech, Come here to me with the ephod. And Abiathar took the ephod to David.
translation: David het vir Abiathar die priester, die seun van Ahimeleg, gesê, “Kom hier na my toe met die efod.” En Abiathar het die efod vir David gebring.

original: (After Jeconiah the king and the queen-mother and the unsexed servants and the rulers of Judah and Jerusalem and the expert workmen and the metal-workers had gone away from Jerusalem;)
translation: Nadat koning Jeconiah, die koningin-moeder, die dienaars, die leiers van Juda en Jerusalem, asook die slim werkers en metaalwerkers weg van Jerusalem gegaan het;

original: And Pathrusim and Casluhim and Caphtorim, from whom came the Philistines.
translation: En Pathrusim, Casluhim en Caphtorim, waarvan die Filistyne kom.

original: When Israel came out of Egypt, the children of Jacob from a people whose language was strange to them;
translation: Toe Israel uit Egipte gekom het, was die kinders van Jakob van 'n volk wie se taal vir hulle vreemd was.

original: But truly, as I am living, and as all the earth will be full of the glory of the Lord;
translation: Maar werklik, soos ek leef, en soos die hele aarde vol gaan wees van die glorie van die Here;

original: Making no division between them and us, but making clean their hearts by faith.
translation: Maak nie 'n verskil tussen hulle en ons nie, maar maak hulle harte skoon deur geloof.

original: Then the priests and the Levites gave the people a blessing: and the voice of their prayer went up to the holy place of God in heaven.
translation: Toe het die priesters en die Leviete die mense geseën, en hul gebed het opgestyg na God se plek in die hemel.
